text:
Hands down, my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  I've been there 5 times now and have left completely satisfied each time.  The restaurant itself is beautiful and has indoor and outdoor seating as well as an indoor and outdoor bar.  Since Brio doesn't take reservations, you'll often have to wait a good 30-45 minutes which is plenty of time to get yourself is peach bellini (yes, it's girly and frothy) which is wonderfully refreshing and not too sweet.  The waiters are all very attentive, even when the place is slammed, which is a nice change from the LV norm.  

Food wise: the bread you're served upon seating is piping hot and delicious; the lobster bisque is amazing; the brio chopped salad is great (but I recommend getting the balsamic dressing over the red wine); caprese bruschetta is delicious, as is the roasted red pepper brushetta (blanking on the name); and those mini desserts (creme brulee especially) are the perfect endings to a great meal.

Weird servers. I dont know how else to say it. We have been there 4 times with 4 different servers and 3 of them have just been some of the weirdest people I have ever had to deal with. I think my waitor I had last time used to be a mime because of the way he was using his hands. The food is the only reason why we come back because its pretty good and we always know what to expect.

Hands down! BEST HAPPY HOUR in town!! 

What a steal! 

Have to try the Shrimp Eggplant!

Had a nice lunch with Kevin and Tim. The soup of the day was yummy.  Perfect for this kind of weather.  The shrimp diavolo could be a little spicier but overall, it was fantastic. Great lunch but love their happy hour prices better.

Two different pasta dishes...both too salty.  margherita flatbread was totally bland.  And for God's sake will someone please tell the servers here, and everywhere else that I DON'T CARE WHAT YOU'RE FAVORITES ARE!!!!  Just describe the food and the preparation.

Ate here last night on the outside patio. It started to rain during our appetizers right after the staff took the umbrellas down due to the threat of high wind. Tried to put umbrella up but staff insisted it stay down even though no wind at the time. Rain stopped and we finished our meal only to find that the manager had removed the appetizers from our bill as a courtesy. With that sort of service, I can only recommend Brio to everyone who lives and visits Vegas - way to go, management!

P.S. About the food:

Lamb gorgonzola - perfection!
Mussels - delightful!
Lasagna al forno - fresh pasta, meat, and sauce - enormous portion and very tasty!
Salmon salad - had to take half of it to go.

Brio is unexpectedly great for several reasons.  They have good food, especially taking into account the fact that they are a chain.  The restaurant itself is absolutely beautiful- comfortable booths and drapery hanging from very high ceilings, beautiful colors and lighting (bordering on ornate, but in a good way).  Outside is equally beautiful, including tables and chairs that surround firepits.  They have nightly happy hour (3-6pm, 9pm-close) and really good bruschetta apps with different toppings (shrimp, mushrooms, etc).  Their penne fra diavola with shrimp is delicious (spicy tomato sauce), and they have nice shrimp and crab cakes.  There are nice salads, pastas, chicken, seafood and steak dishes on the menu (Tuscan Italian style).  Their desserts are all available in mini sizes, which is pretty awesome and rare.  Good wine list.   They also have a nice weekend brunch here.   Reservations are a good idea on weekends or you will be waiting well over an hour to sit down.  It is not the best Italian food of my life, but the food is always delicious and the atmosphere is great.  I especially love this place on summer nights, sitting outside.

Great food, great service. Very big restaurant, makes you feel as youre eating  in Italy :-)
...and deserts are to die for!

Been here twice and they have yet to disappoint me. Ordered the fish special, blackened ahi with vegetables. I usually don't ordered blackened fish, but it was perfectly seasoned and cooked just right!
i'm a regular at this place and its about time i wrote a review. 3 words. yum, yum and yum.

The restaurant is beautiful and the food is pretty good depending on what you order however the service is crappy. I've been there several times and a couple of times the waiters were just terrible, not friendly an all, seemed like they were bothered to answer questions on the menu and just couldn't wait to get out of there. One time we had a woman waiter who was just rude, another time we were sitting outside and a male waiter just couldn't get anything right on our order. While we were ordering it seemed like he wasn't even listening to us and everything came out wrong, some things completely forgotten, salad that was supposed to be no onions had onions, steak medium was well done etc. Had to have everything redone. Disappointing.

Stopped for lunch and shared the crab cakes as an app (between 2). VERY good. 
My girlfriend wanted a pasta that was only on the dinner menu (we were 30 mins early for that) but the kitchen did it anyway. Everything was good including service.

I live in Rancho Cucamonga and we found one out in Vegas while on vacation. I love this place! We had the best server ever! She even brought me my own personal coffee pot. I always order the filet with double vegetables and Its the best I've ever had! Love it here

I wish YELP would change the definition of 3 stars from "A-OK" to "Just OK" since they don't have 2.5 stars.

I was shopping in Town Square and Brio looked like the only non-fast food choice for lunch.  The atmosphere, decor, and service really deserve 4 stars.  They loose 1.5 stars for the food.

I ordered a large Caesar salad, and a Mediteranean Penne dish.   I had the option to get a small salad with the entre for an additional $3.85, but the waiter said it was pretty small so I asked for the large salad entre (which was supposed to cost a whopping $11.00).   The salad came in a large plate which was half empty.  I love Caesar salad, but this one was mediocre at best.  Hardly any flavor.   And the description bragged about the house dressing and brioche croutons  - both tasteless.  When I finished the waiter asked how I liked the salad, and seemed very surprised when I told him that it was bland.   The only good news was that they didn't charge me $11,00 for the salad, but only $5.00, though I don't know if this was because of what I said about it.

The penne dish was pasta with mushrooms, dried tomatoes and fetta and a very little bit of a tasteless sauce.   This is one of those places where if you ask for parmesan cheese, the waiter makes a show of grinding it on your pasta.   I suppose they want you to think this is entertainment, but I think it is really just a way for them to save money on cheese.   As you watch, they grind and grind and grind, and when they're done you may have a teaspoon or two of cheese on your pasta.   For what this dish cost ($15.15) they could have put a dish of cheese on the table - it might have helped an otherwise boring meal.

The only bright side of lunch was excellent sour dough bread which tasted like San Francisco sour dough, but they told me it was shipped in daily from Los Angeles.

$25.00 plus tip with ice tea.   I think I would have done better at Olive garden.

I absolutely love this place! Went for Valentine's day and me and my boyfriend were so pleased. They have great customer service & the food was delicious. They have a cute outside patio where there are dining tables set up. The food came in a timely manner even though they were super busy. I was very very happy that this is where we spent Vday! Plan on coming back often! I ordered a pasta with chicken, bacon, and spinach in alfredo sauce - my boyfriend had a pasta with lobster and shrimp in it. It was literally perfection on a plate! Not to mention the roasted & artichoke dip that came with it was TO DIE FOR. I loved it. With those three plates it came out to be about $65

I was brought here by a friend for happy hour. supposedly there were hot chicks here.

The food SUCKS bangladeshi taxidriver assholes. If you want to know what a bangladeshi taxi drivers asshole tastes likes...please try brio.

Brio is basically the mcdonalds, or wendys of italian food.

The crowd here is on the trashier side. The one at tivoli has the same shitty food, but with a more prosperous and much older crowd. The good news is tivoli has live music in the summer. I will probably be going there for *drinks only* whenever they have music.

Brio is one of the nicest places in Town Square, especially when you can seat outside. I was there at  least two times a week but recently they reduced the menu and left out some of my favorite meals. So disappointed...
Hubby had $11.50 Berry French Toast with White Peach Palmer tea ($3.50) and I had Small Chicken Brick. Both choices were very good. Nothing particularly memorable otherwise.

We have been visiting this location since they opened, celebrating birthdays, anniversaries, etc. at least 10-20 times a year.  We were here on May 7th celebrating my mother-in-law's birthday.  The appetizers were pretty good but the entrees were definitely lacking.  My husband ordered a chicken Caesar salad and they served him a side salad and brought him a piece of chicken as they said they forgot to put it on the salad.  The salad was on a very small plate and that's how I knew that there was no way that this was a dinner salad.  The fact that the chicken wasn't even on the salad was another dead giveaway.  My son ordered the salmon it was overcooked and it was a very small piece and wasn't worth the $23.  I ordered a side lobster tail and six pieces of shrimp.  I have food allergies and I asked that they steam both, and not add anything to it. Well they grilled both and it was overcooked and very dry.   It definitely was not worth over $200 that we spent.  I'm not sure if we will be visiting this location again.  Very disappointed in the quality  of food that was served.

This is my favorite casual lunch dining restaurant. I've tried a few items on the menu, but my favorite by far are the Bruschetta Quattro appetizer and the Steak Salad. Many times, that's all I order! The quattro gives you 4 different selections of their famous bruschettas and you get 2 of each one, making it a perfect sharing appetizer (genius!). I'm not a big fan of salads myself, but I LOVE this salad. The steak is prepared medium-rare (again, not usually a fan of bloody steak) but this is fantastic. Of the 10 times that I order this dish, its always just as good as the last. The dressing complements the steak, and the blue cheese, cherry tomatoes, and walnuts put it over the top. We always order it split, so we can share it was well.

My fiance and I have come to Brio many times, sometimes for a light lunch before seeing a movie, and even one time for an impromptu valentine's day lunch date ... She and I could have gone to a fancy fine dining establishment, but there is just something about Brio and its amazing food and outstanding service that is hard to pass up. The only downside, if you can even call it a downside, is the pricing. It's not totally ridiculous but it is pricey enough to make Brio a twice a month visit, if that.

A solid 4.5 out of 5! The food here is awesome, it's well seasoned  resulting in great flavor and it's soft texture indicates they are fresh ingredients. The place provides a delightful atmosphere with outstanding service and very friendly staff. 

The .5 deduction  is due to a very minor detail; which can be easily overlooked. It's not a big deal, however my wife and I noticed it. Some of the staff reached over our food to service the other guests. Other than that, the places is great!
Reservations don't seem to matter here.  Waited almost an hour after our reservation time.  I made the reservation nearly a month prior.  Not impressed.

Brio surprised me with their fresh, delicious food and large portion sizes.  I've been to both the Town Square and Tivoli Village locations, and both are quite pretty inside, reminiscent of the Cheesecake Factory in style.  

My favorite starter is the spicy shrimp and eggplant: shrimp over romano crusted eggplant in a black pepper cream sauce, amazing!  

For entrees, the lasagna bolognese is HUGE and very delicious, it could easily serve 2 people!  It's layers of noodles in a bolognese sauce topped with alfredo and romano/mozzarella cheese, yum.  If you're looking for something lighter, I would absolutely recommend the grilled salmon salad.  The salmon is cooked perfectly, and sits atop spring greens, asparagus, tomatoes, feta cheese, and crispy shoestring potatoes in a balsamic vinaigrette.  The combination of textures and flavors is really delicious and satisfying, without being too heavy.  The only entree I haven't liked here was the shrimp verduta.

The kids menu is quite impressive as well.  We ordered the salmon ($6.95) for our daughter, it came with a large piece of grilled salmon, mashed potatoes (or sub french fries in our case), steamed broccoli and a drink of her choice.  I could have made a meal of this, it was delicious!  They have other options: chicken parmesan, grilled chicken, lasagna, mac and cheese, burgers and pizzas.  

We've ordered catering from here in the past, and it is a great deal!  We ordered the lasagna bolognese, the lobster and shrimp fettucine (shrimp and lobster in a spicy lobster butter sauce) and the pasta brio (penne pasta with chicken, mushrooms, and a roasted red pepper sauce), all for $160.  It comes with a tray of fresh bread, a tray of their crispy flatbread, and we also had a coupon for a free dessert tray with a $100 order.  They gave us a generous serving of their tiramisu.  Each tray serves 6-8 people, and we had enough for 14 people with tons of leftovers.  Everyone had a different favorite pasta, so it was enjoyed by all!

My wife and I love going to this restaurant.  The risotto entree is fantastic, and the fried calamari app is one of my favorites.  Service is always good and the atmosphere is really nice.  Prices are steep so I don't get to eat here often, although I would if they had better lunch specials.  They do have happy hour deals but I can't usually take advantage of them.

Went to the bar and that was the coldest expressive I ever had. Waited for a long time for someone to ask me what I wanted. The bartender woman was just fake, some brunette girl. When I wanted to pay I kept looking at her and she never attempted to even care about me as a customer. I don't know her name because they don't have nametag and she never introduced herself. I ended up telling another person to please get me my check. I'm a local and not coming back.

the food was good
the service was excellent
free parking at the meters in the evening, not sure what time that kicks in though

Beware if you are gluten-free.  Waitress said they had gf crackers in the basket.  After I ate one, she came over and asked if I was "alright!"  Said she made a mistake about the crackers.  They are NOT gf.  This waitress did not pay attention to anything.  She would disappear for 10 minutes at a time.  Good thing we were not trying to catch a plane or a show.  Very poor service, but more importantly, they should train their staff to be more careful with gluten free customers.
This is one of my favorite places for Italian food. Expect to wait for a table specially on weekends but service is good and food is the best
Non-smoking establishment, despite the outdoor bar area. Food is unmemorable, service is fine, plenty of alternatives nearby.

We went to have brunch at Brio Tuscan Grille on a Saturday afternoon.  They are one of the many restaurants in Town Center Square shopping area.

We arrived a little after 1pm and noticed it was busy, lots of people were standing around waiting.  So we went inside and I asked the hostess how long the wait was and was told 15-20 minutes.  She asked for my name and phone number and we went back outside and browsed some nearby shops.  We came back and sat outside at a bench by the restaurant and still didn't hear anything.  I checked my phone frequently and made sure I had my ringer on. More time passed, nearly an hour and we went inside to see how long the wait would be.  The hostess looked up my name on a computer and another hostess immediately showed us to a table.  We realize it was busy BUT if we hadn't checked back with the hostess we would still be outside waiting to hear my phone ring.  So why did the hostess bother to get my phone number if they weren't going to call in the first place?  We felt our time was wasted waiting around for a call.  Maybe they should invest in those pager things that other restaurants give out that buzz and light up when your table is ready.

The food was pretty good.  We ordered lobster bisque, my boyfriend had an omelet and I had the stuffed french toast with berries.  Our waiter was an older gentleman who picked up on the fact that my boyfriend was pissed when we first arrived.  He was very attentive and had a calm and playful manner.

So I would give the food 4 stars, but because of the hostesses lack of hospitality and indifference I have to give Brio Tuscan Grille 3 stars.
Brio is one of great Italian resturant I been in vegas great pasta and fettuccine food is just great and great service I do like location which is they have outdoor
My absolute favorite! The pork chops are to die for and the Sangria keeps me coming back. Servers are sometimes hit or miss but the food is worth the trip :)
Came for lunch with work colleagues. All of us ordered a different lunch combo and they were all ready very quickly. Food was good, order was correct, and service was prompt.

Hopefully someone who is gluten-free by necessity reads my reviews. Amazing, delicious, incredible are the words I would use to describe the gluten-free Chicken Pomodoro. I ate it all and the only thing that would have made the meal total perfection is a gluten-free baquette. Seriously folks, I would pay extra just to be able to reach into a bread basket, slather it with butter and then swipe my bowl with the crust.

Don't bother ordering for pick up- it is NEVER ready when they say it is and you'll end up waiting three times as long like I always do. Parking is impossible and there's no lot within a comfortable walking distance. Food is mediocre and nothing to rave about, but this place gets PACKED at lunch time on weekdays so be prepared to wait.
Management was very unaccomodating for minor requests in regards to large party reservations.

The experience was a bit rocky.  It was nice to see the place so busy on a late Wednesday night however, it seemed to me no one was communicating.  When we arrived, they told me it would be 10 minute wait.  We waited more like 20 minutes before getting seated which is ok but we had asked for a booth and they tried to seat us at  a round set for 6 when there was two of us in the party.  Directly across from the table was a dirty booth.  
After being sat, 10 minutes go by with no sign of service.  When we did finally get someone to the table, he dropped of bread and left without one word.  We watched server after server walk by without anyone coming over.   A table that sat down after us (across from us) got service well before us.  It had to be at least 15 minutes until our waiter arrived.  Once he got there, he apologized for the wait.  It was smooth sailing from there. 
For a chain restaurant, the food was good.  The Harvest Salad had great flavors however, needed more cheese.  
I think I will sit at the bar next time.  May be the service there will be better.

If you're craving Italian, this place is a must. We made last minute reservations for a party of 20 and I was glad they were able to accommodate us on such short notice. When we got there, we were seated immediately and was presented with the most sweetest waitress ever. I'm so disappointed that I forgot her name!

I am a huge fan of Marsala sauce so I went with the Grilled Chicken "Under the Brick." I requested extra sauce and I was not disappointed. Even my daughter of 6 enjoyed it and you know how it goes when it comes to children. As for my other half, he got the Chicken Milanese. He's a simple kind of guy and way pickier than our daughter, but he cleared his plate with "Wow" in between bites. Let's just say it's now Pomodoro over Marinara any day.

I also love the fact that this restaurant is in the heart of Town Square, my favorite place to shop. And shall I mention the interior? It's so beautiful! Definitely bringing another crowd to this place again.

Went there this weekend and I would have to say I will go back every time I'm in Vegas. Simply delish. From the wedge salad with a yummy dressing, to my flirtini, to the pasta alla vodka. The pasta alla vodka was the best pasta dish I have ever had. The service was amazing. Nothing bad....at all.

Came here for a very late dinner at 11pm with hardly anyone in there thank goodness. I've tried showing up at 6 or 7pm but there was over a 30 minute wait so reservations are a must during this time.
I had the vodka ravioli which was excellent with creamy sauce and my friends shrimp & lobster fettuccine was  also deliciously flavorful. The beef carpaccio was okay but extremely large and the lobster bisque was good. The waitress showed up a little late but once she got there she was great. I would definitely come back here again but may try happy hour on my next visit since it can get pricey if you order food like I do!
This place has great food and a great price the service is also a plus as well . It was my first time here my waitress was a great help I will defiantly be returning
Great food, large portions and a great happy hour.  Perfect place to dine in the fall on the outside patio.

Well.... what can I say. Brio is always the safest bet for a casual lunch or dinner. There are probably better Italian restaurants in town but Brio hits this perfect spot. Whenever I have guests in town I bring them here. 

This time was no different. I've called 15 minutes in advance to make sure we get seated and in fact we were seated right away upon arrival.

Chilly weather calls for a bowl of hot soup and Brio's lobster bisque was an excellent starter. Carpacchio as usual, Burger (perfectly medium-rare), Crab cakes and Fritatta for me... all with a glass of Chianti.

We were in and out literally in 30 minutes. Service was timely and attentive. Brio really feels like a well-oiled restaurant machine :)

I thought this restaurant was decent, it's like an Italian cheesecake factory.  The waiters and hostesses are overly fake friendly, and the italian food is very americanized - big portions, overseasoned, lots of sauce, meat and pasta.

I ordered the caesar salad and eggplant parmesan, the salad was typical, the eggplant parmesan was pretty good, the pasta that accompanied the eggplant was horrible - drenched in oil, undercooked, and lukewarm...yuck!  

At the end the waiter brought out a dessert tray with mini espresso cups filled with a variety of sweets, it is a really good idea, and the perfect size to go with lunch, I picked the apple bread pudding, but it was way too sweet, not so much...

Yet another date tonight... but this time I'm with 4, or should I say 5. Some good friends are in town and invited us to a nice dinner. I started with calamari which I always enjoy. For dinner I had a Caesar salad and mushroom ravioli. I will say there was nothing here I loved!! But I did however think it was cute that the waiter insisted on my free salad that btw dude, came with my meal anyways.. finishing the meal off with red velvet cake, yummm!! Would defiantly eat here again. Not sure I would bring a date though.. actually I'm not coming back. :)
Freshly made pasta sooo good. Lobster bique is soo good everything on the menu is delicious

Ate here for a big family meal last night thinking it was the best compromise option. It turned out to be much better than Zefferini, our fancy fine dining option the evening before which also happened to be Italian good. 

Granted, Zefferini was interested in providing a more authentic Italian cuisine while Brio clearly catered to an un discerning American audience, but who cares! Why?

Part of our positive experience was the waitress we had, which is always appreciated in any establishment. Given the description above you would think she wouldn't know the wine list, right? Wrong. Not only did she had qualitative descriptions about their Tuscan Chiantis, but when she brought out samples of their by the glass range (another plus), her suggestion was spot on! (Winning Chianti selection was San Fabiano)

Her recommendation for a non-meat plate (Mediterranean penne?) was also a great choice. And the fresh sourdough bread made Zefferinis paltry store bought sliced broad baguette weep. 

And always a huge warm smile. 

One last point: we were in the back room which was intimate and quiet, though I could imagine the main salon would be quiet extremely noisy. 

In sum, if you're looking for good food off the strip and aren't trying to crap shoot fine dining without a star, give Brio a try.

I'm new to this yelp contraption but bear with me. My husband and I had to stop by the Apple Store and decided to grab dinner. Went in on a Thursday and had no trouble being seated promptly. Hostesses were kind and seemed eager to help us. I had the chicken Milanese and my husband had some sort of seafood pasta, I cannot remember. Absolutely no complaints. My chicken was moist and tender. Pasta was perfectly cooked and the sauce balanced it out perfectly. Looking forward to returning and trying more items off the menu! 
And sidenote: they have an adorable outside seating area and a few tvs by the bar to watch the game!!

This place is awesome for lunch.  I ordered the Brio chopped salad with salmon as an add on.

The combination of ingredients with the red wine vinaigrette dressing is not only delicious but healthy and satisfying. Adding the fresh, delicious sourdough bread equals a completely enjoyable meal. I will definitely be back for more!

Was celebrating a bachelorette party we Waited fifteen minutes before flagging down a waiter then waited another 5 before finally greated. Ordered food and cocktails. Food came out before drinks did. Water went empty entire time. By far worst service we have ever had. Server said manager was going to come over manager never came. We were offered free desert but informed server we needed to get going because we were going to a show  took server 5 minutes to drop of. Tab. Immediately put money/cards in and took ten minutes for her to come and pick up tab. Will not be back and will not recommend food was very salty. Manager never showed up. Very disappointing.

It seems like it has been too long since we last enjoyed Happy hour at Brio!! 
We finally made it back and were surprised  that we got the same awesome waitress. Danielle always seems to go above and beyond for us. She honestly makes us feel like family and even remembered my special martini I like....
This place is seriously the best for Happy Hour! The food, the price and the service are always fantastic!

So we eat at Brio at least once a week.  Food is great, servers know us, and it is generally a great experience.

However, every time we go we order the Pasta Yandolino.  It is no longer on the menu but they ALWAYS make it.  EXCEPT our last visit when the "chef just didn't feel like making it..."  Not out of ingredients, not we just can no longer offer it since it is not on the menu, etc.  The waiter, who is very cool, said the chef was just being moody and said he didn't want to offer it anymore or "didn't feel like making it today"

WRONG ANSWER buddy...I'm sure it means nothing cause the place does have great food and is always busy but you just don't do that to your regular customers.  Food is a 5, Chef is a 0!!!

Just had lunch at Brio and it was a wonderful experience from the food to the service. I went with a friend who had the steak salad and raved about it. I being the vegetarian did not have a lot to choose from however, was able to add asparagus and avocado to the chopped salad and loved it. 

Even better was our server Ashley, she made our lunch extra special. She was friendly and knowledgable, professional and attentive. I would hire her in a heartbeat!

Hit up the happy hour 3-6:30! Come early because the happy hour is only in the bar area and outside couches. Anthony and Jeremy were our servers and they were both great. I suggest you have a martini because the mojitos and sangrias aren't very strong, though they are both tasty. Get the burgers if you're hungry, they are big enough for a meal.

Amazing!!!!!!!!!!....... so attentive kind and delicious.... service was impeccable and I had a surprise birthday dinner planned for my mommy n law...these two ladies who were serving us handled our party of 19! Beyond well I was so impressed!!  Amazing ambiance! And so organized and clean!! We all were satisfied and will definitely visit again!!

One our favorite places to eat. Easter Sunday we had shrimp and grits, omelette...I think Italian....Service is always top notch.  Food was not that good and portions were small, very small.  Getting a cookie on the way out the door changes this from a 2 to 3 Star Rating...
This place is great! I had the pasta alla vodka it's was delicious!!
Was very and really busy. Good food for a good price. Service was a bit slow, but had a good time. Would recommend.
Eggplant pomodoro was soooooo KILLIN'! Service was nice and attentive, no wait for a table, and there wasn't an unhappy diner at our table.

R u serious, this place is buffet quality Italian Food.   Yes, I've been there several times for events/parties and it feels like a running joke.  Baddddddddd food at a great location.

It isn't a waste of your food time, but its definitely 50 minutes of your life that you will never get back.

Hosted my 50th Birthday party in the chefs banquet room. There was quite a bit of miscommunication between me and Maria. The tables were not set up to my liking and the service was slow and not very thorough. Actually,  we were lacking food servers. They did a great job rearranging the tables,  however, the manpower used for my party was inadequate  It took about 45 minutes to get the beverages to all the guests and the courses had to much delay between them. Keep in mind I only had 15 adults. When we finally did get the food it was excellent. Based on this experience I would dine there with a small group of people,  but hosting a party is not there strong suit. Additionally,  I never met the Banquet Manager or the Assistant Banquet Manager. Did not get a sense that they cared if my party was a success or not, I got the feeling they were only interested in my money. I do NOT recommend this place for a banquet or party. They are way to disorganized to host a great party.

Sonia our server was very pleasant and attentive. The Bread-boy asked if we wanted more bread to which we responded affirmatively. However, he never returned. I would suggest not promoting him to server until he gets the bread right. The place is noisy so don't expect a nice quiet dinner for two. Mom said the crabcakes were lukewarm at best. With so many waiters and cooks bumping into each other, why would food come out of the kitchen cold? Go figure. We'll return, but we won't be in a big hurry. Las Vegas has many choices, and at Town Square, many are within walking distance.

I just have to write this review because usually I have the worst experience at Brio due to the servers. But today Aaron really impressed me, he was on top of the refills and had the best attitude. I'm so glad he was our server today and to top it off the food was delicious no doubt!

Our party of 4 enjoyed an excellent lunch at Brio today. I asked for asparagus instead of mashed potatoes with the Chicken Limon and didn't get any grief from the pleasant waitress or the kitchen. The only aggravation was the hostess absolutely was not friendly. We were the first customers of the morning (10:50 am) and she acted like we asked for the moon because we wanted to sit outside in the sun.

It was super clean, server was nice and the tomato bisque was amazinggg
I usually HATE anything tomato so it was like an OMG HALLELUJAH moment when I had that first spoonful
It actually tasted like lasagna which made me want to cry with joy :')
The hostess was a little rude, but I'm just going to assume she had a bad day and leave it at that.

Brio is great for lunch, dinner or happy hour. Prices are comparable to other similar restaurants and they have a decent variety of entrees to choose from. Their flat bread is my favorite,  along with the wedge salad.

Always an enjoyable dining experience at the Brio.  Not surprised by the 30 minute wait on a saturday night.  Pork chop was juicy and nicely seasoned.  Even picked up the bone to finish it off.  Small tiramisu cup to finish off dinner...perfect size.

My first review - I'm rating this 5 stars due to the exceptional service provided. We originally were seated with 5 people, and they were able to add 3 (total of 8) when friends happened to join us. Additionally, our server and the restaurant manager still ensured that the timeliness of our food was still a top priority. They did everything to make sure we were satisfied and made us feel very welcomed!

Very disappointed, waited forty-five min for entr√©es then cold, they remade everything but much too slowly.
Big parties are priority from what we observed. 
Ruined my family's dinning experience!
Thanks.

It was a very good time. The food was delicious (had the grilled mahi mahi and my buddy had the grilled salmon), service was excellent, and helpful servers.  I would stay away from the fried calamari.  It was really greasy and more batter than meat. The design to the restaurant was pretty neat.

Had gone past this place many times while visiting Town Square.  Finally decided to do lunch one day.  The food and staff is excellent.  From the time you enter and see the hostess to the top manager who is Will.  He visits every table while you're eating and chats to ensure everything is OK.  Not many managers do this.  The servers are the best.  They're very attentive to all your needs.  They also have a lot of items on the menu to choose from.  Since this is an Italian restaurant I wasn't disappointed when I ordered the Tiramisu.  Rich and creamy.

Made plans to meet a friend/colleague for a long-overdue lunch. She suggested we meet at Town Square and Brio is one of her favorite haunts. I was panic-stricken as the last time I dined there, healthy fare options seemed scarce.  Was pleasantly surprised to find a phenomenal lunch special -- fish of the day. This day it was mahi mahi with spinach and other veggies. No need to do my "no rice/no potato" special order drama.  I asked for sauce on the side, no oil  and some lemon wedges.  Delicious! I even resisted the bread basket. My friend's steak salad looked fabulous and hearty as well.

Great and Gorgeous my girl and I are having a delicious lunch in Tuscany paradise good is so good!!! And service is excellent the chipotle panini is amazing and my girl loved the low cal salmon plate perfect for couples brunch/dinner

We threw our wedding rehearsal dinner here in April of 2009.!  Wow.  The most courteous wait staff and management we have ever witnessed in Vegas.  We had about 35 people at our dinner and we had some last minute additions as well and the staff scrambled to get everything set for the extra people.  The private dining menu prices are very reasonable and for great food.   The steak was amazing.  Thank you Brio for great service and great food.  We live in the Chicago suburbs and have hosted a friend's baby shower at the Brio in Lombard and have had great experiences there as well.

My first time Brio. Based on review from fellow yelpers I decided to take my wife and try out the happy hour menu.

We loved everything we ordered and the service was great. I will definitely be back to Brio next time I'm in Town Square.

As a first timer I was impressed with this place! The location is perfect in Town Square. It's a great place for family/friends dinner or even date nights. It had a very soothing and settling environment.

The dishes were slightly large but enough to be finished. They also do half servings, which comes in handy for children or anyone with a small appetite like myself. I got the Lobster and Crab Ravioli and it made my taste buds jump! Their pastas taste how they look - YUMS.

In addition to my satisfying experience, the customer service there is also a two thumbs up. They're on top of customer's requests.

Food was a solid 7.99/10, but service was pretty mediocre, dude with a beard served us.  One refill.  Food arrived separately, food that arrived late, we had to remind him twice to bring us the fresh grated Parmesan.  Eh, maybe worth it on another night.

This place was a big disappointment! I'll keep it short & simple. Server was slow as molasses and not into her job. I ordered a chicken Caesar salad ..easy enough , right? Nope...yellow lettuce, chicken tasted gross and barely any dressing . Manager asked if I wanted a new one...uhhh no! If you can screw up a salad then you got probs! Service slow..food not up to par. Waste of time & money .  I've been to another Brio in Cali ...guess I'll stick with that one because that one is fabulous!

Long story short- I ordered my lamb chop medium rare but it  turned out to be a bit too 'sashimi-like'  for me and they devotedly have it redone for me to medium regardless the buried night. Maybe cos I wasn't expecting much, that was A+ service!
The meat was very tender and the dessert trio was impressive. I think it would have even been better if they could be easy on the salt and sugar.  
Overall I was satisfied with the dining experience.

Mmm. Brio.

I am so addicted to their Crab and Shrimp Crab Cakes, it's ridiculous. Personally, I like to get the appetizer size (two GIGANTIC crab cakes) and then add my own side of asparagus - which they do just right there. 

If I really want to go crazy, I'll get the Spinach Artichoke Dip that comes served with their Cheese Crisp Flatbread as an appetizer. 

And if I really, really want to go crazy - I will add a Bellini to all that action. 

Brio has never let me down. It's got a great location, right smack in the middle of Town Square. If the weather is nice, have a seat out on the patio for some great people watching. 

I have taken my parents here - I've been on a date here - I've been on a Girl's Night Out here - it's just a CROWD PLEASER. Every dish is delicious and the service is always on point.

I hear they are opening over at Tivoli Village come Spring 2011. A Summerlin location would be fab for those of us who have to make the trek out to Town Square to get there otherwise.

All around great experience. Everyone enjoyed their meal, the service was great and the atmosphere was gorgeous.  

*****Tip sign up for their email club and they send you an offer for a free bruchetta quatro appetizer*****

Brio is a Italian Grille in a shopping center catering to tourists on the strip. The food is average, but takeout from any chain fast food is just about as good. 

We started with Roasted Garlic, Spinach and Artichoke dip. It was warm but not hot when served. By the time we all had some it cooled to a strange consistency. Chopped salad was good. Veggies were fresh and the portion was good size. The Campanelle Carbonara was presented in a soupy white sauce that was very thin and tasteless. The thin Alfredo sauce was the consistency of a white wine sauce. When asked the server explained that was normal. The pasta was cooked properly but was not fresh. Clearly prepackaged dried pasta. The special for the night was a Chicken and Vegetable Spaghettini this too was served lukewarm. Surprising to have that happen considering the place was half full. No big tables or crowds. 

Basically just an average place with very average food.

Brio is a step above your typical chain Italian restaurants. The atmosphere at the location in Town Village is great. The food is fresh and hot and the wine list extensive. Top off your day of shopping in Town Village by going to Brio.

We had a wedding rehearsal dinner in a private room at BRIO. The staff was amazing there. Novo (events manager) was so nice over the phone, assisted in making this an easy booking, and making sure we had a great dinner. Our server was great. He was on top of drink orders, making sure the food was correct and placed in front of the right person. He was never intrusive when coming in to check on us, somehow made us feel taken care of but never bothered. Truly a great experience and would recommend to others.

Brio is great.  As crowded as Town Square restaurants can be, the wait is always quick at Brio.  Their menu has some seriously delicious selections, and the pricing is great for the quality of the restaurant.  One of my favorite things on the menu is the shrimp and eggplant appetizer... spicy, crispy... its as good as it gets.  I've had everything from pizza to pasta and fish and chicken here and its all been great.  The daily special menu usually has a fish dish on it which have always been great.  And if you stick around for after dinner, the creme brulee here is awesome, as is their coffee.  The brunch menu is also amazing... try the sausage florentine crepes... i'm getting hungry writing this.  Go there... you'll see.

I rate this place a 3 all because of the sever she was extremely nice and well spoken.
The food was meh nothing special. I had the grilled chicken breast with mushrooms and mashed potatoes.  I had the peach sangria which was superb.

Amazing wait staff and great food.
Atmosphere of this bistro can't be easily beat.
I chose the Brunch Burger which was perfect medium rare!
Gluten free pasta available was also a plus.
Great place for brunch and plenty of room, no crowded tables.
Service during happy hour in the bar area is just so-so. The service in the actual restaurant is excellent. Shrimp and eggplant is my favorite appetizer.

I love Brio! Great food ,great service, great prices in the beautiful Town Square center! During the week they have fabulous, large portioned appetizers for $2.95 or $3.95. I booked a large group and they placed us in our own private room without charging banquet prices!I highly recommend!

I took my boyfriend to this place for his birthday. We loved it. I would recommend that if you are in Vegas to go to this place. The food was excellent and customer service was on point. Omg there dessert is to die for. Can't wait to go back. It was an amazing  experience.
My fiancee and I had dinner at this Brio Saturday night and enjoyed great service, great food,  and delicious drinks.  The bartender was outstanding!
Solid food. Neither spectacular nor bad. Good service. Sit outside.

Authenticity is not their forte.  However, location and happy hour is.  Loved the beef carpaccio and pasta vodka with Peroni draft.  My wife loves the free sour dough and spiced flat bread - lol.  Fyi, mall employees get a nice 20% off ;)  I say 3.5, but rounding up to 4 because service has always been great.

Wow! Planned a wedding reception for 25 after my son's wedding last weekend. All done by phone, planning with Tiffany at Brio. She couldn't have been more effiecient and professional. Our group was put in a lovely private room with 2 servers to assist us. The food was really, really delicious! My favorite being the grilled pork chops, yum. We had the room for 2 1/2 hours and I was able to have a cake delivered and also put out favors at each table. The servers always asked us  prior to adding any charges to our bill. Very well priced. Beautiful setting at Towne Square, inside as well. Not high end but well presented and a great value and looked and tasted MUCH more than the price reflected. What a memorable evening!

This place is a winner.  Having just relocated from one of the best food meccas in California (SF Bay Area), I have been on a quest for good, non-chain restaurants. Every thing about this place works.  Atmosphere, location, parking, meal any time of the daytime,  excellent menu choices, great service mixed with mediocre, healthy food choices,  small dessert portions, excellent wine choices--I could go on.  In 6 weeks since moving we have been here 5 or 6 times.  I will bring friends here for sure, and I just ate dinner alone in the bar area 2 days ago, & it was perfect for me!!  All you negatives , go elsewhere. This is a fine choice!!

Made reservations for 8 on Mother's Day for a late lunch and was seated promptly with my entire family. The service was phenomenal, our waiter was extremely attentive and kind! Ordered the Pasta Ala Vodka which was absolutely DELICIOUS. The waiter never left us without bread as he knew my two picky toddlers were only going to be eating the bread and he even gave us fresh bread to go! Ordered the dessert sampler and tiramisu which were just amazing. I am never disappointed, but this visit was really special. My 3 year old daughter even hugged the waiter before we left!!! Will absolutely be coming back!
Came here for lunch with coworkers, had grilled salmon angel hair pasta. The salmon is pretty good, but a very small portion. One of my coworker keeps saying he is hungry right after lunch :)

Don't bother to come here if your looking for good tasting Italian food. The service was good, but quality of the food was poor. Appetizer we ordered was calamari. It seemed frozen and not fresh. Sauces were not good. I had the pesce piccata, it was very dry and not pleasant tasting at all. The pasta fra diavlo was terrible. It looked like mac and cheese with shrimp.  The third person had the risotto, that was just okay, definitely not good. 

Highlight was sangria and bread. 

It's sad that we wasted some decent money on some bad food.

alright Brio!!! You have redeemed yourself! 
Came here on a Thursday and the service was back to the expectation we had. Our server was lovely and she was well informed on all the happy hour menu! 
Thursdays are absolutely insane, so get there early to find a good spot, the server in the bar found us a spot even though there were none. Anyways my wife and I will be coming back again and am happy that we had better experience.
 Hopefully the previous cocktail server has had some  better days and shows more kindness to her guest! For us the restaurant experience is a combo of service and food.

To start, -1 star for repeat violations, all three violations were repeated from last visit. -2 Server chewing gum while folding dinner napkin (essentially spiting on everyone's napkin THANKS, -3 runner bringing out food when we are only half way done with our salads (I had to ask him to take the hot food back, which when it did come out it was just warm oh well, he was just going to leave it on our table where it would have turned cold by the time we got to it, c'mon man I know it's not fine dinning, but it's not Olive Garden either), -4 pantry cooks using single use food handlers gloves improperly (really scary, if you don't know how to use them correctly, they are actually worse than bare hands). I like your food, but please these are all training and management issues. The last time on our way out I passed a Manager who asked how everything was and I told him. This time no one asked, so know I'm telling everyone. PLEASE FIX THESE ISSUES WE LIKE YOUR FOOD, BUT UNLESS THESE ISSUES ARE FIXED I'LL JUST FIND SOME PLACE ELSE TO SPEND MY MONEY.

I was as customer on Sat, Feb 2nd, and now I am getting around to my updates.
Good food for the $$, easy access, and decent, attentive wait staff.  I read all the latest reviews on this place and might I say some of the negative ones must have just been very unlucky. One note: get there early as the closer to dinner the longer the wait.
I was VERY satisfied with my meal! I had the pasta primevera. Very flavorful! You can't eat here in a rush....because they take their time. Not too long, but the wait is DEFINITELY worth it! ;)

My favorite day of the week is Sundays just because of Brunch! Brio never fails me with their delicious brunch options and Mimosa pitchers. Me & Mom come pretty much every Sunday and enjoy a nice view @ the bar. Jade is the BEST bartender and always makes us feel welcome and no matter how busy they are (& Boy do they get busy), she always give us the best service. 

I cant pick one plate to rave about because all the apps are great (especially the Bruchetta sampler) and the brunch menu has several great options, depending on what your in the mood for. 

All the staff is very attentive and the manager is always walking around checking on everyone. There is usually a wait for a table, so come prepared but its definitely worth it. 

We will keep coming back for the Yummy food, Great drinks & Jade!
Food is always great! Sat at the bar and had the best service and Bloody Mary with Jade the bartender! Always great time but this was above and beyond. The bruschetta sampler is awesome.

This place is Very good ! Thank you so much to the Boss, Manager or whoever Run this place. And bIg Thank you to a NOVA the special party planner. He made our get together party very special ! I were misunderstood  on the phone conversation. But got there and he take n care of it :-) Showed me that he cares about he's job how to please the customers, and people ! Thank you very very much !

I  happy Customers ! :-) 10 stars !
This place is gorgeous! Food is excellent. All the waiters are hott!! LOL.. i will def be going back for more!

Do not come here. We went to attempt and eat dinner at this place with a group of 6...my 2 friends and my fianc√© and her friend. They are both from London and have British drivers licenses. We attempted to order 2 bottles or Prosecco and the waitress said they had to provide their passport on top of the ID or they couldn't be served..we have been for for 3 nights and have eaten out every meal and went to nice clubs and have not been asked to provide a second ID. The lady brought the manager over and she was very rude and cold. I asked to show me the law/article that shows international tourists have to provide a passport on top of their ID, and she said she didn't have it..she pulled this rule out of a rabbits hat. The waitress and manager were so rude and unfriendly and don't know how they work in the service industry..even if you don't have the same problem we had avoid coming here this is a crusty chain establishment with horrible service. Take your business elsewhere there are much nicer places in this price range.

On Sept 23, 2015 We had a small wedding reception at Brios.  What an amazing experience.  They went into the room and decorated for me because I was at the wedding. It was beautiful. The food and service were top notch.  One dish stood out,  a vodka pasta plate was a big hit! 
A very special praise to Nova the director of banquets.  A very sweet, understanding and helpful young man.  He was there for me when I was breaking down and nervous about the party. He is just perfect at what he does! 
Thank you for a perfect day! 
Sandra Perreault and family

Went there for my birthday the service was horrible we were given dirty utensils also the glasses weren't polished. The pasta was bland and I didn't like the chicken that was in the pasta. Better off eating at California pizza.

The lobster bisque was delicious!  The prices weren't to bad, two adult two children $120.00 after tip. One minor complaint, two of our sodas ran empty and I had to ask for a refill. This is a big pet peeve of mine however I'll cut them a little slack since it is Mother's Day. We will return.

Amazing service all around!  Amanda the server was on point and adorable!  Even told her I like cheese, so she brought a container of extra cheese for my to go container!  Made my friend samantha 's birthday amazing!
Amazing good, good service, live music and an amazing interior and setting. Highly recommend!

Very good chicken piccata. Portion size was right, good amount veg and cooked perfectly. Skip the Sangria - better of with beer here. Drinks not this place specialty. Bit expensive but the "light" menu is probably the way to go.

Went with some friends with happy hour and was disappointed. The food was not good, the only fish we enjoyed was the eggplant with shrimp. We sent everything else back unfinished, especially the beef carpaccio. 
The drinks were ok, but had very little alcohol. 
Overall I would not come back.

Booked a reservation for five at 4:30 p.m. on a Sunday.  Our party was there EXACTLY on time but we had to wait just under 10 minutes until the hostess figured out where to seat us...so what's the point of a reservation? Minus 1 1/2 star.

After we were seated, no one came to our table and acknowledged us for 10 more minutes. Huge customer service mistake. The waitress finally showed up but she should've had the bus person bring water and bread while she was taking our drink orders. Again Brio's management, customer service was underwhelming. Minus 1 star.

The drinks were served and our food order was taken then delivered.

1.) Shrimp Mediterranean..5 med/small shrimp on skewer. Small portion, o.k. flavor.
2.) Lasagna..the two members of our party liked the flavor, not the portion.
3.) Spaghetti in red sauce..it's spaghetti, what else can I say.
4.) Veal Milanese...basically chicken fried steak with a small side of pasta. Not worth  it for me. Flavor was nothing special. Pasta was plain.

Meal = Minus 1 1/2 star.  Flavor, portion and presentation are all lacking.

Overall = Total of 1 star given. Brio's is 100% geared towards tourist who would probably never come back so the attention and details of the staff and quality of the food is not a concern. I will also never come back or recommend Brio's to my friends. This is a customer service town with a lot of choices, first impression counts when it comes to where I spend my money.

Our booth still had crumbs on the seats when we sat down (we were a walk-in on a Friday night, so I can't judge too harshly). Other than that, the service and food was great.  We had the Caprese Classico, Shrimp Mediterranean, and 5 oz. Filet Brio from the Light Menu.  Delicious and guilt-free :)

Every time we visit Vegas we eat here.  Wonderful atmosphere and great food.  James was our server, who was very friendly. Our table had the lamb chops, lasagna, chicken Milanese, pasta pesto, gluten free sausage pasta, sampler dessert, cream br√ªl√©e, ricotta cheesecake, chocolate cake w/ vanilla Ice cream.   Every dish was flavorful, and well worth it for the prices. We'll definitely continue to return....
Good food and service. I got the lobster tail and shrimp. It was amazing. The spinach dip was good.

Came for brunch today and had the best experience. Mimosas, Benedict and French toast were all amazing! Seen the manager seating a table , running food and even stopped to fill our mimosas for us :) No wonder it's a successful and busy restaurant .

Took some clients to Brio based on some good reviews from friends.  Thought the food from the appetizers to desert was excellent.  The service was also spot on, i.e. not too smothering and not too spacey.  Loved the place!
Great Ambience, Decent Service, Overpriced Fake Italian Food.
I have been here many times for the happy hour menu.  The happy hour menu is supper great with reasonable prices. I enjoy ordering the delicious shrimp with eggplant plate and the the biro burger.

This is now my favorite restaurant.  As an overview, the food is excellent, the service is professional and fast, the noise level is a bit loud when crowded (like Cheesecake Factory), the lighting is low, the prices are on the higher side, and you get seated almost immediately with reservations. We came for dinner on two occasions around 6pm both on Saturday.

The food is one of the highlights.  I recommend the 8oz filet, or the crab and shrimp cakes, or the lamb chops, and the sampler bruschetta, the Tiramisu, traditional cheesecake, and the Torta Di Cioccolata (like a fancy lava cake with Gelato).  I recommend those  since those were the only dishes my wife and I have tried so far and they were very good!  

The beef and lamb were cooked perfectly to order and seasoned just right.  The roasted veggies that came with our entr√©es were very good although mine were slightly over seasoned. 

The crab and shrimp cakes were awesome...  not too much breading,  not overcooked, and the quality of the seafood was great.  When I took my first bite it reminded me of San Francisco (that where I grew up).  The crispy potatoes that came with this dish was really good and so were the roasted veggies.

The bruschetta was pretty pricey but was pretty good... if you want to skip the appetizers, that's ok because the rest of the food and experience is more than enough to satisfy and leave you with a smile.

The desserts are a wonderful sweet topping to the experience here.  The cheesecake, has no graham crust but I guess that's traditional.  It was still really good.  The Tiramisu was just the way I like it.  Anyways...all of the desserts that I've listed above go well with the coffee served here.  FYI when the waiter presents you with the dessert tray, they are presented in little cups, however they do have the regular size versions of those.

The portions were the right size.  Let me put it this way,  when we left, we did not feel like we overate.

My wife and I have come here twice in the past two weeks and we love it.  The first time was on a date night and we were very happy.  The second time we came was for my dad's 70th bday.  My parent were happy and my wife and I were happy... Good times!

Hope you enjoy it!

Great food as usual at their Happy Hour. But we were really disappointed by a blond ponytail server at a bar. From the beginning to end she was looking upset and NEVER smiled. No appreciation toward us eating there.  We tried to make her laugh and my boyfriend was extra friendly to her, but he gave up. It kind of ruined our date. We always have been fun and good time so just it was very disappointed.

I made reservations to go here for my biffle's burfday.  The hostesses were very polite and the place was busy, but still pretty quiet for the size of the seating area and high ceilings.  We were sat promptly and our waitress took our drink orders shortly afterwards.  The service was pretty good, the food was just "okay".  Overall I wouldn't call it a favorite, we may try it again sometime, but aside from this it was nothing very special and I feel as if it was overpriced for what I got.  Visit and see for yourself.

Last Wednesday was the first day of live calls at our call center, so to celebrate the executive and support staff went to Brio Tuscan Grille for a celebratory dinner.

I've never been to Town Square before...driving around in here gave me a feeling of not being in Vegas...more akin to being down on Rodeo Drive in LA (I know it's nothing like it but it's the feeling I got).  

Stepping into the building, I was impressed with the high ceilings and tall back wall that looked like it had been delivered from Rome itself.  It was very loud in the restaurant because of the openness of the space (it's very spacious for seating and the bar area) but I was able to find my group very easily and interact without much trouble.

The wine, appetizers, salads, bread and soup were all excellent.  The choice in breads was nicely done to not bore you with a simple roll.  The entree's were classic italian faire, however I ordered a steak (not in the mood for lasagna or something pasta).  It was cooked wonderfully; I wasn't the only one to order the steak...all enjoyed theirs, too.

Desserts were served in a type of large shot glass with flavors such as Creme Brulee and Tiramisu, among others.  I loved scooping into the tiramisu and finding a different flavor every scoop.

It was a little pricey for my taste; since I was part of a group and the company was footing the bill, I was more than happy to attend.  I would come here only if I wasn't paying.  If I were tasked with taking care of the check, I could find quieter, more intimate places to get the most bang for my buck.

Beautiful decor, very pleasant and attentive service.  I had lunch.  The lobster bisque was absolutely delicious - but it would have been nice if my bowl was filled as opposed to a half portion.  The Caesar salad was nothing more than a few morsels of romaine hearts, one cruton and a a teaspoon of salad dressing.  That was a bit of a disappointment and I left hungry.  I'm sure pastas and other entrees would have been a better choice.
The service was awful. It toke 20 min for them to bring tap water to my table. Server hardly came to the table to check on us. Food is good but not worth the wait.

Went here for my first time on my anniversary with my boyfriend and my opinions on this place disappoint me so much cause I tried to find the smallest reasons to love it! The service was slow and we got our food before water. Our server also threw back lots of attitude. I asked politely for fresh bread in the beginning and the server rudely goes, "most people here like the bread hard but sure." The food came out and my boyfriends food was cold! And I got the spicy shrimp fettuccine, seeing the price being $20 I expected it to be great, and that being said, the shrimp was hard, pasta wasn't fully cooked, and I found probably 3 lobster. Great sauce. But couldn't be happy eating it. We got the cheesecake for dessert and at that point I was over it as well as to how mushy it was. I'd give brio a second try one day but unbelievable as to how my first time went.

The worst bartenders I have experienced in my life. Did not even have the courtesy of saying hello or any attempt at being friendly. It was like they were deliberately trying to  make me feel uncomfortable . They also said some inappropriate comment under there breath which was out of line and disrespectful for no apparent reason. I noticed they treated those of "color", mexican and black very rudely as opposed to other guests. 

The food at first was okay but later I had to spend a few trips to the toilet. Enough said about that. Will not be giving these ladies my business again.

My family and I come to Town Square quite often and always pass Brio while we're shopping. Finally, after 2 years later, decided to go on a dinner date with my mom after a long night of mother daughter bonding (a.k.a retail therapy). 
The minute we walk in we were greeted with pleasant smiles and warm "Hellos." I was expecting to wait to be seated because the shopping center was busy that night, however, I was mistaken. We were seated right away. 
The atmosphere is awesome, definitely a place I'd consider having a wedding reception at. The decor is beautiful, the lights are nice and dim, the ceilings are vaulted and it makes me feel like I'm eating in a chapel. It's very fitting to have either a romantic dinner or even a casual lunch. 
The food was delicious. The portion was perfect. It didn't leave me still hungry nor did it make me over-stuffed. Started off with bread and lavash and a lobster bisque. The lobster bisque was just a little bit salty but nothing that a piece of bread couldn't compensate for. Shared a Chicken&Quinoa Salad and Pasta Pesto and it was absolutely delicious. And for dessert I enjoyed my favorite, Creme Brulee, made perfectly. 
I will definitely be returning.

We held our wedding reception at Brio Tuscan Grille at Town Center. It was so wonderful, I can't recommend this place enough! A few emails is all it took to book our reservation from Washington state. Nova was very helpful and would respond to my emails within a day or so. The evening went off without a hitch. When we all arrived, the room we reserved was all ready and set up beautifully. The service was excellent and the food was amazing and TONS of it! Our guests kept complimenting us on what a wonderful choice we had made for our reception and how great the food was. I highly recommend Brio for any special occasion!

I received an invitation to Brio for a Spy on Vegas Event. It was great because of the Free Drinks and $3.00 appetizers. The food was surprisingly delicious. Since it was a SpyonVegas event there was not much seating. People were herding over the drinks and there wasn't even enough organization. Eventually we were able to get a spot on the couches. The server was helpful despite the chaotic mess of people. We ended up ordering everything on the appetizer menu. My recommendations- the spicy shrimp & eggplant platter, steak bruschetta, and Margarita pizza. For drinks, definitely have the regular or peach Sangria.
Love this place. Always consistent with the food. Love the reverse Happy Hour and the outside seating area. Great to bring family and friends.
Wonderful day here. The bread is awesome and the food believe in the greater heard so many good things about this if that was. Looking forward to it

I'm very dissapointed because I always go and have a drink with my wife at this restaurant, and I never had problems when I showed my id to the waiter, and now I come and the waiter says she can't take my id as valid because is from other country. Im only here for bussiness and everytime I go to vegas, I go to Brio so I'm wondering what they do with all the other tourist that are in vegas? Unfortunately my wife and I will never go back to such place. This is supposed to be a tourist friendly restaurant and we felt discriminated I only hope this didn't happen only because I'm not american.

Brio is located in the new shopping  mall , Town Square,  which is  about  2 miles south of  Mandalay Bay.  We decided to check it out after reviewing the menu.
 For drinks I ordered the special Wild Berry lemonade which was so quenching. For the entree, I ordered the Chicken and butternut squash Risotto which came with a choice of  Insalata (chopped, caesar or bistecca)  I chose caesar  which was a generous serving.  When the risotto came , I thought, "what a big bowl with such a small portion," but it was actually just enough to fill me.  My husband ordered the soup of the day which was the tomato bisque which he really liked.  For his entree, he ordered the linguine with baby clams and was happy with his choice.  The waiter brought over these mini desserts that looked so irresistible, we decided to order one Tiramisu and one Panna Cotta.  It was so good!  
The staff is pretty attentive and the decor is very nice with plenty of outdoor seating.  I would definitely return in the future.
I liked this place. Thought it seemed like an Olive Garden on steroids. Very good food, very good wait staff, very great atmosphere. Will definitely return!!

Service was great he was on top of it! Which was nice because he did have multiple tables to attend. The steak my hubby ordered was mouthwatering & cooked to perfection! My salad was delicious . ..pretty tasty & filling. Our daughter had her own pepperoni pizza,ate the whole pie! She absolutely loved it! Deserts were amazing as well our favorite was the warm chocolate cake. We tried the tiramisu as well but it was ok alot of whip cream if you ask me.

The "best steak salad in town" is now the worst.  Less than an ounce of steak, bag o' greens past their prime and I counted exactly three  pecans on my plate.   At  our table, the floor crunched with crumbs under our feet.  The booth seating was sticky.  The noise level, including unnecessary shouting from the prep area,  is oppressive and I was unable to converse normally with my lunch companion.  The staff  are friendly but clearly overworked and stressed.  All in all, an unpleasant dining experience.  We won't be back.

We had reservations 6 last night, and, based on my experience at the Park Meadows/Colorado location, I was very excited to partake in some yummy Italian food. We were seated promptly by a friendly hostess, but that's where any semblance of good service ended. The waiter completely forgot to bring bread and butter and was very difficult to catch when we tried to ask for some. 

Our starters came quickly. Our entrees also came quickly. So quickly, in fact, that there was no room on the table for any of them, and we were left scrambling to finish our salads while the busboy wedged in main courses. 

I ordered shrimp and lobster ravioli, which I've had previously at the Colorado location. Apparently this one doesn't serve it, so the waiter changed my order to fettuccine and neglected to tell me. I did not want fettuccine. The busboy kept trying to give me the plate I hadn't ordered until, a good 5 minutes later, the waiter showed up and allowed me to order something new. By this point, I was stressed out that the rest of the party would be finished by the time that my meal came out. From what I remember, the roast chicken was good, but since I was trying to inhale it, not much made an impression.

Last but not least, my friend and I ordered the same dessert - creme brulee. My dish clearly hadn't been cleaned properly before the new brulee was made, since it had rubbery, burnt on bits at the bottom on the ramekin. That, however, paled in comparison to my friend.

She found several different kinds of paper inside her dessert - what looked like a sizeable piece of paper towel and tissue. Like the rest of the night, the waiter never came by to check in, so the issue was never resolved.

Ew.

Brio is an Italian Restaurant located in the middle of Town Square on the South Strip.The parking area is a short walk away. It is a large layout containing an inside and outside sit-down bar, plus numerous tables, sofas, fire-places circled by comfortable seating that offer cozy atmospheres. The kitchen is not visible to patrons and there are no emanating smells. The ventilation is efficient and keeps the air fresh. The uniformed staff is friendly and gives a warm welcome upon arrival. We are immediately seated and attended to.  Music is also performed by a small live band in the evenings. The volume is high and on the distractive side .
The dish I ordered was a beef carpaccio. It is served in a sizable platter that surprised me. It is not an immense amount of food. The center is thin and crunchy Italian bread that resembles pizza, but it is not. This is laid on top of a small salad. The outer edge of the platter has the thin slices of carpaccio that is lightly covered with mustard aioli, Parmigian and capers.
The aroma is of a strong and spicy vinegar with no notice of the raw meat. The taste of the meat is mild, but all the other condiments make the meal salty and acidic. The capers give it lively chewy taste. The texture of the meat is very tender and it melts in your mouth, while the crunchy bread is seedy and rough. The ingredients complement each other very well.
To top it off the dessert was hot chocolate cake with ice cream on top along with vanilla on the perimeter. There was also chocolate syrup and raspberry on the side.  It had a strong flavor of chocolate and vanilla combined. Hot and cold ,sweet and bitter makes a great taste.
The wait staff was friendly however to a fault, as they checked on our needs too often. Their timing was about every 5 minutes and it interrupted our dining.
The overall experience was a plus, I would repeat.
Great and prompt service,; the food quality and presentation is excellent! Nice atmosphere in a European like setting. prices are reasonable.

You have to try everything once. This place is nice but the steak could have been better. Not something I would do again. The server came off a bit rude not to my party but to another server who was just trying to help out a server who did not help us.  On top of that she only comes when another server stands by our table. They had a wedding party here and they sat us right by the room and they was uber loud it was hard to enjoy. Now when a plate cost  28-30something dollars. A relaxing quite dinner would have been nice.

My boyfriend took me here for our anniversary and man was it delicious. We started with drinks I got the peach Bellini and he got the raspberry mojito. I must say the Bellini was ok but just ok it was really sweet and thick and kind of hard to choke down. The mojito on the other hand was freaking delicious I really recommend trying the mojito it was refreshing and had a nice fruit flavor with not to much mint. 

For the entree I got fettuccine Alfredo cuz I'm kinda picky and it is my favorite pasta dish ever!! It was so yummy! It was rich and the pasta was cooked perfect and of course I got extra cheese. It was very filling and the portion sizes were on point. 

We didn't opt for dessert because we were so full it was ridiculous but the dessert menu did sound really good and I definitely want to try one next time we go. 

The decor is really nice and the service was great we never didn't have bread which is pretty damn awesome cuz you gotta always have bread with Italian food. I highly recommend this restaurant for an intimate date night or an anniversary it was amazing and my only complaint is I wish the Bellini wasn't so sweet! A+ Brio
Great Italian food. I ordered a pasta with shrimp. It was super fresh and tasty. It wasn't heavy and I didn't feel gross after like other Italian restaurants. Great food and service.

I love it here at Brio Tuscan Grille!

The service is wonderful. It was crowded tonight and there was a wait even though we got reservations several days beforehand. But the waiters were patient, and they managed their time wisely.

The food was delicious. I love how each table gets a nice basket of bread before the entr√©es. I ordered the Roasted Red Pepper Bruschetta, which is more on the light side of the menu. It was satisfying and not too overwhelming. 

The atmosphere was casual. Although the interior design of the restaurant was elegant and formal, there were several people that ranged from t-shirts and shorts to tuxedos and dresses. I do love how fancy Brio looks, though. I enjoyed looking at the architecture and the design of the restaurant. 

I knocked off one star because although the food was delicious, it wasn't a 100% wow factor. Maybe if I tried something more exotic / new off of the menu, I would give this restaurant the 5 stars it deserves. Overall, I would probably come here again.

OMG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I must say finally a restaurant who understands portions. The service was amazing and funny (like comedy hour) the staff communicated well together and I loved every minute of this experience. I ordered the Salmon dish with pasta, which was to die for. I was able to finish my  entire plate and not waste it or take leftovers. Just enough to feel delightfully full. The tastes and flavors were like a symphony in my mouth. I will be going back  here again and again and again..........

Brio is one of those places you can visit multiple times and every experience is a positive one. Particularly for large dining groups. Whenever family or friends come to town with a large group, or when there is a birthday dinner, we include Brio on the list of eats. 

First off, you can do call-ahead-seating. Bonus. Especially for a group of 12+, which was our case the other night. Shotgun wedding at The Little White Chapel, then down to Brio for some celebratin'! LOL. 

The prices are very reasonable if you consider the competition and what you get. Yes it's a "chain" but c'mon, we're on a budget, we like to drink wine (by the bottle) and there were a ton of us! Also it's not overly chained AND they only do Italian restaurants. Bonus. 

Ok so what to get: 

Lobster Bisque Soup 
Artichoke Dip 
Lobster Ravioli 
Sweet Potato and Chicken Risotto 
Fettuccine Napoli 
Grilled Salmon 
Entree Salad - Steak Salad 
Add on either the Caesar, the Wedge or the Brio salad to your pasta dish...they are all great! 
Dessert - get a variety of the little servings. YUM! 

If you are coming with just a few or alone, I recommend trying the Bar during happy hour. There are some pretty good "bar bites" deals.

I am currently eating at Brio in Las Vegas' Town Square Mall. I am not sure if this was an off day but the service was  not good. I had to ask for items repeatedly. The food was OK but nothing to scream about. Overall,I am disappointed and will not come back. You rarely get a second time to make a first impression.

Loved this nice, little, restaurant!  Great food!  I had the grilled chicken and veggies that were amazing!  My husband got the lasagne and said it was the best he's ever had!  We'll definitely go back!  I highly recommend!

The only reason I keep coming back here is because my friends like the food. I always get coerced to eat here. The service is consistently horrible. One star just because of the service. The food is decent. Do not try the shrimp scampi - it is an abomination. The lamb chops however are great. Our party gave the server a 28  percent tip and he did not even thank us.He just gave us a stupid smirk like he really deserved it.  What a douche bag!  I always say I would never go back here but my friends keep suckering me back. I always think that it is going to be better but guess what? It never does.

Brio is delicious!!!!  The food is so good, the service is great, atmosphere is very classy, beautiful Tuscan architecture and authentic Italian food makes it one of my favorites.  Get here at around 545 and you get seated right away even for large parties.

Brio's food is just okay. I've had heir lamb chop appetizer, and a few of their pasta dishes. The lamb wasn't the best quality but it wasn't horrible. The pastas on the other hand were so overly seasoned, greasy, and so salty that they were gross. That kind of scared me off from trying their food again. NOW! Their bar is another story. Love it. They have an absolutely gorgeous patio with canvas curtains, string lights, and comfy chairs. They have this raspberry mojito that is so delicious that I get one every time I go there. It's romantic and intimate. The staff are excellent, I have never had anything less than perfect service when i've gone there. It's a more mature crowd and probably one of my favorite places to go on a date. I would try the food again, because it is possible I just had a few bad experiences. But the ambiance, the drinks, the service, and the location is what keeps making me come back for more.

Well not sure what to say about this place no more...... Not sure if we come at the wrong time but the service here has got really bad ..... This has been my go to place fore years and my last 2 visit including today just made me realize it time to let this place go.....what makes me so mad is how they go about the hole thing like all you hear is sorry this sorry that like we will take care of the bill...... Like NO we didn't come here to eat and have our bill taken care of we  come here to eat the good food they used to make and leave satisfied ....But now you wait forever and then when you finally order and they bring food it's wrong..... Like what the F**** we done waited hella long and now they to remake for us to wait even longer..... Smh, heart broken this was my last visit here..... sucked that u my man had to leave without eating his meal, he was so disappointed that he didn't even want to stop anywhere else to get him the food.....
