I think it was due to the Italian sausage in it... she's not too crazy about Italian sausage. 
What stuck out: the beautiful decor, the very friendly and very attentive serving staff, the "dough-ball" given to us to play with while we waited (which, we were told, could be baked before we left) and the extremely unique and tasteful food.
All-in-all, a wonderful dining experience, and we will absolutely return!

Decided to try this place out per the mountain of good reviews.  Had excellent food and the service from Geoff was AWESOME!
Per other Yelper reviews, we got the Bruschetta Quartro!  Totally recommend! I tried the lobster pasta and my husband got the pork.  Both excellent.
The only reason I gave 4 starts was because we ordered salads and never got them.  However Geoff was awesome and took the salads off our bill and provided us a free dessert:)

4 stars? Yes, 4 stars...3 seems too low.  Ideally 3.5 is what I would rate it.  A few notches above Olive Garden, Macaroni Grill, and even Maggiano's. While I don't usually like to eat at "chain" restaurants, this has been my saving grace for informal lunch meetings, dinners with unadventurous eaters, and satisfying a group of people with various dietary preferences (low carb, low fat, gluten free, vegetarian).  

I highly recommend making reservations for the evening when you have a party of 6 or more, but for lunch I usually have to wait 10-15 minutes.  They give you a pager and you have the freedom to occupy your wait time with shopping in nearby stores.  Once inside, the setting is a pleasing "Tuscan" style and the energy/noise level is bustling, but usually I like to sit outside because I usually have my nicely behaved dogs with me. They require I tie my dogs to the outside of the restaurant fence and sit at a nearby table,but I have seen dogs sit on their laps with their owners.  This discrepancy kind of bothers me, because my dogs are well behaved, but like to sit at our feet...many don't notice them but if they do it is because they are cute and well behaved.

Usually I order a flatbread and bruschetta for the table as an appetizer. I usually order the steak salad for lunch, which is phenominal, especially since most places end up making the meat well done or not using a tender meat. The pasta is decent here, at least I never heard my guests complain and usually give raves.   The portions are generous for the price, and usually lasting me two meals.  I have had the steak and vegetables for dinner, which was prepared and cooked nicely. Service is always polite, but sometimes a little slow when it is busy. Again the food is no culinary feat, but it is solid and unoffensive.  While not unique, no one is going to complain and your guests will definitely think it is solid food and come out satisfied and full.  

Again a great place where everyone can find something they like and enjoy themselves in a casual, relaxed Italian style.

One other comment, I think they have done a great job with their wine menu. By the glass, plenty of unique and affordable wines covering a range of varietals both whites and reds, but also many familiar, easy drinking wines.  Further, many "gem" bottle that are well priced...about 175% markup rather than the 200%+ markups...that can mean atleast $10 -20 savings per bottle.

Our friends suggested Brio for dinner one night.  I've had it bookmarked since I've started yelping so of course I wanted to go!

The dining area is elegant.  I loved the decor.  You can dine outside but we chose inside.  Service here was impeccable.  Our waitress was outstanding.  She gave us great suggestions for our meal.  

We started off sharing the spinach dip.  Creamy and full of flavor.  I'd definitely order this again.  For my entree I ordered the grilled salmon fresca. This had perfectly grilled asparagus, sweet potatoes, spinach and red peppers topped with the grilled salmon.  I loved the vegetables.  The salmon was a little over cooked but not bad overall.  Dessert? Of course! They offer little dessert shooters.  I tried the chocolate caramel cake shooter.  Oh yeah.... I'd have that again.  Our friends ordered the dessert sampler including creme br√ªl√©e, bread pudding and cheesecake.  Absolutely delicious! 

I believe Brio is one of the better choices in the Town Square area.  I hope to be back soon!
Went to Brio for lunch. I was not very impressed with the meal, especially after seeing the check. The interior is nice and the waiter was great, but the food is honestly subpar.

I love walking into this place & you automatically feel better. The aromas make you extra hungry, the dark lighting is just right & the food is always great. 
I haven't had anything that I didn't enjoy & whenever I bring people over who are first timers they become instant fans. I also need to mention that they have a fantastic happy hour even though I didn't participate in this particular visit. Some of my favorite items are; the balsamic strawberry salad, the lobster bisque & the margherita flat bread. 
The service has also been great on every visit so I highly recommend this place. Outdoor dining is also a must on nice days or evenings.
What a hidden gem in Town Square! Delightful food and atmosphere with excellent service! Enjoyed immensely!

It's tough to find a restaurant that is both classy and casual, that works equally well for a nice dinner for two or for a family occasion. 

Brio makes that happen and does so in an excellent way.

The menu has creative versions of Italian favorites and plenty of more traditional items, and they are very flexible with special requests. They also have a good sized kid's menu as well. 

The service is extremely courteous and the servers work together to take care of the greeting, beverages, ordering and food delivery.

This particular Brio does all of the above especially well! I've been to this one twice and have no doubt I'll be back there again soon.

I'm absolutely a fan. I have never been to Brio and had to plan last minute get together. They really do a great job at this place. The decor is beautiful and the service was above and beyond. As I mentioned earlier, I had a last minute event. I made my reservation for Sunday Brunch during Thanksgiving weekend. It was part of wedding festivities. They were so nice to let me in a bit early to have the table set so that all of my guests would feel like guests. This is what we ordered. 

Appetizers: 
Fried calamari and flatbread BBQ chicken pizza 

Entrees (everyone was pleased) 
Penne w/Vodka sauce, carbonara, fettuccine rustica, paninis, risotto and some brunch items 

Coffee service: 
Cappuccino and coffee for dessert. 

Gluten Free: 
As I was ordering, I mentioned no croutons with my salad ..can't have gluten. Server asked if I had an allergy, I said yes. They made all the adjustments to accommodate my dietary restrictions. There is a whole protocol that goes into effect to limit cross contamination. Awesome. I'm not as sensitive, but those with allergies should feel confident that they have a knowledgeable staff. I do have to mention that initially I asked the hostess and she said no they do not have GF options/choices. They clearly do. So happy that my waiter(s) and kitchen are informed about food allergies. Our waiters were Ryan and Dino.

I love Brio! They have one of the best Happy Hours in town. Almost everything on that menu is so delicious. The shrimp eggplant, spinach and artichoke dip, burger and caprese salad are my favs! The only reason I can't give them five stars is because the service is not always that great.

We've had positive experiences here previously, but left before placing an order Friday night...it took 10 minutes before the waitress arrived, and after taking our drink order, she brought bread but no drinks. There were no set-ups or appetizer plates. When the drinks arrived another 10 minutes later, one guest's drink was not there, and still no tableware.  It's not an inexpensive place, and this simply didn't bode well. We went for a nice walk and had a good dinner elsewhere...that's the beauty of Town Square, I suppose!

We had a school function and they donated all of the food for free.  The food was delicious.  Pasta with chicken, mushrooms, and a full course salad.   I will eat there not just for the food, but for a business that donates to the community.

Thanks Rhett! Walked in for an early dinner with my parents after a long but successful afternoon at the Apple store across the street. This place is huge and has cool architecture inside. They took care of us right away and everything came out pretty quick because they weren't too busy yet. 

Kale Caesar was really good. Added some olive oil and extra dressing which I usually do at most restaurants. Thanks again Rhett.

Very disappointed for the price they charge I was given a dirty torn menu? I asked the waiter for a clean one and he gave me a blank look! When you go order your drink than wait 10 minutes to order your entree because they will serve it right on top of your app ..than I wasn't finished eating but the waiter kept asking me if I was? Huh.. really doesn't management teach them if the fork has food on it leave it alone. The food is average and not consistent.

My recent trip to Tuscany, Italy has me wanting to try all different types of Italian fare.  Brio was a great treat - I actually like this place better than some of the restaurants we went to in Italy.  Not that the Italian food in Italy didn't taste good, but the bold flavors at Brio were more pleasing to my palette.

Large, open, tastefully decorated, the mood was set for relaxation.  Went there with 4 of my team members and this was all our first visit.  The only down was that the acoustics and ambient noise didn't make for the best conversation but as long as your voice was strong, you were good.

Service was good and staff was pleasant and orders came out accurately (and quickly).

The Caprese Bruchetta rocked.  Lots of flavor and great texture.  The sweet balsamic was the perfect addition.

The Caprese Ravioli was equally as good.  Lots of fresh baby tomatoes to season the dish.  Large pieces of pasta and hearty enough to make a meal.

I had the Sweet Potato and Grilled Chicken Risotto.  DELICIOUS.  I wasn't sure what to expect as it seemed like an odd combination but they pulled it off nicely.  Add in some fresh asparagus and i was very satisfied with the meal.

At the table was also salmon, tomato bisque, and the lasagna.  All said they enjoyed their meals.

We had everything except alcohol and we were out of there for around $150.

Definitely will go here again.

Meh. I'm really not sure why I asked for my leftovers. The food was not good. The risotto was undercooked and the lasagna tasted like it had American cheese in it. The lobster bisque was too thick and the bar tender must have forgotten to put the alcohol in our drinks. I won't be back.

Great place, good atmosphere.  Our server had perfect timing and didn't push us to leave after we finished.  I had the eggs Benedict (they call it something slightly different).  The flavor was delicious-best eggs benny I have had!  The potatoes were seasoned very well-again best I think I have had as a standard potato side and the asparagus was thin but tender.  We then had the chocolate dessert and oh my!  The creamy center, not too rich, not too sugary.  Can't say it was like lava cake, center was thicker but I liked it better! I would certainly come again!

I did not pick up the check but my eggs benny was a good portion for me (granted I am small BUT I can eat) and it was $10.95.

I love going to Town Square. The service is phenomenal and the staff is so friendly at Brio. The atmosphere is nice but the prices are a little expensive. I had the chicken parm and it was not very good. The sauce with angel hair pasta was fantastic. I would recommend this place but don't get the chicken parm. With the bread they give frozen butter. Doesn't spread on the bread at all. They should serve olive oil with the bread.

In the past I came to dinner. This time I came here for lunch at 1130 AM. The first time I've ever seen the place totally empty. I needed to get out relatively fast. My server I should make that with the place is this empty, there would be no problem getting the food in a hurry. She did not lie. . I ordered the barbecue chicken pizza from the appetizer menu . In other restaurants when I order pizza there is at least a 15 to 20 minute wait before this pizza is ready. The pizza was on my table within 10 minutes. And it was delicious. The crust was sweet and soft ( a little chewy, just the way I like it). The pizza itself was not overwhelmed with the barbecue chicken sauce flavor. There was an abundance fresh greens that decorated the top of the pizza. A lunch for one for under $10 before the tip. Such a good deal!
Great restaurant! Amazing food!! The shrimp with eggplant is exswiset!!!! Amazing atmosphere! Highly recommended!

HAPPY HOUR TUSCAN TASTER MENU $2.95?!?!!? My fave eat in Vegas by far!!!!! Brio Tuscan Grille is at the heart of Town Square, and since it's a ways off The Strip, it's not bustling with tourists. Sitting outside at the bar on a warm Spring afternoon...=) SO PEACEFUL! 

BEEF CARPACCIO - This one is my favorite! The meat is sliced super super thin and goes so well with the mustard aioli and field greens. 

SLICED STEAK BRUSCHETTA - This one is a close runner up. Some bites you may find the gorgonzola to be overpowering. I think the steak and bruschetta could've done without the cheese. Nevertheless, YUM! 

BRIO BURGER - Okay, but kind of dry and plain. Not a fan of the chips it comes with either. Sliced into fours for sharing!

RAVIOLI CAPRESE - Three giant raviolis. Super cheesy and tastes like it was fried. So unless you douse each bite with tomato sauce, it gets dry.

SHRIMPTINI - I was pleasantly surprised with this! The're very generous with the shrimp! Super cute presentation and uber refreshing.

I looked over at the party of 2 sitting right next to us...turns out they ordered the exact same 5 dishes. Must be a good sign! Our waiter also recommended the SPICY SHRIMP AND EGGPLANT, but we didn't have enough stomach room. 

Where else can you stuff 2 people with such quality food for less than $20, tax and tip included?! I want to tell all my friends, but at the same time, I want to keep this place all to myself ;)

This is a place I visit frequently. The lack of check ins is a reflection of my phone dying or me leaving it in the car -_- i prefers the Tivoli Village location because its prettier and less crowded - oh! and less kids :D 

There is always plenty of parking in the garage either so you can avoid the hot hot sun or the cold of winter. When you walk into the restaurant, the hostess is always there with a smile and walking you to your table immediately. 

I really like the waiters here, because you can tell they're a team and they're always looking out for each other. Whenever it does get kind of busy, and our waiter is running around, another waiter from another section will come help us or tend to our needs. They always saying they're helping each other out, which is nice to see. At the other location in Town Square, other waiters are always ignoring us unless we're their table. 

The lobster bisque is really good and not too fishy tasting. I personally like penne pasta with vodka sauce. They don't have it on the menu though - they have another type of noodle with cheese in it with the vodka sauce. I always ask for the penne vodka though, and they are always more than willing to accomodate and ask the chef for me. I always add shrimp too! Makes me feel like someone important because theyre doing something off the menu for me haha 

My boyfriend has gotten a combination of some type of steak, lambchops, and several pastas, and they are always good!!

We always OD on bread so if youre hungry, you should ask for no bread...because once its on your table, its hard to ignore it!
Great value for the price, nice ambience clean place and service is excellent. The Mgr Ashley super nice very welcoming and accomodating.

Terrible service. Just awful. Granted, it was his first day. But we asked for water and iced tea and waited over 25 minutes. Our kids got their food before their drinks. The server seemed baffled by our request, after he left us alone for 15 minutes without speaking to us - no drinks, no bread, didn't take our entree order - nothing. Then he did bring our iced tea - after we asked three times - with no lemon, no straws. Just clueless! I asked for a manager and requested a new server, who is doing better but we shouldn't have to get a manager's assistance to get drinks. The manager has been very gracious. As for the food? I have no idea because now it's been almost 40 minutes and I still haven't gotten my appetizer salad. Just ... So disappointed. Maybe starting someone new on the Saturday of a holiday weekend isn't the best idea. Just a thought.

Update: We never got our appetizer salads. Frankly, I don't think the server ever submitted our order. Then my brother's order of stuffed pasta with vodka sauce  came out cold. We had to ask three times for olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The food was good, especially the bread, but I couldn't get over the poor service, even after TWO managers got involved. Ultimately we were comped our meal, partly so I would "stop yelling." (My voice was raised but I didn't think I was yelling.) The sous chef was very nice. And we did leave a tip for the full cost of the meal. I won't be returning.

Brio Brio Brio.... I have gone here a ton of times.  So this is a general review of multiple experiences.

1. Good food, lets get things straight I keep going back because of the food location and people watching, the service is at best mediocre and at worst it just plain sucks.

Flatbread - quite good
Fish specials - Good (usually go for this at lunch)
Chicken under a brick - bad should be left under the brick and kicked to the curb
Pizza - good (if you like thin crust stuff, i prefer just going to the flatbreads though)
Lamb - I like pink lamb I have had to send back as ultra rare lamb is not to my taste, beef yes lamb ultra rare no
Deserts are good I link the sampler (see service below)

i like the ambiance of this place for sitting outside and people watching, there arent enough decent al fresco dining places in vegas (because it gets hot) however it is too big.  Been there a lot and have never been remembered because i rarely have seen the same server twice.

Wait staff seems to be overworked and under-crewed so I never take it out on my servers (tip wise), however I have had to complain about wait times and am usually rewarded with free desert to the table which i usually get the sampler which is quite tasty and varied the apple crumble is very good.

Price to food quality is a very good ratio. Overall it is a decent restaurant,  if you are tight on time, it would be  a no go.  However for extended lunches (booze helps deal with longer wait times) it is a go to place.  Just if the service is slow dont be scared to notify people you are waiting and furthermore dont hesitate to take it out on the manager and not the overworked servers who are really trying their best with what looks like understaffing decisions.

Overall a 3 star would be 4 if their service gets a revamp.

Italian food with a capital D for DELICIOUS! 
Our first time at Brio and our lunch at this establishment is a definite amazement. The food is very hearty and flavorful, not to mention the great customer service that Jen has provided us. She was very patient with us and she made us feel very at ease and welcomed. 
The two salads that we ordered, Kale Cesar Salad and Steak salad are both excellent! The chef pulled out all the stops with the salads alone. 
The Pasta Alfredo is one of the tastiest that I've had and I am an Alfredo pasta girl. I recommend this Alfredo to everyone! Go and enjoy it. 
The ambiance of Brio is very intimate and it's pretty casual. There was a lot of Christmas parties happening when we ate there today which made the place have a festive vibe. 
Two thumbs up to Brio and I recommend this place to everyone to try out.

Pasta alla vodka,
and their spicy pannini a must.

Love the decor, can be loud.

My friend ordered a meal that we did not know had garlic in the sauce (she's allergic) and they took back and remade the plate without hesitation. Very friendly staff, comfortable environment, food was delicious, and I cannot wait to go back!

Some people do not know what is good.  Brio is good.  Their food and service is beyond good.
There are so many things on the menu from appitizers to deserts that it would take me forever to write a review on the food.  All I can tell you is that you are in for a treat at Brio

my family and i went here to celebrate my brothers wedding. although we had a big party. first off they forgot our side of the tables drink orders. we didnt have enough waters on our table so we had to share. i waited 30 minutes for our side of the tables drink orders to be taken after telling a gentleman they forgot instead of taking our order he said ill send ur waiter. i asked for a refil 3 times twice to one lady and 1 to a gentleman no one came 1 1/2 hours go by and im still waiting my brother finally got pist and had to get up and get me a refil from the manager. then they wanted to come as ask if everything is ok at that point i had to keep my mouth shut because i was so irritated and disappointed in the customer service there. i would have probably got kicked out and i didn't want to ruine the reason why we were all celebrating. my tia never got the soup she ordered. when our food came it was cold like it was sitting there forever before they brought it out. the only person on point was the bread guy. he didn't fail us. other then that it was a horrible experience and we will never go back. the thing is there wasn't only one person working our table there was 3 and still all these mess ups i don't understand how that even happens.

Great food, wonderful atmosphere and fantastic service. The Chef's appetizer special - bruschetta with pinot noir caramelized onions - was incredible. And the key lime shooter desert just the right amount as well as final touch to a wonder meal. The outdoor seating with fire pit adds to the enjoyable experience. Pricing was as indicated - $$, a great value and well worth every penny. I definitely would come back and highly recommend.

Celebrating our 2 year anniversary at the Brio.  Love this place by far the service here is excellent.  Not to mention the food is amazing.  I highly recommend this restaurant food and drink are amazing.

We were in town square yesterday, and I and the family got hungry after a fun afternoon at the playground so we decided to have dinner at Brio. I have been wanting to try this place out, and considering it was our cheat day, I was really excited to have some good pasta. We ordered the caesar salad, lobster bisque, lasagna, the campanelle carbonara, and the tiramisu and some fresh fruit for dessert. The Caesar was okay, lobster bisque was mediocre at best (very generic tasting), my son liked the lasagna, but the carbonara was just waaaayyy too salty. I thought at first that the Parmesan made it salty, but even the pasta in the very bottom of the dish was salty. I literally couldn't eat more than a quarter of the dish because of it. The tiramisu was okay, at least it washed away the saltiness from the pasta dish. I was so bummed because I've been looking forward to coming here, and actually having some good pasta, and just regretted my decision of choosing brio over yard house or bone fish grill. I know this is only our first visit, but I am sort of hesitant to come back here again since they messed up something that was supposed to be a staple of theirs. On the bright side, our server was nice and on top of things so that adds another star to my review.

I wish I could have addressed this with the wait staff, but I will in a hurry. I ordered sweet potato risotto and a wedge salad. the risotto was over cooked and under seasoned. this was my first experience at Brio, so I'm willing to give them another chance, but something this simple shouldn't have been messed up.
The food was great.  Unfortunately service was very slow.  The manager acknowledged the problem and apologized.  We will try this restaurant again in the future.

Arrival: Five or six girls dressed in black, waiting around doing a whole lot of nothing.  Chatting among themselves.  No personality.  It was nice, I felt like I was in a fancy, posh restaurant!

Our Seat:  They must have had about 15-20 extra waiters and staff sort of loitering around the restaurant.  It was super awkward.  Here's what is more awkward: having those waiters hovering over your table, waiting for their orders from the cafeteria (or was it a kitchen?), talking about clubs, their nights, conquests and misc. other adventures.

Appetizers:  Very good.  Let's say B+.  Stuffed peppers.  Best part of the meal.

Entrees:  This was where it just got bad.  Two terrible entrees.  Mezza Chicken Limone tasted like I was eating straight egg.  Zero flavor unless you ate a moutful of salt and capers.

Do yourself a favor, if you want a chain Italian restaurant in Las Vegas, head on over to the Macaroni Grill and save yourself some time and money.  (Yes, it was bad enough for me to recommend Macaroni Grill)

One of the best Tuscan restaurants I've ever been to! Way better than anything on the strip for the price!! My boyfriend and I went to Vegas for the week and decided to try it and we loved it! The ambiance is beautiful and they text you when your table is ready! The servers were really sweet and helpful. I had the tomato bisque soup and it was AMAZING! Go here!

My husband and I had another delicious dinner, at Happy Hour, at Brio's in Town Square in Las Vegas.
The professionalism of the staff namely, Brian (manager), Alyssa and Mike (bartenders), is beyond compare.  Besides delicious dishes, such as beef carpaccio and spicy shrimp and eggplant in a delicious spicy sauce, we also feasted on crispy shrimp served on a delicious bed of greens.  The Brio burger is still a must have order, for sure.  I must say that it is definitely worth your time, and you owe it to your tastebuds, to enjoy The Brio Restaurant and all it has to offer. J&D (NYC)

The food is good, but the service was a bit....lacking.

When i went the staff was fairly impersonal and didn't really seem to care that i was dining there, just saying.

I just love brio..out for the day at Town Square with my other half and had to go in for my fav.  Lunch bisteca salad and risotto yum yum...the risotto is the business chicken, butternut squash, asparagus and more goodness.  Like always great meal at Brio :)

Good Happy Hour OK service!

I like coming for the happy hour but the service could really use some help! I've been coming here for about 4 years since its in a great central location.  It's easy to get people to meet here since its central to Summerlin and Henderson.  

There is outdoor dining as well as inside dining.  You can only get Happy Hour in the Bar/Lounge area and it is first come first serve for seating. It can get busy especially when the weather is nice so try to get here early especially if you have a decent size group. The outdoor area has fire pits set up as well which is perfect at night when it can get a little chilly.

Happy Hour is $4-$6 small plates and certain drinks.  The sangria is pretty good along with the martini (order it dirty and add Blue Cheese olives for a little extra!).  The beef carpaccio is delicious but not very filling so order a few if you have a decent size.  Some of my other favorites are the eggplant fries, and the black pepper shrimp with eggplant.

The problem with happy hour is either the bar staff isn't properly equipped or they are just too aloof to actually give good service. Every time we have to wave down our server for silverware, napkins, to put in additional orders, or to let him/her we are ready to pay.  On one specific occasion we tried to get the bartenders attention for 20 minutes to place more drink orders and he ignored us.  Finally as happy hour was ending he said sorry happy hour is over. Thats not good customer service in my opinion as I know he saw us trying to get his attention since we were sitting directly in front of him.

I have also come for brunch and the service was still a miss. We split the Tuscan omelette and the berries and cream French toast. Everything tasted pretty good.

Over all tasty Italian inspired cuisine for a good price with aloof service from staff members who would do well with a little customer service training.

I actually really like this place. I've eaten here more times than I can count. I'm a sucker for wonderful outdoor eating and this place has it. The food and wine are nice. This is one of the few Italian food places that my husband can go to because he is lactose intolerant. The cooks here are actually skilled enough and have the authority to make adjustments to several of their sauces and dishes to accommodate his allergy and still have the food come out tasting delicious.

I have been to lunch at the brio several times and is usually good. Not great but good.  My wife and I took another couple to dinner this last Sunday night.  We sat down about 7pm.  We were sat at a table for 6 people.  The wait staff did not remove the extra settings and we finally asked them to take them away.  We were given lunch menus and had to ask for dinner menus.  The bread came and it was cold and hard and the breadstick like items were soggy.  My friend tried to order a pale style beer, didn't have one, ordered a lager, didn't have one so he got a Sam Adams.  I ordered a whiskey sour, i couldn't taste the whiskey, drank it ordered another one and it was totally different than the first one, neither of them had a cherry.  They told us when we first sat down that there were only 4 lobster bisque soups left, my friend said he would take one, a minute later they brought us two and we still didn't even have the dinner menus, they took them away and gave them to another table which I thought was against health code.  We asked for more bread and got the same as before.  I ordered the shrimp venuto (or similar) and it when I came it was obvious it sat under the hear lamp for some time.  I thought it was terrible and actually spit out a few bites and didn't finish it.  Our friends pasta dishes also looked like they sat under a heat lamp for a while and no one finished their meals or even asked for a to go box, that's how bad the food was.  Our waters were not filled unless asked.  All in all a very bad dining experience, so bad I felt compelled to yelp.  Hopefully we just experience an off night. But with so many other dining venue to solicit, we will not be going back to the Brio.

WHOA!!!! Where has Brio been all expensive lunches in my life?!

The 2.95 happy hour is AMAZING! If portion size is too small for you...ORDER ANOTHER IT'S ONLY TWO NINETY FIVE!!! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW YYYYYYYYYYYYYEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

- BRIO Burger - 
For 2.95 i was expecting one or two slider sized burgers. Nope they serve a FULL SIZED burger cut into quarters. The beef patty is pretty darn tasty but there's no condiments so after a few bites it could get pretty dull. Couple this with the salad from the Shrimptini or from the carpaccio and sauce it with the sauce from the shrimp and eggplant. 

- Ravioli Caprese - 
Not bad but no meat. The sauce ultimately makes the dish. Go early and they'll flood that plate with sweet tasty sauce, go late and there'll be a a few slabs of sauce on the plate.

- Chorizo Fonduta -
The 'Meh' of the menu. The fondu is a bit salty and is very rich.

- Beef Carpaccio - 
Thin strips of raw beef with a spring salad on top drizzled with some kind of mustard sauce with capers. WIN. 

- Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant -
Dont really like eggplant very much but OH MAN THAT SAUCE IS GOOD!!!

- Margherita Flatbread - 
Very nice, Very tasty, Could use more basil but overall it's perfect as a starter

- Shrimptini - 
Already peeled shrimp in a martini glass filled with tasty salad. Very refreshing and awesome as a starter or in between rich dishes like the shrimp and eggplant

- Sliced Steak Bruschetta - 
All you taste is the cheese and the greens but still this brushetta is DAMN tasty!!
Happy Hour is amazing there. The food is always good, and the ambiance is great! The beef carpaccio was awesome and at $4 I think I may have to become a regular!

We stopped into Brio as we pulled into town for a fun weekend. We happened to be at Whole Foods and walked around the corner after seeing the 4 star rating. To our surprise, this place is gorgeous on the inside and very roomy. We were able to sit down promptly upon arrival and sat at the bar.  

We ordered 2 wedge salads which were amazing. They were about as fresh and tasty as a wedge salad can be. We also ordered a bbq chicken pizza or flatbread and a risoto. These were top notch dishes that an incredible amount of flavor. 

I would definitely recommend that anyone come by and try Brio. This is a top of the line restaurant.

Love this place. Happy hour is best here. Large portions for affordable price. Bar Plates: $4-6 from 3:30-6:30pm. Dinner  food is great as well. Always good to make reservation around Christmas Holiday. Lots of Parties ! I ordered the Campanelle Carbonara Grilled chicken, bacon, Parmesan, and creamy Alfredo. Must try the Grilled Salmon Fresca* (LT) Grilled asparagus, sweet potatoes, spinach, red peppers, pesto vinaigrette, Feta, tomatoes, and balsamic. Last but not least - the Warm Chocolate Cake with Vanilla with bean gelato.
Love this place, fun for happy hour.  Sometimes overcrowded but it's nice to sit outside.  Great food and dessert!
I love eating here!  The bartenders, particularly Alyssa, are fun and right on top of things!  Excellent tasty food with great service at the bar make for a very pleasant afternoon lunch!

We had the pesto pasta with a side of Alfredo, half chicken and mashed potatoes, and the lamb chops! It was all so delicious and the bruschetta Quattro was amazing! I loved the tomato and mozzarella!

The lamb chops were by far the best I've had, not greasy at all and very flavorful! The mashed potatoes were also cooked so fluffy and delicious!
Wow! Had my sister 50 bday dinner. Everyone there was super nice. Great food. Thank you guys

Second time dining at this place, first time was a hit and this time was no different. First thing, I noticed about this place is the layout. High, High Ceilings and the Overall decor looks so Grand, Open and Romanesque. Like its decorated for a Wedding Reception or Event of some sort.

We were greeted with smiles and quickly seated. Our hostess, immediately gathered and picked up the extra table settings in Lightning Speed and then handed our menus. WOHO! No more than 30 seconds our Server comes over and hands us the menu with a big smile and takes our drink orders. No more than a minute, a food runner brings us our drinks. A few minutes later, Our server politely comes by and asks us if we were ready to order and this is what we got:

"Primi" (Appetizers):

Calamari Fritto Misto: Big plate (easily shared by 3-4 people)! I loved the peperoncini mixed with the squid. Once in a while I would pick one up to spice it up a bit! Or sometimes it was a spicy surprise! Breading wasn't real golden brown and crispy. Came with 2 sauces on each side -Red sauce/Marinara type and Yellow sauce/Garlic Aioli. Red sauce typical pasta pizza sauce flavored. On the other hand, the Garlic Aioli was Absolutely Divine!! I don't know if its just me but that flavor got my attention real quick! It had a distinct flavor and a hint of horseradish mustard something that I couldn't get enough of! I didn't want to look like a dog but I would of Licked that plate clean with a shine! 

Spicy shrimp & Eggplant: Nice presentation, came on a long rectangle plate all lined up like in a straight line. Overall, flavor wasn't really impressive more disappointing if anything. The black pepper cream sauce wasn't as good as it sounded but the romano crusted egg plant was nice. Basically, after a few pieces, I was over it.. I guess that's why its an appetizer! But this felt heavy and after a few, I threw in the towel..

Entree:

Pasta Pomodoro with Chicken and added their Bistecca Insalata (salad): Another Heavy Weight plate, a generous mound of angel hair pasta, grilled chicken, pine nuts and their cilantro pesto drizzle. Plus some grated parmesan on top. Pretty straight forward dish and pretty good as well. It was just lacking 5 Stardom calibur, just like every other dish.. (Except for the salad, I'll get to that!).

*Bistecca Insalata: The Freshest Wedge of Iceberg Lettuce (crisp and almost neon green), Gorgonzola, real pieces of bacon (not dried bits), shiny red roma tomaotes and their mouthwatering creamy parmesan dressing!! One of the Best salads I've ever sunk my teeth in!!

Couldn't help but watch some of the staff really get to work. During our meal, we couldn't help but notice a vacant table behind us that was getting set for the next guest(s). The busser/server assistant was so precise and jaw dropping fast! I mean like watching a dvd and pressing forward like 3 times/3 arrows!! Just like everybody else here!! It's like the In N' Out Burger staff on a Redbull High!!! Also, I must mention our (Pregnant) Server did not skip a beat from refilling drinks, stopping by to check on the dinner status, to adding the extra Garlic Aioli sauces in our staff wrapped doggie bags! Service 5.5 Screaming Stars! Taste of Food 3.5-4 Stars (Bistecca salad 5+ stars), Value for amount of food 4-4.5 Stars and Ambiance 4.5 Stars..

Ordered the Shrimp Mediterranean and a wedge salad through grub hub. They were both delicious. Even though it was delivery, the salad was cold and the Shrimp was perfectly cooked. I can't wait to actually go there to eat, though I don't know how the food could possibly be even better.

Just went there tonight for early dinner. Was strolling around Town Square Mall, and my boyfriend was craving for pasta. The inside looks nice. Service is good. Pasta here is good. 

LOBSTER BISQUE - really good. Better to eat it slow because the spices can be strong and the taste may seem too powerful. 

RAVIOLI DI BELLO - I highly recommend!!!! Some raviolis I've had are dry, or has little meat, or has a sauce that's either bland or overpowering. This ravioli is none of those. It's great! It has the right amount of meat inside. Sauce is tasty. The mushroom gives more flavor. The tomato cleanses the palate. 

CAMPANELLE CARBONARA - It's good, but not the best I've had. 

We both had wine too. Total came up to $60+.

Pros: 
* their carbonara pasta on their lunch menu is great. They mix it with bacon & spinach, and have the right about of cream sauce. 
* get the calamari!!! 
* friendly staff 
* clean, nice atmosphere. Can go for a casual lunch, business lunch as well as nice date. 
* good location. Who doesn't love Town Square? 

Cons:
* their Caesar salad was weak.

I had heard how great this place was so I had to try it. First impression was an arrogant hostess who was more concerned with marking off her floor chart or station map than greeting me. I was sat and ordered the Lobster Bisque which was amazing, the bread was awesome. My server Jade was excellent as well. I ordered the Veal Marsala and it was extremely bland and tasteless. Not even the sauce could save it, Marsala usually has a nice, nutty flavor. It had no flavor at all, very disappointing. After seeing the decor and tasting the bread and the Bisque I was expecting a great meal, it was far from it. A microwave meal has more flavor.....

This is a lively restaurant. It was Tuesday night during the week of the magic fashion trade show and it was a packed restaurant. Everything we ordered was delicious. See the pics. The service was excellent and the manager even came by to see how we were doing. The group I was with routinely comes to this restaurant every time they are in Vegas because they love the food so much. There is some lovely outdoor seating and the restaurant is nestled within a beautiful outdoor shopping center.

We sat a booth at the bar for about 10 minutes when some guy walking by gave us some water.  After another 5-10 minutes another guy walked by and finally gave us some menus.  No drink order, nothing.  Finally left after about 30 minutes of basically no service.  I could understand if they were busy but there were 2 people sitting at the bar and another lady in a booth.
Two words: HAPPY HOUR! great prices on food and drinks here, one of my favorites. My friends love it here, great atmosphere.

Im adding this as a heads up for vegetarians.  This place doesn't offer much for us and if you have to ask for alternates, like leave out the meat, price remains high.  For us the price is mid to high.  Server was outstanding, did his best to please us, i wish i remember his name.  The salad I ordered, three tomatos something, not excellent.  Server said without the chicken it gets mixed reviews.  Anyway go elsewhere if you're a veggie cause there are much better "Italian" places with better selections.

Keeping in my mind that I've done nothing but appetizers and drinks here, and only at the bar area, I'm kind of a fan. The bartenders have generally been very nice and attentive. And the outdoor bar part is actually kind of a nice place to sit. The appetizers have all been ok, but nothing too impressive. What I have found most impressive is their $5 martinis on Thursdays during happy hour. All of the martinis I have sampled have been absolutely delicious. And for $5, well, you just can't beat that.

Always good. Never a disappointment. We booked a room to celebrate my daughter 16th bday and the service was on point. Food was excellent and always at the right temperature. 

Unfortunately we were not offered to take left overs and I didn't realized until the end to ask for them and I was told none was saved. 

A little disappointed on that but I will remember for next time.

It was my very time eating, the atmosphere of walking inside was phenomenal and the food was spectacular! Service was great and especially eating outside during the night sky was perfect as well. Most definitely coming back again real soon!
I tried their lasagna for the first time and thought it tasted average.  I truly was not impressed.

It is your traditional Olive Garden type restaurant. Service was pretty good. Food was mediocre. I ate there, probably won't go back. It just wasn't that outstanding. If you're looking for a nice relaxing place to eat outdoors, this is a pretty place. 

At the risk of sounding like a fake Yelper....let me tell you about a place I found nearby that was AMAZING. Check out Rice Trax. Wish they'd been open on Sunday, then I wouldn't have had to eat at Brio. ;-)

I've always love Brio it's one of those places that lands in between Casual and Classy. It's perfect for a couple steps above average casual dinner date or a fancy enough dinner party. No matter how you put it it's a nice place to dine weather you're here for a work gathering or dinner for 2 it's perfect and their food is great. 

I was here recently for my father in laws big 5 oh and we had our party in their small banquet room. I've been in this room before for his parents 50th anniversary and it works for a small private group. The service here is awesome and the staff is really accommodating as far as cakes, flowers, decor and slide show goes. 

The food and drinks are always good as expected. We had at this party a four coarse meal. Staring off with 2 choice of salad an Italian chop and a Cesar's wedge with bacon yum! Then we were served the apps calamari and something else I can't remember but their calamari are battered and delicious crispy enough and had great seasoning paired with marinara dipping sauce. The family style entrees were lemon chicken with capers or something like that, steak and this very good cheese tortellini 
Pasta dish. All this and bread and butter as well. 

As usual all the food maws very good and the dessert (2 options) tiramisu and cheese cake were really yummy and presented really nice...not pictured boo. But regardless Brio is always a nice place to dine and the food is always satisfying!

happy hour- yummy
I love the white sangria and the flat bread pizza
spicy shrimp and eggplants it was good
crispy shrimp piccante- excellent
One of the BEST places in Vegas. Always great food and service.

Brio did a wonderful job with my bff's wedding reception, so for that, they get 3 stars.

But the gluten-free pasta primavera was hard, chewy and bland and the mushrooms tasted microwaved. And the server only mentioned the complimentary reception wine after making it appear like you could only get cocktails (which were not included with the wedding reception). Y U HOLD OUT ON ME?

There is nothing special about this place that warrants a return visit. Our party of 6 was seated right on time for our 5:15 reservations. The restaurant was not busy this particular Sunday night, but reservations are recommended. We were quickly served hot bread and butter which was a good start because I was starving!  Our server was nice, but she was inconsistent. After she took our orders, we hardly saw her again. Someone else brought our dinner to the table, and we were all shocked that they didn't offer cheese. This is supposed to be an Italian place right?? We had to wait a while for our server to come back and check on us and then we were able to ask for fresh parmesan. After that, we hardly saw her again except when it came time to drop off the check. Even after that, she disappeared for a good 20 minutes and we needed some things on our bill adjusted so we finally had to flag someone down to ask them to tell our server to come back to the table. 

The food, meh, nothing special and surely over priced. I went with the chicken under the brick, which is a grilled chicken breast with marsala mushroom sauce, served with mashed potatoes and veggies. The marsala sauce was really good, I just wish there were more of it. I loved the vegetables that came with my meal especially the carrots, they were a tad sweet so I think they might have been glazed. I also ordered a side chopped salad which was just okay as well. For each side salad it was $4.95! That is for lettuce, a few chopped veggies, and dressing. The bill for just me and my mom was $54! Other people in my party agreed the food was just okay and definitely overpriced. I hear they have a good happy hour, I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here, but I wouldn't be opposed to trying the happy hour.

We stumbled on this place randomly and loved it. The atmosphere, decor, food and even the location is great. I ordered the lamb chops. Huge portion (no way I could finish it) and delicious. My side was Brussel sprouts and it was made with amazing sauce. My husband ordered the Gorgonzola meat tenders and of course I tried it with mash potatoes and veggies. Everything was delicious. 
The waiter wasn't as amazing as the place and the food - but overall it was a great place in Town Square. 
When we return to Vegas, I'm sure to come back. 

PS they have outside seating with misters! So you don't get too hot.
I just love when there is 15 to 20 empty tables and the snooty hosts make you wait 10 to 20 minutes to seat you, great food anyway

Date & Time:  Tuesday December 20, 2012 @ 1pm
Dining Companion:  Mommy
Scene:  Shoppers in BodyCon Dresses & Tall Boots
Decor:  Ornate Domes & Striped Booths
Service:  Efficient
Mediocre:  Tomato Soup & Club Sandwich
Skip:  Lobster Bisque & Kale Salad
Total:  $28

Been to this location a handful of times, always enjoyed coming here. But today we had a waitress who had a unwelcoming attitude the whole time which made my family uncomfortable. I will be back, but please don't give me Erika.

Definitely a fan of this place! Food is great and you wont be disappointed with the menu! The service was excellent, people were all very nice, bellini was awesome! I've had a few things here that were just ok, which is why I gave it a 4 star and not 5.  

The gorgonzola crusted lamb chops were delicious, but heavy (as lamb can be, but still).  They were good but needed something lighter to go with it rather than the olive oil covered spinach.  Bruschetta was pretty good, I recommend the sausage or the prosciutto tomato basil one.  The one with steak was too dried out.  The food was still good though and the ambiance is great!

We went to Brio for dinner the other night after hearing good things about it from friends and family.  

We asked to be seated on the patio as it was a gorgeous evening especially as Canadians!  The patio was gorgeous and after the first plane scared the cheap out of us we were used to them.

We ordered the calamari to start, the plate was a little bit sloppy with the dips just dumped on either side but the calamari was amazing and the dips were both decent.

For dinner I had the chicken carbonara which was super tasty and my husband had the mushroom ravioli with brown butter ravioli which he said was out of this world amazing.  I tasted the brown butter sauce which was super delicious with a great depth of flavour.

The very best part of the night was the trio of desserts.  A walnut cake of some sort, a vanilla bean creme br√ªl√©e and a caramel mascarpone cheesecake.  The creme br√ªl√©e was amazing.  It was silky smooth with a great vanilla bean flavour, and the mascarpone cheesecake was light and airy with an amazing caramel flavour, by far the best desserts of our vacation.

We will definitely visit Brio again.

Italian food inspired by Tuscany...well, I've never been to Tuscany but I do love Italian food and I wouldn't say the flavors seemed that authentic but I enjoyed my meal and service. Went for brunch on a Sunday and our group was seated fairly quickly. The clean and beautiful decor captured my eye. There was a bridal shower going on next to our table and they were taken care of nicely by the servers.

Our waitress and waiter were attentive and friendly. Started off with bread and butter, would have liked some oil and vinegar because that makes me think Italian. After looking at their menu for 15 minutes, because I couldn't decide from all the amazing choices, I ordered the Tuscany Harvest Salad. Came with grilled chicken,  mushrooms, bacon, almonds, Gorgonzola cheese, apples, dried cranberries, crispy lavoush, and Tuscan dressing. It was DELICIOUS! 

I still had room for dessert and their dessert platter had a nice variety so I went with the BRIO's Famous Cheesecake which was creamy and topped with caramalized sugar and creme anglaise. Every bite I took made me fall in love all over again. 

Their brunch menu has some great choices and I would not mind returning to this place or hosting a dinner party. Good choice, glad we yelped it. It's located in a town center so parking can be a pain but there are plenty of shops to walk around in.

I've been here so many times and I'm always pleased. Very good food and service is great. I mainly come here because of the atmosphere. It's located in town square, so it's great to meet friends here and shop around afterwards. The inside is just so classy and romantic. Thought I'd finally leave a review after coming  here so many times! This time they had seasonal items and we ordered the scallops risotto and the pasta ala vodka. The food is maybe just a bit semi pricier than it should be, but I figure you're paying for the setting and the nice service. Love the sourdough bread they give when seated!

I think the bartenders are either overworked or having a bad day, because they are certainty busy doing a lot of prep work behind the bar. Unfortunately management needs to realize, if you are over working your bartenders, then their service suffers. There seems to be a lot of people behind the bar, but few who can serve, and it's apparent the ones who can are having a bad day.

I've eaten here about 20 times... usually at the bar area.  Consistent food, great wine, solid service... great atmosphere.  Also had private dining in the chef's room for our engagement dinner.  Good food.  Good times and nice location inside Town Square.  Check it out!

Came here for my sisters birthday. Service was exceptional. Food was amazing!!!! I always have a great experience here and every time I come here I am always with a large group. As a matter a fact I also had a private party here for my daughter last year that occupied the entire back. I love it here that much. Sad to say I will probably not come back here. As we were leaving they were closing the curtains. Running over all of us that was seated. I would have been nice to tell us in advance. They stepped on my foot as they were doing and didn't apologize. Just laughed and said oh excuse me. My guest and I Felt that was rude and I was quite embarrassed because I was the one that suggested this place to have my sister's bday dinner.
Food was great and the service was good.the bathrooms were clean and the atmosphere was awesome in the restaurant.

Came here for the second time and there was a wait. Of course there was, it's the Christmas season and it was 6 pm on a cold night. 
So I made reservations for 7 and we were seated 7:05 minutes. 
Our waiter was ok and he took forever in getting our water, soda, etc. but i pardoned that. 
The food though, was very good. I ordered spaghetti with pancetta and vodka sauce (off menu) and our waiter still had the kitchen make it. The calamari was hot and mouth watering with slivers of peppercinis fried and mixed in with 2 sauces on the side. The table bread was a choice of crisp bread and sourdough, and that was even delicious. 
If you're shopping at Town Square and you don't mind paying $18 - $25 a person for a good Italian dinner, then this is the place.
Lovely lovely food! Been here twice and I love the atmosphere. I'm not into their spaghetti here but the main dishes and appetizers are nice!!

Me: "I'll have a Bellini."

Bartender:  "In this bar that is a frozen beverage.  Will that be acceptable?"

Me:  "No, thank you, I'll join my husband and have a mojito.  Thanks for telling me."

Bartender:  "You're welcome.  I thought you'd want to know."

That got us off to a very good start as we had a 3:00pm lunch in the bar at Brio after an enjoyable visit to Hoover Dam and Lake Mead.  Why the bartender thought I might care if the Bellini was authentic or not I do not know but she was right.  And it was the first step in stellar service that continued through the process of making the drinks, taking our food order and until the time we walked out at the end of our meal.  

Not only was the service great, the food exceeded our expectations, and the setting was lovely, hence the four stars.  

Brio is part of a small chain and as a rule we avoid chains, in particular when they involve 'staged opulence' interiors as here.  Different strokes for different folks and we simply lean to smaller, privately owned places with less flash..  But a local woman we met at Aria and with whom we discussed food (favorite topic for her too) recommended Brio and thought we'd be pleasantly surprised.  So in need of a late lunch, we headed to Town Center Mall (Whole Foods is also located here) and Brio.

We split the barbequed chicken flatbread and it was tasty...crispy thin crust, delicious sauce with just the right amount of chipotle, white meat chicken, feta and cilantro.  Served very hot from the oven, it was a great partner for the refreshing, well made mojitos..  We finished up by sharing the creme brulee trio, relying on the recommendation of another yelp reviewer, and thought all three brulee options (cleverly presented in demitasse cups) were good for flavor even if the sugar toppings had lost their crispness.

Our food and two cocktails were about $35 so a decent price.  

Based on this single experience, we would return to eat at a Brio Tuscan Grille again if we find one at some other point in our travels.

I just want to give a round of applause to Jarrett!!  My husband and I had a date night (which is a rare occasion, because we have a 17-month old son) and we came to Brio with only 45 min before our movie started.  We knew we loved the food, but would we be able to get what we wanted and get to the movie in 45 min?  We had our doubts--but Jarrett made it happen.  To make things even more difficult for him, we ordered everything :)  Appetizers, alcohol, salads, main courses AND dessert to go!!  He gave us amazing service, and the food was fantastic!  We were out the door in 40 min--can you believe it? at a sit-down, upscale restaurant??  Awesome!!  I had the artichoke-crusted beef with mashed potatoes, a bistecca salad and we split a sampler of bruschetta.  My husband also had a salad and he ordered lasagna.  Everything was yummo and the service was impecable!  Ask for Jarrett next time you go there!

This was my second time here and I really like the atmosphere.  Although it is always ridiculously crowded, if you have reservations, getting in is no problem.  We had a large group (11) and were seated before our reservation which was nice but our table wasn't completely set up.  Not a big deal but when we all finally got seated they forgot to keep setting up the table, leaving some of us without place settings and me without a water for the first half of the meal which really annoyed me even though I asked 3 times.  It was super busy and the appetizers were delicious, so I forgave them.  I decided to go with a healthy option, the Shrimp Mediterranean because I wanted to be light plus I've never tried farro before.  It was quite good but since it was the healthy option, I was done super quick because there was so little.  I was not going to order dessert but when I came back from the bathroom the table had ordered for me and I was glad they did because the special caramel dessert cookie thing was amazing!

Food and atmosphere was on point, it was too loud though, and because of how busy it was, the service was lacking a little bit.  I do like how they have more options than their sister restaurant Bravo.

I am a frequent guest at Brio, as the food tastes very good and I really enjoy the atmosphere of the restaurant. For me the best item on the menu is pasta alla vodka, which is handmade ricotta filled pasta with pancetta, garlic and basil in a spicy tomato Parmesan cream sauce. It is my favorite pasta all times and could eat it almost each time I visit the place and never get bored with it. I usually enjoy tasting various items from the menu in other restaurants, but pasta alla vodka is simply delicious and could never get enough of it. The only problem is that the dinner portion is exactly the same size that lunch portion, but more expensive... Slightly disappointing. 
And obviously I did try other dishes from their menu as well and all of them have nice fragrant flavors. So overall good food with solid service!
Great food! Beautiful restaurant! Quick Service. Didn't want to leave!
Love relaxing in the outside patio seating area and the happy hour menu is great! My fav drink here is the white peach sangria and I order an off the menu Steak Caesar Salad!

I would never have come here to Brio if the work hadn't hosted lunch event.  I'll just call the pasta dishes serviceable and the presentation wonderful.  But the lobster bisque was amazing.  That was some good ass bisque.  The warm fresh bread that they brought out complemented the bisque.  I did hear some comments from co-workers that the there was less vegetarian options on the dinner menu vs. the lunch/brunch menu.   

I'm not going to compare it chains like Macaroni Grill or Olive Garden.  But I did like the ambiance and service was good.  I've never been to Tuscany but if it's all about the feast, Brio certainly is a good place to go for big groups if your in Town Square.

Great service! From management my experience  was amazing when their was any issues general manager Jesse, was on top of it. He had great customer service as well as managing this fine Establishment . Overall, As a local in Las Vegas I recommend Br√≠os to anyone.

Thank you management!

Came in for happy hour with one of my good friends. As I entered the hostess at the stand asked me the basic seating questions once I informed her I was coming in for Happy Hour she changed her tone informed me that Happy Hour seating is at the bar or by the fire pit. 

As I walked around LOST the employees just continued to watch me walk back and fourth. I was alone still waiting on my friend and you can clearly see it in my expression that I couldn't find a seat. I had to ask someone for help who then also told me to look on the other side where there is another fire pit. Ok I get it, it's Happy Hour and seating is first come first serve but what's the point of having guest walk in and out feeling lost when you can have some type of organization to it?

Finally when I sat down it took about 10 minutes for someone to ask me what I wanted to drink and I guess they don't give you menus until you ask for one? This is the 4th time I have came here. It was my first time for Happy Hour and everytime I can't help but feel as if the staff be littles their guest. I clearly come back for the food and not the service! 

Happy Hour was definitely worth it! Great prices, good portions so as far as the quality in their food it's great! They need to work on better customer service skills. I have had better service at fast food restaurants then I've had here. It obviously wasn't a bad day for them cause 4 out of 4 tries the service just keeps getting worse.
Hosts were rude, literally had better service at IHOP this morning. Steak was so-so, waiter was decent.

Have eaten here a couple of times and loved my food every time! Service is great, decor is absolutely beautiful inside. Next time I go I may choose to sit outside on the patio... overall great place! Loved the shrimp risotto special and the steak bruschetta.

I enjoy their happy hour, however I just don't like how you can only sit at the bar or inside booths for the town square location. I would say that their pastas are on the same taste level as cheesecake factory, around the same price but LESS then half the portion as cheesecake factory pasta portions. I normally like to take extra food home and I cant do that at Brio because their pasta portions are only enough for one sitting. very nice environment . Decent customer service , Always come here for a quick bite.

I have visited this pleasant Italian place for lunch and dinner. My family and I discovered it on one of our many trips to Las Vegas. It is now a must stop whenever we go to LV. 
For the primi, we had the spinach artichoke dip and it was amazing! I am a huge fan of spinach and artichoke dip and this is definitely one of my favorite. 
The complimentary bread they give is also so good! They give you soft, warm bread, and cripsy flatbread with balsamic vinegar and wine...oh so good. I would just go for this!
Their caesar salad and Brio chopped salad was good, nothing really special, but they both did taste very good.
I had the Chipotle Chicken & Bacon Panini with charred tomato, carmelized onions, spicy chipotle mayonnaise, Fontina, Boursin and Applewood bacon. The Bacon was superb! The sandwich overall was perfect! I would get this next time I go to lunch.
For dinner, I had the Grilled Salmon. I am also a fan of salmon, and the salmon was cooked to perfection for me. It came with Romano crusted tomatoes, citrus pesto, asparagus and crispy shoestring potatoes. 
For dessert, I had their tiramisu. It was okay, nothing worth mentioning about it. 
The service was great both times I went and I loved the decor around the entire restaurant most of all. It really made me feel like I was in another world, not just in another LV restaurant. 
If you go to Las Vegas, this is a must try for some good Italian food and not as expensive as on the strip. Plus, you can shop and walk around the Town Square afterwards :)

My family and I have been coming to this restaurant since it opened. The food is delicious and the service is good. On our last visit, however, the service  was exceptional. Our waiter,  Aaron was extremely attentive, never once did we have to wait for a drink refill or ask for anything. He even offered to go cups for our drinks. This gentleman gives 5 star service. I will be sure to ask for him on our next visit.

Fun atmosphere, tasty food, and solid presentation all make for a reliable "go-to" spot when hunger strikes.  My strawberry and spinach salad was appetizing and colourful and hubby's pasta was savoury and rich.  Everything was served with a (genuine) smile and we enjoyed our time feasting and people watching.

Mother's Day Breakfast!! The elegance of Brio started off my day with ease. The host staff was welcoming and cordial. We had a reservation and we were seated within minutes so no real waiting. 

I got to enjoy Berries & Cream stuffed French toast with applewood bacon. It was a bit overwhelming due to how sweet it was but what do you expect with stuffed French toast drizzled with honey and syrup. Nonetheless, it was yummy!!! 

The service was ok. I felt like our server was getting irritated a couple times but then he would snap out of it. I get they were super busy so I just let it slide. 

I have enjoyed happy hour at this venue many times and have always had a great time. Overall, still a satisfied Brio customer!

Overpriced. Overrated. I ordered a 5 oz steak with mashed potatoes and asked if I could sub grilled asparagus for the steamed vegetables. This dish was $22 and they charged me extra for the asparagus. The plate looked like it was completely empty. The steak, smaller than my palm. The asparagus I was charged extra for, was undercooked and bland. I asked for Dr Pepper, received Coke and then when I finally tacked down my second server of the night due to a shift change that left us completely neglected, the Dr Pepper was flat and watered down. My boyfriend liked his sweet potato Risotto, but the serving size was also very small. It's loud, freezing, and an overall unenjoyable place. Wouldn't ever come here again. Huge waste of money and an afternoon.

This is a good place ... I have not had a bad meal here yet. ... beware get reservations they are very busy. The steak is really good and the salmon. The pasta is really good as well but what i remember the most was this wine called the sketchbook ... was awesome so smooth. Service is great even when they are so busy.
I love this place i love the food the service and mose of a the wonderful atmosphere of the place thay always make you feel welcome.

Form the hostess to the server, everyone was very friendly. Now, THE FOOD was bananas! MY girl & I had the Lobster bisque to start,"Now I have had my fair share of bisque but this will go up there on 1 of my top 3 for sure" I forgot what my girl had but whatever it was it was great. AS fo me...I had the Surf & Turf. REALLY GOOD but the portion was a little small. Never the less, our experience was great & I would highly recommend it to anyone.
Why did'nt I rate it a 5 star...I'm a stickler for having our drinks filled at all times..even if it's just water,"which I was drinking". But in our servers defense, she was very busy & had a large section. 
Maybe next time they will bump up to a 5 Star.

My girlfriend took me to dinner on my birthday at this location on 04/27/17 for what was supposed to be a very special day and occasion, but instead it was a terrible experience!! I had a horrible birthday and the absolute worst experience that I've ever had at any establishment. When we immediately entered there were three young hostesses just standing around chitchatting, we stood there for a few seconds before we were even greeted. Finally after their "worthy" conversation was over we were greeted and escorted to our table. We were seated with no silverware, the waiter came over, took our drink orders, and we ordered an appetizer and also got served the appetizer without any silverware. We didn't receive silverware until my girlfriend walked up to the hostess stand to request the silverware. It became immediately obvious that our waiter was just not having a good night and was overwhelmed. The service that he provided was horrible, he didn't take the time to check on us after we got our food, and we had to wave for him to see that we needed a refill on our drinks. I ordered my favorite dish and it seemed as if they were either low on ingredients or that they had served me the leftovers from another diner's plate. The portion was very small and on all my other visits I had never seen such a small portion of this dish, which was my favorite dish to order. Prior to arriving at the restaurant my girlfriend had also called to advise them that it was my birthday and she requested a birthday dessert. While at the restaurant she even notified the hostesses and requested for them to please notify our waiter that it was my birthday and once again requested the birthday dessert. Needless to say the message wasn't relayed to our waiter and all he brought to our table was the check. Finally fed up with the terrible customer service we requested to speak to a manager and the manager Megan came over. Prior to her coming over to speak with us we were disappointed with the lack of communication and poor service, but not too upset. However, Megan absolutely added fuel to the fire and made the night and my special occasion even worst. She was very sarcastic and EXTREMELY dismissive of our concerns and complaints. Her solutions to the issues were her sarcastic jokes & remarks, a very poor attempt at an apology, and a free dessert card. The experience was terrible and truly was the absolute worst dining experience and attempt at celebrating my special day. Prior to this experience everyone who knows me knew that Brio was my favorite restaurant in town and that I would visit this location 6-8 times yearly, and even ordered catering to go orders for events at work, but based on this experience and especially the way that we were treated by Megan I will NEVER again visit this restaurant or any other location. I've already deleted the rewards app with unused rewards because the experience was so bad that I truly will never ever visit any Brio restaurant ever again. Great job guys... the ball was completely dropped on this night! Worst experience ever!!!!

I absolutely love brio. The reason being behind this is because everytime I come to eat here, the quality they bring out to me is great. We usually come here for an occasion, or for lunch happy hour because their pricing is a little expensive.

I always end up getting some sort of pasta, with a nice sauce. I love their ravioli pasta and chicken limon! 

Customer service wise, I've gotten the good, the bad and the in between. Although, our last experience here was actually not so bad. I believe our server might've been new, so she didn't seem like she knew everything on the menu when we asked her about some entrees. It was my friends birthday, so we asked her to bring a surprise cake out for him, or something cute to surprise him. After a few minutes, she comes to our table and asks us who's birthday it is and what kind of cake he would want. He had no idea, and sort of laughed. But instead of just bringing one out to surprise him, she kind of ruined the surprise. But I guess things happen, but it would have been nicer to surprise him. Next time, I'll be sure to make myself clear. LOL

The first time I went here, I was with my best friend. We went there for happy hour. We were told that happy hour is only at the bar. The bar area is inside the restaurant and  outside. The happy hour menu is only a page just one sided. Even though the selection is small the food is delicious. The plates are good enough to fill you up with just 2-3 plates.

The second time I went there I went with my boyfriend. We went on a thursday. Also went there for happy hour. When we sat down, I noticed a $5 martinis only on thursdays. 

The price for the happy hour food is $3.95 for every single plate on the happy hour menu. 
The service is good. But the first time I went there, it was ok. We had to ask our waitress to get refills on our water.

This a main staple at Town Square and very popular at peak times. Expect a short to moderate wait if you want a table. We walk right past all of the people to the bar area where we always find a spot for 2. If there's no seating at the bar on the inside we sit outside. 
The food is always great and the staff is usually pretty good. They bring the traditional bread before the meal. 
My favorite meal of all time is the Parmesan crusted beaf medallions. It has a slightly different name now because the crust is different but it tastes the same.
Best Happy Hour in Vegas!!! 3.95$ small plates, Bill is 30$ ate, drank, great atmosphere, thank you Brio, you never disappoint. 5 stars

Sadly, we squandered over $200 on what we thought would be a fine dining experience for our family.

Service: FIVE STARS
-  Lindsay was our server.  She was personable and very professional. 

Ambiance:    TWO STARS
-  We were seated in the dome area; it looked tired, dingy and absolutely lacking in energy and excitement. The chairs were uncomfortable.

Food:  ONE STAR
-  Several meals were served; my personal experience pretty much covers it all.  The strip steak I had was nothing to write home about; it lacked that "grilled" flavor you would expect of a steak being served in a fine dining establishment. Portion-wise- it was a decent size. The accompanying mashed potatoes were hot and cold, suggesting they were microwaved. Their texture was like the flour and water you used to make a paper m√¢ch√© project in elementary school. As for flavor, well let's just say they did not even come close to being a "fine dining" entree; even KFC delivers a better mashed potato. The veggies were worse! My veggies were so overcooked, they reminded me of the shriveled aliens you see in sci-fi movies. Visually, they were simply gross looking.  Thankfully, their flavor was better, but not by much.  Definitely not a "fine food" entree!

OVERALL DINING EXPERIENCE:  Double thumbs dow.

Really delicious meal and excellent service.  We tried the bruschetta sampler and the BLT was my favorite.  Salads, pasta and dessert and all was delicious!  

It was not a very intimate setting, it was very open and we were smack in the middle of the restaurant.  That would be my only complaint.

Being a local this is a one of my favorite places to go. The chopped salad and Brussels sprouts are amazing. They have a great happy hour during the week and the drinks are flowing! It is sometimes hard to find a seat at the bar but usually only have to wait 10mins. The bar tending staff is great! Delmar is one of my favs. The bathrooms are always clean and never dirty. I love the outside sitting area when it's warmer out especially with the fire pits.

I don't usually like eating at "chain" restaurants or posting reviews for them. But, as far as "chain" restaurants go, Brio has some really great menu items. And out of the restaurant choices at town square, Brio is up at the top of the list and definitely not somewhere you should ever avoid (avoid Claim Jumper!). 

Brio has wonderful flat breads and bruchetta. Yum. Last night, I ordered the pasta alla vodka and OHMYGOD, I ate the entire plate. Literally, I ate the entire plate. I can't even tell you details about the type of pasta because I shoveled into my mouth so fast that I'm almost in a state of memory failure. All I know is the sauce, the pasta, and the prosciutto were SO DELICIOUS and a must-order if you like vodka sauce. 

I also really love the fresh bread they bring to the table, particularly the cheesy cracker-like pieces! YUMMY! 

They have a really great selection of desserts too: small ones that allow you to sample many different flavors. I really enjoyed the creme brulee!

Came here for the late night happy hour last Monday, which is from 9 pm to close, and no surprise it wasn't very crowded at all. We had mostly drinks but ordered a couple appetizers too including the margherita flatbread. Everything on the happy hour menu is priced between $4-$6 and the drinks seemed decently strong. The flatbread was nice and crunchy and a pretty good size. Service was efficient and our server kept coming back to check on us the entire time we were there. Our food and drinks came out pretty fast. I was impressed and would definitely come back to check out their full menu

Food is great at brunch yet for dinner I couldn't tell you how it is - it took 30 minutes to get water and iced tea.  We got bread but no silverware.  I had to steal some from a table next to us when they got up and left due to lack of service.  Now 1 hour into my time at this table - still no appetizer and my butt is hurting because this chair is too small for my American ass.  My server had a table walk out on him... I wonder why?  Brio is a great place to hang out for happy hour and brunch but avoid dinner service as it takes way too long and the meals are the same size portions as lunch for a higher price.

Oh Brio.  I try so hard to enjoy dining there because the food is amazing.  Keep in mind, I'm a bit biased because typically I frequent Brio during happy hour.

First, let's talk about Happy Hour. A plenitful variety of appetizers (including a full size burger) for $2.95.  Budget friendly?  That would be a yes.  I've also eaten at their sister company Bravos quite a few times, and everything I ever had off the menu was AMAZING.  

But good food only gets you so far with me.  What's an instant ratings killer?  Oh right, Bad service. 

Now granted, I eat at Brio quite a bit because it happens to be located near my place of employment, so because of that I tend to frequent their Happy Hour specials on my lunch hour.  Just the food portion though.  Drinking during my lunch would be a little more than frowned upon.  

So I'm not sure if it's because I typically dine alone, or they know I work in the vicinity of the restaurant, or it's because I never consume alcoholic beverage in the bar area when I'm on my lunch, but the service has gone from decent to mediocre to abysmal.

My review is based on my previous visit.  So I'm sitting at the bar during happy hour and it's actually quite a slow day, meaning lots of empty bar stools.  I come in, sit down, and no exactly what I want.  The gentleman beside me gets his food right as I'm sitting down and apparently knows the one of the many...I think at one point I counted 5 people working behind the bar.....bartenders.  She inquires about his food, glances at me....and WALKS AWAY.  Ok, maybe she was distracted.  5 minutes later- no one has even acknowledged my presence, let alone taken my order.  So I sit patiently wondering what the deal is when one of the bartenders notices I haven't been waited on and asks how she can help me.  Afraid that no one is going to come in my direction again, I place my food and drink order all once.  Meanwhile, the guy to my left is displeased with one of his dishes and gets it removed from his bill.
