So my food comes, it's tasty as always, but water at this point is empty.  After being finished with my food for well over 5 minutes, the bartender from before comes over...glances right at my empty water glass... and asks if I'm ready for the check.  

So let's briefly discuss the number one way to piss me off at a restaurant- oh that's right, an empty drink.

So at this point, I pay my tab and bolt.  And haven't been back since.

I've dined here quite a few times. The food has always been good. I'm writing this review because recently I tried the white peach sangria. Let me just say order this!! It's fabulous and everything a summer sangria should be. Do yourself a favor and order it, you'll be glad you did.

I love this place, especially when we have nice weather here in Vegas. In the summer they let you sit outside and they turn on the misters for you. But we went on a beautiful Sunday afternoon for some LUNCH! and we were hungry! 

I usually always get the pastas, but my girlfriend had the crab and shrimp cakes which were really good. I had the pasta brio which was good, from what I remember. And my friend Vanessa had the grilled salmon angel hair pasta.

Its a nice quiet atmosphere, and its always nice to walk around town square after. 

Good place to take someone on a date. 

MUST TRY!
It is kind of pricy but totally worth it! I love their patio and their salads are amazing. The staff is very polite and actually gives you space and time to eat.

Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip
Parmesan flatbread, great for sharing 11.50

Lobster Bisque
Sauteed shrimp garnish 6.95

Braised Beef Pappardelle
Rosemary pappardelle, crimini mushrooms, roasted carrots, red onions, tomato porcini sauce 17.95

My wife and I came here after a rainy night shopping at the south outlets. First off, this place looks like a more elegant "big sister" of Bravo Cucina Italiana (see previous review) with the brightly lit ambience. The menus are quite similar also Portions are quite generous as my wife and I shared everything. The dip was pretty good and the bread that came with it were pretty big. The bisque was ok as it had more of a butter flavor than lobster flavor. The lobster bisque at Top of the World in the Stratosphere tasted way better. The pasta was pretty good as it pretty much tasted like a pot roast with long, thick egg noodles. Our waitress/chefs were nice enough to give us 2 divided plates of the dish. Overall, we had a good experience here and we'll try it again if we are in Towns Square...Oh yeah, we had a lot of leftovers and they still tasted good.

Had an awesome birthday dinner here for my husband thanks to our server Craig! 
We took advantage of our rewards card and started with the Garlic, Artichoke, Spinach Dip which was delicious (especially those little cheesy triangles of deliciousness they serve it with).
For entrees he went with the Lobster and Shrimp Fettuccine which he couldn't stop raving about and I decided on the Fettuccine with Tomato Compote and Kalamata Olives (which I wasn't too sure about when I ordered, but was SO glad I did, because it was delicious and under 600 calories!) Our 3 year old had the kid's pepperoni pizza which was delicious and more than enough for him (and such a steal at that price point!)
We finished off with a free birthday dessert (thank you Brio for taking that extra step for us!), and the kiddo enjoyed his kid's ice cream sundae.

Our server was wonderful, he was friendly, attentive (but not hovering), and made our dinner extra special. We truly appreciate the wonderful customer service and delicious food to boot. Thanks Brio!

I have lived in Vegas for about 5 and a half years now. My husband and I are foodies, so we have been all over Vegas for dinner, from super fine dinning, to buffets. Brio is our favorite place to eat hands down. The service is always great and the food is ALWAYS terrific. We have never ordered something we didn't like! We love the mushroom di bella pasta, Pasta alla vodka, and the bistecca inselata...the steaks are great as well. They also have the best ice tea in Vegas! Highly recommend Brio!!

We got there at 6:30pm with no reservations, they were busy, so the hostess  gave us a buzzer, so when our table was ready we will get buzzed,in less than 5 min. we were buzzed.(THAT WAS SUPER FAST) The decore inside nice, nice, the place looked great,and the the smells coming out of the kitchen you thought you were back in Tuscany. It felt back home for a while.We sat in the gazibo room, the  lites were nice and dimm, and the atmosphere was great. Sandy was our waitress and she was very polite and spirited. Her recomendations were awsome, the ceaser salads that came out were fresh and the lettuce crisp the lobster bisqe was good too.The basket with the bread that came out was nice and hot. As soon as they  saw our table empty with bread they kept on coming with more, and they always refilled our drinks as well. The pasta dishes with ricotta panceta in a vodka cream sause excellent (Pasta a la Vodka),the brazed beef with cremini mushrooms and homade noodles was great, the flavors were all there, awsome!! The mohitos are a little on the lite side, but it was corected from Sandy.The deserts that came out in little espreso cups [2.50 each] Smart!! Very good idea you can try them all. In general the experience was great and we will be back. For a chain restaurant to look that good and please their customers so well, gets 5 stars from me. PPERRRFFECCTOOOOOOOOOO!

I never really paid attention until last night while out having dinner with my mom, but Brio is a fantastic blend of Carabas meets Cheesecake Factory.  What does that mean? Fixed menu, factory workers as servers, little intimacy in the entire venue, just get-em in get-em out experience. It's like a production line.. granted most restaurants are but they all don't FEEL that way.

Now, I'm not saying things were bad, my server (forgot his name) was very nice and super attentive, food was good (not great, just good), and over all it was a decent dining experience.

I would chalk this place up as saying it's just another commercial chain food establishment with main perks being their happy hour specials and outdoor seating when the weather is nice.

Sorry Brio, I'm just as disappointed as you are.

We continue to have excellent service and delicious food so we will forever be loyal customers! I always recommend this place to couples, singles, and families. It's great for anyone! The kid's menus are great and the kid's pizzas are huge! My son loves it here!

Second time coming here and it's only been for happy hour! It's so great:) my sister and I decided to spend some quality time together. We sat at the bar because all the couches were taken. Delmar was amazing:) Excellent service. He was so nice and even made my sis and I a yummy shot because she recently turned 21. Cute! Kind! And good at what he did. No complaints here lol oh and the food is always good. Next time I go here I'd like to see the actual menu though. I'm sure it's delish. Dessert was also very good! Overall this place is great to go out on date or hang out with the girls.
Great food but my favorite part about Brio is the tiramisu!!! I've come just to have dessert when visiting Las Vegas

My review is not for issues with the food, but the cleanliness (or lack there of) of the restaurant on Friday night when I was there. There was hair on the tablecloth, lots of it! It wasn't on the top, it was on the part that hangs off he table. I brought it to the attention of the waitress and she said that was disgusting. I also pointed out that the hair was greasy and she cleaned that up, but never bothered to do anything about the hair on the table. The plates on the table (for the bread) had so much water that when my friend put her bread on one of them, it got soggy. The food was good, but my experience upon being seated made me wonder about the hygiene in the preparation and service of my meal.

I had never eaten at brio till last night. I was excited because I had always heard great things. I ordered a the chopped salad and lobster bisque. My boyfriend order the shrimp and lobster pasta which I was excited about. Our food came out in a timely manner, but as I was about to eat my salad there was a large hair which was very off putting. My waitress so kindly apologized and brought me another salad. As I was waiting I ate some of my boyfriends pasta but it had no flavor and there was only a couple pieces of seafood. Couple hours later I got home and began to feel ill with the symptoms of food poising. This experience was very off putting and unfortunately I will never be back.

i probably had the best service at this restaurant than i have ever had anywhere. Elana the hostess was friendly from the start. Q our server was absolutely fantastic and made some amazing strawberry lemonade for me. MJ the manager was nice enough and came around to our table to make sure everything was fantastic for us. i for sure will be returning to this restaurant. fantastic staff.

Food was on the salty side. Not many vegetarian friendly options. Plenty of paid parking spaces. Just an okay restaurant nothing to fancy. I really enjoyed the bread they gave as an appetizer.  Not really a big fan.

I saw some friends having lunch on the patio and wanted to surprise them by picking up their tab. I went to the host stand and asked for a manager, they sent me a Megan. Megan was very helpful and I was able to buy lunch for my friends as a complete surprise. Props to the staff for being very helpful in a slightly odd situation. Thanks for helping spread some smiles.

Not going to lie, we waited for 15-20 minutes to get service. But, beyond that, the service was great. On person that stood out to us the most was Jaime. He wasn't our waiter but he offered us cheese and had a Huge smile on his face. We joked a bit and laughed and he really set the mood for our party. We spoke to the manager about him and he was very pleased to hear what we had to say.

I always like this place.... Thought I reviewed it before.... Good atmosphere and good food. Good service.... Has one of my favorites... Beef Carpaccio. This is definitely better than B&B at the Venetian !!!!

Great Italian food! Atmosphere is so relaxed and comfortable. Come for a lunch break between shopping at Town Square or enjoy a nice dinner out on the patio with wine.  We ordered the roasted red pepper bruschetta, the lobster and shrimp Pasta, and for my 5 year old the kids macaroni with a side salad.  Good portions too. Everything was delicious.
Really good italian food for a decent price! There is usually a long wait.. We had to wait for an hour, but the ambiance and quality of food was worth it! I ordered the pasta alli vodka. Delicious!

I have been visiting Brio at Town Square since a long time ago. Approximately since 2007 or so. This is the place to celebrate family birthdays, bring people when visiting from out of town. I have had very good experience with staff until tonight. My son's 14 bday dinner. The waiter was the most clueless waiter I have seen comparing to restaurants in the level of Brio. From the beginning, he forgot to bring my soup, i didnt bring it up thinking it was an honest mistake. Then, i was without a drink for 21 minutes and when I asked him, he never brought it. My daughter had to go to the bar area to ask and another gentleman who brought my drink while our waiter was high fiving and hugging every girl including the hostesses that would cross his path. When our dinner came out, we usually get a "Did your dinner come out ok?" from a regular waiter. This guy said " Are you all happy now?" After the drink incident which im sure someone told him about it, he didnt even recognized and owned up to his mistake but ignored it completely. To top it off, he comes towards the end to ask if we wanted dessert(Of course we said no) and made a comment if our party of 4 switched places on the table....I just had to make a comment to see if he gets it and I said; "Maybe you should come around more often"...that comment flew in front of his forehead and he didnt even have a reaction to it.....I have never seen this guy before but next time I go and if i decide to go back to this location, I will make sure I dont get this waiter and run away from his area. Tivoli Village location is almost the same distance for me. I guess i will make that decision later. I consider myself a good tipper(20% to 25%) for average service. At the same time, I give less and even $0 if the experience is a disaster like tonight. I am not looking or any freebies or anything like that but i someone needs more info on who this individual is, please feel free to message me or comment here.

Posted by my wife since she doesn't have a Yelp account
"Very disappointed that my review from yesterday shows that I wrote it last September. You're a class act Brio's, own up to a bad review once in awhile. 
I love Brio's in Town Square. My husband and I take out of town friends whenever someone visits. It's always part of the Las Vegas experience we love to share. We took a very dear friend tonight who is visiting From New Jersey. She's waited for years to go. As always, the food was great. However, our server was lousy. First time ever! We had to ask someone else to bring parmesan, a little extra sauce for my crab cakes, my husband sat for 15 minutes with an empty wine glass...we were told she had 'other customers'. It was 4 pm..not busy. She just wasn't good. First time I ever saw my husband leave a 10% tip. Such a disappointment from a place we love so much.":

Just had lunch from Brio Town Square. I'm wishing I hadn't. I had the ceaser salad (8 leaves and part of the stalk) the dressing was good. The HALF BURRATA & PROSCIUTTO SANDWICH that tasted as if tapioca had a kid. The complete lack of flavor made it a sad meal. To make the box more appealing baked crisps were put in. A solid challenge for even to eat even one. They have made items that can be used in construction. NEVER AGAIN!!!
Brio's is the perfect 4 star restaurant. I always enjoy! Most dinners cost between $22-$29. It's location is excellent so many things to do inside town square mall.

I have been to Brio before and normally sit in bar area. on this  visit I was meeting my girlfriend and her family from out of town. Monday afternoon not to busy got sat right away. now to be fair I did ask for another table so I was given a different server. took a few minutes for him to come by and he did greet table nicely. there was 3 adults and 2 kids we ordered some ice teas and that took at least 5 minutes. 
our server Josh came by and took our order then brought out bread. food was brought out without Caesar salad, which we had to ask for. one of the children ordered the kids mac and  cheese did not like the food. so I had to flag down another server to find my server to get her something  else to eat. finally our server came by and never mentioned  the new order. I let him know about the new order and he went √†nd brought it over. 
overall food was okay but service  was not. server was only at table 4 times including he never checked back to see if we were okay. a man could of been manager only stopped by once to see if second order was okay. I am sure based on business maybe server had off day as the alternative  would be he was not good at his job.

Brio has not maintained the quality standard that it had when it first opened. Crumbs were all over the booth, food was very slow coming, it took too long to pay, and most importantly, the food just wasn't as good as it had been on numerous previous visits.

They are in a prime spot at Town Square and I'm afraid they might be resting on location to keep patrons coming in the doors, rather than improving the food quality.

We had our wedding reception in the large private room and I am so glad we chose Brio for our event. The food was amazing, our guests could not stop talking about how good everything was. And the service was great, the waitresses were on top of it the entire night. They really exceeded my expectations, our reception could not have gone any better!
Been coming here for years and it only gets better.  I really like the prices as they are reasonable compared to other restaurants that are not nearly as good.

This was my first time at this restaurant and I was very impressed. I went with two friends on a weekday in the evening and there was no wait. The inside of the restaurant was nicely decorated and very clean. The service was also very friendly and attentive. 

The food was great. We ordered a bruschetta sampler appetizer which had a few different types of bruschetta on it. I wasn't the biggest fan of them, but that was a personal taste thing, my two friends loved it (sometimes traditional things just can't be out done). I had a glass of sangria which was decent, but tasted syrupy too me. These reasons are why I took off a star. 

My entree was delicious. The sauce was very light which is my preference (heavy creamy sauces make me feel like a blimp after my meal, some people are into that, but not me). I'd come back and order it again definitely. 

Also, they have a promotion right now if you sign up for their points club thing you get a discount on your meal that night (I think it was 20%), which was a nice surprise. Pretty much 100x better than olive garden, and for about the same price.

My dish was delicious and very well prepared. My partners on the other hand was a bit on the small size for an entree. The size portion for the pastas should be a little bit larger for the price. The atmosphere was ok a little busy, but this location is prime.

calamari was the worst I have had ever in my life. Definitely did not look like the pictures. It was just a bunch of bread crumbs and prepubescent squid bodies  Pasta was ok but had to wait 30 mins even though I had a reservation. For shame..............

I took my mother out for lunch on Mother's Day . The place was packed and I didn't know we had to have reservations.  But was told that the bar area was open. There were tables there and had an amazing lunch our server Reno Martinez made our visit perfect . He was very knowledgeable of the menu and helped us with suggestions. We where attended quickly and he made us feel very welcomed. I highly recommend anyone to sit at his section . Thank you Brio for hiring such great and profesional help... Thank you Reno Martinez you made my Mother feel special with such wonderful service ...

Yesterday evening, a group of 10 of us decided to celebrate our friend's birthday by having dinner at Brio. I had been looking forward to trying Brio for a long time as I'm frequently in Town Square. 
When we first entered, I really liked the decor! It was very majestic and beautiful - kind of reminded me of Caesar's Palace!
We immediately ordered drinks. My best friend decided to order a Bloody Mary while I went with my favorite extra dirty martini. Both cocktails were disappointing. 
Our server then brought out several baskets of warm bread which was delicious and probably one of my favorite parts of the meal!
Our group ordered several appetizers to share - the calamari and the spicy shrimp & eggplant. Both dishes were excellent. 
Since my cocktail was unenjoyable, I decided to play it safe and order a glass of wine to complement my meal. I knew that I was going to go with seafood so I went with the Sauvignon Blanc from Italy which was an excellent choice! It was a very crisp and refreshing wine.
For the main course, I went with the Pesce Piccata (wild caught cod), which unfortunately lacked flavor, was rather dry, & overall disappointing. The angel hair pasta that came with it also tasted somewhat undercooked. My best friend ordered the evening's special - sea bass - which was delicious!
Finally, we ordered a few desserts that we all shared at the table. I had the cr√®me br√ªl√©e and it was fantastic!
Overall, my favorite parts of the meal were the bread, appetizers, desserts, and overall ambiance. The service was very good too and our server was polite and knowledgeable. 
I plan on returning to try other items and specifically to try their happy hour!

brio!

friendly staff. great service. spacious. huge portions. ordered the pesto pasta - light, fulfilling, and flavorful. great quality!

will come back again and try other things on the menu! check out the picture i posted.

Cant get enough of their happy hour menu! 

Their blackened shrimp with eggplant was to die for as well as their Beef Carpaccio and their Crispy Tuscan Tots. It was so delicious that we ordered two of everything! The Roasted Garlic, Spinach and Artichoke Dip was ordinary but I do like the Pita like chips they come with.

Im not a fan of alcohol but those Sangria Rosa's are yum! Beware though, two of those and you'll be at a good level.

Trying to make it a weekly HH date with girl friends.

Las Vegas is not a walking city.  The hotels are far apart.  The suburbs have strip malls.  The heat in summer (and the cold in winter) makes much of the year unpleasant outdoors.  But in the spring and fall we can have some absolutely gorgeous days.  Last night was a beautiful warm spring evening.  It was not windy and the clouds overhead were spectacular.  This was the perfect time for dining al fresco and what better meal to have than something Italian.  A friend of ours who works at UNLV suggested this new restaurant in Town Square.  Although we have been to Town Square several times (and visit Fry's next door regularly), we had not tried this restaurant.

We were seated on the outdoor patio promptly and ordered the carpaccio which was recommended by our friend.  I'm glad we did as it was delicious.  I decided on the lobster risotto and my husband had the Veal Milanese both accompanied by a lovely Italian white wine.  There was plenty of lobster and asparagus in my risotto.  My husband's veal was tender with just enough capers and lemon butter to flavor it, but not to make it soggy.  I am not much of a dessert person, so we skipped it.  Sipping the last of our wine while the the sky grew dark was the perfect end to a beautiful day.  We will be back.

First time dining here.  The service was good except our waiter forgot to bring extra bread then after asking a third time, it showed up and my husband's second drink never showed.  HOWEVER, the ambiance was great and the food was better.  Will dine here again.

Decided on Brio for happy hour and was pleasantly surprised that they had a new menu. For happy hour you need to sit in the bar area, either inside or out and there are a few high top tables that are included. We arrived at 5:40 and had about an hour left of happy hour which runs until 6:30. The movie started at 7:30 so we had time to chill.

For drinks waters, a white peach sangria 5/5 and a cucumber basil gimlet 3/5. For apps we ordered the beef carpaccio 5/5, shishito pepper hash 5/5 very nice flavoring with the sriracha aioli and the potato skins topped with cheddar cheese sauce, applewood bacon, green onions and lime crema 4/5. Service was wonderful and very attentive. They came by to let us know it was happy hour last call so we got another round of sangrias and another beef carpaccio. 

Thank you Brio for providing such a nice start to our evening at Town Square.
The appetizer wasn't as good as expected the calamari wasn't cooked enough. The entree was really good and the drink they could use a little bit of more alcohol in it.

Great restaurant !! Went with a large group and service was outstanding would also like to mention that the food was fabulous. Pricing is also very reasonable for the standard of the restaurant. Wish I could remember our server's name she was very great at anticipating the needs of our table.

went with a co-worker, nice warm evening so we sat on the patio. It was a nice atmosphere, but right next to the airport, so you'll be chatting enjoying the outside lights & warm breeze, then a  plane is directly overhead & you think a wheel might fall onto your table...
food was good, liked the non-booze drink options, free refills, service was very good. 
I would go back.
I will only come here for lunch from now on dinners are to overpriced for food that is not top notch!!

We booked Brio for a small wedding reception from across the country, sight unseen, and were pleasantly surprised with the venue. Not only was everything arranged just as I had requested for our dinner, but the food was amazing (steaks were cooked perfectly) and the service was excellent!

A good restaurant indeed! I enjoyed the food of course ..the location is at best. The waiter and waitresses were so nice. The ambiance is somewhat beautiful...I loved the one we ordered,that was a bomb...
I want to go back there again if given any chance and order the same dish haha!!
The only thing so so was the Caesar salad I ordered, plainly twas only lettuce and crotons plus they don't have blue cheese, failed..
Otherwise, overall I'll give 8:))

I always have a good meal when I'm here. Service is great, pretty big place so don't have to wait a while and they have an amazing HAPPY HOUR! Its too bad its mon-thurs because i'm always free on fridays.. but most of their food during happy hour is So incredibly cheap i end up getting all!!
My faves:
Harvest Salad
Tomato Bisque Soup
Vodka Pasta
Shrimp and Eggplant thingy.. (forget the name, its an appetizer)
Must try the above listed.. its amazing~! So good that i didn't know it was a chain restaurant. Good job BRIO!
**Not the best place for Vegan, but can be vegetarian friendly.

Really? I'm confused by all the glowing reviews. Brio is basically a glorified OG. Everything stinks of a chain Italian restaurant. I did appreciate the fact that they were very accommodating to our need for a speedy lunch. I had a flat bread pizza which was just fine. Tasted nothing like a true Neopolitan thin crust pizza, but its bastardized Italian food and for what it was it was just fine. If you're a fan of the OG this may be the place for you- plus they have a fantastic patio for outdoor dining.

Had dinner here Saturday night and the evening couldn't have gone better.  Our server, Amit, was excellent...personable and attentive without being intrusive.  Made sure everything was on time and just as ordered.  (Would return just to have him serve us again!)  Our meals (pesto pasta, Mediterranean shrimp special and chicken ravioli) were excellent and it was pleasant eating outside.  Glad to see the uncomfortable chairs have been replaced.

I'm a sucker for pasta and pizza, so Brio is totally my place! I lunched here a few days ago with my fianc√© and his brother. We snagged a table outside and, even though it was blazing hot, we were kept cool by their awesome little misting machines built into the fence. Our waitress was Dominique and she was adorable and very friendly. 

We ordered the Beef Carpaccio to start and it was fantastic. I ordered a flatbread pizza and was pleasantly surprised-- I was expecting a long, thin flatbread with toppings, but I actually received a cracker thin crust pizza with gooey, browned cheese and crisp pepperonis. Delish! We also ordered mimosas, but they weren't very cold... but that's my only complaint.

Ate here for the very first time and it was absolutely delicious! When we arrived we were greeted and seated right away by the Hostess. 
 I had the Blackened Tilapia with grilled veggies which was cooked to perfection. Our waiter was very attentive and was super friendly! I love the ambiance of the restaurant and I look forward to dining here again especially for the price.

We went on a Sunday night it was pretty busy since it's the holidays... It's more of a casual dressy type of place... Our server was very slow he only came by twice to refill our water... We received bread and butter when we got there the food itself came by really fast... I ordered the shrimp and lobster fettuccine which was delicious the lobster bisque perfect for the cold weather. The truck did a great job the only reason it's getting a four stars instead of five because of our server I could  have died of dehydration!!!

I love the atmosphere at Brio.  Although it IS indeed a chain, which is not my favorite part of a restaurant, it is still nicer than your average.

Their outdoor seating is spectacular.  The misters make it bearable to sit in the summer Vegas heat, the fire pits are great for the cooler evenings.

The food is pretty solid - I love their entree sized salads.  I can't comment on cocktails or desserts, as I've never had one there, but I'm guessing it'll push above average.

Overall, it was a great place for chilling on the patio or for a business lunch.

Always a great experience when I come here. The staff knows their stuff! They're always friendly and helpful. The interactions are nothing but genuine and the atmosphere is awesome. Keep up the good work all!

I've been here a few times and really like it.

The food I've ordered has been really good.  They have a big menu with a ton of choices, which is always nice.  Even their dessert has a nice selection that compliments coffee or tea perfectly.

The restaurant itself is really nice too.  Its typical Tuscon decoration but it goes above and beyond.  

I've always had good service here so I have no complaints about that (lets face it, any restaurant can have a bad waiter at any time).

There is patio dining as well which I like because I love to people watch.

It is a little bit pricy, but the food quality is better than most. 

All in all Brio is enjoyable.

Yes, its a chain restaurant, but probably one of the best ones that makes you feel like you are fine dining. 

Although there is always a wait at the Town Square location, its worth it. 
The carpaccio is one of best in the city... Don't be shocked when you see the platter it is served on.. For a meal for one, it's perfect. 
My friends had the grilled salmon and pasta. No complaints.. 
As for the kids menu, WOW... a large selection with great portions to eat now, and lunch for tomorrow. 
The service was great, and I love the decor! Great place for a nice family dinner!

My first time here was on a somewhat windy Thursday. There were 3 groups of people ahead of us and the restaurant was just opening; it was 11 AM.

We were asked where we wanted to sit, and we said outside for who knows what reason since it was quite windy that day. Our meal was delicious. I don't know the names of the two breads they put on the table, but they were really good! 

I spent approximately $60 for two people, during lunch. This included a shared appetizer, beverages, and 2 orders from the lunch menu. I haven't tried the dinner service at this location.

June 10 was my first time at Brio as I was here for a family friend's high school graduation party. For my first time, it wasn't bad, but since there were so many of us in our group, it took a long time for our food and drinks to come out.
Though it was on a Saturday night, parking was decent and the restaurant wasn't really all that busy. Whether it's for another graduation party or a different event, I'll be back another day.

Updating my last review from three stars to five. After a rocky service on my birthday a few months back, my family and I decided to give Brio another go. The experience was just like the Brio I remember and used to frequent so often. Jessie the manager made sure to make everything right and went above and beyond to ensure we had a great experience. Our waiter was so friendly and funny which really made the experience that much better. Kudos to Brio for doing it right and for reassuring me that this is definitely my forever go to destination for weekly girls cocktail nights and business lunches. All of their food is amazing and I'm glad this was such a pleasurable experience. They have excellent misters so don't be shy about sitting on the patio to enjoy a nice dinner or app.

Came here with my boyfriend yesterday, our first time visiting. We ordered from the happy hour menu - and absolutely loved it! Food was great, drinks were great and the prices were surprisingly really well-priced. We also really loved the way it's decorated inside, beautiful atmosphere. Our server was excellent as well! Highly recommend this place!
Good food, good service, good atmosphere. 3 stars only because I don't consider Brio's fine dining, but never had a bad experience there. Good portions as well.

I had brunch at Brio in town center this morning for a baby shower. I was with a large party and they accommodated us well, with plenty seating available for our large party and even a side table for the gifts and baby shower games. Service was prompt, and the food came out quick enough and servers were knowledgable on the menu. The cocktails I had were delicious and the food was good, however I could not tell you my servers name because he never gave it. Overall everything was "good", not great.

We had reservations but arrived earlier and were immediately taken to our table. The server arrived and took our drink order. We decided to have cocktails since they looked appealing on their promotional menu. We ordered the Berry Cooler and the Berry Cosmo and my gosh, were they disgusting! They tasted like chilled cough syrup. I asked my husband to let me try his and it was actually worse! So definitely a thumbs down on those! We ordered the Pasta Alla Vodka with shrimp and the Salmon Strawberry Balsamic salad. These dishes were amazing, totally made up for the crappy drinks we ordered (which were still at our table not to be touched)

Overall it was a good experience, we'd definitely go back. We just won't be ordering any mixed drinks
Just had another great meal / great drinks sesh. Love this place always come back here.

This place is a ten out of ten. The outdoor seating is beautiful (fire pits, outdoor couch/chair arrangements, beautiful lighting) indoor looks like a palace. Service was above and beyond. We were treated like royalty. If you are in Town Square, this is an absolute must try.

Giving a five star review for the exceptional service we received from Jenna the manager and Mauricio who helped make things run smoothly. During Fathers Day we expected it to be busy and it was. The food tasted great and Jenna rescued the afternoon after several mishaps. So appreciated her helping us out and restoring the celebration.

Food was great.... service was horrible!  I've eaten at Brio many times and always love the place.

I went with my daughter yesterday for dinner. We were promptly seated by the host. We waited 10 mins for our waiter to come over. She took our order. We never got bread. Our drinks came timely. Got our appitizers timely. Main course took forever! And the waiter never came back! I sat there with no drink refill for 45 minutes. We literally never saw our waitress after she delivered our drinks (meals are brought by other staff). I had to ask another waiter for our check and he tell us "sorry I'm not your waiter". He gets our waiter and she brings the check over. I put my credit card in it and leave it on the table. 20 minutes go by and she still doesn't take it!!! Rediculous!

Did I leave a tip... yes I did... $0.01. That's right I left a 1 cent tip because that's all this waitress deserved!

Food tasted good and was presented very well, however, I am a Celiac and asked for gluten free. Didn't get it. Was sick immediately after leaving restaurant.
Jesse, the restaurant manager contacted me immediately. I'm sure she will make sure this doesn't happen again. I'll be going back for a gluten free experience.

Stopped here with some friends on a Friday evening. The waitress was attentive and friendly without being overbearing. We were seated immediately and water and bread were out for everyone right away while we perused the menus. I ordered a steak and a salad and both were very good and reasonably priced.

We noticed as we were leaving there was a cool outdoor patio with a fire going. Wish we would have stopped out there for a drink. Looked nice.

This is an excellent go-to spot for dinner after enjoying a night at TownSquare.   I have ate here with my wife and kids on multiple occasions without ever being disappointed.   

What we ordered on our most recent visit:

1) Shrimp Risotto with Lobster Tail - 
2) Lobster Bisque
3) Grilled Salmon off the kids' menu
4) Cheese Pizza off the kids' menu
5) Crab Cake as a added side

While some reviews will say the menu is hit-or-miss, you will be happy if you ordered any of the above items.  The lobster bisque was delicious with a good amount of actual lobster in the soup.  The complimentary bread initially served upon being seated was great for dipping into it. 

The shrimp risotto and lobster tail was excellent.  The lobster tail was mouth-watering and the cheesy risotto was bedded with a generous amount of great-sized shrimp.   My kids' loved their dishes and the crab cake, albeit on the small side, was very tasty and not expensive.

The ambience inside the restaurant is nice enough for a romantic date for two but also enjoyable for families or a group of friends.  On Tuesday's starting at 5pm until 9pm, live music is provided which elevates the entire dining experience.   Loud, but not loud enough where you can't make audible conversation at the table.

Our servers have always been well accommodating to our every need.   We have had no problems here.

I will add that on previous visits I've also had a good experience ordering the beef carpaccio, caprese salad, brio steak salad, as well as the chicken limone.   While others might have said  'hit or miss' I've come to note that their menu so far has been one giant bullseye.

Came here for lunch and had a breeze getting seated. 

I really like the fact that our server was knowledgeable of the wine list because I am one to appreciate a good bottle of wine. She suggested the White Oak Chardonnay and to my surprise, I fell in love with it. 

The slice steak bruschetta is a must try!! The steak and cheese complemented each other quite nicely if I may add. 

I ordered the chicken piccata which I felt like you could never go wrong with. It was mediocre. There wasn't flavor that really stood out for me. The salmon has a good amount of seasoning on it which enhanced the flavor of the fish. 

Last but not least, the dessert menu! The caramel mascarpone cheesecake won me over! It was simply to die for! 

I can honestly say that Brio did not disappoint! Kudos!

We had such a great experience there last night. Our server Jessica was very attentive and quite friendly.  Jessica made sure our glasses were never empty as well as checked up on us along with Jenna the entire time.  

My lobster and shrimp fettuccine was amazing, and the pasta was very fresh.  The sweet potato rosetteo was also amazing.  Finally, we couldn't have picked a better ending with the butterscotch pudding.

I have to say, this location is my favorite of all the Brios!

** YELP 100 CHALLENGE: 046/100 **

On our last Vegas trip, my boyfriend and I were in the plaza planning to watch Captain America: The Winter Soldier. We were starving, so we decided to look for somewhere to eat afterwards. Using my trusty Yelp app, I found that Brio Tuscan Grille was one of the highest rated restaurants in the plaza that was still open at that hour, so off we went!

The ambience and decor of Brio Tuscan Grille felt very classy and upscale. We weren't too dressed up, so we felt slightly out of place. However, our service remained top notch, and everyone was very nice, friendly, and attentive. Brio Tuscan Grille is a great place I'd recommend if you want a hearty Italian dinner. My boyfriend and I loved everything we ordered, which was the following:

-Roasted Garlic, Spinach, and Artichoke Dip: One of my favorite appetizers, so I usually always order this.. and Brio's is definitely one of my favorites I've had so far! The Parmesan flatbread they provide for dipping tasted so cheesy, crisp, and perfect. It was a good blend of flavors with the spinach dip, which was neither too salty or bland. Usually restaurants serve tortilla chips with spinach/artichoke dip, so I thought Brio's upgrade to parmesan flatbread was a very nice touch. Highly recommend!
- Lobster Bisque: Very creamy and filling. The lobster bisque I've had in the past had a stronger tomato, tangy taste. Brio's version is definitely more creamy and thick. While I liked it, it was probably too heavy to eat in conjunction with the spinach/artichoke dip.
- Pasta BRIO: I honestly don't remember this dish too well, since it's been months. However, we ordered this to share per recommendation of our server. I do remember the sauce being very savory and delicious, and I most likely enjoyed it. It's supposedly their signature dish, so I assume it's one of their more popular pastas.

Overall, I enjoyed my first dining experience at Brio Tuscan Grille. I usually don't like eating at Italian restaurants, because I'm never blown away by their dishes. However, Brio exceeded my expectations, and I highly recommend it to anyone in the area. If you're fan of spinach/artichoke dip, definitely order this as well!

I'm starting to get mixed feelings about this place.  I was first introduced to Brio a year ago when I was in Dallas.  Since then, when there is a Brio near where I'm going, I always make reservations.  

This is the 2nd time I went to Brio at this shopping center.  1st time was OK except when I ordered a glass of house Cabernet and have to ask 2 times and never got.  When I was charged, the waiter asked if I wanted to take my wine to go.  I thought really????  Wine to go???  I told the waiter to just cancel the wine and give me a new bill. 

My daughter and I ordered the following:

Glass house Malbec ($10): if they are going to serve a glass of wine, either serve it 1/2 the glass or serve it in smaller wine glasses.  See my picture, I got 1/4 glass.

Caesar salad ($5) - it didn't come with parmesan cheese.  who serves a Caesar salad with no parmesan cheese????  I had to ask for cheese twice. 

Campanelle Carbonara pasta ($20) - This is my all time favorite.  It comes with spinach, chicken and bacon.  I wanted to go vegetarian so I substituted the chicken and bacon with mushrooms. It was still really good. 

My daughter got the kids rigatoni with meat sauce ($7).  My daughter really liked it. 

I will definitely go back again but don't order wine and make sure that they put cheese on the Caesar salad.

This place has always had amazing service and food. We can only go when we're on vacation now because the last time we went we found that they have no phone service.  We have never had to use our phone until this time. When you're on call and the hospital calls, you can't be running around the building trying to get a connection. In case you need to though, head towards the Apple Store.

This is the go to place for my boyfriend and I when we want to have amazing food & look around townsquare. 



a month ago - I take off a star because the last time we were there we sat outside & had the worst service possible. We knew something was wrong when the hostess told the other hostess to sit us outside and she said, " uhh you sure him?" hah.The food was still amazing. Just the fact that it took them forever to bring us our wine at first & when we asked for the check ( From someone that wasn't our server, 'cause OUR server disappeared on us) it took longer as if we were waiting for more food!

We went to have brunch just this sunday and had a great time. I got the Eggs Oscar & he got the Chicken & Chorizo Benny. Add some coffee to the mix, Perfect. Server was awesome ( tall guy). 


All in all, we love this place & our last visit just solidifies why we always come back.

My family and I have been here twice so far and definitely more to come! This place is amazing, super friendly service, great prices and tasty food. Even their children options are great priced and large portions. Sign up for their app to receive free items.

I ate here on July 14. I had been wanting to try this place out forever. It took about 10 mins to seat us which was fine. It was just my son and I. My service was horrible through the entire meal. I'm surprised my server even showed up most of the time. My son ordered a cheeseburger that was charred and the bun was stale and crispy. I ordered a Caesar salad and the lobster with shrimp risotto. My salad never showed up and my risotto was still hard. The lobster was cooked perfectly. I will also add that my peach sangria was wonderful. Our deserts were pretty tasty. Overall I wouldn't go back.

Love this place!The decor is Tuscan and beautiful.Best lobster bisque ever!!!Warm and tasty bread basket accompanies the meal with delicious sourdough bread .Cant wait to get back here for happy hour soon.

Came here for a Sunday brunch. To begin, parking was obviously chaotic at the fun-filled Town Square. I parked far but enjoyed my stroll over to the restaurant. Once we got to the restaurant, we were asked to wait a few minutes to get our outside table ready. The restaurant is large and well-decorated. I loved the high ceilings and it could be the elder, classier sister of Cheesecake Factory. We asked to be seated outside and the waitress who walked us over was kind and let us pick the table we preferred. Our main waitress, Sophia, was on her third day at the job. She was kind, fun, and considerate. She was respectful and did her very best to provide suggestions and answer questions. The other waiters were very kind, too. The starter bread was awesome, especially the thin, crunchy triangular crackers. The food was good though it was a little cold and could have used more flavor. I got the Margherita flatbread while my friend got the Lasangna that came with a salad. Each of us paid roughly $15 for our meal. One thing I really liked about the restaurant was that the  menu had the calories written on it--helps a lot for the health-conscious people at an Italian restaurant! All in all, food was good but the experience is what would make us come back again. Fun place to do people-watching at, especially while sitting outside!

I love brio so much it hurts. I always have great service. Professional, friendly and attentive! 
My husband and I frequent here for dinner dates since it was the location of our first date when I realized I needed this hunk in my life. 
We've sat outside and inside and at the bar and liked all areas. all their pastas are to die for and my husband usually gets the salmon I believe. Or some sort of fish entire. He always loves it.  
And for. The amazing service and quality of food its such a great price. 
I'm usually not a fan of chain restaurants but I love me some brio!!

We ate here as part of a fixed-menu wedding reception dinner. 

Our servers were very attentive and we never had to wait long for one to come around. I had the Chicken Limone which came with mashed potatoes and roasted veggies (zucchini, carrots, broccoli). It was a MASSIVE portion. It was delightful. I had moscato to drink and as a non-wine person, also delightful. The appetizer was the parmesan flatbread with artichoke dip. It was yummy. The Caesar salad was on the sad side, but the rest of the meal made up for it. I have no idea if the cake we had was by Brio or if it was brought in, but it was also wonderful. 

If I was spending the day at the mall here, I would definitely stop by for dinner on my own dime.

It was our first time coming here for my sisters Birthday. The ambiance was great. The food was ok. The waitress was nice. My complain goes out to the Manager if I'm not mistaken her name was Ashley... from the moment we were seated til we left I observed her going to the surrounding tables greeting them asking how their food was and so forth ,new tables next to us were seated a couple of times and not once did she walk over to acknowledge us. Sounds petty but it left a bad impression being that it was our first time there. The waitress walked over to check on us and I said nicely " What's the managers name the woman who's been walking over to these tables next to us acknowledging every other table besides ours? Is it because everyone else that's here is Caucasian and we're not? " She said oh I'm sorry I'm sure that's not what it is, I know being minority it feels like a racial thing sometimes but I'm sure that's not what it is." I made it very clear that I never ever feel that way because I have a multi cultural family. She asked if I wanted her to address the issue and have her walk over and I refused it. I did not want her walking over to us just because I complained. 
As a manager your supposed to set an example for your staff and I think she did a poor job at that tonight. So thank you but no thank you we will not be coming back to your establish

Husband got sick after eating dinner about a month ago. Our daughter and friend went yesterday and the food was awful. I don't usually write bad reviews but this is now twice the food was bad. Service was good and atmosphere was good. Really wished food had been good too.

This place had some darn good food.  Ate here fir a friend's wedding rehearsal dinner and loved it.  The food was all amazing.  Great appetizers and meals portions are nice and large.  Drinks were good also and reasonable prices.

I had a great experience and would go here on dates regularly.

The unorganized front desk to check-in should have been a good indicator that the rest of the experience would be as bad as that was. Our waitress had to be hunted down by another waiter. During her first visit to our table we ordered drinks and our meals. 

The people that came in after us, and were  seated after us got there food 20 minutes before us. The waitress finally came by and joked about how long it was taking, yet offered no apologies. 

Now, I understand that it's a Sunday, and Valentine's Day, however a little more organization and consistency would have been nice.

This will be the last time I visit this restaurant due to the horrible experience. I do not recommend it to anyone anymore.

UPDATE: Someone from Brio replied to my review that they would message me. 6 days later, I'm still waiting for a message. They must be on the same schedule as the restaurant was that day.

Promise next time i will take a picture of the food.
Brio town square is my favorite location than the rampart one. half bar is inside the building half is "outside".
i Love their bar seating area where they offer a very nice Happy Hour deal from 3pm to 6:30pm monday to friday at the bar area only (at the bar or the 4 high tables by the bar or the couch facing the bar)
Love their sangria, white peach or red sangria. Robert handles the bar with his team and he is just Excellent at remembering what you like to drink! Is that bad when he sees you and already prepare your drink without asking?? 
They are so so busy at the bar, no matter what you always get a smile! 
Happy hour time I to order their beef carpaccio, capt√©es salad, artichoke dips, sliders
The lobster bisque and the steak salad are to die for!
The main restaurant is very elegant and cosy! I love the decoration. To avoid the wait, you can always book your table :)
Staff is friendly. Good address in town for good food and great service!

Love the Happy Hour.  It would be great to have a couple more low carb options. My group loves the burger and shrimp dishes. I wish they would have converted my burger from buns to lettuce wrap, but it came out with just the meat patty on the plate. It would have been great to substitute the chips for vegetables.  Oh well, still yummy.   

Came again for the Brio Steak Salad. One of the Best in town.
We were unhappy with one of the servers here and then moved to Abi's section. She was amazing and changed are whole night. Well be back to sit with abi again :)
The chicken under the brick is axing along with the eggplant and shrimp appetizer it's a must try
Nice place with ample outdoor seating. Food was delicious but service was a bit slow. Waitress kept blaming it on happy hour. Overall a good experience and the pork chops are amazing

Service is okay. We had reservations and were not seated for 30 minutes. Manager came to our table (16 in our party) and sincerely apologized. She sent us 6 appetizers. Nice recovery. Our server was good, not great. I had to ask twice for a refill, and he forgot my side of veggies. 

Quality of food is good. All hot and fresh. However, nothing special. Everyone in our party agreed food was good but not great.

Prices are too high. We don't mind paying high prices for great food, service, and experience. Brio did not quite make the grade.
Loved the food and ambiance. Only about $80 for a family of four w/wine, appetizers, entrees and dessert. Very reasonable. Will return next time we're in town!

This is one of my favorite spots in town. I love love this location . The bartender Jade maybe Jayde I don't know but she is the bomb! Her attitude is always upbeat and her service is amazing . She bartend, cocktail and runs our food. Everything comes out amazing and she never forgets anything. The food quality and presentation puts the icing on the cake. Superb!

Well I waited more than a month for a response from Brio's corporate before finally deciding to write this poor review. I really wanted to address this with Brio and not the rest of the world, but with no response whatsoever, here I go. I had brunch a month back, and ordered the eggs, home fries, and bacon. It says it comes with brioche toast on the menu. It does not. After addressing this with the waitress, the manager comes over. He stands there for a little while (very awkward) before finally asking what the issue was. Wasn't sure if he was waiting for me to say something first? Anyhow, he told me they don't have or have ever had brioche toast, and I asked him why the menu says they do? He says he doesn't print the menus and that corporate does. Wow!! I couldn't believe his answer! Maybe the correct answer should have been, "You know you're right, it must be a misprint, I should let corporate know." It's very deceptive to advertise brioche toast to people and then serve crappy white stale toast. I rarely bring up anything I am displeased with at a restaurant, but this was Brio's third strike with me. The last time it was a cold omelette that I didn't say anything about. I wanted to give Brio another chance since I have been going here since the opening, (and their eggplant shrimp appetizer is actually pretty amazing), but three strikes and you're out.

Brio Tuscan Grill located in Town Square on South Las Vegas Blvd.  Brio is an Italian restaurant with an American flare and a trendy atmosphere.  Noise levels can be a little loud when it's really busy because of the open air design. The bar area is small but acomadating with full menu.  They also have a large outdoor seating area with umbrellas and patio heaters to help keep the temperature just right during your dining experience.  They have a good happy hour and morning Sunday all you can drink mirmosas.  Good food, great wine good times!
Food is good. Menu is great for dinner but lacks around the lunch hour. Drinks are resonable and good. Order the calamari and the Caesar salad as a combo!

Came here with my wife to kill time while my kids played at the Gameworks right up the street for some small bites. We ordered the Bruschetta sampler which was good wish the steak was more tender. We also got the Brio chopped salad it was also good needed more veggies in my opinion but it was satisfactory. Now what I was most excited about was the prosciutto and Burrata pizza I wasn't disappointed it was good but after I got it immediately wanted the crust to be thinner maybe next time overall it turned out to be a nice time waster and the company was awesome. The staff are nice also they put us out of the way of the other people we also had our giant twin stroller so they do accommodate strollers even at lunch go figure.

Brio is one of my favorite restaurants in vegas my husband and I come here often however tonight I have some different feeling towards this place.   Our server seemed annoyed everytime we asked her for something,  we waited and waited for our apps to come out, one made it to the table one did not, everything took forever, our server disappeared for what seemed like hours,   very poor service tonight and I was not happy.  Get it together brio
4 of us went for a birthday celebration. Very attentive and food was good.
Kai was awesome.  We were outside alone in the chill by the fire and he picked up our table.  Fabulous!!!
Can't go wrong at this place. I highly recommend the pasta brio. Also during the week if you can get here on time the happy hour is amazing!

Cons: 1) in one of woman's cabin toilet didn't work light; 2) warmer outside didn't work eather; 3) tiramisu has too much cream; 4) there is a big line but outside and inside is plenty of free seats. 

Pros: 1) big and good food; 2) has a gluten free menu; 3) waitress is nice and welcoming.

A word of warning, this is not what most would consider authentic Italian, and I agree. It isn't. However, it's still tasty enough for me to enjoy and want to come back! Parking is a hassle since it's in the Town Center but just park in the lot about 3 blocks away and you're fine. Assuming you don't mind a bit of a walk in Vegas weather.

I had the Pasta Alla Vodka and it was tasty. It was ricotta filled with pieces of pancetta and a spicy tomato cream sauce. I do feel there could have been a bit more pancetta. The garlic was almost too absent to be considered a big contributor to the dish, which disappointed me because I'm a big garlic fan. 

They have some really interesting cocktails which unfortunately i wasn't able to sample since we were driving back after lunch. 

Decor is nice and dishes maybe be more than moderately priced. Came for lunch and it was about $16 plates. 

But I'll def be back

I have eaten here many times. The sourdough bread in the bread basket is outstanding!  I always get the lobster bisque, just so I can eat more bread. 

The chopped salad is my favorite!  Seems like it would be boring, but I love it. Lots of flavor!  The service can be pretty slow, but it's always very friendly. Since the restaurant is so busy, I kind of expect service to be slow. 

Originally, I was going to give them 4 stars. I bumped it to 5 because of how friendly and easy they were to work with. I had to deliver a wedding cake there. Many venues don't allow the cake to get there too early, but they let me deliver it early and they carefully stored it and presented it to the client.  It was 3 tiers. Outstanding business to business service!

Their light menu is fabulous. I had the salmon Fresca and the flavors were so delicious, especially the sweet potatoes and balsamic glaze. Loved the healthy options. Outdoor seating on a nice night is also great! Also recommend the peach sangria, sweet and refreshing.

Great service, outstanding flavors, variety, and huge wine selection!
You can stay as long as you like, there's never a rush to leave!
I love the patio when the weather is nice.
Great decor and very good food!  Service was very mediocre this past visit although the manager saved with a complimentary bisque.  The group we hosted loved the restaurant.

OOOOHHhh My GOOODdNesSSSSs!!! The moment you walk through the doors.. you just know this place is a winner. I am writing this review with a smile on my face because if you have ever tried Brio... you know why. First and foremost, the restaurant is beautifully constructed inside and out. HUGE outside patio with fireplaces and inside you'll find a very open area with high ceilings, flat screens, large booths, and busy friendly servers. I ordered the mushroom stuffed ravioli with brown butter (holy mother.. absolutely to die for!!!) appetizer, lobster bisque (creamy.. just the right consistency and flavor with lobster pieces on top served in a cute white porcelain bowl) and the Sausage Gnocchi (perfect with red bell peppers, browned red onions in creamy red bell pepper sauce.. just a hint of spice). I cannot believe there isn't a Brio here in So Cal!!! The menu is very simple: brunch, soups, salads, pizza, pasta, and bruschetta (perfect portions). I am so sure whatever you go with, you will not be disappointed. I plan on taking everyone I love, here for a scrumptious toothsome Italian meal! BEL CIBO!!!

Went here after i got married. We had 19 in our party and the servers were wonderful. All of us were really impressed. We even had a private room. Its a little expensive, but worth the extra dollars. My steak w/mashed potatoes and roasted veggies was around $30. The atmosphere is nice, its very laid back.  Thank god for the private room, we were able to stash away my very loud family of comedians!

Had a really nice lunch with a friend on the patio. All of the hostesses and our waitress were all very accommodating and friendly. I wasn't expecting them to be very friendly after reading some of the reviews but we actually received excellent service. We split the Quinoa Salad with Asparagus and Grilled Chicken. It was very good, filled with flavor and was just right for a light lunch.

I had the lobster bisque soup and carbonara pasta and it was very good! I came during lunch and it was not too busy.  The service was good, although I had to ask for a spoon for my soup.  Also they had a kids menu with activities but no crayons or pencils.  My experience was good overall and I am giving four stars simply because it was not a WOW experience.  I would definitely come back.

I've been to Brio twice. The first time I had a decent Caesar salad. It wasn't anything special but I know experience wise, Brio is one of the best and most popular places in Town Square. It's been more than a year until I heard about the happy hour. Their bar happy hour features $5 drinks and $3.99 items. I went with the chips and burger and for that price you can't go wrong!  They also have shrip, ravioli and another 5 or so items on the happy hour menu starting at 9PM. Ill definitely be back soon!
Excellent menu! Friendly staff and great environment. Would highly recommend.

Been going to Brio for over 6 years here and in NJ. Tonights service during happy hour at the bar with Phillip as our server was the worst EVER. We tip VERY WELL having worked in the industry. This is the second time we have had Phillip as our bartender, the next time we arrive and see him at the bar we will move onto California Pizza Kitchen or Claim Jumpers.

We have had both Jade and Roselle as our servers at the bar and they are both EXCELLENT. Phillip needs to take a few lessons from their playbook!!!

Pros: Delicious food, elegant atmosphere, good service.

Cons: Out of the last 4 times I have been here, I have found hair in my food 3 times. Gross. Lost my appetite entirely.

We have been to Brio at least a dozen times and after this last visit we will not be returning.  We had family in from out of town and we were telling them how great this place was....Well we are so embarrassed that we took them here.  The service was so terrible and the food was not much better.  We had a table of five, and it did not seem to be a very busy evening.  Every meal came except for one and we were told it would be right out.  Ten minutes later we asked about the meal and we were told that the kitchen made it wrong again...What?  We were not even told it was wrong once, only that it would arrive in a few minutes.  We decided to cancel the meal since everyone was waiting to start their dinner so that one person would not be eating alone. The waitress said "let me get the manager".  He came over and was a complete ass.  He said "what seems to be the problem?" So we told him our issue and his reply was " we are making it on the fly".  Well if he knew what the problem was why did he ask? And then when it came to the bill the waitress said "I wish you would have ordered dessert, it was on the house".  Nice to know it, after the fact!  Just a colossal mess.  Everyone makes mistakes, just let us know...Don't leave us hanging.

The go to place for entertaining guests. great for a meal with family and friends. The open space is very welcoming with tasteful furnishing. Far above-average fare for a chain, you get your money's worth in both food and atmosphere combined with wonderful service. The place fits well in the Town Square environment.
One of my favorite Italian spots in Henderson.  The food and ambience is amazing

Just wow, Brio, you blew my socks off!

Spinach and Artichoke Dip:
- Has a hearty, cheesy flavor
- Great for veggie-haters too, you can barely taste then
- Perfect chip-to-dip ratio
- enough for six adults

Gerber All-Natural Lemon Pepper Chicken:
- beautiful presentation
- not sure how to describe the vegetables, but the way they prepared it is a mix between fresh off the grill and also steamed (??). My point, veggies were delish!
- the skin in the chicken was crisp and crunchy 
- the meat on the chicken was moist, I didn't even need a knife
- not a huge mashed-potato fan but it's mixed with 'mystery' seasoning that revolutionized my thoughts on mashed-potatos

Our server was genuine and knowledgeable. I just can't give that fifth star because of the hostess though.. It was dinner time when we came in (6 adults and 2 kids) and she told us it was about an hour wait. Understandable. We were all tired and weren't about to walk to another restaurant though. Noticing a few empty booths, we asked to be seated there but she promptly told us it's only for parties of 6. They looked pretty spacious and the two kids are no more than 4. We said we didn't mind cramping together and she told us, 'She would need to ask because they don't set the tables for 8.' She seemed extremely annoyed at our request as if placing two more plates was such a huge hassle -.-

Good customer service is a big deal to me. Brio's got their food DOWN PAT, they just need to work on service and they'll be awesome!

$2.95 appetizers during Happy Hour

Great deal because the apps are d-lish!

My table ordered almost everything on the Happy Hour menu and we were thrilled with everything.  The shrimp-tini was light and tasty.  The mozzarella and roasted red peppers bruschettta was not light... but it certainly was tasty.  

You can easily make a whole meal out of the Happy Hour menu for less than $10.

The downside... HH ends at 6:30pm.

I'm not usually a fan of the chain restaurants but this one I love. The ambiance is chill and the food and drinks are consistent. 

We sat on the patio and it was a beautiful night to do so. Enjoyed some drinks, appetizers, desserts and coffee. One of my favorite go to dish here is the Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant appetizer. It's all about that sauce. This dish never disappoints and I usually always get this when I visit Brio. No, seriously!!! A few other favorites I have had before (but not on this particular visit) include Beef Carpaccio, Lobster Bisque, Bistecca Insalata, Roasted Whole Chicken. 

On this visit, we had the Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant, Bruschetta Sampler, Pasta Alla Vodka, Torta di Cioccata, and Creme Br√ªl√©e. Everything was good! Our server Jason was very good. Friendly, informative and attentive. We'll be back!

I also had a Cucumber Basil Gimlet which may be one of my new favorite cocktails. Hendrick's Gin, fresh basil, crushed cucumber, Angostura bitters, fresh lemon and lime, on the rocks. Refreshing and light drink.
Brio has one of the best happy hours in town. Awesome spicy shrimp, chicken nachos and tomato mozzarella salad. Great food and all great big portions even for happy hour.

I love the food here.  It's fun, it's carbs, and it's yummy.  If you're looking for some good food in Town Square that isn't the typical stops, try this place.  Great decor, great service and a tasty menu.

One of the best happy hours in Las Vegas! And if you don't agree, please message me and let me know which place has a better happy hour! This review is for their happy hour only since we didn't look at their regular menu. Happy hour is from 3:30-6:30 and I believe they have a late night happy hour as well but I could be wrong... so call and double check. 

If you park in the structure near Staples, you can walk through Inglots to Brio. I wasn't expecting such a fancy place but it was! Bar is self seating and they had some couches and benches on one side, and a covered patio on the outside along with a wrap around bar. Service was a bit slow in terms of getting drinks out but our server, Danielle was sweet and checked on us often. 

Brio's sangrias are on the sweet side, but they are definitely tasty! I ordered the white peach sangrias while my gfs ordered the sangria rosa. The white peach sangria was a bit sweeter than the sangria rosa. Brio also offers $5 martini wednesdays and $5 wine thursdays! The martinis that they offer include the classics but also some interesting specialty ones as well. I'll have to come back on a Wednesday to check it out!

We ordered 3 beef carpaccio (yes, it was THAT good). I wasn't too fond of the parmesan flatbread... which was more of like a chip to me. The field greens salad was lightly tossed with a dressing which worked very well with the beef carpaccio. 

2/5 Sausage and pepperoni flatbread: the flatbread was a bit TOO crispy IMO. I think they might have slightly overbaked it. There wasn't enough ricotta on there, but the pieces that did have ricotta were delicious. 

3/5: Brio burger: the brio burger is one burger, cut into 4 pieces with their homemade chips on top. I didn't care much for the chips and neither did my friends. I thought it was too salty. We ordered the burger to be cooked medium, but it came out to be medium well, which wasn't a big deal. The meat was juicy and the bun reminded me of a hawaiian roll. 

4/5: Black peppered shrimp: My friends LOVED the sauce that came with this dish. I thought it was a bit spicy (just a kick) but enjoyed the eggplant. There were about 9 pieces of shrimp in the dish. The shrimp was small, but nicely presented and for the price, it wasn't too bad. My friends ended up dipping the burger into the left over sauce. 

We were all stuffed at the end of our meal and the bill for everything, including 2 white peach sangrias and 5 sangria rosas was about $70. Not bad at all! Brio is our new happy hour spot and we can't wait to come back.

A bit disappointed... not what it used to be. Seemed very much like Macaroni Grill. Plus the men's room was filthy. They must've run out of paper towels, so the threw a package of paper napkins in the towel holder.  Plastic still around the napkins. Brussel sprouts were virtually raw.. green beans way too saltly. Pasta over cooked. Steak prepared raw, when i asked for medium. Cockroaches outside (i know, but still a big turn off when you know they're walking around by your feet and the sandaled feet of lived ones). This is the second time there in 2 months where the experience was subpar. Bloody Mary's are better on airplanes. Bartenders act like they are doing you a favor by serving you a lousy drink.
One of the best happy hours in Vegas. Food and drinks were great and the service at the bar was no different.
Great happy hour if you can get a seat. Come early, but don't expect a spot if you show up after 530PM. Decent entree's, but overpriced in my opinion.

Two friends and I just got back from Brio at Town Square.   This was one of the better Italian meals I've had in a long time.   

The atmosphere is comfortable, nice bar area, outdoor patio seating makes this a very nice place for dinner.

One friend had the Lobster Ravioli and we both thought they were excellent, She didn't leave one bit.  Darn it!   (We always taste each others dinner.)

The other friend had the Mediterranean Penne, she loved it.  I thought it was pretty good.

I had the Chicken Limone which I love as Chicken Piccata when I make it at home.  This one was awesome.  Two large, very tender chicken breasts in a creamy butter/lemon sauce.   Sides of crispy potatoes and roasted veggis made this a truly wonderful choice.

The Caesar salad we ordered, (mine with very good anchovies) were a little on the dry side but very good flavor.  The romaine lettuce very fresh.

My Cosmopolitan  was perfect as was the others' Fruitini.  A fruit flavored martini.  

Service was good, except our waitrees forgot to bring me extra lemon for my chicken.   Not a big deal.  The place was full - unusual for a Tuesday evening and she was very busy. 


Valet parking is available if you can't find a spot on the street.  This is one we will definitely return to soon.
Italian Moscow Mule is amazing here, so is the lobster bisque and. Everything else on the menu. Definitely a must if in Town Square

I hosted my sister's bridal shower here and they were absolutely fantastic to work with especially considering I am located in Los Angeles and not familiar with the area, they were very considerate of working with me in order to make this a fantastic day for my sis.

They have two private rooms for private parties that are very nice and elegant.  Since our group was smaller in size, we opted for the public outdoor patio which was very nice.  They also let us bring in our own desserts to celebrate her.

Our food was great which included an aritchoke dip appetizer and then I had their Citrus Green Salad which was really flavorful.

The service was excellent.  Crystal was our catering coordinator who was great to work with leading up to the event.  Michael, the manager, was also super friendly.  Our day-of server (I can't remember his name sadly) was also great to us and very patient allowing us to occupy the table for a long time.  

Would definitely go back there the next time I am in the Vegas/Henderson area.

When the stars make you drool
just like a pasta fazool, that's amore!..


try their pork chops, freakin awesome!
Love love love this place! Its a very fancy place but casual at the same time. Food was amazing. My steak was cooked perfect and my sangria was deeeelish! Cant wait to go back

We came here 1/1/09 right after viewing a traditional New Year's Day movie next door @ Rave Movie Theatre.  Since it was 10pm, it wasn't crowded at all.  I picked up a card right at  the entrance to the restaurant for a free appetizer with purchase of an entree (score!).  We ordered the fabulous mussels (usu $11.50) that came in a bacon cream sauce.  The entrees were delish but my dining partner didn't like the lasagne due to the fact that it did come in a cream sauce but I thought it was great because it wasn't thick & lasagne noodle-y.  My veal milanese classico was tasty & is lemony with (in a good way).  Our waiter, Allen, was fine, not weird as was mentioned in previous reviews but forgot to fill our water & ice tea.  Pretty decor, plentiful food, had a lot of leftovers for the next day so all in all would definitely return but I'll also ask my Italian colleague what she thinks
Delicious food! Have been a regular for years and the food keeps you coming back. It is also one of the best happy hours in Vegas!

Amazing! Located at town square on LVB. 

I've only had them for delivery but still was happy most of the time. Few times was delivered late (not the restaurants fault and that was addressed)but was still good luke warm. 

I don't care for lobster that much but love the lobster bisque! 
Loved several of the pastas. 
Chicken meal and others all impressive and flavorful. 

Give them a try! Enjoy!

Came here with my mother late night and was surprised to see that it was quite readily available and busy enough to enjoy on a weekday. 
Loved my wait staff: chef accidentally placed chicken in my salad, and my waiter caught it just as it hit my table. Super awesome. 
Ambiance: beautiful outdoor patio with mist so you don't get too hot. Trendy/casual vibe. The tables are really big and round so it's nice for conversations and food sharing with groups. 
Food: got the pesto pasta with salmon. Super good! Love how you can make your own pasta. Just wish there were a few more flatbread options.

Happy Hour Heaven. Br√≠os happy hour is wonderful but be prepared to wait a while. It's always packed because it's always good. I came here with some friends and we ordered the red sangria which I thought was delicious but my friends said it was too bitter. I think to each their own. They preferred the white sangria. 
We started off with the tomato and mozzarella salad, the beef carpaccio and the black pepper shrimp! Everything was delicious of all three my favorite was the shrimp. 
Next we ordered the dessert trio and a dessert. I have no idea what we were thinking, I guess we were hungry at this point the alcohol had set in and our server convinced us. The trio had mascarpone,creme br√ªl√©e,and a strawberry short cake mason jar. We also ordered the brownie sundae. Delicious! My favorite was the mascarpone. All together our check was less than 50. What a steal. Definitely coming back!
menu has nice variety for those who like to eat heart healthy. Happy selections are tasty.  Friendly staff and very professional.  Worth a visit...

Long story short:

The food was pretty good: 4 out of 5
The ambience/atmosphere: 5 out of 5
The service: 2 out of 5

Based off the reviews I'm reading from this place, the service is pretty mixed. You'll either get an attentive waiter who'll fulfill your needs or have someone who seems like they'd rather be at home than waiting tables. You can tell which type of waiter I got.

With that said, I'd come back though. The food is pretty amazing, but like I said, the service varies here.

My Four Stars is for the bar area and Happy Hour Only which is from 330-6pm & 9pm-close . 

I would of given it a five but place was pretty packed and seating is limited cause they closed the patio area due to it being a bit cold outside. Went here with my mom and brother . We ordered 5 drinks and 4 appetizers which totaled about $56. Not too bad. The appetizers were really really tasty and the portions were decent. Service was pretty good as well ESP for it being happy hour. I would def check this place out again for another happy hour and maybe even dinner .

Not worth the money, I have made better pasta myself. We went last night and 3 of the 4 of us didn't like the food whatsoever, the other person wouldn't pay that price again for the small amount they received.

This is my 3rd time coming to Brio since it's opened and unfortunately I'm never really happy with my experience. I always try to give it another try but my experience is usually the same. The servers are not very friendly almost feel like they get annoyed if you ask for something. I got the chicken limone didn't care for it much. I'm so picky about Italian food... I really wish restaurants would focus on seasoning. My food was pretty bland. My mom got the pasta pesto also very bland.  I wasn't really impressed with the Calamari either. The presentation was wonderful but the food itself was not. It's a beautiful restaurant....Maybe for cocktails but not to dine.

Went were walking by and decided to stop I got a few drinks. We had the sangria and it was amazing, if you're in town square and need a refresher on the weekend I'd suggestion stopping by. It's only 8$ per drink and it's well worth it.
Thanks for a great evening and wonderful service by Jess! Food was great, and I loved the suggestions! Definitely will be back

Had a reservation for 5 for 6:30 pm.  We arrived and within 5 min were seated.
