It was Friday night and it was totally packed and about 50 people hanging in the foyer and out the front door waiting for seating.  The noise level was UNBEARABLE.  I could not hear my husband talking to me and he was right next to me.  The people at the next table were trying to talk but had to yell and they did...non stop...as were everyone in the restaurant.  We were waiting for our other guests but could not take it anymore and gave up our table, called our guests who were just getting out of their car and told them to meet us at Twin Creek that this place was not acceptable to a social evening.  What a shame...it is so beautiful inside.  We have only dined for Brunch outside in their really nice patio...and for that experience I would give it 5 stars...but definitely not the place for a social Friday night .....at least inside the restaurant...outside it was pouring rain, so not an option.

I never realized how good the service in Vegas was until I moved out. Aside from the good food, the place itself is beautiful and the waitresses and waiters I've had have always been kind and knowledgeable. I will definitely miss this place :')

Okay, I wised up and had a Bellini, the beautiful Italian cocktail combining peaches and Proseco (sparkling white wine).  It was smooth as silk, icy cold and slid down my throat.   I had just had the pleasure of the drink at Harry's Bar and the Four Seasons in Florence, so the Bellini had some tough competition, but withstood the test!

We chose the scrumptious and spicy shrimp and egglant, the shrimptini, and punctuated it with the sliders, which turned out to be one big burger cut in quarters.
We preferred the steak bruschetta, but enjoyed the happy hour fun before our golf lesson across the street!

Funny waitress, and a great table in the shade near the bar!
I love this place ... It never disappoint .. The food always delicious and the Sirvece is really nice and the atmosphere just amazing
Excellent Italian Food!  I've been a few times and the Happy Hour is the way to go for value!  In a nice/new shopping center Town Center Mall.

First time coming here and probably last... the moment we got there no host was in the front to sit us as I had to go walk to the bar to tell someone to sit my daughter and I. Finally we got seated and began to look at the menu, dinner time. My daughter was set on the shrimp and lobster fettuccini. Took me awhile to have my mind set as the menu choice was great. Many things to pick from. I ended up getting the beef short ribs. Quite a wait must I say. Very upset too our server was just rude (wish I got the name). I kept looking around and saw there was bread at the tables with people eating and we did not get any so I figured it wasn't complimentary. We got our food after a wait and my daughter politely asked our server if the bread was complimentary and why we didn't get any and she straight up goes, "it is but you should've asked earlier, your meals already here." I had to bite my tongue as I know my daughter didn't want to cause a scene. My short ribs were dry right off the spot. And I expected a thicker meat. I look over to my daughters and it looks great! But where was the shrimp and lobster?! It was just sauce, pasta, and tomatoes etc. she loves seafood too so she was pretty bummed out. We both just ate it as we were about to spend money on this meal we could've made at home. 

I wanted to get her dessert because she's been with her mother a couple days so I just wanted to make the dinner better but the "warm chocolate cake" wasn't even warm. We were over it already. Slow seating, rude sever, and disappointing food. Would I go back to try it again? Possibly. But this whole experience was just sad.

Writing this as I am sitting at the table waiting for the waiter to come back, it's been over 15 mins and our server is no where to be found. The food was very good, but the service was lacking. I could understand if the restaurant was really busy, but it's almost closing time and there are only 3 total tables seated right now. If I could split the rating for service and food separately I would give them a 5 for the food, and a 2 for service. I've come here many times, and always had great service, but tonight is definitely is far from it.

3.5/5. Stopped in before a movie for a few drinks and appetizers today (Sunday afternoon). It was pricy, but we knew that in advance. I might have given five stars, but we listened to several female bartenders complain over... and over... and over again about what a bad day they had at work. We get it- it was busy. Please be more mindful of what your patrons are listening to. The side of the bar we were on was empty- there certainly wasn't a wait for the restaurant. It was a bummer to listen to them complain. They were VERY nice to us- food was amazing- the mood was just a bummer. We'll think twice before coming back with so many other nearby options. No weekend happy hour.
The best food I have EVER eaten!  My mouth danced the whole time.  Beautiful and unique admosphete and exceptional service. Ahhhhhhhh!
Delicious! Pesto pasta, shrimp Alfredo, spinach dip by the fire. The atmosphere is very mood setting with dim lights and decent music. Price is reasonable. Loved it!

I had heard good things about this place and was really excited to try it but my experience was awful. I never write negative reviews but this was exceptionally terrible. The waitress acted like she was bothered serving us, she almost stabbed my mother (slid a sharp knife across the table instead of handing it) and didn't bring us silverware after we asked several times (not sure why it wasn't already on the table). Anyway the food was mediocre at best, I've had better Italian food at Olive Garden. I had a Caesar salad, but I tried the chicken and penne ala vodka. My chicken was burnt and the others were just ok. Aside from a hair in the food and sticky silverware. Will not visit again.

Oh Brio, I wish I met your happy hour sooner. 

For your dining pleasure (during M-F, 3 to 7 & M-Th 9 to close), TUSCAN TASTERS FOR 2.95! Woop woop! Good quality food for such a little price. 

The service was great despite the fact that the server was by herself (or so I overheard). Sarah was her name. She managed to keep a smile on her face and was very polite.

The best plate from my happy hour was the Spicy shrimp and eggplant. The crusted eggplant had a sligh crunch and paired nicely with the black pepper cream sauce. However, the shrimp tasted spicier than the eggplant for some reason. 

The Brio Burger was decent.. Go for the other tasters instead. 

I also enjoyed the sliced steak bruschetta. The tender pieces of steak were topped with yummy gorgonzola.

I wish there was drink specials on the menu... ::sad face::

The seating area in the bar was very nice. There was two lounge areas complete with a love seat and arm chairs. Luckily, I got there in time to bag one!

The mini desserts looked so good but I choose just one. The vanilla creme brulee. The strawberries tasted so well with the vanilla custard. I which I ordered three of them! One was simply not enough!!

Brio! I've never been to Italy but I think you just gave me a small taste of it!

It was good, but not good enough to justify the prices. I will admit that the service didn't seem like a franchise place, it felt more intimate and welcoming and the setting is nice. The price to food quality ratio was a little off though.

My friend and I came in for brunch for our birthday month brunch celebration.  We went in around 3 pm on a Sunday and the wait was only 10 minutes.  (Just a little side info: the pager that they give you to tell you that your table is ready will work across the way at Victoria Secret!)  Once we sat down, we were greeted by our server who immediately asked what we wanted for drinks.  Although it wasn't listed on the menu, they offer a carafe of mimosas.  When we asked the server about it, she wasn't sure if they do that and had to go and check if that was possible.  The server returned saying that it was possible and she told us that it would be $18.  We felt like that was a better deal amongst the 2 of us.  One glass of mimosa was already $6.  The carafe ended up being 2 and a half glasses each! 

I ordered the open faced chicken avocado omelet and my friend ordered the ravioli di bello. Since we came for brunch, I decided on a brunch dish, but was also interested in the ravioli.  My friend beat me to it!  While we were waiting for the food, bread and butter was brought out to the table. The food itself was delish although I wished that I had gotten the ravioli di bello! The flavors in that was amaze! It made my chicken avocado omelet seem a bit bland.

The food is good but the service was not good at all. Our server was annoyed most of the questions we had. Believe me I get it.....it can be annoying but we literally asked 4 questions, maybe 1 too many for her. (I wish I could remember her name) 
I asked about the raspberry mojito and told her I didn't want it that strong if they can please put extra raspberries. She looked at me like I asked her for her social security number. Lol
My drink was beyond strong. Of course she didn't make it so it wasn't her fault but I asked if she can have them put a little more of the raspberry syrup in it. She said "it's not syrup it's fresh actual raspberries" (with attitude) woah! Okay then we'll can you ask them to not make it strong please. 
She charged me for 2 drinks. By the end of the night I was exhausted talking to her and we paid the bill and left. 
I don't know if I would go back.
Good food and service. Not the best, but a lot better then Olive Garden or Macaroni Grille.

Brio is amazing.  I've never had a bad entr√©e or a bad experience.  This is across a couple of locations and a good stretch of time.  

Love coming here for lunch, business or personal.  The strawberry chicken balsamic salad... wow.  Maybe my favorite salad ever.  That being said everything is good.  Try the salmon,  try the gorgonzola crusted beef medallions.  It's all good. 

Bottom line, come here, eat well and have some vino.

This is as good as it gets for Happy Hour. I am only rating Happy Hour. Brio, Monday to Thursday, 9pm to close at the bar, $2.95 per Tuscan Taster, which are supposed to be appetizers but are the size of entrees. $5 Martini Thursdays can apply to the Tuscan Taster Happy Hour special, and if it's not Thursday, but you have a card to show that you're in the food and beverage industry, you can get $5 martinis even if it's not Thursday. 

They used to have the Steak Bruschetta, but they took that off the menu and replaced it with the Mozzarella Red Pepper Bruschetta with Arugula. Anyway, to the food.

Brio Burger: ordered this at medium, came with crisp chips and a nice plain brioche bun. The meat was delicious and fresh. The chips were really crispy. Dip this in the tomato sauce of the

Ravioli Caprese: 3 pieces of ravioli, circular, with cheese topped with basil and tomatoes. 

Beef Carpaccio: paper-thin slices of raw beef (about 6) with a little aioli, capers, some leafy greens, and a pizza-shaped slice of crisp flatbread. Everything was fresh and tasted great.

Sausage and Pepperoni Flatbread: Crisp flatbread baked in a wood-fire oven comes topped with bits of sausage and pepperoni cut into four triangles.

Food deserves 4 stars. Service from Nicole M. deserves 5 stars as we only had happy hour items and raspberry iced tea, but she still treated us like any other guest, and ambience and happy hour menu deserve 5 stars. I have been to Brio Tuscan Grille about 5 times for their night time happy hour.

Give this place a shot if you haven't tried it yet for happy hour. You'll be surprised - pleasantly while enjoying the view of the Colosseum and the background Italian music that so dearly reminds me of Firenze, Italia.

I have now gone to Brio several times and my experience is always the same, GREAT!! The ambiance is sophisticated but laid back. I had a party of 3 and we were offered the outside patio or inside for seating with little wait. The menu can be a little intimidating but our waiters have always been very helpful. You receive warm bread that's freshly baked. Their lasagna was super rich but you could definitely taste all the cheeses and meat. The Filetto Di Manzo Toscano steak is always cooked perfectly! I have never had a steak cooked and done so well! We also asked for the grilled salmon which was just as delicious. All the plates came warm and in big portions. I recommend the peach sangria! You can't go wrong with any of their dishes. Fabulous work their chef is doing!

My boyfriend and I love coming to Brio whenever we're in Vegas. The food is delicious, the service is efficient and friendly, and the ambiance is very classy. The last time we ate at Brio for lunch, we were starving so we ordered an appetizer, entree, and dessert. 

Steak Bruschetta - The bread and arugula tasted so fresh and the steak had great seasoning. I definitely recommend ordering this for your appetizer! 

Pasta Carbonara - My boyfriend loves ordering carbonara whenever we go out for Italian food and has ordered it from Brio in the past. However, the carbonara during this visit was very bland and tasted like it needed more seasoning. 

Pasta Alla Vodka - Delicious! The creamy marinara sauce was very flavorful and the ricotta filled ravioli were so good. I'm definitely going to be ordering this next time.

Chocolate Molten Lava Cake - One of the best lava cakes we've ever had. The caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream paired perfectly with the rich chocolate lava cake. We scarfed down the dessert within minutes. 

Overall, Brio is an excellent Italian restaurant and the quality of the food and service is always up to par.

If this review was solely based on the happy hour it would be a solid 5 star . So if your like me and you hunt for the best happy hours out there this is definitely one of the best ! They have huge portions and the food deals are $4,$5 & $6 . 

I like the beef carpaccio $4, black pepper shrimp $6, caprese salad $5 and the eggplant fries $4. They also have good deals for the drinks . But keep in mind that happy hour is available only in the bar area ! It's from 3:30-6:30 Monday - Friday . 

I've eaten here non happy hour a few times , and it was okay , it's a totally different experience in my opinion. I had the risotto and it was okay portions were good but it did not wow me . 

The main area is really pretty and they have outdoor seating as well so you can people watch if that's your thing . For hot days , they also have mists to keep their patrons cool on their patio. 

I love you brio !

I've been here over 6 times and the food is about the same as the Cheesecake factory. Lunch time is a good time to come because the salads are cheap and the carpaccio is a good portion.

Fish dishes for dinner are quite good. I've tried several and none have been overcooked. That's good for consistency.

There's nothing special about the wine list but the choices are alright. The great thing about this place is the outside seating.

Brio has fantastic food. It's great for brunch, lunch, dinner, bday dinner, etc. 9/10, we get great service. Love their happy hour. Love their bread and cocktails. Outside seating is awesome when the weather is nice and they even have an outdoor bar.
Excellent!  Service was great, food was delicious.  We highly recommend the pork chop it's huge and juicy. The Alfredo was perfect!

It just keeps getting better. The Sweet Potato Risotto is amazing, and so is the Tournedos Di Manzo. I have yet to have desert still... I really need to get on that.

I've decided the Town Square location is much nicer than the Tivoli Village one- although the service at Tivoli seemed slightly better.

I've come here many times and have always had a great experience. However this time was a bit different. We ordered our food from the server in a timely manner and waited for the food to arrive. When it did one of the items was incorrect and I pointed this out to the service staff but was told no this is the item you ordered. After checking the menu it clearly was not. That was quite frustrating. No one checked back to be sure we were enjoying our food. When we were done eating we asked for some to go boxes. The server brought two boxes but nothing for the pizza. We waited 20 mins for the server to come back. We asked him for another box and the check. We proceeded to wait another ten mins before we were paid out and ready to leave. Very slow service and frustrated with incorrect items ordered.
Awesome place for lunch. Very nice atmosphere and love the patio area.  Highly recommend.

Great manager, Marlin, great server, Jennifer.  Pasta and other dishes were excellent,  2 night in a row. Will definitely come back.  High recommendations!!! Beef carpaccio excellent,  great pasta  and veal milanese!
This place is very nice inside. Fancy. The food was good but I wouldn't rate it more than 3 stars. They do have a pretty nice presentation though

Spontaneity kicked in.¬† I'm here; I'm hungry!¬† Feed me, BRIO!!!¬† Take me on a mental escape to Tuscany! Okay too quick...¬† What happened to my food?!¬† 

I ate it.

I'll have to return for another escape.¬† Signed up for their loyalty card.¬† We shall see what perks are upon me in the future.¬† Though I found it odd the form asks to write down our password access to sign up for it.¬† Fine.¬† Make it kooky.

Stacy, the waitress attending to my table, is super sweet and smiley.¬† I hope you get her as your waitress.¬† Was polite and checked on me enough; not overdone.¬† Even looked cautious about asking cuz I was on my phone... Yelping ppptthh :P

I enjoyed my short rib & white cheddar open faced sandwich.¬† Challenge was not being able to eat it like a regular sandwich nor like a pizza.¬† Made use of the interesting fork and knife.¬† Plus it's cleaner for the face.¬† I didn't want 'BBQ stick face'.

Really nice interior decor and high ceilings.¬† Booths are pretty spacious.¬† Bar area was quiet for a Saturday, but loungy.¬† It'd be nice to hold a small party here.¬† Patio seating has umbrellas and palm trees.¬† An enjoyable space.

Now if Italian music were playing instead, that might make it feel more like another country ;)

While I do frequent Brio, it truly is hit or miss.  Typically the service is always great but this past week it wasn't even busy and the service was awful to say the least.  

Brio is the perfect spot for a date, celebration, or just a good meal.  They have reasonable prices and the food is always good.  

I typically always get the sliced steak salad.  It's delicious.  I have gotten the lobster bisque a few times and it's overly salty and doesn't have almost any lobster meat in it.  

My friends have gotten several different dishes and always enjoy them.  This past time we had the beef carpaccio which is presented very nicely but it's definitely not the best I've ever had.  

A huge plus to me is Brio's loyalty program.  Almost every time I dine here I have a $10 off on my card which is great!  If you don't bring your card they can easily look it up with your phone number as well!  How convenient!

While i'll definitely be back I think they have a few things to improve their overall customer experience.
Absolutely fantastic food and service!  Only a few minutes away from the strip.  What a great value!

We had a 15 minute wait and I only had 10% of battery left on my iPhone.  The reception counter uses two iPads for reservations and one of the cords was not being used.  I plugged my iPhone in and was going to let it charge.  Nobody noticed and it wasn't even visible, but I felt that I should just mention it to the receptionist.  

She said that I could NOT charge my phone there.  I asked why, and she said that she didn't know whether my phone had any viruses.  I asked how my phone could infect their system thru a charger adaptor?!  She had no answer but said no.  Wtf?!?  I've never had a bar or restaurant refuse to charge my phone.

The food was good as it usually is.  Started with calamari and steak carpaccio.  Entrees of veal milanese, pasta brio, pizza, mac & cheese... All tasty.  

Service was good from our server but they don't have bussers or other servers touching tables.  It took forever to get plates cleared off our table.   We had our empty app plates stacked on top of each other until the end of our meal.  Plus it took forever to get refill on drinks and order more cocktails.
Service sucked!! Food is salty and the price is expensive. The three main category of a restaurant! Just did not do it for me. Will not come back ever!!

Located in Town Square which is a ways off from the strip but since we were a big party and had kids with us this was what we were looking for.  There's patio seating with mist for the hot Vegas weather although we chose the air condition inside.    Made our reservations on open table for a large party of 17 for my mom's birthday.   We were seated earlier than our reservation and Heather our server was very attentive from the moment we sat down.  

Everything we ordered was amazing from the rib eye steak with a lobster tail on the side, shrimp risotto with a lobster tail, braised short rib, shrimp and lobster fettuccine.   The mac and cheese on the kids menu was not your normal kids Mac and cheese and actually tasted like pasta.  It was a portion for an adult or even three kids!   

Now for dessert, order the caramel marscapone cheesecake.  We ordered the creme br√ªl√©e, tiramisu, chocolate torte di chocolate but the cheesecake was my favorite.  

It was my mom's birthday and they even gave her a birthday card.  Very nice touch to already great food and great service.

Went there for lunch today.  Had a soup and salad,  excellent.   But I have to say our waiter was probably the best I have ever had in any restaurant.   I mean ever.   He was probably 30 or so,  but he was phenomenal in all aspects of serving.   Kudos to Brio,  great hire!!!   It is so nice when the food great and the wait staff if equally as great.   Totally enjoyable lunch.

I visited Brio for about the 5th time the other day. Once again, a delightful and satisfying dining experience. Whether you're in the mood for a hearty Italian dinner or something light and fresh, Brio does not disappoint! 

The menu was slightly different the last time we went. We had the roasted red pepper bruschetta. The balsamic glaze is amazing. I had the grilled salmon fresca. It was definitely fresh and extremely delicious!

I was in Las Vegas for the first time.  A friend took us to lunch at Brio, and since I'd been looking forward to meeting her there the entire trip, and the experience was awesome, they could have served Peanut Butter and Jelly, and I'd probably rave about it.

But Brio serves much better food than that.

The setting is cute, very tall ceilings, Mediterranean style, chic.  The service was friendly and attentive.  The menu had enough of a variety that I had a hard time making up my mind.   Well, that and we gabbed away for 20 minutes before even looking at the menus!

We shared the Brushcetta Sampler and Lobster Bisque appetizers.  (I can't resist Lobster Bisque)  Brio's version was rich and creamy, with good lobster flavor.  I do like more large chunks of lobster meat in my bisque, though.  The bruschetta was a total winner.  There were 4 different types, which our server described as she set down the platter.  I loved the BLT bruschetta.  There was also a Roasted Pepper, and a Beef and Arugula.  They were all fabulous.

Our entrees were:  A chicken and veggie pasta in a light cream sauce (Friend), a Chicken and Applewood Bacon Panini (the Boy), and Scallops with Arugula, Roasted Tomatoes, and Lemon sauce (Me).

Could we be any different?  And yet, each entree was great.  The Scallops weren't overcooked.  (BIG Plus)  The pasta was huge, and the cream sauce wasn't cloying and heavy, and the Boy's panini was crusty, savory goodness.

We shared their dessert sampler (Photo) consisting of miniature cups of selected samples.  Tiramisu, Raspberry Cheesecake, Brownie Sundae, Blackberry Rhubarb Compote, and Apple Caramel Ala Mode.  HOLY YUM!!  (Tiramisu was rated the Best, followed in my opinion by the Blackberry Rhubarb Compote.)

The experience was awesome, the company was fabulous, and the food was great.  I can't wait to visit the one we've got at HOME!  In Denver!   I'm so excited!

At Brios grille tonight with my wife and girls. Our server Jessica is great very friendly and quick with the order and did not push us. My meals lately have been ask the server to surprise me just nothing to spicy. She did a great job tonight plus it had bacon. The sauce was silk smooth with good flavor a vodka sauce with stuffed ricotta. The three other meals were good and big servings. We sat outside since they have the misters. Inside has great A/C and ambience was inviting but a lot of people so a little loud. Plus tiramisu was great.

The dining room at Brio is warm, casual, and comfortable.  Service is quick and friendly.  Our party sampled several dishes:
Pasta Brio - very good and perfectly al dente
Lasagna - solid but not phenomenal.  Huge portion.
Bread basket - delicious rustic loaf and crackers
Steak carpaccio - excellent.  Must try!  The sauce and salad that accompany it are great.
Florentine steak - juicy with a crisp seared exterior.  Excellent!
Shrimp Mediterranean - here's where the experience fell short.  The shrimp was ok and had a lot of kick.  The orzo and farro that came with it was extremely oversalted.  It's as if they put a canister of salt into the cooking water.
Dessert trio- very good.  The cheesecake was my favorite.
I'd definitely come back.  Just skip the Shrimp Mediterranean.
Oh my, lobster bisque! Bring me 3 bowls please, and 2 loaves of that bread too. Everything here is delish, great outdoor seating and nice bar area for colder days. Highly approve!

Never fails! Anything and everything is delicious! One of my faves, is the Gorgonzola filet mignon... Always cooked perfectly and try their Bellini!!!  And it never hurts that the staff is always friendly!

I really like this Brio location.

The high ceilings give it a large feel and the food is always good.
Delicious food and good service.  My son was especially delighted that his burger extended all the way to the edge of the bun :-)

I have been here several times and I have mixed reviews about this place. There are times when I have been here where the food and the service is just not up to par and the last time I was here, was not any different. 
   I brought my sister here for her birthday dinner. We decided to sit outside since they had the misters outside turned on to cool things down a bit. We didn't order any appetizers but we decided to get drinks. The peach and raspberry sangria with moscato in it not only looked good but it was very refreshing. My sister ordered the shrimp risotto and I ordered the angel hair pasta with pesto sauce and shrimp. The risotto dish seemed fine, each dish had jumbo shrimp in it but my pasta was dry and had little to no sauce on it.  
   In the middle of our dinner, the restaurant decided to turn the misters off, even though it was only 7:30. At that point, it just got too hot and uncomfortable to even enjoy our meal. We were just ready to go but our waiter seemed really busy so we just sat out there in heat waiting for him to come by with our check. 
    May be next time I come here, I will sit inside so I am not melting in the heat and can try to enjoy my meal.

Food is really good,  like always. ..  We come here often but tonight is just an exemption.  We brought our niece from Italy for her birthday and to impress here of our food and service.  Like I said, food is phenomenal but absolutely no service at all.  We have to ask three different servers just for a bread.  Can't get no water and our main server had to ask the birthday girl if she wants a surprise dessert.   I thought its called a surprise.
Food was delicious and service was quick.  The waiter checked in periodically but also gave us time to sit and talk.  Great evening, great food, great friends.
The desserts. Delicious. The setting was upscale casual, food was good, nothing superb, but overall a good place to enjoy a nice dinnner

Went here on a Saturday night with a friend.  I was impressed.  The wait to officially sit outside was like 45 minutes so we opted to go to the outside bar and found a table there.  There was waiter service.  We had a few cocktails and ordered an appetizer and a salad to share.  It was just what I had hoped for for a girls night out.  The cocktails were interesting and very tasty.  The food was good, and what you would expect from a place like this.  The outdoor patio was nice and the service was good.  We implied that we wanted to just drink and be mellow and he left us alone for the most part.  

I would go again, very nice place.

I'm not an Italian food fan, but I simply come here for their Beef Carpaccio. Its SO deng good! Their servers are very knowledgable of the food they offer on their menus, and we always get A-Plus service when we come here.

For now my review is five stars. However! I did not have a full dining experience. Me and two coworkers went here after work on Friday around 1:30pm and we just had sangria and appetizers. We sat outside in Town Square because the weather was beautiful. We ordered the white peach sangria, which was excellent beyond belief. I'm typically a red sangria person because the others are too sweet but this was just perfect. I ordered the steak bruschetta. My goodness. It was so awesome. It had a touch of Gorgonzola cheese on it but it wasn't too strong as it sometimes can be. It had arugula and Parmesan. The steak was so tender and flavorful. I was legitimately impressed. 

Our service was very good and attentive as well and she split the check three ways for us which I appreciated...considering this is sometimes a painful task. 

I was glad we sat outside where is was quiet and shaded. I saw a glimpse of the inside and it just wasn't inviting. It looked dark and loud.

For starters, the place is pretty..  But!!!!!  The food was terrible.  The Cesar salad had almost no dressing.  I ordered the lobster, shrimp fettuccine and the noodles where under cooked.  No not aldente!!!  Under cooked and sticky..  the lobster on the other hand was OVER COOKED.  Cooked till it was tuff with no seasoning.  The mushrooms where almost raw and the shrimps had no flavor either.  As for the service.... well the service wasn't very good either!!!  And where my lemon for my Fricken water??????
Happy hour and a martini is always good here.... And at night or in the winter they have a fire pit...!

My experience with this restaurant was not as I expected. The feeling I got as soon as I walked in and asked a simple question was as they were doing customers a favor by letting you in. 

I choose to ignore their lack of courtesy, asked for patio which faced towards Victoria Secrets and behind their bar, they said it was closed although there we people sitting there. Then they took us instead to another outsite section which basically had no one sitting in the area.

I simply left this restaurant and inmediately ran into California Kitchen, which had a much better attitute towards customers.

Maybe some badic manners trainning would help this hostes at the entrance representing Brio.

Salmon salad for the win! No cheese and gluten free, this fresh salmon salad is phenomenal. Paired with a good dry white wine it's perfection! 

Carpaccio and shrimp and eggplant apps are amazing as well, mine and Andy's go tos! 

You also can't beat the happy hour. Everyday I believe 4-6:30pm. Get there around 4 and you should be golden!

The food is great but to me the best was the service! Joey was our waiter and he is the best! He was very quick and he knew what to help us out with. He gave the best suggestions and he was not wrong! I loved Ravioli Di Bello!! SO GOOD!! My dad loved the Lobster and Shrimp fettuccine and my mother had the grilled salmon fresca and was delighted. She said Joey was one of the best waiters and when we go back to vegas we are going in his section ONLY!!! Go to Brio and go for Joey!!

My uncle took my mom & I to this restaurant over the weekend to celebrate her birthday & my graduation. I'm usually pretty skeptical with Italian food in general because I'm allergic to gluten and can't eat much...but I figured I could find something to  suit me.

Loved it here. It's located in this high end outdoor mall (which we didn't see too much of, thanks to scorching Vegas weather...) and the restaurant itself is beautiful. I loved the building with it's high ceilings & open space. I made me feel like I was dining in a castle :)

It was still a little early for dinner (about 5:30), so we were seated right away, although we had no reservations. We were given a bread basket with some flatbread crisps to munch on while we were looking over the menu. I didn't try any of it, but my mom & uncle said the bread was yummy. I ordered the sweet potato & chicken risotto and a  salad, my mom ordered a flatbread pizza and my uncle got the crab cakes. We all decided to share the spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer.

The salad was amazing. Best cesar salad I've had, and I've had quite a few in my time. The dressing wasn't too salty...and the tanginess was perfection. The dip was a bit too salty for me...but I tasted a little bit of the parmesan crisps that come with it & they were great. 

When my food arrived it was very pretty :) The risotto wasn't gummy (which is usually the case) and the flavor was great...but I was a little weirded out because they used dark meat chicken. There were ligaments still attached, like they used a chicken leg instead of a chicken breast. Not that there's anything wrong with that, I am just used to seeing white meat used, as opposed to dark. It tasted fine, tho...I took it all in stride.

I ordered a creme brulee for dessert and it was pretty good. Not the best, but definitely up there.

All in all, the ambiance was nice & the waitress was very friendly. We had a good time here. I'm don't usually visit lavish restaurants when we're in Vegas, but I'd definitely give this place a try again. I'd love to try some pasta here, but I really would hate to land myself in the hospital...

That's is my to go place! I love to chill on their patio during summer. I usually go during happy hour, I recommend you guys to take the black pepper shrimp with black pepper sauce.. if you want a refreshing cocktail during summer, you can't go wrong with their white peach sangria!! Oh!! And I almost forgot the lava cake who's excellent :)
Just had lunch here today and the food was amazing!! Service is great and the outdoor sitting area was refreshing! It is a must try!!

Very nice ambiance and the staff was friendly and attentive.  The food was mixed. Some of the dishes were very good (especially some of the appetizers) but my entree was very disappointing (had the shrimp/lobster fettuccine). As a result I have to give it 3 stars but it is the type of place that I would be willing to try again while ordering something different.

Wonderful atmosphere especially on the patio on a warm, breezy, day in Vegas. Our waitress was great! She was new but very friendly, efficient and attentive even though we waited almost an hour for the 3rd person in our party. I ordered the special on the menu insert, salmon. The flavor was good, but unfortunately, it was on the cold side. The others in my party were very happy with the steak and pork chop.

The service here is hit or miss. More misses than hits, unfortunately. I love their steak salad but it took them 3 times to get it right. There have been times where we were completely ignored. No water or bread for 30 minutes.
I just don't know what's going on here:(

Brio is definitely my favorite chain Italian spot in town! If you didn't know you would have no idea it's a chain joint. Everything is solid, great portion, and tasty just a bit over priced in my opinion but well worth the visit during happy hour. I love their bruschetta so I got the bruschetta sampler which was really tasty and a great variation of flavors. Their bread assortment is quality as well as their soups and salads. I ordered the chicken pesto pasta had tons of flavor however they went a little light on the pesto for my liking so if you really like pesto make sure you ask for extra! My friend got the crab cake entree which looked amazing I tried a piece and I will probably order it next time I visit. All in all a solid Italian restaurant that I would recommend if you are in the town square area!

Me and a friend  were shopping in town square. Decided to stop here for lunch. As we walked in I was impressed the restaurant is nice and classy. We were greeted right away and seated immediately, since they were not that busy. The ambiance of this place is great it's very relaxing. They have a variety of choices on the menu to choose from and the price is very reasonable. My friend had the pasta brio with Alfredo sauce. I  went more traditional and ordered the Americana burger. Both dishes were very good. Now as for the service it was very good our waitress always made sure we were taken care of. I really enjoyed this restaurant and suggest you give it a try.

Food was great, but service was horrible! Got seated outside with our waitress Robin, should've known how the service was going to be when it took close to 10 minutes just to get our waters. Chicken limon was EXTRAORDINARY! I ordered the salmon freshca no red peppers and what do I get red peppers all I got from Robin was oh they don't seem to be listening tonight. Had a bite of my friends chicken limon and I wished I had ordered that mmmm so yummy. Then we ask her for a dessert menu and again a 10 minute wait only for her to come back and apologize that she's taking long. Then another 10 min wait to get our dessert, creme br√ªl√©e is fantastic. Overall food was GREAT, however the service made my first time here not so pleasant.

We are fairly new to the Vegas scene and we came from a town that had bee limited options. So this is one reason why I love bug cities...the eateries!!! The food! This was our first sit down Italian restaraunt and it was pretty good. They gave you good size proportions and we had to take it to go.  The pasta was very yummy and soft..almost like homemade pasta. And the deserts were delish!!! Planning on going back soon to get the lobster and shrimp fettuccine again!

Sat at the bar on a Wednesday night.  $5 martini's and fairly good appetizer specials.   Short rib nachos were tasty but not enough cheese.  Bartender (male, short dark hair) was efficient and friendly.

So first of all we had the worst waiter we had ever had in our experience dining out. He was more concerned with his hair than asking my Mom just once if she wanted a refill on her coffee. He just stood in the corner and messed with his hair. We never received bread with our meal and when asked about it he said he would bring it which he never did. We asked about the menu change and he seemed annoyed at the question. On our way out we mentioned to the Manager that we were disappointed with the service and all she said was I'm  sorry in a very insincere way. Will never return to this restaurant chain again

This is a solid restaurant. 

I've been to a location in Orlando, and now the one in Las Vegas. Every time the food has been consistent, flavorful, and served hot. This particular location has paid close attention to the aesthetics, which from a designer's point of view is always appreciated. 

More important however, when considering any restaurant with multiple locations and above-average prices is the food and service. Again, I have yet to be disappointed. Considering the brusque treatment I got at the Grotto in the Golden Nugget, I was afraid that might be par for the course. Thankfully it isnt. 

Brio's Vegas location in a walking mall is a nice change from the more parking lot-oriented locations in other states. Its nice to be on a patio that isnt overlooking only cars but real pedestrians going about their business. 

For a nice bite of Italian close to McCarran, Brio's Las Vegas location gets my nod.

Let me start of by saying if I could give 0 stars I would. This was my first experience at Brio. My boyfriend searched on yelp restaurants in town square and we saw it had great reviews. When we first were seated, the chairs had food on them and we had to switch them out. We decided to order drinks, which took about 20 mins to come. For our entrees 
My boyfriend ordered the chicken limone and I ordered the pasta pesto. It took an entire hour to come to the table. In between the wait, the waiter and manager came over at several times saying it was "coming out soon " when the food finally arrived, they informed us they had no angel hair pasta and instead gave us fettuccine. It was old clumpy and not cooked. The meal looked gross and even the waitress agreed it was terrible. The manager came over and apologized but never offered us anything except to remake our food that would take another hour. I will not be returning here ever again!!!!
Awesome food! Lobster Bisque is amazing. Food was delicious. Would go again.

Wow.  What a nice surprise.  
My husband and I were vacationing in Vegas and were sick of the constant stimulus of the strip.  This place was recommended for a quiet meal with a romantic vibe.

Let me tell you--Service is important to those who've worked in the service industry. (I used to be a waitress. I know how hard the job is!)

Boy, did we get blessed.  Tamara was our server.  Her bubbly and genuine smile really stood out from the glazed and frozen grins we were starting to get used to.

My husband ordered the salmon salad and said it was a large but perfectly filling light meal.
Tamara dealt with my modifications to their Garden Salad and handled it like a CHAMP! The grilled chicken added to salad was so juicy!  It definitely wasn't some 'garbage' chicken that couldn't be used in another dish. (Again, I know how restaurants work...)

Tamara  wasn't miffed that we weren't drinking and ordered Pelligrino.
But, THIS is Vegas and she did tempt my husband to stumble...off his low-carb diet! 
Per Tamara's suggestion, John ordered the light cheesecake bite AND the peanut butter cup. (When he falls off the bandwagon...forget about it!) He said Tamara's taste buds were right on the money KA-CHING! Her cheesecake won top billing.

If we lived in Vegas I could definitely see us coming here a lot.  In fact, every time we stop by Sin City, we will be nabbing a table here. 

Great job, Tamara. You made this incredible restaurant an experience we will definitely remember. With a smile and attitude like that, the world is your oyster!

Me and two girlfriends were out and about in Vegas this past weekend and after all the window shopping we had done, we realized we were famished. So we drove and came upon Brio. The first thing out of me and my friends mouth was HAPPY HOUR SPECIALS!!!! See we frequent the Brio in Scottsdale and we love their happy hour special in which a select few of their appetizers are all $2.95. We snag a great parking spot and walk into Brio where the sign says happy hour 3-7 in the bar. SCORE!

We are immediately seated and our waiter comes over to take our drink orders and we say may we also get the happy hour menu. He proceeds to say that happy hour doesn't start until 3:30pm but I say your sign says 3pm.  He proceeds to tell me still needs to be changed but happy hour does not start to 3:30pm. We say fine, we will wait the 20mins until happy hour starts. He proceeds to walk away but what he doesn't realize is that I am still watching him and I swear the look on his face was like these bitches.... So needless to say when he came back I called him out on it. He let me know that if his face conveyed that then he was very sorry and that he apologies for the misunderstanding. Hmm suspect... (however he got back into my good gracious later)

We order Brio Burgers, Ravioli Caprese, Roasted Red Pepper & Fresh Mozzarella Bruschetta and Sliced Steak Bruschetta. Now we have had this before at the Scottsdale Brio and each time the burgers have been perfect and the bruschetta has been divine. This time not so much. The burger was perfect on the inside but burnt on the outside, the Ravioli and all the Brushchetta came out lukewarm at best. Our waiter came over to ask how everything was and I was like eh do you really want to know? So we told him that we weren't happy but we were hungry and we would eat it anyway. He offered to make everything again but we declined as we had already waited for about 30 mins for the food after we ordered. He says I will tell the manager and she may come over to talk to you.

Well the GM came over to talk to us and asked how things were. We told her that we were use to how great everything was at the Scottsdale location and we came here because of that notion and we were disappointed but hey for $2.95 per appetizer, we cannot complain too much. She said that she had just spent a month at the Scottsdale location and this was her first day back and she apologized for the meal and she said she would take care of it for us. We were all like wow, thank you that is very generous. She asked if we wanted anything else and we declined and thanked her again.

Little did we know that when she said she would take care of it for us, she meant the entire bill!! Drinks and all. We asked for the bill thinking we had to at least pay for our drinks and our waiter let us know that the entire bill had been taken care of. WOW! We did leave our waiter a nice tip and left out of there shaking our heads. 

So maybe this Brio was having an off afternoon but I give it 1.5 stars for the food but 5 stars for the GM for being extra generous.

We had a discount coupon for this restaurant and visited for the first time. Upon arrival we discovered the majority of the seating is outside on an enclosed covered patio. Even though they had heat lamps it was chilly. We decided to wait for an indoor table. The wait lasted almost 30 minutes and there's very little area to stand in while waiting.

This restaurant has a VERY lively bar that you can also dine at. It was full and loud. The layout of the restaurant is laid back but accommodates few tables in the main dining area. The entire end of the restaurant restaurant is taken up by the trio that plays on the weekends. Fearing the noise we were happy to find that the trio played familiar but low keyed music that didn't interfere with the dining experience.

Now the food. It was very good with emphasis on Italian naturally. We ordered different items and all were quite good with enough left over to take home. Our waiter was outstanding, friendly, competent and kidding. Every time he brought out a dish he would say, "Take a Picture". It was funny.

Anyway I don't think we will go back. While we enjoyed the food, the atmosphere just was found wanting. When you make a reservation that should ask if you want indoor or outdoor seating.

I've frequented Brio plenty of times with friends and family, and it has always been a good option. With that in mind, there are a few"Dos and Don'ts" that I'd recommend:

~ Don't be afraid to explore the menu. I enjoy a myriad of different dishes ranging from the steak to the pasta. My friends also enjoy dishes such as the pork chops. 

~ If venturing for dinner, I would avoid the basic salads as the price doesn't warrant the size. Lunch time is a much better deal. 

~ GET THE CARAMEL MASCARPONE CHEESECAKE! IT'S F***ING AMAZING!!!

~ For this specific location, I've found that during peak times, their service seems to slow down quite tremendously--more so than you'd expect. Off-hours are best and quick if you're in a hurry. 

Overall, if you're looking for a good restaurant with a wide variety of options, Brio is a solid pick. And remember...GET THE CARAMEL MASCARPONE CHEESECAKE!

I love this restaurant.  That being said, I was ultimately surprised when our waitress in the bar section was a little too sarcastic or trying too hard to be nice, like it was physically hurting her to do so... She explained our menus like we looked confused as to what she even had handed us.  I was turned off immediately by how apathetic she was being.  We were done with our meal and two other waiters asked us if we wanted the bill.  15 mins go by, four servers stood by the checkout while we painstakingly waited at our table.  We honestly could have just got up and walked out with no discrepancies...  Also I bartend, my fianc√© is a competitive bartender as well so we know professionalism.  A older bartender got woodford reserve out and left it on the bar for 5mins... He free handed the sketchiest old fashioned I've ever seen... And then did not put the bottle back in its place.  The second bartender came around and poured water yet did nothing about the bottle that was still out.  The original tender passed it four more times without putting it back.  He also proceeded to stick an unopened straw into a shot he poured but had found something in the drink that wasn't supposed to be there. It was an unpleasant experience.

I choose poorly. Came here today on a business lunch. My first time here. Everyone raves about it. Beautiful restaurant. Great waitstaff. Everything on the menu sounded great. I choose the shrimp risotto with tomato bisque. The soup was the best thing. The sourdough bread was fantastic, but my risotto was disappointing. I think it was a little over cooked. The shrimp were great. Cooked fresh to perfection, but I think the risotto might have been sitting around awhile. Seemed more like oatmeal. A bit bland too. For an $11 lunch item it was very small. Smallest portion at the table of five. The club sandwich next to me was at least twice as much food. I cleaned my plate and was satisfied but not full. The guy next to me couldn't finish his sandwich and homemade chips, which were pretty good.

Good atmosphere and beautiful venue. The bread app that they start you out with is to die for. Server was very attentive and very friendly but I forget her name. I got their ravioli pasta and at first glance, it seemed small but by the time i was done, i was full.

This is a chain restaurant located off the Strip in the Town Center shopping mall.  The food is consistent and the atmosphere is good.  Prices are not bad either.  If you want good Italian food, come here.  We had excellent service, and they had live music outside.  We had the iceberg wedge salad, a pasta dish and shrimp mediterranean and all was excellent.  They have large deserts if you want to share, or small ones if you want to have something different.  The area is nice to walk off your meal too.
5 star lobster risotto if there were 7 stars I would give them all. Perfectly al dente cooked, very nice taste. This dish is top 5 on my bucket list.

Wow. I was pleasantly surprised. I was expecting the Olive Garden but this place is much better than that. Their food isn't anything groundbreaking, but it is good. I had one of their dinner specials, the blackened scallops on pesto risotto, and thought it was great. The scallops were large and weren't gritty at all. The risotto was a pretty good consistency (not the best I've ever had, but still good) and had some bold flavors with the pesto and mushrooms. This dish is different than the shrimp and scallop risotto on their daily menu, by the way. 

I love the fact that you can get small samplings of their desserts for 2.45 a shot. They're large enough to satisfy your sweet tooth without feeling like you're bingeing on a huge piece of cake or whatever. Most of the desserts are tasty, but not spectacular. The tiramisu and cheesecake are probably the best. I was impressed with the food and the interior of the place. It was a nice casual atmosphere and a relatively inexpensive meal.

Love this place, food is good and price is good. 
I love the strawberry salad, pasta la vodka, risotto are my favorite.
Highly recommended

Really slow service, manager nowhere to be seen. Staff caught lying and give you inconsistent stories and excuses about a request to move to a different table or to at least open the umbrellas so you don't fry while you wait 20 minutes for a mimosa or 30 minutes for a simple caesar salad or a total of an hour for your main course. If you go, hope all goes magically well but don't expect unsatisfactory situations to be fixed or be handled properly.

Great restaurant...I work with someone who lives in the northwest part of the valley and since I'm in the southeast...it's a great location for us to meet in the middle for lunch or dinner.

The food is excellent - not on the inexpensive side, but definitely worth the money for such good quality and taste.  I'm particularly fond of the Mezza Chicken Limone and end up getting that almost every time we go, although I've had the chopped salad as well and it's great.

I like that the menu flags a number of items that are under 595 calories so if you are counting them at all or just want to know what might be a healthier choice - they make it really easy.

Love the outside seating (and there is plenty of it) - especially if we're trying to get some work done...the inside can get a little bit noisy.  Service is excellent...beyond reproach, in fact.  Definitely the place you want to go to for a business lunch.

A franchise restaurant in a mall adjacent to the airport posing as Le Circe with prices that are far too expensive for a dressed up Macaroni Grill with vaulted ceilings that are unable to mute nor dampen the subway station levels of noise on the main dining floor.

5 star food and service. My wife and I come here all the time. An awesome place to eat, people watch and enjoy in town square. I have been coming here for a long time, I guess today was the first time i'm writing a review.

My department of 8 came here for lunch on a Monday afternoon.  Without a reservation, we only had to wait 5 mins prior to be seated.  The lunch menu was pretty decent.  Many options to chose from, such as salad, pasta, paninis, flatbreads and more.

I decided to go with angel hair pasta with salmon.  The angel hair pasta was cooked perfectly, not too soft, not too hard.  The salmon was a a tad bit more cooked than I would have liked, but because there was a nice scampi butter sauce, it was still delicious.

I will definitely return to try their items on the happy hour menu.

Best tasting happy hour food by far!!! Came after work with some coworkers & will def be back. 

The egg plant fries are BOMB!!! The shrimp is BOMB!!! The burger is BOMB!!! All off the happy hour menu. 

Not a disappointment when the food is delish!!
Service was very slow. Had to flag down server for more water and to order wine. Crab Cake Entree came out cold. Caprese Salad has tomato with the sticker still on it.

One of the best place I've been in Las Vegas. We sat outside at the bar. Despite the heat we had a great time. The food was very tasty. The portions generous for the price and the staff very friendly. The wait time isn't bad for such a good place. Will return for sure.

I don't get a date night that often.  Gave it a shot with this reputable brand but was disappointed.  Food ordered was calamari, caprese salad, and the nine ounce filet with Gorgonzola crust and roasted vegetables.  I ordered a planned dessert of creme br√ªl√©e to be brought after our dinner was consumed.  Meat was phenomenal.  Was cooked well done despite my tastes, yet retained juice and texture.  Amazing bite.  The accompanying veggie partnership was well thought of.  

I found no issue with the caprese or the calamari.  Both were well made for a hometown Italian place like this.  I was impressed with the flavor profile of the mozzarella and the crisp texture of the squid.  

My issue was with the timing.  We received our apps, salads, and main course simultaneously and then never received our dessert at all.  The timing had put off my date, whom said Brio is fired.  Despite my likings for this menu, I probably won't come back much, due to this experience.

I decided to get myself some dinner after a nice day of shopping in Vegas yesterday.. I should've went to the whole foods around the corner instead of this Italian restaurant because the service was horrific !!! the bread was  stale I ordered penne alla vodka with no pancetta and the gentleman brought me a gnocchi ravioli with ricotta cheese ....when I went to send it back he tried to argue with me to tell me that in the menu it says something else ....and I told him that I know what the menu says because I ordered Penne alla vodka  he then sent the manager over who was very nice she offered to pay for my entire dinner asked me if I needed anything else and I told her that she needed to hire people that can read and write... Let me add that I specifically requested penne pasta with allla vodka sauce no ricotta cheese and no pancetta ..if The waiter or the chef had an issue with my order they should've told me but instead of that my order was completely disregarded and that's to the gentleman who decided to message me privately who is now blocked

Can't say that I have had a better Italian meal.  The veal was awesome...I inhaled the scrumptious pasta and roasted veggies...the bruscetta sampler was very tasty and the dessert/dolcini sampler was over the top outstanding....too bad I was too full to competely enjoy.  The wedge salad was also tasty and the lemonade was so good.  Best service in Vegas....Q was the most attentive waiter ever...he even told me...we will make anything you want....who says that?  Can't wait to return in November ...our new favorite! !!!
Excellent service and food.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great meal.  The portions are big too.

Pretty solid place in Town Square  for lunch or dinner.  Good food with a nice flair, pretty noisy because it is usually crowded.  Happy hour has some cheap dishes if you want to try some different things.  I recommend the Chicken Milanase and the Caesar salads.  Average prices for the type of restaurant.  Great place when the weather is nice to sit in the patio with the fire pits.  Great place for groups as well, very accommodating.  I recommend this, one if my favorite places in Town Square.
Beautiful place inside of Town Square. Usually order the Lasagna but went with the Crispy Chicken salad. Really nice place. Waiter was very friendly & knowledgable.

This restaurant is a solid 4.5 stars but I had to bump it up for the location. This spot is definitely one of my favorites close to the strip. Town Square is such a great place to walk around and shop and then to stop here and have a bite to eat of some bueno Italian food with a beer or a glass of wine is a great way to top off the night unless you go see a movie afterward which is great too. 
I like to sit outside and enjoy the Vegas summer night and watch people walk around as they go in and out of stores while I eat my food. If it's to hot outside the inside is very well designed and looks extremely fancy with good A/C and it's not as expensive as it looks like it should be.

The food is outstanding but the experience is big chain restaurant unfortunately. Let me be clear, there was nothing wrong with the experience of lunch today at this wonderfully located spot, but there is an opportunity to give an experience that is special. Our experience was nothing short of average - staff act like we are out of town tourists who won't come back again. A little training on service and delivering a good experience would go a long way to make this spot 5 star.

With that said the food is outstanding - fresh, properly flavored and displayed. The food will bring us back, the overall experience needs work.

Our night started off with a 25 minute late reservation, but in spite of getting sat so late, the food and service were exceptional. 

Our waiter was super friendly and knowledgable about the menu. He made some good suggestions. 

I had the bruschetta quatro along with the salmon Fresca. I wasn't feeling in the mood for salmon so I swapped it out for chicken. 

Overall this place is good. Love the environment, the food is great, and we liked the service.
Great food and greatt service! The restaurant is beautiful! Makes you feel like to are in Italy!

Went for the Happy early happy hour.All the food items are $2.95 from a selective menu at the bar area so we tried a few.
I enjoyed the Ravioli Caprese the Burger,ans the Shrimp and Eggplant. They were nice big portions and full of great flavors. The steak brushetta was ok, a liitle overwhelming with the cheese. I had 2 beers and my wife had a mixed dink and our bill was only$30. Great place to have a few drinks, a bite to eat and a cool scene if your lucky enough to get a seat on the couches outside. Give this place a try!

Came here for a quick bite and shared the Bruschetta Sampler, Bisteca Salad, and a Fettuccine dish that was a couple minutes shy of al dente...

Luckily the Italian peach tea helped me wash the pasta down. The dessert tray didn't look appetizing, so we passed on the sweets.

Next time we're in the area, I'd rather dine at Yard House instead...ALOHA!!!

The location is splendid.  Truly elegant, despite being a fast casual restaurant. The food is a bit uneven.  Not sure they are the most fastidious with the cleaning and service, either.  But if you're out shopping and touring, not a bad place to stop in for a bite.  Desserts are large and filling, as are the pasta plates.
Great for a lunch salad with girlfriends...  if you're not into rabbit food, the pasta lunch specials are tasty too, but be prepared to nap the rest of your workday... :)

The interior is sooooo much cuter/nicer than I would have expected from the outside. We sat on the patio which was really nice, although, you do hear all the planes flying overhead the whole time.  Service was fast and polite. The bread brought out before our entrees was really delicious and warm. I don't know why, but I thought I would mention that...
I ordered the brunch special which was Eggs Oscar - two poached eggs with a shrimp  crab cake over potatoes and veggies. It was very tasty and the eggs were cooked perfectly. My sister got the pesto pasta which she said she really liked. I tasted it, a little bland for me, but she really seemed to enjoy it. 
We didn't try it but I have been told by a few people that the white peach sangria is really good. 
We got the little desserts in shot glasses - tiramisu for me (good) and key lime for her (amazing!!!)
I would love to come here with a group and sit inside because the atmosphere is so cute and the menu seems like it would have something for everyone.

Wonderful experience at Brio.    Here for a volleyball tournament and was asked by the captains to set up a dinner for the team and parents.    

Made a reservation for a party of 30.   They were very accommodating and didn't even demand that we order off of the catering menu.  So we were able to sample from the dinner menu.  

We were amazed that they were able to serve us all at the same time, the food was hot and everyone enjoyed their meal.    For 30 people that was a feat.  Service was exceptional.   The restaurant was beautiful.    Their mini desserts was wonderful as each of us could sample something yummy without overdosing on sugar.  

Would highly recommend Brio Tuscan Grill to parties large and small - For special occasions, first dates and groups.

What a joke! I've wanted to go to this place for quite some time. So yesterday a friend and I planned to go for happy hour. Well we went and was quite disgusted about the way they handle the seating arrangements for happy hour. You can have happy hour at the bar or at designated tables with fire pits on the patio ONLY. Oh you can sit at a table right next to the ones with a fire pit, a mere 3 inches away; but you have to order from a regular menu and pay full price. Who's hair brain idea is this? Poor business practice and well, just plain fucking stupid. So save yourself the frustration and go to Tommy Bahamas or the Blue Martini as every table and person is offered the happy hour menu and pricing regardless of where you sit, just so long as you go during the designated hours. I'm still in shock.  Completely disappointed.  I'm spreading the word to any one that will listen. I will never give this place one dime and I would encourage those reading this to do the same. They need a new business plan and manager.

Where do I begin with this one!? Okay, I know - the atmosphere! The Town Square location is the grander of the two in the Las Vegas area.  There are dramatic high ceilings with beautifully draped material flowing from the rafters.  The place is huge and although there is a wait at times, it moves along quickly.

The food has been consistently good. Being Italian, I dislike Italian chain restaurants, but this is not one of them.  The ravioli is superb as is all of their pasta dishes judging from the reaction of our guests and our own experience.  Their desserts are wonderful, and they even have "tapas" size to make you feel less guilty.

The newest location in Summerlin is smaller and a little less showy than the Town Square site. However, this just makes it a totally different experience; same great food, but "cozier" feel.  Lots of fun on a Saturday when the Farmers Market sets up at the site!

For lunch or dinner, this place is a sure hit.

Food was good but nothing exceptional, the restaurant is quite busy and noisy on a Saturday even when the rest of town square is calm. Good wine and apps probably a great place for happy hour given the wine selection but generally a bit overpriced for the quality of service.

We've always enjoyed this restaurant! We've been here for corporate holiday dinners and just normal night out at town dinners. If you go here for brunch on the weekends I recommend coming in around 1045am. They open at 11am but the doors open at 1030am. 1045am will only be a 15min wait.. if you come right at 11, the wait time might be longer. It does get busy at open, especially Sunday mornings. For the quality of the food, the price is excellent! Great food for a reasonable price!

EPIC Happy hour. Soooo I came to this place a few years ago to meet a girl friend of mine for happy hour. EPIC. The food is great and cheap and the cocktails are the same. The location is CLEAN and open and busy.  All of the locations have a bar that wraps around from inside to the outside patio with a cover and misters... since it gets so darn hot in Vegas. I love that and love to sit out there when its not soooo hot. 

Parking here can be a challenge depending on the day, so you will want to park in the South Parking Garage and walk across the street.

Now, if you start with an appetizer and a few cocktails and decide to move to the main dinning area for dinner, they are more than happy to accommodate you. Or.... if your fine in the spot you have choose, DONT want to move to the dinning room.. you can do that too. 

The Staff here is AWESOME!  I cant tell you how many times I have been here looking to get a booth in the Bar area for happy hour, to meet some friends, and the waitress or waiter has made it a point to watch out for me to grab the next open one :).  I love it when people are nice and looking out for you.  

the food is GREAT, Service is GREAT, location is CLEAN and Bright AND... It can accommodate a TON of people. 

This is my Favorite Happy Hour spot for Vegas... so far!

This place sucks big meatballs(see what I did there) service is bunk as hell. We sat there for 15 mins with no one helping us. So me and my party left. On our way out,We then told the manager what was going on and her response was on some half ass "I'm sorry", "we can get you menus now". She needs work on her managerial skills cause she seemed as if she doesn't have that.(she might need to take a class) Maybe it was because we didn't fit the "look" of her crowd. In any case, that's the first time and last time at that spot...just go to yard house for happy hour!

Not terrible, but not great either... this place has a really nice atmosphere & service isn't bad. However, it's overpriced to say the least. Not a great menu selection compared to pretty much any other restaurant of equivalent size/style. Overall I'd say this is more the type of place you go to when you're trying to enjoy a nice & impressive layout, as apposed to just getting a good solid meal & leave satisfied.

Whoa, I enjoy this place. Never have I ever thought I would enjoy this place. Abby Q was a very pleasant server. I would recommend her to anyone who is trying to dine at this restaurant. Much gratitude!
Stopped off here on a recommendation from a local. We were not dissapointed. It was delicious. The best brunch we have had in a long time.

You can't get any better than $2.95 special plates during happy hour!  The menu is small for happy hour, but the food is AMAZING !  
We had the Margharita Pizza, Steak Bruchetta and the Burger.  It was enough to fill our tummies.  The drinks we got weren't on happy hour, so we paid more for beer/ wine than food.  LOL.

I suggest sitting in the bar and trying out this happy hour.  It seemed popular, and the price can't get any better unless it is Freeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!

I can't say enough good things about Brio Tuscan Grille.  I recently ate there with my husband and kids. The food was fantastic and, even though, the atmosphere indicates a more upscale restaurant, my kids were welcomed with no hesitation.  The chocolate dessert that I shared with my daughter was out of this world - so gooey and delicious.  I can't wait to go back.

I've typically gone to Brio for their happy hour ($3.95+ for small plates on weekdays), so I've never really gone here during regular lunch & dinner hours as I thought their prices were quite high.

However, I came here for lunch with my coworkers & I didn't realize they have a lunch menu (from $10 -$17), and their prices are very reasonable. It's not fast food cheap, but for its quality & ambience, it's definitely worth it.

Overall, servers have been nice & check up on my party in a timely manner. However the food takes a little longer to come out compared to other restaurants. Nonetheless, their complimentary bread & crackers satisfy one's appetite while waiting.

Honestly, everything on their menu is pretty tasty & delicious.

Wow. What can I say? The place is boomin, so there was a short wait understandably, but only 15 minutes to seat 7 people? That's no time at all. The atmosphere, with the old paintings and Roman look, is great. I would decorate my place like that if I could. Next, the service. Our waitress' name was Kimberly, and she was great. Very attentive and a fantastic personality. She got a good tip for sure. Lastly, the food. Frickin fantastic. I had a mushroom ravioli with an alfredo sauce that knocked my socks off. I also tried the tortellini and lasagna that was also just as good. I would recommend this place to anyone, especially lovers of Italian food.

Came here of a business dinner with my crew, and regretted this choice. Seemed like an over priced Olive Garden with tacky decor. Yikes!

Wish we went elsewhere.

Always love coming here for happy hour, prices are awesome $5-$6 food and $4-$6 drinks! Happy indeed! Lol service is pretty great also, the workers are nice and makes sure that you got everything you need.

I just don't like how dark it is at night when you're dining inside it's a little hard to see, maybe just because I don't like to use my glasses but a little more light and it'd be great!

I give Brio Cacina Italiana 4 stars simply because they deserve it!

Have frequented Brio Cacina Italiana many many times.  Have even celebrated my birthday here! Great fun!  What I love about the Brio is that they have a variety of dishes that I find delish!  From their Beef Carpaccio to their Eggplant & Shrimp appetizer to their perfect pasta! Just love them... if you go during the week, you can catch their Happy Hour & get the Beef Carpaccio for $2.95, baby! Yes, I said it! I went one early evening  for appies (appetizers) & drinks with my girlfriend and our bill was a mere $30 something when we finished! How can you beat that? We noshed on the Carpaccio, Shrimp cocktail and wine!  Also, the environment is great - I love chilling by the outside bar on the lovely spring / summer evenings... always a Gem in my book!

to be more up to date: Saturday, 29 Jan 2011 was date night - even tho our mood was less than nice... we still enjoyed our meal! :)

your constant companion,

~dee
Best Italian food I've had in Vegas so far! Great service also. They are usually very busy, but it's well worth the wait.

Brio Is just one of THE BEST places to go for happy hour! You sure do get your fillings with only ordering all their Tuscan Tasters. I mean $3.95 appetizers and $5 martinis, sangria, and wine? How could you beat that? You'd really have to decide which would come first, a food coma or a drunken state.

My personal faves here are the Beef Carpacio, Ravioli Caprese, and the Eggplant. For the drink specials-it's all about the Peach Sangria, and the Mojito. Best believe they don't hold back on the alcohol either!

Also, their angus burger which is also on the happy hour menu is definitely a double BANG for your buck. I took my aunts here for happy hour and just got a kick out of it1 They loved the decor, and the ambiance, and most of all they loved that they were full off of yummy appetizers. 

Our server was also very helpful and friendly. She even went out of her way to separately send out our dishes so we weren't overwhelmed with food. Not like thats a bad thing or anything!

I will crave you again soon Brio.

Brio is a great place for lunch not too busy, dinner on a weekend you may have to wait.They do alot right, I don't have anything negative to say. 

Free WiFi also..(hope they still have it) 

Brio bakes and cooks most things in house so everything is fresh, You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  I love the smoke chicken sandwich, and pasta's at Brio.
Very comfortable setting and reasonable prices.

Came here for lunch today and couldn't be more pleased. Great service, great decor, great food and an exceptional Bellini. 

The soup of the day was tomato bisque and it was the 2nd best tomato bisque I've ever had, just delicious. I had the lunch special, Mezza Chicken with mashed potatoes and roasted vegi's and it was good, 4 stars.
The 5th star was for the amazing peach Bellini and tomato bisque. The next time I am in Vegas, I will definitely be back!

We go to this Brio all the time because it's more convenient for our family get together. Food is always good but the service can be improved on. They seem to get our orders wrong and do watch out for the bill and double check. There has been several occasions that we got charged for more things than we should. But the kids love the food and we don't have a choice when they choose this place. Maybe the Summerlin location has given us a better experience in the past...

I've only been here once, but it's on my list to visit again next time I'm in Vegas. 

It has been quite a while since my visit, I wasn't even going to review, but there is a dish that is still on my mind, even today, so I feel it's worth a shout out. The best thing we ate here was the roasted grapes. My folks kind of looked at me cross-eyed when I ordered it, but it is easily one of the best dishes I have ever had. My parents still talk about it. This dish was perfectly executed. The texture and flavor of these sweet little gems was so delightful, I forgot where I was and went savage with my fingers. I just could not get enough. 

All of our food was very very good. I'd give 5 stars, but our service was lackluster. Not sure if someone called out or our server was just not good, but we seldom saw him very and when he did stop by, he wasn't very helpful. 

Despite that, Brio is a beautiful restaurant with great food that will be a pleasure to visit again.

Brio is a typical chain restaurant.  Everything is pretty consistent but nothing stands out.  I had lobster bisque which was way too salty and carpaccio which was fine.  Lunch service was quick in and out.

I've always loved this place, and tonight my love grew even stronger. Although it's rather loud inside (and hot outside!) I was able to have a great business meeting where I could hear my partners well. Had the lobster with crab and pasta, mmmmmmm!! Will be coming back for sure!
Personally my experience was awesome,  the food is really good,  they doesn't have a lot of wines for be a place with an Italian name and serves pasta,  the wine's menu is not so extended.

Loved this place! Had a nice lunch with my aunt and the food was delish. I had the pasta pesto which was to die for and the portion was just right. My aunt had the Caesar salad and margarita pizza which I tried and was yummy. Service was good and seating was roomy.

Latest visit was pretty awful.

Came here for lunch one afternoon with a coworker and there was a huge line of people waiting to be seated. Luckily we had reservations and so we were taken to our table. We each ordered an entree, since I'm part of the restaurant's loyalty rewards program I get discounts and promotions in my inbox regularly, I was informed by the staff that I couldn't use my promotion due to some weird random company policy. 

The prices have increased significantly in the last 6 months, AND the food quality has definitely gone downhill. The chicken dish I got was rather stiff and over cooked. Service seemed very absent, and not very friendly. 

Really really disappointing, and I will very likely cancel my account and never set foot here again.
The pasta brio is absolutely delicious. Always consistent regardless of the location.

If you're looking for a decent Italian place, Brio is one to check out! Located just South of the Strip, Town Square is a great place to relax, hang out, and shop. The ambiance of the restaurant is relaxed and quiet and put together very well. Their outside eating area is huge and borders the restaurant along a couple of walkways for pedestrians. It's a really nice place to relax and enjoy your meal.

I've had quite a few dishes here. The lasagna is great as is the lobster bisque. I've never had a problem with quality or taste here. They also have a great wine selection to pair with your meal.

They're service has always been on par and friendly. This is a great place to have business meetings or to take business persons you want to have an intimate and business-friendly meal with.

The restaurant can get quite busy during the holidays so make sure you have a reservation in place before you head here.

The atmosphere is good. The music is a bit loud for conversation. The pasta with Vodka sauce was creamy without losing the marinara flavors. The chefs special of Braised Beef Pappardella was excellent. The long ribbons of Rosemary infused pasta paired well with the braised beef. The beef fell apart with each bite. Nice offering from the kitchen.
