Would have liked to try the food here but we wait at least 20 mins for someone to come & take our orders (& this was just drinks) the people that got seated after us were already getting bread & appetizers. & still no one approached our table, even though my aunt made eye contact with some of the waiters who still probably couldn't get the hint that we we're obviously waiting for someone to take our order. Of course we just left & just went for Yard House. Disappointing for a nice restaurant.

Tried the Bruschetta Quattro...SO GOOD. I only got the Brio Chopped Salad because I was full, however my husband got the Gorgonzola Crusted Bistecca - PERFECTION. So moist, succulent and ;....I'm drooling. Best ever. My BIL ordered what I wanted originally, Sweet Potato & Chicken Risotto. AH-MAZING! So flavorful and innovative. The BIL's gf (haha I love acronyms) needed gluten free dishes only and the server was most accommodating. Actually, the service was the best I've had in years. Overall the ambiance is in a beautiful setting in a 'strip mall' look of Town Center, but I am now craving for the bistecca and live no where near a Brio :( Will definitely go again!

I've ordered takeout from here twice now and both times have been full of noms. However, it's a little pricey for my expectations--I don't think they are probably using any higher quality ingredients than Macaroni Grill, Olive Garden, or Maggiano's, but it seems to be quite a bit more expensive.

Yesterday I had a lunch combo... a half salad and a small portion of risotto. The risotto was really great with a lot of veggies (squash, asparagus, tomatoes) and pine nuts. What's not to love about that? The side caesar was good too, and the combination of the two filled me up without being too heavy of a lunch (even though it was a generous portion of creamy risotto!). 

I would love to go back and not have it for takeout--I'd like to experience the food fresh out of the kitchen instead out of plastic to-go boxes. However, it is a good option for takeout in Town Square!

Great cocktail menus and a go-to place for my friends and I when we visit Las Vegas.  Happy hour is a great deal, but you can only enjoy the deals in the bar. 

They have a new option on their menu where you can order 2, 3, or 4 small dishes of appetizers or side dishes for a decent prize.  Although listed as a small dish, the size and portion is more than enough for a group of 3.  

Best thing I've had here and a must for anyone to order is the spicy shrimp with the crusted eggplant.  So delicious and flavorful!  One bite, you'll want to eat the whole dish.  Not too spicy but definitely full of mouth-drooling flavor.  

Their brussel sprouts and caprese salad is also delicious as well.  Something I'd definitely order again. 

From their cocktails, I got the Cucumber Basil Gimlet with the Hendricks Gin.  Very refreshing and great palate cleanser as well.  Their sangrias are also decent as well.  

Service is great and no complaints there.

I absolutely love this place. Their happy hour is definitely one of my top picks in Las Vegas. The quality and portion of the items on the HH menu are very well worth your money considering they start from $5. You must try the beef carpaccio, period. You definitely will not be disappointed and you'll probably order more than one. Another favorite is the Bruschetta Trio, very flavorful and savory!
Aside from the food, the inside and outside is really comfortable and sleek so it makes it easier to stay there for a good amount of time.

Definitely one of the best happy hours around. Just be there early to get a seat and if you're at the bar you may be sat a bit close to another customer. The food here is good and the cocktails are well made. My main criticism is the service. It really is one of the worst of places I've been to for slow service. The last 2 times I went, I waited over 40 minutes for my class of wine and the other time it took so long to get the menu that we nearly walked out. They really need to step up their game with the service here, otherwise this place would be fantastic.

I normally have a great experience when I come here, not this time.   The food was not up to it's normal standards and we had to send a dish back because it was cold.  They changed the noodles to a sticky so called angel hair..  If it ain't broken don't fix it.  Service was slow and he forgot to bring a salad to one of our guests.   I miss the old Brio and will give it one more chance hoping it was just a off night for the staff.

Had a wonderful experience with my friend. Roy was our server. Honestly, I wish I could give him 100 stars. This guy is awesome, friendly, and chill. Got he wedge salad; and lobster bisque. IF YOU HAVE TO CHOOSE BETWEEN THIS RESTAURANT and another one (Tommy Bahamas) CHOOSE BRIO.!! Lol you won't be disappointed. We were sat out on the patio. Beautiful weather. Busy night. Good vibes. Servers time management was on point. TRY THE PEACH BELLINI!! Yass

Perfect place for date night or after a long week at work or a get together with some of your friends. Ambiance is casual but can get loud when it gets crowded. I made reservations online and got seated right away when we got there. I noticed some people who were waiting to be seated had to wait a little longer than those with reservations. It pays off to plan ahead!

Me & my boyfriend started off sharing a the chopped salad, which was tasty but would have liked a little more.

For my entree I got the shrimp Mediterranean, very nice presentation. It was grilled shrimp over a bed of orzo and assorted veggies, all super tasty and the portion was just right for me. 

For dessert we shared a snicker doodle peach cobbler that was topped with vanilla ice cream. It was sweet & fruity, nothing short of satisfaction.

I want to come back, perhaps for happy hour or try something different on their huuge varietal menu.

Every time I visit Vegas, it is always a struggle for me to find a good restaurant to hang out with friends or family, be as loud as I can be, have a trendy atmosphere, reasonably priced, not on the strip, and the food is packed with flavor. 

I'm from Las Vegas - and there isn't a single time where I think I NEED to go to a restaurant.  Since leaving this place, I have been to restaurants that I never knew could exist - restaurants where you can hang out in a trendy restaurant, eat phenomenal food and not spend more than $30/person? What?!

I don't know what it is about Vegas. Maybe it's the fact that Vegas values the bright lights, brand names, glitz and glamour before anything else. 

Anyway, a group of us (10 + 1 baby) needed a restaurant that can hold us, have great food, reasonably priced, trendy, and away from the strip.  My friends even though they've lived here all their lives can't even give me any suggestions (I'm flabbergasted). Where I live (Phoenix), I can give you my top 10 and then some. So I decided to on Brio and I've eaten at this restaurant before in Phoenix and was not impressed. Restaurant reminds me that of a Cheesecake factory, chain restaurant.  

They did seat us right away, which was nice. The bread came out and the group was having a fun time.  We are loud as ever and the noise level of the restaurant was loud so we didn't feel like we were bothering anyone with our obnoxious rants an laughs so that was good.  I ordered the gluten free grilled salmon with lemon and caper sauce. The flavor was ok. Nothing to rave about.

I wish I had better options to fit what I was looking for in my dining experience. At the end of the night, it wasn't the flavor of the food that made the night a "good" night.  It was the fact that a group of 11 was able to get together, talk and laugh as loud as we want, not cringe at the bill, and still be happy and full.

This is a great place to come in the Spring and Fall when you can sit outside on the patio with great weather.  During the Winter time, we like to come here and hang out in the bar area and have a glass of Wine or three.  We normally don't eat dinner here, but enjoy meeting friends and colleagues for lunch.

The last time we were here, I had the Bistecca Insalata (Wedge of Lettuce, Gorgonzola, Bacon, Roma Tomatoes & Creamy Parmesan Dressing, $5.25).....I love Gorgonzola Cheese and find it difficult to resist a Salad with it.

Overall, it's one of our favorite places for lunch.....looking forward to Spring and the outdoor dining!

Return Factor - 91%

How to have a 5-Star experience at this 4-star chain restaurant:

Bruschetta Quattro 5 star
Spicy Shrimp Eggplant 5 star
Steak Salad 4 star

Our dinner here was part of a Vegas deal that included dinner & a helicopter ride at night above the Vegas strip. So the shuttle dropped us off here before the flight informing us we had about an hour and a half before pick up. We were seated and then given a ticket receipt to show our server and then in turn order from their prix fixe menu. Our server some young guy was obviously annoyed by our dinner package and kept making it clear that gratuity was not included the deal. For drinks I ordered a bellini and for dinner we had a caesar salad & a wedge salad , along with their lasagna & a pasta dish I can't remember. The white sauce with the lasagna was a bit strange since I'm used to red sauces but it was good, everything was good. The restaurant seemed like a fancier version of olive garden but I enjoyed Brio's much more. The server was the only thing that made this visit unpleasant, his presence was scarce and I knew dinner included a dessert which he claimed to forget but seemed like he just wanted us out. Would like to return and experience a better dining experience.

I'm going to have to say the food is absolutely delicious!  Everything that was ordered satisfied my taste buds. Atmosphere outside is quite enjoyable.

On the service side, we thought it was strange and a bit rude that one of the waiters came through the gate outside. Which was right next to our table with a sign that read "this is not an exit" and moved a chair to get in and did not say, "excuse me." I guess it was an entrance? Lol

Also our waitress could have been less splashy on the water refills as she dripped all over the floor and splashed some on my friend and the table. 

Other than those little things it was great. Nothing that would stop me from eating here again. Do recommend!

Brio has been a reliable lunch spot whenever I have guests in town. It never failed us! 
Ambiance - Check
Service - Check
Food - Check
Location - Check
They have it all~~

One of my favorite Italian restaurants in town. I have been here for lunch, dinner, and happy hour. 

My favorite drinks are the Tuscan sangria and the strawberry basil smash. 

Both the Caesar and bistecca salads are good. Very fresh. 

Favorite pasta dishes are the lasagna, carbonara, and salmon angel hair. 

The chicken limone and lobster bisque are also very good. 

For happy hour the spicy shrimp with eggplant and the fried ravioli are my faves. 

I never have room for dessert here so no details there. 

Great place to eat outside on the patio or by the fire pits before or after shopping at Town Square.

Ok. First time at Brio. Excellent first impression by our server Amit. He was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and what suggested items to orders. Salmon was fantastic. Excellent presentation. My boyfriends cod was slightly dry, but we decided not to say anything.

It was two birthdays and we were surprised with two desserts. Creme brulee and caramel cheesecake. Delicious.

Overall, everything was wonderful and such a pleasant experience. Will definitely return for another dinner date

This place never let's me down. Consistent good food. I usually get the steak salad, which is always perfect. I try and sneak a couple bites of my friends food, so far I've tried the lasagna, shrimp risotto, both have been excellent. The bruschetta is the best in town. And the outside seating with fire pits puts this place on my number one list to eat at when I'm at town square. This is a pretty good spot for a chain restaurant.

Me n my boyfriend decided to do a little early birthday celebration for me  so we decided to try brio  ,the experience was very beutifull and amazing, we wore very satisfied with our service, the food and wine was amazing, we are looking forward to repeat this amazing dinner again. .great job for the service n to the cook,

I have always had good luck at Brio in Town Square for lunch, Happy Hour, and dinner.  Service is always good and the food and drinks are well made and full-flavored.  If you like Brio, I reccomend joining the MyBRIO REWARDS club.  You get a free meal on your birthday and various discount offers throughout the year.

This trip we came for lunch to try the new Lighter Side Menu.  About a 5 minute wait...not bad for lunch time.  Our server arrived right after we were seated for our drink order.  She was very attentive and super sweet.  I wish I remembered her name!  

I had the 5 oz Filet Brio with asparagus, cubed sweet potatoes, spinach, and roasted red peppers.  $19.95 and 365 cals.  It definitely tasted better than 365 calories...and was more filling as well!  The filet was cooked to a perfect medium rare, juicy and savory.  The portion size was just enough to share a few bites with my friend without feeling like I needed more.  For some reason I was expecting mashed sweet potatoes, but they were tiny roasted cubes and were delicious.  The asparagus, spinach, and red peppers were also prepared superbly.  All the ingredients complemented each other and the meal was delightful.  I will definitely get this again.  The price point seemed a couple dollars too high for lunch, but the meat quality was very good, so I cannot complain.

My friend had the Shrimp Mediterranean, also from the Lighter Side Menu.  $14.95/ 470 cals. It came with orzo & farro pilaf, feta, broccoli, spinach, and asparagus.  She let me sample her dish; it was very tasty and something I would order if I was not super hungry.  I think mine was more filling because of my protein choice.

All in all, another good Brio meal!

I can't begin to say how much I enjoyed this restaurant. If I had the money I would open one. The ambience was amazing and the food was delicious. We had the bruschetta sampler and I couldn't pick my favorite. The lobster bisque is out of this world. Service was a little slow but he was very nice and helpful. The best was the mini Creme br√ªl√©e. Yum. Found there's one in Irvine, I'm going again very soon.

Brio is a nice Italian restaurant in the heart of Town Square. The prices are affordable and comparable to any other chain restaurant found at a mall such as Cheesecake Factory. I like that they offer a number of gluten-free options including their pasta. The restaurant itself is huge with a nice high ceiling. Service was prompt and our waitress checked in on us frequently.

Lunch started off with a couple of appetizers including the beef carpaccio and calamari fritto misto. Although the carpaccio color appeared on the paler side, the actual beef mixed with greens, capers, and mustard aioli tasted delicious. I was disappointed that the calamari was on the soggier side. We were served the standard bread and Parmesan crisps, but I was annoyed by the ice cold and rock hard butter, which has always been a major pet peeve of mine. 

Lunch specials included a two course meal featuring a soup or salad plus a pasta dish. I got the lobster bisque, which was good, but on the salty side. I had a feeling that it was mostly filled with the shrimp to cover up for the lack of lobster meat. Nonetheless, it was a nice excuse to eat more bread. For my pasta dish, I got the campanelle carbonara. The plate was less than a full entree, but by that time I was getting pretty full. For drinks, they don't carry any beer on draft.

Although, I wasn't super impressed with the food, given the service, space, and prices, Brio is pretty fancy for a mall restaurant and a nice fit for Town Square.

I really enjoy eating here. One of my favorite's in Town Sq. Especially if I am in the mood for Italian. I believe this has overall a much higher quality of food than some of the other Italian chains out there. Decor and ambiance is also very inviting and pleasant. Its easy to wait for  a table as you are in the middle of town square or even head to the Brio bar and hang out. Overall a great experience every time I have gone.

I came here for a wedding reception and I was very upset with the service. 

First of all if your planning on having a wedding or any reception here, I don't recommend Brio Tuscan Grille for it. The room isn't very private, they don't have doors to close it off, they just have curtains. You can hear everyone in their main dinning room. The worst part was my table was by the kitchen. While the wedding party was saying their speeches, all I can hear was plates being bang left and right, the staff having LOUD conversations and overall a ton of feedback. 

The food that was severed was family style. We had a chicken dish (very dry), fish was pretty good (that's what my one star rating is for), pasta (was alright) bread and salad (not enough dressing). The food presentation was so messy and dirtying looking. 

Very upsetting on how they rushed us the whole dinner. They should have slowed down on clearing our plates and focused more on customers service and filling up our water. 

Lots of other restaurants in the areas to choose from.

Absolutely fantastic place!  My wife and I were recently in Las Vegas and stopped by here with a friend.  The server was excellent...and even brought some pizza dough to occupy my daughters attention!  I had a bruschetta sampler that was amazing.  Their wine selection was excellent.  We were even visited at our table by the executive chef.  After all was said and done, he paid for our meal and drinks!  Food, service, and decor all top notch in my book.  I do not give 5 star ratings easily!

Brio is a very pretty restaurant, and the food is not bad (although far from outstanding)....but it's so damn crowded, and the wait for a table is so long that I won't go there anymore.

On Wednesday, it was so jammed that when I asked the hostess how long the wait for a table would be, she said "oh, just 30 or 40 minutes".
I told her to never, ever, put the word "just" in front of a "30 or 40 minute wait".

There are many other Italian restaurants in Las Vegas where you will get better service, and better food.

I could eat here three times a week. Since I don't live close by I always seem to order the same thing. The beef carpaccio and spicy shrimp and eggplant are so good it is hard to go off the beaten path. The desserts are all delicious especially the tiramisu and cheesecake with berries. The wine list also has a lot of great options. There is not a better option the next time your at Town Square.

My boyfriend and I went last night and our server was very hospitable. I'm a server as well and it made me appreciate her patience with our dietary restrictions even more. Just a suggestion to mgmt is to keep staff up on table maintenance and cleanliness. When we sat our table had not been wiped, there was still coins on the table from a prior guest and the floor below us was filthy. It is a great & beautiful establishment. Keep up the good work. :)

I have been to this Brio location a couple times and each time has always been a great time! Whether with big groups or with just one other person, I've always gotten great service!

For this experience in particular, I decided to sit at the outside bar sonce the bar on the inside was already packed (also because the inside bar was a little too dimly lit for me). Upon sitting down, the bartender immediately greeted me and my friend and provided us with happy hour menus and asked if we had any questions regarding the menu. Her attitude was so nice, friendly and happy it instantly made me happy! I wish I had gotten her name. 

I ordered the sangria rosa which was honestly so yummy. It was just right and not too strong. Definitely wins my heart over the white or red sangria. 

For food I ordered the blackened shrimp with the eggplant. It was literally sooooo good and sooo filled with flavor and spice that I had to order it a second time. Definitely love coming to this Brio location especially for their HH!

Ordered to-go for a group of people at work. When I arrived, the hostess was rude and kept trying to look around me at people coming in. She handed me my bill, and when I handed it back with the credit card - she replied that it would be a few minutes in a snobby tone. 

The food was fine... probably the only thing that made me round up to 3 stars. 

Strawberry Balsamic Chicken Salad - good, lots of chicken, could use a little more Gorgonzola cheese. 

I also noticed that the Fettuccine Rusticca looked good. 

To go order was well prepared with utensils and napkins. Also included a bag of bread and crackers - both were pretty good.

One of my favorite spots to hang out at and do work. Very calm atmosphere, staff is friendly , food is good. The white peach sangria is my favorite on a hot day. It's typically my go to spot to meet my girlfriends, or can be a swanky place to meet for a business meeting. I've went to multiple locations and love where the owners have chosen to build the restaurants. Will definitely continue to go to brio.

As you can see I do not review very often (or at all). I felt this place should be reviewed though. I work long  hours and many days of the week and I happened to have some time off to spend with my wife and my 2yr old son. I thought it would be nice to go "try out the Italian place in Town Square." They have outdoor seating and I love Italian food. I have ate at many of the other restaurants there in Town Square but not Brio.

When we get there we asked to be seated outside since that was one of the reasons for choosing the place. We sit and wait a few minutes but not too long for the waiter to come by and take our drink orders. He leaves and is gone for a while but then comes back with waters which we didn't order but that is ok. Still waiting on my beer though. He eventually makes his way back to our table with my beer and takes our orders. 

After he leaves I take a nice big drink from my beer to realize the glass is dirty!! Now I'm a aircraft mechanic, I don't mind being dirty and have a certain tolerance for dirty, but when you charge 8 bucks for a beer I would like it in a clean glass or at least one that isn't sticky!!

Now I wait a while for the waiter to come back to let him know the glass is dirty so he can replace it. Once again he finally shows up so i could inform him of the issue. He apologizes and says he will be right back. He does come right back with a new glass and proceeds to pour the beer from the dirty glass to the "clean" one. No bullshit. Isn't that like scooping water from the toilet bowl and calling it clean? Needless to say I drank the water. 

I ordered one of the 14oz steaks since I was happy to spend time with the family. I ordered it medium because thats the way I like it. However, I got it well done, so well done the edges were burnt to s crisp! You got to be kidding me. A 30 dollar steak that you cooked all the flavor out of! I eat it because I am not the kind of person that will fuss about an overcooked steak only to get a properly cooked steak with spit in it. Especially after the dirty beer incident. 

I don't normally turn back food or complain since I am easily pleased but I think for a 100 dollar meal you should be pretty damn happy with all aspects of the service. 

I will never go here again! There are plenty of places to eat at Town Square and new ones are opening all the time. I'm hoping soon there will be a new opening in the Brio location. 

Do yourself a favor......eat somewhere else.

This place is spectacular. Great atmosphere and fantastic food. Our server was phenomenal and gave us great laughs while enjoying our meals. They even gave me an iced latte, which isn't something they typically make, and it was made perfectly. This place is great and I will certainly be making a trip back here again.

We came here for Valentine's Day and they were slammed. We had to wait 20 minutes after our reservation time to get seated. I understand the wait because apparently they had 1200 reservations today! We sat outside and our service was outstanding. Our server Joey R was awesome! He made sure our food came as quickly as possible and was just right. He was very funny and kept making jokes which is a huge plus in my book. He made handling so many customers seem easy and still spent time talking to each table. I love this place and had a great experience tonight!

Perfect place for a nice, classy, ladies night.  Drinks, and good food are always fun. Love drinking their sangria on the patio even though service does tend to be a little slower. Have had several dishes and their menu and all were good! Love the bread and oil! I really did enjoy their calamari and stuffed mushrooms! Lots of flavor and different selections! Fantastic deserts to chose from!
 I will say that it's not the best Italian food but, the ambience and service does make of for the food not being the greatest.

Ordered several items and drinks to try.  Some items tasted a bit salty to me. But overall had a nice experience.  The waitress was extra friendly. The high ceiling tuscan dining room was much more impressive than anticipated. Next time I would love to try the crab cakes.
This is a great place to eat . The food is amazing and the service is top notch .you'll the the happy hour as well.

All I know is that I sampled pizza throughout the Rise Up Japan bake sale, and it was pretty delicious pizza.  All the workers were pretty friendly.  One day I'll have to actually try this place out, though I'll probably wait until their Boca Park location opens.

Great food, excellent service, hits the spot every time. A+

Definitely recommend. Try the New York steak
Great hh here. $3 appetizer menu!  The quality was pretty good too. Drinks r only .50$ off tho

Olive Garden?

Italian restaurants are a dime a dozen and this is yet another chain eatery to add to the list.  BUT, it is a notch up from Olive Garden.  Food was good, drinks were passable and I left wishing I had spent my money at Montesano's instead.

This place was amazing! I was actually so full with my portion and I couldn't finish the whole thing. There are so many flavours and it touches every single centimetre of your Tuscan palate. Calamari is fantastic and we got out reservation within the half hour we called it in. Perfect service, and she was fantastic and talked to us a lot. The only problem was that no birthday wishes were sent to my mother--who had her 50th that night. I called it in through the phone and they said they would wish her a happy birthday, but nothing happened. 
Maybe I'll pull the waiter aside next time!!

I've visited this place a few times.. Went last night, and noticed their menu was different and that all their pastas and entrees do not come with complimentary soup/salad anymore! You have to pay $5 extra if you want a soup or salad!!! And all the prices went up!! My pasta dish was $19!!! It used to be about $16. My boyfriend got somewhat of a chicken Parmesan and that was $20!! And nothing special might I add! I will not b going to this place unless it's for an event or something it's definitely NOT WORTH IT!!

The best happy hour! Yes, they have good items in their non-happy hour menu but MAN for the quality + price in their HH menu u need to go!

HH is @ 3:30-6:30pm but I can't remember if it's mon-fri or mon-thursday, always call and ask!

HH FOOD 5/5:
-Beef Carpaccio ($5): WOW this was amazing. It's like raw meat but it's flavored really good. The plate they serve it in is also huge.
-Black Pepper Shrimp ($6): This plate doesn't taste like there's eggplant in it. IT IS SO DELICIOUS. Super soft and the shrimp doesn't taste fishy.
-I heard all the other items in HH are good, but I haven't ventured out to try them.

I used to work at a nearby store in Town Square and have been in this store for a few times now but only managed to write a review now due to the amazing service of our waiter Amit or Ameet (not sure exactly how you spell it). He was very accommodating, patient, and great with his recommendations (the eggplant/shrimp was sooooo good)! 

The location is great too, feels very fancy but welcoming. You can either dine inside or outside depending on the weather. 

The only thing I wish they would change is the complimentary bread coz it lacked a little bit of flavor and it wasn't warm, plus the butter they served was cold so it was a bit disappointing trying to spread some on the bread. I prefer a side of good olive oil and balsamic vinegar as opposed to cold butter.

My bf and I came here for our anniversary dinner. It was very easy to make reservations online.

The restaurant is very dim, interior was beautiful and classy. We went on a Sunday night and they seemed to be pretty busy but their service was very fast. We got our drinks and appetizer right away. Our food came not too long after that. Which was great! Usually places being that busy take quite awhile. 

We ordered calamari as an appetizer and blue moon and moscato for our drinks. My bf wasn't please with the blue moon coming from the bottle. But I was very pleased with the moscato and the calamari was good. For our entrees, I ordered lobster and shrimp fettuccine and my bf had the 8oz filet mignon. Although, my bf was disappointed that the steak was almost smaller than my fist.. both entrees were delicious!

Would come here again whenever I crave Italian!

I was very pleased with my experience at Brio. This was my first time in the town square area. My friend suggested coming here before dropping us off to catch our flight back home. I assumed they are a bigger city franchise, but it was still fun to try a place we don't have in lincoln. Service was exquisite and our waiter was very nice in answering our questions and frequently refilling our waters. We all opted for the lunch combos-reasonably priced and ended up being the perfect amount of food. I got the pasta brio with the red pepper sauce, chicken, and mushrooms over rigatoni. It had really good flavor in the sauce and was evenly portioned with the chicken and mushrooms. I also got Caesar salad for my side and loved it. It was the type of creamy but yet still oily homemade Caesar I expect at Italian restaurants like this. My husband got the fettuccini Alfredo and liked his dish as well. My friend said the tomato basil soup was one of the best she'd ever tried. They made sure we had enough bread and got a second basket as well. I really enjoyed the seasoned flatbread, in addition to the traditional bread that was served. This was a great meal to have before getting on the plane-filling but not overly stuffed or something that is going to make you feel sick after. I'd try brio again! Nice, clean ambiance similar to that of an Olive Garden but still with a casual feel so you don't feel obligated to dress up.

Came in and my friends had already been seated, and actually ordered already.  As soon as I sat down, our server handed me a menu and took my drink order (strawberry lemonade FTW!);  She quickly returned with my beverage, and I was ready to order... Steak salad.  Weird, I thought, but it turned out to be soooooo good!  Our service continued to be on point, and we left quite satisfied.  The mini size desserts are perfect to complete any meal.  I had a cute sized creme brulee that didn't leave me overwhelmed.  I will be back here next time I'm in Vegas. The location in Town Square is great.  There's meter parking right outside.  Covered free parking also available for those who don't mind a short walk.
Pretty delicious reasonably prices. Went for brunch. The chips with the chipotle chicken sandwich not the best rather have had fresh fruit instead.

Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (33 of 365). I have a lot of catching up to do!

This 5 star review is for their Sunday Brunch. Although, I can say that their week night dinners there are just as yummy.  But their Brunch I have to say, is super yummy!  For dinner, I like their lobster ravioli; exceptional!

As for my lovely brunch, they mix their early morning mimosas and bloody mary's real well.  They have like 3 different kinds of eggs benedicts.  My friends and I decided to order all of them to to try.  We had your normal canadian bacon, another one with shrimp and crab, and a very different one: chorizo and chicken.  All of them were so good.  You must try them all!

To top off our buffet of eggs benedicts, we shared the Rasberry creme stuffed French Toast.  Nice 3 big slices that we each had or own good individual piece.  All of this was to die for.  We will definitely be back for Sunday brunch!  

Fair warning: there is quite a wait for the brunch.
We were there for a birthday party. Service was great, as was the food. We really enjoyed ourselves and the ambiance contributed to the good time.

Brio Tuscan Grille has become our new hotspot.  We love it.

Food is always fresh and delicious

Service never fails and the restaurant is gorgeous!

Sourdough and crispy thin bread basket is fabulous, but don't fill up save it for your entree!

Risotto with chicken and sweet potato. Yum!

Caprese just like I had in Sicily...fresh tomato and greens with buffalo mozzarella, olive oil, and balsamic with the perfect amount of S&P.  

Amazing service-everyone was smiling and very friendly, nice hostess, great waitress, love the kids menu which offers healthy alternative like salmon, broccoli and mashed potato's one of the reasons we come here...it's my child's favorite!

Four Seasons Service!

I will be back!

Came here to meet up with a couple of yelpers.  We sat at the bar area to try their happy hour bar food.  I had a strawberry lemonade and as far as happy hour food goes I had the spicy shrimp and eggplant, beef carpaccio, and shrimptini.  

The spicy shrimp and eggplant wasn't that spicy, it was perfect.  The sauce was great, if I was at olive garden I would grab a garlic bread and wipe the plant clean.  The beef carpaccio was delightful.  I wanted to chew on the beef like a piece of bubble gum until the flavor ran out.  The salad had just the right amount of dressing.  The shrimptini is your regular shrimp in a martini glass.

The happy hour goes: 
Monday - Friday from 3:30pm-6:30pm & Monday-Thursday 9pm-Close.

Stop by, if you can find a seat, and enjoy a quick snack while you shop around!

This is my favorite restaurant. The food is delicious and the service is always good. They stay open until 11pm. I finished my meal off with two deserts: cheesecake and cream br√ªl√©e! Delicious I must say!!!

I've been 4 times now.  I continue to have a "meh" opinion.  Food is OK.  Certainly overpriced.  Comparable in quality to other chain Italian joints but higher in price.

The service is always great and the happy hour is really nice.  Worth a visit but don't expect GREAT food.

When I hit up Vegas I don't usually hit up restaurants.  I know some of you are probably thinking... Why not?  Don't they have tons of great restaurants out in the City of Gluttony?   True that... But!  Remember!  This is also home to endless scrumptious buffets as well!  How can I let that slide right?  Ok... so I ended up at a restaurant this time around... Buffets I'll see you on my next trip.

Stopped by this hidden shopping plaza near the South end of the strip... Yes!  There is one real nice shopping mall and it's not an outlet!  (Town Square)  This plaza is totally nice and especially during the winter time coz it's got such a cozy feel to it... since we were looking for food, we came, we searched, and we landed at Brio Tuscan Grille.

Initially I thought I wasn't going to like it, but I'm glad that I was wrong.  Let me tell you why this is definitely a place that I'd go back again...

D√©cor:  Awesome!  Interior design at this place rivals those at the Grand Lux caf√© except much fancier!  Dim, beautiful lighting, and awesome outdoor patio with a fire pit for a nice little gathering should you have a large party.

Food was actually more tastier than I was expecting...  Here were just the few that I've sampled

-Calamari:  Flash fried to perfection with aioli dipping sauce, yum!
-Penne Gorgonzola:   Off the hook good with just the right amount of sauce
-Fettuccine Rustica:  Just ok... not enough sauce for my taste
-Chipotle Chicken and Bacon Panini:  One of the best sandwiches I've had!  The bread was toasted beyond perfection to a point that it is crispy yet chewy!!! Not sure how that happened but I really need to try more paninis and see if they all taste this good!  Then the chipotle flavor coupled with load of chicken was just awesome!  (Yes, this was my dish!)

Service was wonderful too!  Water was always filled to the rim without requesting them to come by to do so, and they also allow dogs to be right by the gate so our buddies can share some food with us!  (not inside but at least near us)

Price:  Very reasonable!  Majority of the dishes for lunch runs no more than $15 and good portions too!

If you are in the Sin City and craving Italian, do help your wallet a favor by giving this place a visit instead of some fancy Italian joint inside the casino... you won't regret it!

So glad we ended up here last night!

We started off at Texas De Brazil but the wait was over and hour and a half! Then we tried Tommy Bahamas and they were closed for a private event!

Finally we happened upon Brio and their wait was over an hour!

We slipped into the bar and as fate would have it a table was getting up to leave right as we walked in!! So we swooped the table like the stealthy women we are and all was right with the world.

We had an amazing server! We had a few drinks and I have to say their Raspberry Mojito is a must try!

We started with the Carpaccio appetizer and it was absolutely heavenly. Like I'm crazing it right now at 8:00AM just writing about it good.

For our main course we had the Steak salad and the Salmon salad. Both were ginormous portions and incredibly tasty. Neither of us were able to finish them and we left incredibly satisfied!

This will definitely be a go to for girls night!

I have lived in Europe and wanna-be-Italian restaurants in the States are just always disappointing to me. The only thing I liked there was the fresh bread. My husband ordered the grilled salmon over angel hair pasta and I had the risotto. The grilled salmon was very plain and almost dry.. really nothing special. A small piece of salmon over a bed of pasta... The risotto almost made me cry.. It had BACON in it! The bacon flavor was so overwhelming I really couldn't eat it. Don't give me wrong I do like bacon BUT not in ITALIAN risotto... Thats just wrong! Sorry! Service wasn't perfect either.. We paid about $40 for 2 people (small appetizer included) no drinks and I left the restaurant hungry and unsatisfied.

The staff is always very attentive and the food is solid. There is nothing amazing about this restaurant it's consistent. I feel this 
may be my most ambivalent review yet but I am just not moved emotionally either way on Brio. I will go pro vs con and see if that helps. 
Pro . Nice beef carpaccio 
con. Not many anti-pasta you would expect. Marinated Veg, Charcuterie, or maybe roasted carciofi 
pro. Nice size pasta bowl 
con. Although I love Ricotta and Vodka sauce this dish was a little 
blah. 
pro. Outdoor seating 
con. chair was so tight and uncomfortable I found myself fidgeting the whole time
pro. Cold Peroni and glass
con. Dirty glass
pro. location is very convinent
con. Chain(BBRG)
I am gonna go with 3 strong stars just can't go 4 on this one.

On a recent trip to Town Square to return some items, a friend and I decided to eat lunch at Brio Tuscan Grill. It was around noon on a Friday, and since there was a wait to sit inside we decided to sit on the patio. 

The overall attitude of the hostess worried me a bit... She wasn't welcoming, did not try to engage us in any conversation, walked way ahead of us, and did not check to see if we were ok with the table she put us at. And we weren't, as soon as our waiter came to take our drink orders we asked to be moved to an area that was slightly shaded. 

After checking over the menu I was unable to decide so I decided to ask  our waiters to help. We had multiple waiters, one was being trained by the other. Between the snooty hostess and trainee-waiter this could have been a disastrous lunch but thankfully the waiters  did a great job together. They convinced me to to try the citrus garden salad with shrimp. My friend had  the mezza chicken under the brick. 

The bread did not come out until after our food, but our food did come out pretty quickly. My salad was huge, had lots of perfectly cooked shrimp and the linguine was surprisingly good, which made me happy since I was worried I wouldn't like noodles on a salad. The dressing was a light lemon vinaigrette, and the dried cranberries and pecans were nice compliments to the cilantro and peppers. 

Based on how quickly she devoured it, I think the mezza chicken under the brick was pretty good as well! 

Total damage for our 2 lunches and 2 ice teas was right around $30 before tip. I am looking forward to visiting Brio again during happy hour.

My first time to Brio Tuscan Grille.  I know, I know...I've been missing out.  I love me some Italian food, even though I don't get to eat it much.  Based on their menu, there's enough of a selection for everyone.  

There's even a "Lighter Side Menu", which I chose to partake in. Lighter side choices range from lean steaks, chicken, salmon, salads, and some white fish (i.e. Mahi Mahi and Tilapia). Of course, I went with their 5 oz Filet Brio.  This was served with asparagus and sweet potato.  You can't go wrong with grilled asparagus and their sweet potato was amazing.  My only issue with both...wish I had more.  As for their 5 oz filet, I had this cooked medium-well.  In the last 2 weeks I've had steak at least 3 other times at well respected steakhouses.  No joke...I think Brio's was up there in tenderness, taste, and presentation.  My entree was less than 400 calories and a little over $20.  Bang for your buck without a bang on your nutrition!

The ambiance was great. You gotta love the tall ceilings.  Our server was great as well. I know that this is an Italian restaurant and I didn't get anything Italian.  But their steaks are good and for that alone, I am a fan.  


YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE 2013 - (485/500)
Nice Italian place. Food is nice, service is amazing, and my girlfriend and I all had a great night at here. Thank you Brio.

Matt r was a great server it was my first time coming and had a great experience to be honest we were going to Texas day Brazil but for some stupid reason they're closed at lunchtime on Mondays and Tuesdays so we ended up here and it was probably better the Hostess were hot too 


Back again and LOVE jessica from Ohio.  Great service.  So friendly.  She was so nice I'm not even gonna leave the comment part about how they messed up my pasta and it came out 15 minutes later....    oppps just did.   But the food and service was great

Indulged in happy hour today! Great drinks and very reasonably priced appetizers (under $3) until 6:30 at the bar, who could ask for anything more? The bar was busy, but finding seating was not too difficult. The service was great and bartenders attentive. We tried about half of the appetizers on the happy hour menu and all were great! The steak brochette, their version of the shrimp cocktail, breaded ravioli's exceptional. I had a Bellini (which is a frozen drink at Brio), which was perfect sitting at the patio bar on a warm evening. Brio is going on the "must frequently visit" list!
great food..spicy shrimp with egg plant and lamb chaps are amazing

A much better place than CPK. 
The food quality is better and the customer service as well. 
AND THEY HAVE RAVIOLI!!! I love their fettuccines. The flavor, texture, everything is perfect. My favorite is their artichoke dip appetizers. Omg, i get this every time before i order our entrees. I am a very loyal customer so once you get me going, i will return. And this is my second time here. 
My first time was the best. The waiter was also the server and he looked like he enjoyed working there. If i was able to request who my waiter is, and if I remembered his name, i would have done it in a heartbeat. Unfortunately, i cant because the second time, the customer service was so off. My waiter was great and friendly, but my server was not. He just threw the bread onto the table(it even slid upwards). Like wtf? Crapper server. Pissed me off. And then when he brought my dish, he left the plate half hanging off the table in front of me. It could have easily fallen all onto me but I grabbed it and pushed it in. Something he should have done because I can easily burn myself from that. Usually, all the waiters will tell you to not touch the plate. This guy just leaves it half hanging from the table and expect you to take care of it yourself. Also, when he came to pay time, i waited for a long while and had to ask someone else if I can get the check and to go box. :/ my waiter just disappeared on us. 

However, i will still leave this a 5/5 because i personally love all the other waiters. Especially the waiter from our first time being here. He was so ecstatic to serve us and take our order. He has really good opinions on what to eat and everything. The food itself has always been delicious. The first and the second time, I can honestly say I rather go to brio than cpk. The pricing is only $2-$5 more expensive than cpk but its also $2-$5 worth more than cpk.

*edited, changed it to 4/5 since the manager here completely avoided my concern about how the server during my second visit was rude.

Pleasantly surprised at the quantity and quality of food here.  The kids meal portions are HUGE!  I cannot see a kid actually finishing their meal here.  Though I thought the food here was a bit on the salty side, the food was tasty.  Service was average.  Prices a little on the high-side.

Great food, reasonable price, good ambience.  Always some talent to see. I would recommend either a Friday for the bustling energy or the happy hour specials. Best time to be here.  I will have to say that the service could be better.

I love this place. Its good simple Italian Food, drinks are great and the service is on top of it. The moment you walk in they are very welcoming and happy. 

The Best: Food Food Food
I love a simple pasta with great service.
My girlfriend and I especially enjoy the desserts! Lava Cake! Amazing

Brio Rocks

Our server, Robert, was great. He knew just when to approach our table and when to give us a moment to have our dinner and socialize with our friends. I would give 5 starts if the salmon salad I had was better. The salmon portion was delicious. However, the salad portion needs some changes... for one, the asparagus still has its stalks and therefore you had to spit out chunks of the end instead of being able to consume it whole. The salad was also a bit mushy... I'm not sure how to change this, but if it can be done, I would highly recommend it. And lastly, the forks can use an upgrading. I was thankful to have an extra fork to use when the first one felt as though the prongs were bent in different ways... unfortunately, the second was similar in fashion although not as severe. 
That being said, the atmosphere was great! We'll be back and I'd love to try a different dish.

My boyfriend and I received a gift card to brio and we decided to try this place out for an early Valentine's Day lunch. Everything from the ambiance to the service was fantastic! The decorations all around were beautiful, and the high ceilings with the curtains really caught my eye. 

Our server, Cortney, did an amazing job coursing out our food and handled all of our requests. 
We had calamari and the shrimp & eggplant for appetizers. The runner who brought them out even said they were the two best things on the menu for appetizers, and he was right! The shrimp and eggplant had a peppercorn sauce and grated cheese. SO DELICIOUS. And the calamari had fried peppers in it and came with two sauces, one that was tomato based and the other mayonnaise. For entrees, my boyfriend had crab stuffed shrimp and lobster tail. He didn't care for the orzo and broccoli on the side, but I found it delightful! It also came with lobster bisque!!! And I love lobster bisque. I had the chicken limone. Delicious was an understatement. It was seasoned perfectly & nice and tender. I am so sad that I was too full from the apps to finish it, but at the same time, i can't wait to warm it up later  Cortney boxed up our calamari and my chicken and even gave us to go sauce for the calamari. Her kind smile and great service really made our first time experience a great one! 

Overall, from the low prices, big entrees, cute decor, and amazing service, we will definitely come back!

I have been to Brio a few times for happy hour, full-on dinner, and just drinks when shopping at Town Square. As another reviewer mentioned, I am not especially 'jazzed' to be writing a review for a chain like this.. but it is what it is. 

Had this never been a part of Town Square I would not ever have heard of it I don't believe. So having said that.. I had come in for dinner a few times. I am that guy when it comes to a non-belief in "American Style Italian" or whatever Brio claims to be.

As for the quality of the food.. it isn't bad.. just nothing spectacular. Lately My friends and I have been dropping in for Happy hour on Thursdays as they have a $5 'martini' menu along side their daily happy hour of $2.95 'Tuscan Tasters'' .. 

The thing is, they get so swamped with customers during happy hour, that the service gets seriously patchy. I'm totally down for someone hustling amongst the tables they are waiting on, just trying to do the job and make some descent money.. in fact I can appreciate it. It's the consistent mistakes on the bill, the negative attitude, especially fromt he bar staff, and the disregard for any style of customer service from the staff. There is constant conversation about everything but work, and in a very loud way. 

I honestly know that this is literally a step in some direction from a place like 'Chili's" or 'Friday's" but with the environment of a bit higher end restaurant that they are trying to create.. you would hope for more is all I am saying. 

In the end of it all, I would be back for the Happy Hour.. as it's good prices and descent nosh when you are shopping or heading to a movie.. but I think I will be looking for other options when I am next down at Town Square. Happy Eating!

We always enjoy our dining experience here...
I love the atmosphere-the high vaulted ceilings,the lighting,outside seating is neat too accompanied by a fire pit for those chilly nights. It is so pretty inside like you are about to be a witness at a wedding!!!
The service is quick & I never encountered  a rude employee (yet)...

This place is one of the few places that my daughter enjoys (too picky)!!!
There hasn't been a dish that I have sent back. The bread basket is not only filled with soft bread but you get crispy flat bread with sesame seeds as well...The Pasta Fra Diavolo (Spicy Shrimp wih Angel hair pasta), Cheese Ravioli, Ravioli Caprese(Crispy Cheese Ravioli) & the Wedge Salad are just a few of our favorites. 
I just tried Fettuccine Napoli which has Smoked chicken,carmelized onions, broccoli, tomatoes,& chili flakes. The chili flakes is what sold me and sadly, I felt these chili flakes were just flakes minus all the chili. Not spicy at all-what happened ? I also had to add salt (I hate having to add salt to anything).
So even though this dish was a miss for me I can still appreciate that just because this is a good restaurant doesn't mean you are going to like everything. Brio can tend to be pricey....
We will be back....

Came here for a friends birthday.  It was about 12 of us in total.  Everything started off great until it was time to recognize the birthday boy.  (I'm going to rewind about an hour into our dining there was a birthday party in front of or table. About 4 waiters sang happy birthday and lit the birthday dessert as well as clapped and celebrated which is what I've always been accustomed to when parties are being celebrated at restaurants). Proceeding with our dining it was time to celebrate our birthday boy with the same song and excitement.  1. Our waiter LIED and said the restaurant DOES NOT SING HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO GUESTS.  2. THEY BROUGHT OUT HIS CUPCAKE, QUIETLY SO PPL AT THE OPPOSITE END OF THE TABLE DIDN'T EVEN REALIZE IT HAD BEEN BROUGHT OUT. The reason this irritates me is don't lie to me after I just witnessed your courtesy to other patrons and don't hush hush a celebration that was shared at your establishment.  3 stars because the food was good.. took long to come out though.  No refills on drinks,  waiter seemed overwhelmed and irritated.. felt rushed out even though people were still ordering desserts.. I won't be back.

I've had several very enjoyable meals here in the past.  I would strongly suggest the spinach artichoke appetizer!  I've never been disappointed!

My mom and I decided to stop for a snack while we were in Town Square.  We tried the tasters menu...$2.95 each.  So good!  We had the raviolis and baked mozzarella brushetta.  Very satisfying!  Hit the spot!  Nice little portions, perfect for splitting.  We agreed ordering 1 or 2 more would've made for a filling meal.  

We both really enjoyed the food and portion sizes.  However, our favorite part of coming here was the service!  You have to sit in the bar or outside on the couches to order the tasters menu.  We sat at the bar and actually had 3 different bartenders waiting on us!  Each was more pleasant than the next!  Very nice to have attentive service!  Each of us are planning on inviting co-workers or friends for a happy hour to enjoy the tasters.

Not impressed. I'd been to Brio twice before (once here and once in California) and this time, out with friends, will probably be my last time. While our waitress was very nice, she was forever missing in action and when she would take our table of 8 drink orders, she'd return with only 5-6 drinks, the others would sit thirsty. We'd flag her down and politely ask if our drinks were coming and she's look through her notepad and look confused, then 10 minutes later deliver our remaining drinks to our parched friends. Salads and appetizers ordered, again, a salad is missing and as two of the three appetizers are brought to the table, the third elusive appetizer never arrives. Meal orders placed, all miraculously arrive. I ordered the Pasta Fra Diavolo, which, by its name alone signifies it is a spicy dish. Ugh, no. Quite flavorless honestly. Bland as the napkin on my lap. My husband ordered the Under the Brick (or something like that) Chicken, he said it was not very good, again, lacking in flavor and depth, he was disappointed. Other items ordered was steak which was said to taste very gamey and sat on the plate next to the watery mashed potatoes. Lobster and Shrimp raviolis were said to be okay, but not fantastic. The friend who ordered the Blackened Tilapia said it was very good, however the plate next to her was the Chicken Milanese was not good at all, overly salted and dry. 
Our check took forever to be delivered. Once we paid it was $113 per couple, including a cocktail each. I usually am not super high maintenance, but I felt like I had to beg for a refill of water or the check. The food was not toothsome as one would hope. Big let down.

Our waitress was awesome!  She had us right at a little table next to the bar at a couch where I could put my feet up.  They were busy back there making drinks, yet she was super attentive and down-to-earth.  I had the margherita pizza and it was heavenly.  My husband had a pasta dish that was amazing and I kept stealing his side of vegetables.  The bruschetta is amazing too!  This is a great place to stop any time of day if you are doing a little shopping in Town Square.

The service was great, very attentive to our needs.  The food was fabulous, flavorful and elegant.   Cooked to perfection.   We had the Gorgonzola created steak medallions and spicy shrimp with eggplant.   If we lived closer I'd eat here all the time.   Way to go Brio crew, Chris was our waiter and did an excellent good meeting our needs.

Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant! I probably eat here 2-4 times a month (especially happy hour, can never go wrong with happy hour), it's just that good! Once you come in, there's kind of like, an Italy-feel atmosphere. Which I love because it feels like I'm eating lunch or dinner somewhere in Italy. 

Their service is PERFECT, they're very welcoming and always introducing themselves in a friendly manner. I come here too often to the point where they recognized who I am and my order, kind of embarrassing but at the same time, am proud to be a regular! 

Unto the food, so far I've only tried their tuscan grilled pork chops, beef carpaccio (this appetizer is a MUST), filet mignon, and some pasta. ALL of it were perfectly cooked. I'm very picky when it comes to eating meat and I'm just so glad I found a restaurant that are consistent with grilling their steaks. Although, I've been ordering my usual (pork chops and carpaccio) the last couple of visits, I think it's time to expand my options, but I shouldn't have to worry about getting something that I won't like because brio never disappoints. I highly recommend this place!
We thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant.  The ambiance was wonderful. The food and service were amazing!

Brio is one of my favorite places, especially for the Lasagna, but today was a huge disappointment! I ordered the Eggs Benedict with asparagus and potatoes. The eggs were fully cooked through, the potatoes were cold and hard, and the asparagus was dry and wilted! The best part of the meal was the Mango Mojito! If I return it will only be for the Lasagna and Mojitos!!
Despite the noisy open air atmosphere, I loved the food. Calamari is awesome and pasta is fresh.  Cheesecake was so-so.

We came on the evening of Black Friday - there was a 20 minute wait for the indoor seating but they could seat us right away outdoors. We were hungry so we chose to brave the elements. It was a bit chilly - to be certain. We were glad for our jackets and I ordered a hot chocolate.

The decor was nice, outdoor tables could maybe use a few more heaters on the cold evenings. We loved the idea of the fire pit though it's not super comfortable for dining - better for drinks/appetizers I suspect.

We started with the ravioli appetizer. It was quite good, though perhaps could have used just a tad more tomato/marinara sauce.

I ordered the steak and I have to say it was one of the best steaks I've ever had. Perfectly cooked, much larger than I expected, perfectly seasoned.  Nicely done sides of mashed potatoes and vegetables.  Really outstanding. The rest of the table seemed to enjoy their dishes as well.

Service was friendly, professional and attentive.  He made a small mistake on the check in not crediting our free appetizer coupon but immediately recognized and fixed it with an apology.  

The only downside I can think of was it being a bit chilly, but we can't fault Brio for the weather. Look forward to going back on our next trip to Vegas.

Unfortunately my family and I had the worst experience eating here tonight. The only positive was the view while eating outside. The lobster bisque soup we had was not only cold but tasted terrible. Then my brother had the lasagna which was also cold and tasted terrible he couldn't eat it. My pasta had no flavor whatsoever. Very disappointed. Why was that kind of food given out. I'm just in shock.

I do like Brio regardless of its "chain status." It has never been a disappointment to the palate. I decided to come here for lunch....I've never been! I ordered the Crab/Shrimp Cakes.....delicious! If you are starving, I wouldn't recommend this plate or you can order an appetizer if you are that hungry. There were large pieces of shrimp and it was tasty, but a lil on the small side. It came with crunchy potatoes (much like potato chips) and some zucchini, carrots, onions and red pepper mix. My favorite entree from Brio are the pork chops. Their pork chops have always been so tender and juicy...its literally to die for. Yum! As always, me and my sweet tooth....loves the creme brulee sampler. I like Brio and I can't deny it.

I always enjoy my time here. The food and ambiance is amazing. What I order: Artichoke Crusted Fliet Mignon with mashed potatoes, house salad, Shrimp Verduta (angel hair tossed in artichokes, shrimp, garlic, sun dried tomatoes, feta, spinach, with pesto and bread crumbs), and their white peach sangria. My family usually orders all of these and splits. My mom always asks if I want to check out other restaurants when I am back home, but I always insist on going to Brio.

Came to Brio for their happy hour. It was Bomb Diggity! Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant is a must! Outside seating is sooo pleasant. 

As for service that depends on the person. I sat in two different areas. The first server wasn't too pleasant, but the second was phenomenal!

One BIG complaint... although outside seating is wonderful, there happy hour outside seating is not so nice... limited to about 12 - 20 people. One star off for that one.

I'm totally coming back here y'all, oh lord. Right off the bat, the place can be loud and busier than other restaurants, but given the location, I think this is expected. 

I came here for dinner with my mom and her friend and we started with a round of drinks at the bar. I ordered my usually Moscow Mule and was underwhelmed. Maybe it's because I had been sick a little earlier in the week, but it definitely did not rank as one of my top favorites. 

The food totally made up for the drink though!! We started with the Calamari and the Bruschetta Trio Sampler. I've never had bruschetta, but I really enjoyed it, especially the one with the prosciutto, ricotta and bell peppers. I think this was the chef special for the night, but I hope it's available for more than one night. 

For dinner, I had the Lobster and Shrimp Fettuccini and WOW YALL. So good!! Slight spice, wonderfully creaminess and a portion that was out of this world ($22.50 I believe and I still took some home). 

For dessert, we had the New York Style Cheesecake and Creme Br√ªl√©e. I love me a good creme br√ªl√©e, and this was def one of the best ones I've had. I wouldn't have ever come to this restaurant on my own, so I'm really glad my mom and her friend decided to take a different route for dinner.

Came here for the happy hour which recommended by my friend that lives in Vegas but I guess we came on the wrong day because it wasnt happy hour. She said that all appetizers were $2-$3 and drinks and that was what i was hoping.....well, since we were all already here we just order some drinks and some appetizers.  Suprisingly it was not too expensive but would rather have it during happy hour though!

Pretty nice atmosphere especially the female bartenders!! They're pretty hot!! Great location which is right in the middle of the mall but the parking is horrible.  Maybe because we came here during New Years weekend, bad choice.  Highly recommend this place.

We've been to Brio every time we visit Vegas and never had a bad meal or service until the evening of Monday April 20th. We were disappointed with the lack luster service (if you could even call it service) and room temperature food. Cold mashed potatoes are just gross and a server that is never around is just sad. It's to bad because the food is usually awesome and in the past we loved the creme br√ªl√©e enough to make a special effort to go there when we're in town. With so many other restaurants to choose from, Brio will not be one on our list again for a long time if ever.

I've been to this restaurant numerous times over the past few years and I just can't resist coming back. Whether I'm meeting with friends for an early Sunday brunch or grabbing a quick cocktail after work during happy hour, I'm always thrilled with the quality service I receive. Not to mention, their happy hour prices are insanely cheap! My favorite combo is the red sangria and the black pepper shrimp, which are a part of the regular happy hour menu, but if you're looking to spice it up a bit, each location has their own set of chef specials so you can always try something new to please your tastebuds and add a bit more variety to your pallet.

My partner and I decided to give Brio a second chance. This time, our experience was so great! Our waitress was super sweet and attentive. The food and drink suggestions were accurate based on her observations.  It was a much pleasant visit.  We were very satisfied about the entirety of our food and our service.
I want to thank the general manager for taking time to make sure we were taken care of.
It made us feel welcomed and comfortable.
I will continue to give my patronage to Brio.

There was nothing overtly above-average about this restaurant that would warrant a solid thumbs up. We walked in with no reservation, and when we were seated prior to our estimated wait time we were pleased. That came to an end by the time we were seated. We waited around 10 minutes to be introduced to our waitress and get our orders in. There was an average of 20 minute increments between getting our drinks (besides water) food, any refills and the check. This was a Thursday evening towards the end of the night, no reason at all for service to take that long.
As far as the food goes, it was okay. The spinach dip appetizer was hot and full of flavor, definitely a large enough portion to share with 3-4 people. I had the Campanelle Carbonara which had an overwhelming flavor of bacon. It literally took over the entire dish. My boyfriend had the Chicken Limone which was a nice well-rounded entree between the meat and veggies. Dessert was a Torta Di Cioccolata and was the best part of the entire meal- melted chocolate inside the cake complements very nicely with the scoop of vanilla gelato.
Maybe we'll come back for Happy Hour next time, I've heard good things. Hopefully we score with better service than this evening.

Ambiance was good, service was good but the food was forgettable. Nice outdoor seating for the fall or spring season, view of the passing traffic, foot and vehicle. Their dessert was their savior and only reason why I am giving them 3-Stars. 

They had shot glasses filled with different desserts: Vanilla Creme Brulee, Milk Chocolate Caramel Cake, Tiramisu and Strawberry Cheesecake. We, husband and I, shared them. I like little samplings like this in places that you're unfamiliar with their food, it allows you to taste some of their desserts without having to order a large portion of something that you may not like. 

Brio isn't a place that I'll be visiting again, at least any time soon. I wasn't wow'd by anything that they had. The dessert was good but not outstanding.

3 Stars - Food. The bruschetta was good but not outstanding.  Insalata caprese was very good with nice mozarella.  The pasta vodka was overspiced, overcooked, and unimpressive.
2 Stars - Atmosphere. Much of the silverware was dirty and had to be sent back before we even started. The restaurant itself was very loud and felt more like a shopping mall than a restaurant. 
1.5 Stars - Staff.  Bored, unattentive, and seemed bothered when we ordered. 
1 Star - Price.  Go elsewhere to get intimate or authentic.  Come here if you want to show off poor spending choices for a friend or relative you don't particularly like.

My wife and I came for a quick lunch during one of our visits to LV.  Knowing that we were in a little rush, they brought our food quickly with a smile. The service was courteous and speedy. Try the creme br√ªl√©e!

This review is only for their happy hour. I came here a while back for their dinner menu, but I don't remember my experience then. That'll be a future review.

Their happy hour is legit. I would say better than Yardhouse happy hour, but then again I'm not a big fan of Yardhouse. Their food menu is great. Multiple options for only $3.95 each!!! And drink specials are only $5!! And they aren't little skimpy appetizers either. Order about 2 or 3 items along with drinks, you'll definitely get full (well at least I did.) 

We ordered the spinach artichoke dip, shrimp piccante, margherita flatbread, brio burger and 4 cocktails. All came out to $35!!! Not bad for an afternoon of food and drink. Their peach sangria was definitely tastey and I was already on my second one even before the food came. All the items we ordered were delish. Good portions with a lot of flavor on each. Easy to share and reasonable on the price. The bar was busy so the bartenders weren't really on the chatty side. In conclusion, I would say this was a successful happy hour!!!

Honestly,the best place I've eaten at! 
Definitely the best Italian place we've ever eaten! 
So so SO good!! Our server was amazing as well! Just great time overall. Can't rave enough!
All their food are super delicious, love the ambiance, and their waiters are friendly and will be there whenever you need them.

Brio is one of my favorite places in Town Square. The decor is beautiful and they have great food. I have been here several times and the service is usually great. I feel like it is better when you sit at table rather than the bar. I prefer to come here during happy hour (3:30 to 6:30 pm) because the prices are more reasonable. They also have a late happy hour which I believe starts at 9 or 9:30pm. They have the most delicious shrimp and eggplant dish that is available for happy hour.  It is called the SPICY SHRIMP & EGGPLANT Pan seared shrimp, Romano crusted eggplant, black pepper cream sauce for $12.75 regular and half off for happy hour. I also love their Imported Bottled Peach Tea peach tea. SAN BENEDETTO for $3.25 each. They also have a nice kids menu with activities and crayons to keep them busy when I bring my 8 and 5 year old. They loved the food and feel like we are going to a fancy place because everything is so clean and nice. Town square has a lot to offer so if you drink here you can head to Blue Martini afterwards to dance.

Located in town square. 
Wonderful ambiance and awesome happy hour. 
Great place to grab a bite to eat after doing some retail therapy. 

Outdoor patio. 
Full bar. 

Brio is somewhere in between Olive Garden and an authentic Italian restaurant. Not horrible, but not quite THERE on the amazing Italian restaurant list. 

All the waiters are incredibly friendly. If you aren't in the mood for pasta they have healthy salads and meat dishes available as well. 

Come here after shopping in town square, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come to this restaurant.

I wish they had an option for less than one star-- my mom and I came in for happy hour and found a high top- sat and waited for over 15 minutes without anyone even greeting us. We walked out and they lost a customer out of both of us.

The best happy hour menu! Their beef carpaccio and brio burger are my two favorites! The only thing is that their happy hour is only at the bar and its first come first serve. It gets filled up pretty fast so you have to get there early.

Service was terrible. Horrible. 
I spoke to the manager about it at the time and he was unwilling to do anything for us, explaining that "the person was new and it was a busy day."

then I yelped it, and the manager or owner (like on several reviews here) wrote to me assuring they'll make things "right" if I'll remove my Yelp review. 

I did so. That was four months ago. We tried again, but were treated about the same.

I wish I hadn't taken down my original posting, but I do have the letter here on Yelp, that was written by Brio, saying if I'd take it down, they'd make things right. :(

Never again
I can't even describe how much I love this place, service and everyone who works here period. Been coming here every Wednesday for past 2 years. It's literally my second home.
The best adka vodka pasta I have had in a long time!! To die for. Service was great and love dinning there every time! I haven't had a bad meal yet!

Came here for an early dinner with a friend I ordered the steak salad, The cauliflower, and the brussels sprouts. The salad was very good however I did not like the Gorgonzola it was a little overpowering. I was told that the sangria, white sangria,was very very good but did not try it. I saw a few state dishes and even a lobster dish that looked delicious so I will be back to try Brio for dinner. The ambience is very pleasant especially with the outdoor seating just be prepared to have sunglasses if you decide to come on a sunny day.

-happy hour regular; so posting just for HH, not restaurant. 
-can get very crowded to no seats in happy hour area, and people don't move that quickly to vacate.
- bar service can get slow, two bartenders for HH rush hour?  not enough. 
- HH food is a good deal.  pepper shrimp!  
- sometimes the food can come out cold, my flatbread pizza is hit and miss

Omgeeee so good. It was my first time me and my kids enjoyed our food and experience. Service was good. They did forget to bring us a high chair but it was no big deal, so we didn't bother to bring it up to our server. Over all it was great we will be back

This review is on their happy hour. They have really good food and drinks for cheap! The ambiance is also nice. The outdoor seating is cute and a great place to hang out. It gets pretty crowded for HH though so you might need a little luck to find a good spot.

5 stars all the wayyyyyyy!  Cinnamon was a great server!  She made our time there the best!  She was so attentive and pleasant!  Next time we are there, we will definitely ask for her.  I asked her to bring a small dessert to my friend who was celebrating her birthday.  She made our time there so fantastic!  Food was awesome...  So glad that we chose Brio's.
The Parmesan crusted chicken salad is to die for. My husband just had the Smore's dessert and it was amazing! You have to try it!

Duh Solid!  I love their ambiance and their food is very tasty.  I've heard complaints that it is a chain resto but seriously doesn't feel like there is any lack of service.  The waiters are usually very well mannered and competent.  One quick tip is to check out their Happy hour (even on friday nights!) totally worth it and the prices on the food is RIDICulous for the quality you get!
Always consistently pretty darn good! the menu is huge! prices are a little more then olive grade, place is ginormous with an amazing patio and bar!

I've been to Brio a few times.  This was my first visit to this location.  I had a chicken and Quinoa salad off their low calorie menu.  Very good.  Also had the tomato bisque  which was excellent!!!  Service was good.  Everything about lunch was good. Good spot for a business lunch.  I would definitely come back.

Great food with a lovely view of shopping area on outside table service. Only problem I had was keeping my napkin on my lap due to the wind! Brunch is served til 3 pm. If you're in Vegas check out this restaurant!
Food great but the best happy hour in Vegas!!! Price is really low & great sizes to share. & the drinks are like the price of a soda

I'm a regular here and the past THREE times I've come here something always goes wrong mostly the food isn't right and it goes back to the kitchen then I have to wait and eat my food and it's cold. It's get tiring ridiculous it makes me not want to come back to this restaurant because they can't handle someone's order....

Located in Town Square on Las Vegas Blvd. Let me get this out of the way, I am not a big fan of pasta (It's boiled dough for cryin' out loud) and ordering chicken at a restaurant (unless it comes in a bucket), that being said they many other options, and just salmon, actual beef! This is a great date place, only because women really like it, as a matte fact I may be the first male to review this place. And the only reason I have ever been here is because of a date many months ago. (the date turned out badly, the meal however was quite good). So fellas take your lady here, you will both be happy. Oh I almost forgot download their app for groovy deals and offers. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

I love coming to Brio when I wanna be casual classy. Ya know, classier than Yard House, but not paying Fleming's classy prices. 

One of my favorite date night restaurants. Great decor inside, good food and good selection of wines. Awesome service. 

My 4 stars is mostly for the ambiance and not so much the food. The mushroom ravioli is pretty good, but when I went this past weekend, it was so-so. I'm hoping the next time it'd be as great as when I tried it the first time. Orrrr I should probably order something else. 

Who doesn't love free bread? I usually wait a while to eat mine so I can use it to soak up the sauce from my pasta. 

Overall it's a decent experience here as long as you don't set the bar too high. But it's great for any occasion: catching up with friends, date night, family dinner and I even came here for my birthday once. 

Good place to check out while you're at Town Square Mall.

Weather was perfect for outdoor dining. Had the shrimp & lobster ravioli with a Caesar salad. Salad was perfect. Ravioli was delicious; tender shrimp with lobster ravioli and a sauce with a little heat. Service was quick! Great dining experience!
Great Italian resturaunt off the strip.  Didn't go during Happy Hour but everyone says it's a bargain.  Food quality excellent and nice decor.  Had the lasanga and it was awesome.

The food was great however, the service was horrible. I am a server at a fine dining restaurant myself and I must say.. the service here was below average. Rachel was our server.. She had no personality nor did she try to up sell a single item on the menu. I like to offer my guests a glass of wine or a beverage to start. It seems like she just wanted us out of there because we had 2 young teens with us. I felt like we were rushed and not given the proper service we deserved. I made a reservation through open table and noted a birthday.. She could've at least greeted us with a happy birthday? Instead when dessert time came around she just left the dessert menu on the table without even explaining to us what was on it. I'll be back for the food.. But definitely get out of Rachel's section! I have better customer service at McDonald's. At least the workers there smile and are polite. I'm now on my way to have drinks elsewhere

I've been here a couple of times, but most recently I ate here for a work dinner. Each time I eat here I am reminded that I shouldn't judge chains so harshly. This one is doing it right with food and service.

Our service was very good, especially for a large group. Our drink orders were taken immediately and brought out quickly. They also did a good job of keeping up with fresh drinks for the heavy drinkers. Our starters came out quickly and meals followed shortly after. Every need was addressed right away by our waitress.
