I started with Lobster Bisque and the Chopped Salad. The Lobster Bisque is well flavored and the serving is perfect for a rich bisque. The Chopped Salad has a nice variety of vegetables and black olives with a tangy vinaigrette. I liked that it's chopped for easy eating. 

For my main entr√©e I ordered the Pasta Fra Diavolo with Shrimp. There was plenty of large shrimp in the dish and the sauce packed the heat I was looking for in the dish. The portion was plenty. Paired with starters I was only able to eat half and enjoyed the other half for lunch the next day. 

All of the dishes ordered at the table looked delicious. The next day everyone discussed how happy they were with their entrees and that we were pleasantly surprised by our Brio experience.

This place is pretty dang awesome for a chain!

We went here for an early birthday dinner celebration in the later evening. They were pretty packed, but service was still good. It's very pretty and romantic inside, so it's a nice place for a date or a bachelorette party. 

We ordered the chicken milanese and the sausage pomodoro. Both dishes came out fairly quickly, and tasted wonderful! It's probably hard to go wrong with any of the dishes though.. everything smells really good! I also opted for the peach bellini, which was fruity, sweet, and totally did not have a hint of alcohol! 

They also have a pretty good menu for happy hour on weekdays! :)

Love Love Love Brio.  The food here is delicious and original, not to mention they have a fantastic Sunday Brunch menu that can help kill even the worst of hangovers.

Service is prompt and the prices are all extremely reasonable, and there's always a ton of seating and I've never had to wait for a table.

Huge portions that I always have a hard time finishing, though I always try really hard!
They have the best frozen peach Bellini drinks for brunch. The stuffed French toast is also delicious!

I came here for HH to see what the hype was all about, and it surely does live up to it!

Drinks are $5 and appetizers are $3.95.  We started with their white peach sangria and beef carpaccio, spicy shrimp & eggplant, and four cheese pizzeta.  We thought that the food wouldn't be enough, but boy were we wrong!  The portions are HUGE for the price.  One appetizer for each of us would have been enough.  The flat bread pizza was good and paired well with our sangrias.  But our favorite dishes are the spicy shrimp & eggplant and beef carpaccio.  The spicy shrimp was laid on top of the eggplant with this creamy sauce ladled around it.  The beef carpaccio is definitely a star all on its own.  Its such a steal to get a huge plate full of thinly sliced beef for less than 4 bucks.  I've carpaccio at sushi restaurants, but this was way different.  The beef melted in your mouth and I could've probably scarfed down the whole plate if I wasn't sharing it.  

My first time there did not disappoint.  I'll definitely be back for a beef carpaccio of my own and try some other things on the menu.

We were visiting Vegas from Seattle.  We met up with some "local" friends who took us out to Brio.  The patio was packed and the inside was pretty busy too.  We had to wait four approximately 30 minutes for a table (Saturday night and lots of prom goers to contend with).  Once we were seated our waiter came right over and took our drink order.   We also received a bread basket that included herbed, baked cheese crackers which were an excellent alternative to bread.  I ordered the steak salad - PHENOMENAL! The flavors were amazing, lettuce, arugala, steak, feta cheese, balamic drizzle and a delicious dressing.  I will go back next time we are in Vegas.  I would never have known about this place if not for our friends that live there.  We wish there was one in Seattle!!!

I love this place. Me and my mom come here all the time for happy hour. We love it. It is hard to find seating for happy hours since it's only available by the bar and they do get busy but once you do so worth it. My mom usually gets the peach sangria it's her favorite. I get different things. But we always. Always get the spicy shrimp sauce and eggplant appetizer. It's to die for.

Brio is a pleasant surprise.

I thought it would be Olive Garden on steriods, but it wasn't.  Thank god we made reservations, though, we would be waiting forever.  This place was jam packed (on a Thursday, 7:00p).  Maybe because martinis were $5 a pop?  

Our server was friendly and informative.  I was scared my friend wouldn't enjoy the food because she is vegitarian.  My girlfriend and I ordered the roasted red pepper and mozzarella bruschetta (which was delicious!) and the mushroom ravioli (to die for).  We couldn't say no when he brought the dessert tray.  Bread pudding warm and glorious!

All in all, a success.

Brio is one of our loves and the place we like to go for birthday dinners, family get togethers. It's very pretty inside and the beautiful decor reflects the good food.
They have a full bar and happy hour and a wonderful outdoor seating area where you can people watch while enjoying your meal.
I have a great affinity for the flatbread that comes in their bread basket. Crispy triangles that are coated in herbs, sesame seeds, and cheese full of flavor and texture.
Our favorite is the Pasta alla Vodka. That is why we come to Brio.
My heart skips a little beat when they put this dish down in front of me and shower it in finely grated parmesan cheese. The aroma of the vodka sauce is one I have not experiened in any other Italian restaurant. Can't quite put my finger on what makes that distinctive delicious Brio Vodka sauce so special. Maybe it's the garlic that's been shaved thin (with razor blades?), or the fresh basil that perfumes the sauce, or it's the star of the dish...the soft pillows of heaven...the delicate ricotta filled pasta purses that melt in your mouth and go oh so very well with the sauce. I swear someone else must be eating my dish because it goes too quick until you devour the last of the pasta and reach for the sourdough bread to sop up the rest of this amazing sauce...it would be a sin not to!
This is all I want to write about Brio, because when you come there you must order the Pasta Alla Vodka :)
Just had the most amazing lunch I had the carbonada it was great... the most friendly bartender Rosel  and Jackie the manager was on top of everything we has a pleasant experience
I was in the mood for a really good salad and this place totally satisfied my craving! great service, nice atmosphere, tasty food. Ill be back.
After doing a little shopping, decided to stop in for a bite to eat!  Service was great, and the ambience was nice!  Wasn't too hungry so just had a salad and a cocktail.  Great experience!
Always great service, accommodating staff, service with a smile! I'm addicted to their steak salad. The Best!

Food was excellent as always but unfortunately the portion size has greatly gone down & incidentally making brio overpriced. It's too bad because I used to really dig this place but now I feel like I'm get'n rip'd off! Everything we ordered look'd like It was either off the kids menu or was the size of an appetizer. Don't get me wrong though, if money is no object, then party on Wayne! I personally can't enjoy anything that makes me feel like a glutton lol

You can really never go wrong with Brio. Hands down the best local Happy Hour IMO! 

Brio has Happy Hour Mon - Fri from 3:30P - 6:30P. HH is available at the bar/seating around the bar indoors or outside. Bartenders and servers are incredibly attentive on a consistent basis and the HH bites and drinks are so worth the visits to Brio.

Below are my go to recommendations:

- Beef Carpaccio $4
Thinly sliced carpaccio topped with greens, capers, and mustard aioli. I will be honest... There has been a few times when the carpaccio has been chewier than preferred but I'm hoping those were a few one offs. The past two times I've visited, the carpaccio has been on point! 

- BRIO Burger $6
Never disappoints. Comes already precut in quarters to share and the patty cooked to your liking. Also served with a side of homemade chips which are always delicious 

- Black Pepper Shrimp and Eggplant $6
My favorite!! I don't think I've met someone yet who hasn't enjoyed this dish. Saut√©ed shrimp paired with small pieces of breaded eggplant - smothered in a creamy reddish black pepper sauce with just the right amount of spicy kick to it! I can easily devour an order of this myself 

- Tomato Mozzarella Salad $5
Slices of tomato and mozzarella topped with basil and greens tossed in a light vinaigrette. Balsamic drizzled on top - a very light and refreshing salad

I personally indulge on their wine during Happy Hour - $5 for quality wine is quite the deal and the pours are great. Love their house Chardonnay. 

I've been to Brio for lunch and dinner (they have a delicious bleu cheese steak salad and a variety of tasty pastas) but I'm definitely more a promoter of their Happy Hour!

Had lunch there this Sunday, and we liked the experience. I wasn't impressed by the d√©cor, but didn't bother me either: as long as it's clean, I'm fine with it. I care more about the food and the service :)
The field greens salad was simple and nice and the bf loved the lobster bisque. We shared the vodka pasta, and even though it looked small, it was just enough food for the two of us.

Lunch Menu/Service Review

I met a client here for a lunch meeting, along with a couple other co-workers. Luckily we arrived before the lunch rush at 11 AM, right when they open. We were seated in the expansive dining area at a large booth. The server arrived right away and took our order.

Bread service - comes with sliced white bread, kind of dry, and seasoned toast points. Olive oil/balsamic come along for the ride, as well as butter. OK.

Next up - raspberry iced tea, incredibly sweet, obviously some sort of soft-drink style concoction, not great.

Main entree: Pasta BRIO - "Rigatoni, grilled chicken, seared mushrooms and roasted red pepper sauce" - $14.85

While pasta was well-cooked and sauce was delicious, chicken pieces had something to be desired. Mushrooms however were a nice addition, although I didn't get any hint of the searing, it seemed like they were just cooked in with the pasta. Overall, OK, but for the price kind of deflating.

Price points my party felt were a little out-there compared to the quality and quantity of the food we were served. 

Coffee service after the meal - a very strong brew accompanied by individual creamers for each person in the party (I liked that).

Service - good and on point.

Atmosphere - Nice when we arrived, but as the dining room filled up it became VERY loud and it was hard to carry on a conversation, especially business-related since we didn't really want to yell into any other person's face over the noise.

Overall - A-OK. Better than most chain Italian restaurants out there.

Lobster bisque was Amazing!!! I went back they changed the menu around. I tried the new stuff but it was bland or burnt tasting and I loved the old menu but I was really sad and disappointed perhaps it's a new night chef but the lobster bisque didn't taste the same either... I will give it one more shot though...
we come here all the time for happy hour. love the food and service! I highly recommend the spinach dip and the flatbreads. So yummy!

Oh well, Brio is one of my favorite restaurants for the happy hour meals. Everything tastes delicious, I would recommend the burger, the eggplants, shrimp cocktails, 
each dish is 2.29$, nothing can beat that
cheap and the food is good
strongly recommend

I love to come here for Happy Hour from 3-6 pm or 9- closing because everything on the menu is so good. My favorite is the Carpaccio, I ate 3 orders myself in one sitting. Only con for me is that the happy hour menu is pretty limited and anything that is not on happy hour menu is a little pricier than I'd like. I would definitely keep going back for happy hour!!

I'm a sucker for good service. Brio delivered.

Once we got seated, we were shortly after greeted by our server with two waters. Seems small, but understand the difference between being asked would you like a water, and the anticipatory service of deciding for you, "here is a water. You need it to live. Drink it... or not. It's there for you to decide." 

Our server was a bald, white gentleman who referred to me as "my man" a lot. It made me feel like he was the Caucasian Denzel Washington straight out of 'Training Day,' and if I'm being honest... I didn't hate it. Endearment aside, he was also incredibly attentive, hospitable, and patient with my indecisiveness. More on that here:

I couldn't decide what to eat. The menu was one page long but it was intimidating. I'm an Olive Garden loving Italian food kind of guy (aka basic AF). I wasn't ready for foods I've never heard of, cheeses I can't even pronounce, etc. It seems all to much for me. Our server quickly took note of that and took it upon himself to create a pasta order from scratch collaboratively with me. It was incredibly kind of him to do. Shout out to the White Denzel! He's a real one.

I ended up getting a fettuccine pasta with both alfredo AND marinara sauce, with an order of grilled chicken breast and grilled shrimp as add ons and that meal was F-I-R-E! I probably would have been the loser that came here for soup and bread if it wasn't for him out of sheer intimidation. 

I'll be back for happy hour next time. I hear its poppin.

The food is always consistently good, BUT the service at the bar is horrendous.  My friends and I come here often and sometimes get the same bartender, Nicole M #224.  She is not attentive or pleasant.  It's always the same with her, so I finally decided to speak up.  I'm not sure how management allows this.

I really enjoyed Brio the home made lemonade is great if you are not a wine drinker bit the house sauvignon is also great with most of the dishes tonight I had the calamari and pepperchini appetizer which is delicious. For my entree I went with the pasta alla vodka and added shrimp it has a nice little spice to it and the pasta was cooked perfectly AL dente  my gf had a mixed seafood pasta dish that I tasted it was also very tasty. One thing I have to say as a downfall was that our waitress seemed to cater to the bigger tables and just check on us when she felt like it but we had a good table convo going so it wasn't that big of a deal. Prices were fair for the food we ate I see a lot of company's about that on here but this is vegas own your wallets people come on. All in all a very nice dining establishment and being in town square would be a really cute date spot for you lovebirds out there.
It was our first time here. Our service was wonderful and our food was delicious! I loved the aesthetics and interior design. We will be coming back whenever we come back to Las Vegas.

Had shrimp vertuta, sauce was like soup. The chopped salad starter was wilted. What Italian uses feta cheese on pasta and salads anyway. Service was good, food was Horrible! Not even remotely authentic! Never again!

So I'm here eating and the manager is completely rude. After all our food was sent back and the cooling vent leaked all over me. We call the manager over to ask/bring to her attention all the discrepancies we had. She should've came over when the food was sent back initially but she didn't. She acted like a complete bitch!!! Wasn't even thinking about accommodating us and when I told her I was writing a review the bitch said as she was walking away "You do that..." to be that rude and unaccommodating in this type business is really ridiculous.

We got here at 730pm and it was an hour wait so we took our chances at the bar and got seated right away. We started with 2 red sangria paired with the beef carpaccio, calamari and bruschetta. The beef carpaccio was good But I had better at Giada. Calamari you can't go wrong crunchy and tasteful. The bruschetta is the best! Assorted toppings with different flavors, highly recommended.
For dinner we share the Bistecca Alla Fiolentina a 14 oz strip steak which was very tender, juicy, and mouthwatering. it was paired with mash potatoes and grilled vegetables. Overall, I gave Brio a 4 star because of the server, she told us the appetizers came in small servings. So, ordered 3 and it filled us for the dinner. Plus, the sangria was sour and watered down.

This place never seems to disappoint in the area of food.  The management and leadership can still use a little work.  The open at 11:00am and first the girl  had a hard time unlocking the door and keeping it unlocked.  Once she got past that everyone was let in and from the first person on, you were told it was a 5 minute wait to be seated, REALLY???  There was no one seated yet, what was the 5 minute wait for?  

We requested to be seated outside but when our name was called the person taking us to our table took us to a table inside.  We told her we asked for an outside table and were taken back to the front and told to wait while her and the host figured it out.  In the meantime, other people were seated both inside and out.

Finally we were taken to our table outside.  There was no one else sitting on that side yet so there was a wait for the server to be notified that people were starting to be seated in his area.  

From this point on, everything was awesome.  I had the 5oz filet with sweet potatoes and asparagus was cooked more towards medium rare then medium which is not unusual for this kitchen but none the less it was good.

We also had a salad which was amazing.  At the end we ordered cappuccinos and some desert.  When mine came, I noticed it had cinnamon sprinkled on top.   I called the waiter over and asked if it was cinnamon and he said yes with a surprised look that I was even asking.  I looked at him and asked, Don't you remember I told you I was allergic to cinnamon and we had an entire conversation about this and the sweet potatoes?  He thought for a second and said, oh yes we did talk about that and this was his mistake and he was sorry and would get me another one.  

So even though the food is really good, from the hostess not listening to where people would like to be seated (inside or out), to the kitchen not really preparing food properly as ordered to the server not really paying attention to his customer and the customer needs is the reason for the 3 stars and the statement at the beginning of this about the management needing a little more work and leadership experience.

I have been to Brio many times at Town Square and once at Tivoli.  Tonight the service was so so, but the food was the star again.  This time I had the steak salad.  Often times restaurants just "phone it in" on steak salad, but this one was fantastic.  I asked for medium and it was cooked perfectly, very well seasoned meat.  I asked for no pecans and asked for the creamy parmesan dressing instead of the horseradish.  In my opinion, it is THE BEST dressing there.  I will always enjoy a visit to Brio.
Was at the Brio last night,the service was so bad,Hay brio what is wrong with u,,the food was good

Meh.

I'm not a fan of Italian, but I can eat good Italian.  This was not it.  It felt Macaroni Grill-esque.  The food was heavy and unimaginative.  When I told the waiter I liked Sangria he suggested something not on the menu, I am not joking when I tell you it tasted like a wine cooler.

I'm was thoroughly unimpressed, and shocked that it was so busy.

I am starting a yelp just because of Brio! It was fantastic! Our waitress was Rebecca and she walked us (my daughter& son in law) through the menu. 
I had a delicious mimosa and a great and the portobello ravioli. 
 After dessert I was very happy and so was my family. 
Restrooms were clean and fresh. 
Bar looked well organized. 
Hostess was happy and greeted us as we came in and as we left. 
Management was always present and looked as if he ran a tight shift. 
Thank you Brio!

My goodness!  I room a friend new to town here.  I talked it up since I had such an awesome time at the Tivoli location.  Walking in, the AC is so cold that I could see penguins.  We asked to be seated outside and were quickly seated.  We were quickly fogotten.

After waiting for some time, a nice himsel man introduces himself and takes our drink order but never returns. This keeps happening over and over.  Finally we get someone and we ask for drinks before we order.  

We had to keep asking for the bread basket but they kept forgetting. The server didn't know the soup of the day.  Finally we ordered and our food came. The dressing on my Field Greens salad was too heavy on the vinegar and the salad was drenched to the point that the greens were soggy!  My soup got cold because no one brought me a spoon and I had to ask a couple times. No one brought me any crackers, offered pepper or cheese for the soup or salad, or my friends omlette.  Our drinks were often empty.  

Fortunately the manager walked by and we were able to share about our experience.  He was too kind and comped our meal, but I am quite reluctant to return to this location.

When you are tired of paying Strip prices for a meal. Go here we had an awesome meal from sampler bruschetta to steak crusted with gorgonzola and sampler desserts. 

Excellent service as well.

Food was great! A bit pricy for my budget but on date night it's a good place to go.

Parking is tough to find but there is a free parking garage half a block south. Easy walk through the stores to get there.

Service was impeccable.

I have only one complaint about Brio, but it is really not their fault that the bar gets filled up too quickly to enjoy Happy Hour!! Other than that, you get great delicious food for under $4 dollars during Happy Hour!!! The beef Carpacio, the fried ravioli, the flat bread pizzas and the spicy shrimp with fried eggplant are highly recommended. Beautiful atmosphere and inviting "al fresco" patio dinning with fire pits. I have been here too many times to count (parties, happy hour, lunch and dinner service) but have always had great food and service!! Speaking of service, I once slipped and fell as I entered the bar area. I was more embarrassed than hurt. In fact, I was fine. But the wait staff and a couple patrons rushed to my aide. Their concern for my well being was very touching!! The Manger gave me her card and insisted I call her if I needed to seek medical treatment due to my fall at Brio. Happy to report I was fine and I did  not need to seek medical attention. It took longer to recover from the humiliation of the fall than the pain from the fall itself...lol!!

One of my favorite places to stop buy when shopping at town square. Simple menu. Good variety of flavorful Italian dishes. Nice peach ice tea. Reasonable prices and good deserts. Tomato bisque is one of my favorites along with some of there signature entrees. Good selection for salad. They also have a diet calorie menu sometimes I see floating around for those conscious. There is also bonfire setting for the colder weather and sprinkling for the summer outside seating areas. Can accommodate large party's very well with seating. Crowd is well composed typically, usually family's and couples dating. Great personable atmosphere with reasonable prices.

Horrible dining experience and bad customer service. We were highly disappointed in Brio restaurant service. The food was absolutely terrible and without our consent our orders were changed and customized to a leftover uncooked fettuccine. Never returning to Brio again and we weren't the only unsatisfied and disappointed customers!

Sitting on the patio in May, evening time is excellent!
Savored the appetizers - samplers of 3 bruschetta types, absolutely enjoyed the cold Moscato with cod fish on top of tortellini
They have the best most accommodating staff !! Thank you Brio Waiters !

The service that we received yesterday was incredible!  We don't get to have date nights very often, so the hospitality we received was special! Our server, I believe his name was Jessie, was very charismatic, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. From the wine suggestion he made to the help he gave us deciding on our meals- he was an Allstar! We felt like we were a special table even though we know how busy it was. Overall, a great night- make sure you ask for Jessie!

I love Brio! I used to always order pastas such as Pasta Brio but of late I've been obsessed with their wedge salads! Let me tell you about how savory it is! So it's a big piece of wedge lettuce as a whole, topped with bacon, tomatoes, blue cheese and their house made Parmesan dressing! This dressing is amazing! It's what has me addicted to this salad. I usually order this as a main course with grilled chicken and it is amazing! It's a great meal! 

Also their bread is addicting!! I love their flatbread, it's a top grains and Parmesan. It's delicious! 

I have yet to be disappointed with the service and quality of food. The atmosphere is serene, it can be an upscale classy dinner or it can be casual. I love the patio seating at night and it's a great environment to hang out with friends. 

BTW they have happy hour at 9PM to closing!! It's worth it!

Came here tonight for my moms birthday dinner and honestly we were really disappointed in our time here tonight. From the get go it was one thing wrong after another. We sat down and got our bread, butter and water. 

We then ordered an appetizer and while we were waiting asked for more bread which we never got until asking a second time. Then when the apps finally came out there was only three settings instead of six. I had to get up and go to another table and grab three extra settings for the rest of our party. Such a rookie mistake on the service. 

Then after placing our dinner and salad order we wait for fifteen minutes for our salads to come to no avail. I finally ask Mandy where our salads are and she said they would be ready in one minute. By that time I'm annoyed because I know that the dinner would be coming out any minute. And I really wanted my salad. Who wants to eat their salad in one minute or eat it with their main course. So I told her I didn't want it but my dad still wanted his. He finally gets his Cesar but as predicted our dinners come out thirty seconds later. They should have held our dinners until my dad was finished with his salad. But the food runners didn't care. 

Then for my moms birthday desert we had to tell Mandy and remind her even though we told the hostess when we made the reservation. Why do the hostesses ask if we are celebrating anything if we have to tell our server in front of our mom that its her birthday? 

They comped our appetizer which was nice. So one star for that. But we really just couldn't enjoy our dinner fully because of the lack of attention to detail with the service. This is probably our last time here.

The experience at Brio Tuscan Grille was not one bit short of SUPERB!  My family couldn't stop ranting and raving about this place for days, and I was tickled to have pleased such a difficult group!  I had my son's graduation lunch here.  He graduated from UNLV last May 13th, and we were all from Los Angeles.

From the moment I contacted Brio's Banquet Team, Nova (Banquet Manager) was so wonderful to communicate with... so patient and careful to answer all my questions quickly since we're from L.A..  I tried the big Vegas hotel buffets first and most of the banquet/catering staff were difficult to deal with -  very slow to respond and I never felt like they even cared about my small but large party of 25.  They really made me feel like we weren't a big deal to them.  With their high prices for the Mother's Day weekend, I had high expectations so my patience wore thin very quickly.  Brio did not even require a deposit for our event, yet Nova had a clearly written Event Proposal showing the details of our meal selections and the pricing.  No surprises!

Like clockwork, we were seated at exactly 2:00 pm as stated on our Event Proposal!  Then we met THE MAN....  Amit, our head server!  He was an amazing guy who lit up our tired selves with his positive energy and excellent service skills.  He said we were his first large group, but no one believed that!  The food arrived also like clockwork... it was almost like a staged show.  The intervals were perfectly in sync with our guests' eating behaviors.  We couldn't believe that service!  First drinks, then appetizers, then salads, the main course dishes and dessert... all perfectly timed in harmony.  The entire time, Amit was checking in with me, in constant communication with me and on top of the whole game.  Even small details like no empty drink glasses and lemon wedges were never forgotten.   By the end of dessert, we were about to take this man home with us to L.A., he was so good!!!!  The entire family loved him and just could not stop speaking kind words about him!  

The food was amazingly awesome... from the calamari, to the lemon chicken, to the grilled salmon... and that amazing "we wanted to lick the plate" vodka pasta!!!!  The dessert was the icing on the cake....  caramel marscapone cheesecake in small cups topped with whipped cream!  Delicious to the last bite!!!!   All were scrumptious dishes that warmly satisfied our hunger pains after 5 long hours of graduation ordeals and traffic. 

Nova, Amit and the BRIO Banquet Team -   A HUGE THANK YOU FROM THE SANTOS FAMILY OF CALIFORNIA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  WE LOVED EVERY MINUTE THERE!!!!!!!

I LOVE this establishment! I have eaten here at this location twice. My first experience with the Brio was at their Rancho Cucamonga location. I had ordered one of their flatbread pizzas which was good but not nearly as good as my friend's short rib. She shared some of hers with me and that's where my love affair began. That taste of heaven remained with me ever since... I went back and ordered it for while in Vegas for my birthday. They serve it over a cheesy polenta along with Brussels sprouts and oh my goodness.. the flavors all meshed together so well. This was the best meal that I've had in a restaurant. Unbelievably delicious. The short rib is fork tender and melts in your mouth. Full of flavor! I was also given a caramel mascarpone cheesecake for dessert. Perfect sized portion and very rich and decadent! Soooo good! I ordered it again yesterday during a late lunch and their steak salad which was really delicious. Service and quality of food has been outstanding at both locations. I'm really surprised that they don't charge more for their food. Their price point is excellent for what you get. highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking for a great dining experience.. A great pick for a special occasion. Very nice ambiance too.. Don't forget to order the short rib and the cheesecake! You won't regret it!

We came here for lunch after peak lunch hours around 2:45pm. We made a reservation and the hostess at the door is nice and friendly. She seated us right away after verifying our reservation. 
   I really enjoy the ambiance of this restaurant. They have both outdoor seating and indoor booth/table seating. It has high ceiling and private room area for small parties. It gives guests an European feeling which is hard to find here in Vegas. 
   As for the service, I can only give 2 stars max, Our server is very nice and he seems to know a lot about the dishes but he does not check back with us often enough to make sure we are ready to order and we are satisfied with our food. As a matter of fact, we had to get someone to get him to take our order. Same situation with the water too, we always have to look for someone. 
   We ordered two dishes and shared, Crispy Eggplant Pomodoro and Mezza Chicken Limone. The Eggplant is dry and the sauce has nothing special, while the Mezza Chicken is juicy and tasty. Probably not going to order the Eggplant Pomodoro next time.
   I saw a lot of good review in regard of happy hour at this place, Would love to give it a try.
Definitely worth a try, great food and Perino on tap, my favorite beer.

Really nice looking, high-ceilinged (is that even a word? LOL) venue with a great waitstaff and hosting staff.

The food was definitely delicious, but I'm from New York, so it takes a lot to impress me with italian food.

I got nothing against the place, it's actually the best italian that I had when I was out there. I would definitely eat here again!

This was our second visit to Brio Tuscan Grill.  The food is very good and fairly reasonable.  The biggest problem we encountered was one of meal timing.  We ordered our dinner, a salad, and a bottle of wine.  The salad came out very quickly.  Before we were half finished with our salads, the entrees arrived.  Finally, the wine showed  up.  I felt we were being rushed so they could turn the table over sooner.  Not sure we will be back.

Went to Brio for dinner and thoroughly enjoyed the place. The house cab-merlot blend was really good and not expensive at all. We ordered the artichoke-spinach dip to start and the service was VERY fast. The dip was a very generous portion, plenty to feed 2 people. After the appetizer, we had the grilled salmon and shrimp and crab cakes, respectively. They were very flavorful and filling. Both of us were pleasantly surprised with the speed of service. I would most definitely come back to Brio.

I ate dinner here on 05/28/2015. I ordered the Grilled Salmon and enjoyed it. It tasted fresh and the cook/ chef put the perfect amount of sauce. The entree was on point, but the service wasn't.  The server forgot to ring in our appetizer and she also made a mess on my table by spilling water while pouring it. She never tried to at least dry it. One thing I do not get about this restaurant is why they only hand out one dessert menu if there was 5 of us on the table.  I had to wait for my turn to look at the menu and while I was picking my dessert the other people in my table already ordered and the server had to come back to ask for mine. In summary, I had to watch my cousin and her friends eat their dessert while I waited for mine. That was ridiculous! Well, at least the dessert was on the house since the server forgot our appetizer. She made up for it. I lost desire with this restaurant. I thought I was going to have a blast...

This is a great restaurant!  They have a lot of options on their menu, and all of them looked delicious.  The atmosphere can't be beat; it's a beautiful restaurant with a charming ambiance.

Our server was very friendly and attentive.  Whenever we ran out of bread or water, he was there immediately with more.  When asked for a box to bring our leftovers to family, he offered to put fresh bread in with it.  He had a great attention to detail.

There were three of us enjoying our meal there, and we all loved what we ordered.  I had the sweet potato and chicken risotto, and others had the lasagna and the salmon.  All of the food is plated and presented beautifully.

Service was great. Waiter Jeff was very attentive and pleasant. Husband had Pasta Pesto. 560 Cal but felt like more. Good job. Very filling.  Had a double cappuccino and fantastic lava cake!!  Good lunch spot.

We ate here the other day. Nice looking restaurant with outstanding interior design. 

Food:
Carbonara- I was so hungry so this dish hit the spot. I love carbonara spaghetti so I may be biased. So good and love how they put a large amount of food.

Service:
The staff were nice. The service was fast and we made it on time for work during lunch time.

I've been of age for quite sometime and idk why I waited so long to come here for happy hour... and I love happy hour!! I'm actually not quite sure the exact time of their HH lol I think it's from 4-6? Or 5-7? Somewhere around there. Anyway, upon arrival, you seat yourself by the tables at the bar or just at the bar. 

There were 4 of us at the table and I'm pretty sure we ordered everything off of the HH menu. There wasn't a lot to choose from but a good variety! So I'm not a big fan of burgers but the burger they had was actually really good - I was very impressed. I think my favorite though was the shrimp & eggplant dish! Really rich & creamy & just super yummy. I don't think there was anything that I didn't actually like, which is surprising lol. I also had one of their sangrias - I believe the white one. The drink was delicious, not too strong. 

The lady who was serving us was really nice, but I think she was the only one back there. She came to our table maybe once or twice after our initial order & there was a good amount of people there. I would suggest staffing more people back there for HH so they're not so stressed. But will definitely be back!

We went here for a late lunch. We ordered the eggs Benedict, steak bruschetta, crab and shrimp cakes, Margherita flatbread, and lobster bisque. All was pretty tasty and nothing spectacular. 

The reason I gave it 2 stars was because the wait staff seemed slammed even though it was like 3 in the afternoon. The other reason was that the lobster bisque came in a bowl but was only filled halfway. I asked why was it filled halfway? The answer given to me was since all food was hand/tray carried they only filled soup halfway. The problem with that is from the customer's perspective; it just feels like they are shorting you. Most if not all restaurants carry their food out on trays and my soup is always filled to satisfaction but not here.

Brio Tuscan Grille at Town Square is a nice Italian restaurant to take family and friends when  visiting Las Vegas for the first time.  The food is full of flavor and fresh. I eat there at least once month.

On Saturday I had brunch with a friend. My server Erika was friendly and informative of the entrees. She was concerned that I was ordering to much food since their portions are large, so she convinced me to split a Cesar salad with my friend instead of ordering one for myself.  

Erika was right, it was too much food, I was stuffed after eating my Calamari appetizer,  Cesar Salad, and one omelet with roasted potatoes.  Yes!!! It was to much food. 
Thanks Erika for having my back!  I also witnessed Erika's interaction with other patrons, and she was polite, professional and friendly with each encounter. 

A few things I would recommend, is to offer refills on beverage service without me having to ask. Trying to flag someone down for a refill for my Arnold Palmer was annoying. In addition, when serving an appetizer for two, please bring serving utensils, it was difficult to serve ourselves without any cutlery or spoons for the sauce.

Brio should have a loyalty program for their regulars offering lower priced cocktails and food. 

Cheers & Bon Appetite!!

Ahhhh Brio... sweet Brio....

When I saw those pics of the beef carpaccio - I was sold. I didn't realize, however, the grand SIZE of this dish.... best bring a fellow foodie to savor this delicacy- it'll become a sweet memory for y'all... "remember that one time we split an arms length worth of beef carpaccio??!! Yeah.. GUUUD TIMES!"
Just go for it...

My person & I ordered the same dish after much deliberation and bouts of indecision .... lol. We both ordered the pesto pasta and man.. A+. Had lots of vegetables & good amount of chicken... just all around GUUUD. highly recommend. But really- everything on their menu looked worth trying.. so I'm planning on swinging by for that. 

we also split a side of mashed potatoes ... auguuguh amazing.com.org.edu.uk.usa.gov 

AND we didn't forget dessert ... I forget the name of it but it was a chocolate cake filled with chocolatey liquid goodness... with some raspberries & vanilla gelato I believe !! I DIG IT.

Our server was pleasant & polite .. it was a busy Saturday night so we were glad we made reservations ahead of time! We only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated ..

YOU GO BRIO!

We decided to give this restaurant a 2nd chance for dinner.  We started off with a shared Caesar salad. My wife ordered the crab and shrimp cakes that were accompanied by roasted vegetables and creamy horseradish. My entr√©e was blackened ono served over garlic mashed potatoes with a trace amount of Hollandaise sauce and topped with a spoonful of a delightfully spicy charred tomato relish.  My fish was overdone and there was very little, if any, garlic in my potatoes.

We stopped for lunch on our way home from the airport and a little shopping. What a pleasant surprise. This restaurant is plenty large for ample seating and is a very nice ambiance with classy atmosphere, Delicious meal choices and a great selection of wine. 
We usually share to avoid over eating and had the shrimp Mediterranean "specialty", shared the chopped salad $4.95 entree addition and a 9oz glass of rose.  It was perfect for two! I would certainly return here again if I was in the neighborhood.

From my first visit in 2008 to many, many visits in the last five years, I have enjoyed EVERY meal and experience. Perfect for an intimate evening with your beau, a light lunch with your shopping partner, or a celebratory meal with a group.

Having dined here so often, there are few dishes I haven't tried. These are my favorite that are classics and, unfortunately, some items that have since been removed from the menu (seasonal, making room for new dishes):
CALAMARI FRITTO MISTO: It's no surprise that I love calamari and it's one of my *benchmark* dishes to try at new restaurants. I like their batter, the lightly-battered peperoncini that creates a nice, refreshing note, and their delicious marinara for dipping. I do not like the creamy sauce (not really sure what it is) that is also served.
LOBSTER BISQUE: This is definitely one of the best lobster bisques (or bisques in general) that I have eaten. Nice pieces of lobster and this version is finished with a touch of sherry. Delicious. BTW, the cup is enough; trust me, don't go for the bowl unless that is all you're planning to eat.
POLLO AL FORNO FLATBREAD: Grilled chicken, tomatoes, bacon, feta cheese, green onions with a tomato sauce and creamy parmesan. SERIOUS YUM. The bread is the perfect thickness, creating the right vehicle for this delicious medley of ingredients. Sadly, this is no longer on the Vegas menu!
CHICKEN MILANESE: Romano breaded chicken with herb spaghetti served in my favorite sauce - pomodoro. The breading is crispy without overwhelming the dish and I love their interpretation of the pomodoro.
CHICKEN LIMONE: PIccata-style chicken with a blend of lemon, capers, and white wine - another preparation I really enjoy. The chicken breast is always juicy and the sauce is tangy. They used to serve it with their cripsy potatoes (large chucks of well-fried/sauteed potatoes with herbs and peppers - think "Potatoes O'Brien"), which I really liked.

There are many salads, appetizers, pastas, flatbread, and bruschetta that they offer, I've eaten, and have enjoyed very much. You can't go wrong! The only dish that was less than satisfactory was the Sweet Potato and Chicken Risotto; bleh.

This year, they introduced "The Lighter Side of Tuscany" with menu items that have reduced calories (I believe they are all below a certain amount, say 600). I tried the INSALATA BRIO: Mixed greens, roasted red peppers, grilled asparagus, tomatoes, grapes and candied pecans tossed with an Italian vinaigrette and balsamic drizzle. Just 345 calories! Well, I removed the gorgonzola and asked for the dressings on the side, so that I could get it as "Vegan" as possible. Very delicious!

They have a specials menu that is updated daily, so make sure to check it out because their seasonal cocktails are certainly worthwhile. Some of my favorites that were offered in the past (and I believe one may have become a permanent menu offering) are the STRAWBERRY BASIL LIMONATA (Muddled strawberries and basil in a limonata, so refreshing and yummy) and the APPLE CIDER MARTINI (A little brandy, apple cider, spiced rum, lemon juice, rimmed with cinnamon, YUMMM). I've recreated both cocktails at home and it has consistently been a crowd-pleaser.

Fantastic decor and spacious.  The most amazing desserts and scrumptious salads.  I really enjoyed the lobster bisque and the Sweet Potato & Chicken Risotto was phenomenal!!!  I also like how they didn't prepare their Sangria cheaply with a carbonated beverage.  Couldn't quite pinpoint what they put in it, but whatever it was... I'm a big fan!

Danielle was awesome.  So genuine and knowledgeable about the menu.  Quick and prompt service even though she was busy in lounge.  Happy hour is from 3:30-6:30 in bar and lounge.  Ask for her if possible.

Written by Kyle's wife- Deb Stantus :) 

I can't begin to say enough great things about my experience. I'm from out of town so planning my sisters baby shower from Arizona was a bit nerve wracking. Nova could not have been more helpful! He gave incredibly helpful and detailed advice, was patient with my many questions throughout the process and ensured that every single request we had was accommodated. He went above and beyond throughout the entire experience which gave us such peace of mind. We were grateful to be working with him on this and would highly recommend both him and Brio to many friends and family!! I also want to mention Matt, who we spoke with one day throughout the process, who was also extremely helpful with his advice on the menu and updating a few things for us. They make a fantastic team! Responsive, professional and incredibly accommodating and happy to help. On the day-of the event, Mauricio was a lifesaver!!! He helped us hang so many signs and banners that we could not have done it without him. He was also so patient and happy to help. This made the morning set-up so much easier and brought our vision to life! We could not have been more grateful to have his help throughout the entire morning. Both Mauricio and Nova deserve kudos for executing the event perfectly both in advance of the event, and on the day of. We truly appreciate this as it made a very special day for us memorable and all the guests had a wonderful time.

Really friendly waitstaff; very attentive and aim to please. 

The food was really good. I made a mistake and didn't realize pancetta was bacon (I don't eat pork or shellfish) and as soon as I realized it was bacon in my dish, they said "No worries, it happens all of the time, we'll take care of it!"  7 minutes later, I had a brand new dish without the piggy. My husband and friend both cleaned their plates, so in assuming they liked what they ordered. 

The ambiance was nice. Open, well air conditioned, and not too loud.

I really have no complaints. I wasn't "wowed" but it was really tasty, and I can see myself coming again and again when friends are in town on the strip and we need a solid and central place to meet and dine. Town Square is great. 

I'm going back next weekend with a group and if I have another great experience, I'll up it to 5 stars. :)

This Brio location is a great restaurant as a whole. The design is beautiful. The staff is wonderful. The food is very good. Collectively the group I was with had salmon, shrimp, their peach beverages and chicken fingers. Everyone was very happy with their food and drinks. I would highly recommend this restaurant !

Happy hour are the best hours to go! I was in town square and had gone here before. I decided to see their happy hour menus to enjoy.

Variety on happy hour is limited but their regular menu items have a wide variety. The food is good it's and the drinks were really good as well.

The service was normally they seemed a bit impatient maybe it was because he bar area was packed for HH. 

I'd go back since the food items have vegetarian options.

I've eaten here about 2 dozen times and never had a bad experience 
I love the Bellinis and the happy hour
Been here for large parties with friends and family. 
Parking may be a bit tricky at times
But it's central location is a good pit stop 
I shop at the Victoria Secret, and Bebe regularly

Brio is on of my favorite happy hours!  No, they don't offer drink specials, but they do offer some tasty treats at $2.95 each.  The portions seem to have gotten a bit smaller since they first started doing happy hour, but it is as delicious as ever.  The specials are also only at the bar area or patio area, so be sure to snag the first seat you see; it's first come first serve.

My favorites have been the Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant (you have to scoop up every bit of that sauce!), Braised Meatballs and Polenta (I had no idea what polenta was before this, but now I love it), and the Sliced Steak Bruschetta.  There are many more items on the menu but these have stood out to me the most.

Dining outside is great, especially in front of a roaring fire on a cool fall evening.  Inside is nice but it gets loud.  My biggest complaint is the service; it can be difficult to get your waiters attention, even though it's been a while since they've checked on you.  Still, the cheap eats make this a must try.

I just have to say how incredibly impressed I am with this restaurant. I have been planning my Vegas wedding since February and was having a hard time finding a place that was elegant with excellent food without breaking the bank. Nova is the banquet manager there and he was truly amazing. He addressed my one million emails prior to the dinner and was a true advocate for helping me have an outstanding dinner even when I lived in another state. It was stressful being so far away but Nova made it easy for me. 

Let's start with the food. I had visited the restaurant before I signed a contract to try the food. The chicken milanese was great but the real highlights were the filet  and also the pasta with vodka sauce. The pasta was handmade and to die for. We were also served two types of salad and potatoes/veggies. Everything was great but my wedding group raved about the filet for days. Who would have thought you could get such a great steak at an Italian restaurant. 

The service was great. Tamara was fun and very concerned about making sure I was a happy bride. I paid for a bar package and was not disappointed. The staff was very attentive and took multiple drink orders. I definitely felt that we got more than what we paid for. The servers also cut and served our cake that we had ordered. 

Overall it was a fantastic experience and I am sure that we will go back each time we visit  Vegas to relive the memory. Thank you so much Nova and Brio Tuscan for making my wedding so memorable.

My boyfriend and I absolutely love this place! If we could eat this everyday, we would do with a smile on our face every time.

We always get the beef carpaccio. The. Best. Thing. Ever. Everything about this appetizer is delicious. If you can handle rare beef then I suggest you try this appetizer. It's so good one time my bf and I went and they were all out of the beef carpaccio.

My boyfriend always gets the lobster bisque and every time he orders it. He's never disappointed. Ever.

For me, I either order their lamb chops or their salmon. Always really good and tasty.

As far as customer service, they are very kind and polite. Always on top of things I don't recall them ever asking them to refill my drink. 

I didn't hesitate giving This restaurant 5 stars if that's not a good enough for you guys then I don't know what is.

If I could give ten stars I would!  Brio staffers, including Nova as the coordinator of our wedding reception, were phenomenal.  I was not able to get them our place cards before the event, and they not only improvised where I had not provided these, but they made everything beautiful for our reception.  The food was amazing (guests LOVED the menu) and the service was truly exceptional.  The staff took time to make the centerpieces look perfect, the cake table decorated with their attention to detail and everyone just made our guests feel pampered and special.  After all this, the prices are some of the most reasonable on the strip.  We will be repeating our vows again, and will definitely be long-time fans of this restaurant and staff!

I was with a party of 10 on a Friday night. The place was packed. Because of how busy it was, service was quite slow. For appetizers the table ordered calamari and spinach dip. The calamari was good, the white dipping sauce that it came with was straight mayonnaise. I couldn't believe it. I hate mayo with a passion. That killed it for me. I ordered the Grilled Salmon Fresca substituting the sweet potatoes for mashed potatoes. The plate came out looking beautiful. The salmon was very good, cooked perfect. The mashed potatoes were bland, had no flavor, I don't even think they used salt. That part was disappointing because I love mashed potatoes, that's usually the part of the dish I eat first. For dessert I had Tiramisu. I wasn't thrilled, I've had better from the Smith's grocery store bakery. Overall I give this place 3/5...I'll come back to try other items on the menu on a not so busy night.

Brio has become a classic staple for both casual family dining, and date night with friends. My husband and I had our wedding rehearsal dinner here also, so it's near and dear to my heart.

You start off with a basket of free bread, and Parmesan crusted sesame crackers that are delicious. I ask for oil and vinegar as opposed to the butter that comes out with it regularly.

The menu has a wonderful variety of salads, pasta, fish, chicken and steaks. My favorite menus items include: the strawberry chicken salad, steak salad, and chopped salad , the ricotta stuffed pasta in the spicy vodka sauce, the lobster bisque,  salmon Fresca, and also the beef medallions. I'm picky about my steak being cooked all the way through, and they always do a great job.

This place is also super kid friendly. Crayons to color on the paper tablecloth, and the most delicious kids size Mac and cheese that is easily shareable for two children. 

Brio, don't you go anywhere.

Last night's dinner at Brio was wonderful! Our waitstaff Rosie was superb! She deftly attended to our party and we never had to ask for anything. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. I had the Chicken Limone. The lemon sauce was tart like I like it and the chicken was tender and juicy. The veggies of carrots and zuchini were standard. The mashed potatoes were good. The dessert! Oh the dessert I had! The chocolate lava cake was scrumptously delicious!!! Triple yummy for chocolate lovers :)
I will definitely visit again.

I stumbled upon this restaurant while looking for a Hello Kitty store for my daughter.  Undecided as to where we were going to have dinner, somebody suggested Brio.  We took one look at the menu and we decided to try it out.  Sitting outside in the middle of December is not highly suggested, thank God they have heat lamps!  For starters we had the spicy shrimp with eggplant per our server's suggestion...it was really good!  I had the Shrimp and Scallop Risotto (also our server's suggestion), substituting the risotto for their yummy fresh fettucini.  It was good but didn't hit the spot since it wasn't was I was craving for.  The servings were huge, the price reasonable.  Will definitely suggest this place to friends when they're in town.

I absolutely love this place. They still stand for something and keep the community entertained. 
Brio has a lot of events like a paw on the porch . The food is amazing. I literally have to stop going to the 3-6 happy hour ! 
The service is amazing and I appreciate the mist outside .

Stopped here after we went shopping for some clothes over at H & M and I'm glad we came in here :)

The space speaks for itself. It's large and open with vaulted ceilings. 

Customer service is very formal and inviting. 

Portion sizes are generous as well as the costs haha.

If you feel like stepping it up a notch from your average dining experience but still don't wanna break the bank then this is a good choice for Italian food lovers :)

I went to Brio for a work dinner, and as usual I loved it. We started off with the spinach dip and the bruschetta and both were really tasty. For my entree I ordered the Filet and it was well seasoned and cooked to perfection. I highly recommend this dish, if you're in the mood for steak. I went with a group, so I was able to try several other items as well. The pork chops were delicious, but I don't eat much pork these days. If I did, I might order this myself. The lobster bisque was just okay. The last thing I tried was the Shrimp Mediterranean and it was the best of all. It's served with orzo pasta, which is my favorite.

I've been to Brio several times and I have yet to be disappointed. It's a place that I know I will visit again when I'm in the area.

The food was ok, but the desert was FANTASTIC.  Try the Creme Brulee cups - it came in pumpkin, peppermint and cocoa flavor. 

Would come back to the Square on my next trip to Vegas.

I came here for Happy Hour with my girl friends for their tasty appetizers and drinks. Happy hour is served only at the bar though, so it was a bit cold when we had to sit outside during the winter. Luckily they provided heat lamps and had curtained off the outside area.

My favorite appetizer is the black pepper shrimp with parmesan eggplant, it has a very flavorful sauce. I used the complimentary crusty bread to sop up all that deliciousness. The crispy eggplant fries are served with a fantastic creamy horseradish sauce is very tasty and the beef carpaccio with capers and topped with mustard aoli and shaved parmesan cheese was also very good. 

The tomato margherita flat bread is simple and straightforward, nothing special. The Brio burger is decent and was sliced in fours to share. The roasted garlic, spinach & artichoke dip is served with parmesan flatbread was also good. And of course you have to wash down all those appetizers with a dirty martini or two. They have pretty good happy hour items and prices and I always have a good time here.

I enjoy Brio every time I visit. The service is often top notch, the bread and butter at the table is delicious, and it has some of the best lobster bisque in town (pairs perfectly with that bread and butter!). Sometimes the food is a bit salty or has an unexpected kick. Otherwise, the experience is great. Don't be surprised if one of these days you find me devouring some lobster bisque in the corner like a scene from Beauty and the Beast... Don't mind me...

Now all of you reviewers need to tell me what you did for service?

Regardless if happy hour is discounted pricing, you all understand that's probably one of their busiest times of day. 
Considering its the time of day people are getting out of work, if you hand a menu to someone and disappear for 30 minutes it's hard to sit still. 

We came in at the beginning of happy hour! Seated ourselves near the little booths by the bar. It took 13 minutes just for a menu. NOT COOL.luckily my boyfriend and I have some amazing conversations or else I don't know how else to let the time pass. 

We eventually got our menus l, took a look. In a matter of minutes, especially after waiting so long for a menu, we finally are ready to give her the rundown on everything we want. 

We keep seeing the same server rush back and forth so we keep waiting. After we see her and have her tell us she's about ready to take our drink order, she looks over and sees a party of 20 rush outside. 
Where do you think our server went?!

Never got to put that drink order in :( 
All we wanted was a nice happy hour!
After all, grandma had the little one all day so we might as well take advantage. 

After being so patient to try out this elegant restaurant, we thought maybe yard house was a better choice. They know us there so there's never waiting for a drink! 


Maybe we gotta be dressed lookin like a million bucks, or go with a fat group! 
I wanna try it again, my man was just really tryin to get that happy hour on so it might take a little convincing.

I have been to Brio a few times prior to this and each time has been nothing special so I never thought to write of those experiences. On Monday a friend of mine and I decided to eat here after some shopping. There was no wait and we had the pleasure of being seated in Amanda's section who was an absolute delight!! I could not have asked for a better server or better service! She was extremely knowledgeable of the menu, engaged in some wonderful conversation and even joked with us when appropriate. 

We started with the amazing Bruschetta Sampler which Amanda recommended, perfect choice! My friend went with some sort of pasta and I chose the lamb chops with Maple Balsamic Brussels Sprouts. 

After the food was delivered, Amanda checked up on us to ensure everything was great. I actually finally was able to convince my friend to try lamb for the first time. She actually loved it  and we expressed that to Amanda. After a couple of minutes Will, some sort of manager came over and asked if everything was ok, we confirmed that it was and he continued on his way. After I finished the first lamb chop, I took a break to show my friend something on my phone when we were rudely interrupted by Will, the manager. He immediately asked if we wanted boxes. We hadn't even had our main dish for longer than 10 minutes and I told him that I was not finished and I was still working on it. He then said he would go get the check, he returned a few minutes later and said "No rush!"  I was kind of confused because there wasn't a wait for seats and there were several tables that had been at their enjoying their dinner longer than we were even in the restaurant. 

Amanda came over and even was confused on why he was bothering us, we explained that we felt that we were being kicked out and were not even offered the dessert menu which we were actually going to order, but since we were made to feel unwelcome we would just pay and leave. Amanda decided to get another manager to come over and apologize for the experience. Jenna came over and apologized and offered free dessert but our experience was already ruined and since we were made to feel like we were not wanted we just wanted to leave. 

We paid the tab and decided to leave. Again I cannot tell you how amazing Amanda was, Jenna was very sympathetic and tried everything change our experience. 

Honestly, Will should not be allowed to work with the public. I do understand why we were basically told to leave before I was able to even taste my side dish.  I definitely will not be back at this location!

I forgot to mention that after this was posted, I did receive gift card in the mail as a way to make peace, but also a personal phone call from Will informing me that he was bothered that someone would feel this was about him, he apologized profusely and even offered to buy me drinks, i kind of feel weird that they gave him my number and he kept me on the phone for a good 30-45 minutes trying to win my approval. It was strangely uncomfortable but at the same time nice to be able to tell someone they were the reason for a low review, just weird he has my cell phone number.

Their service is always great at this location.

I planned a large group dinner for a birthday party & we were able to get a private room. They also helped me surprise the birthday girl.

I always find myself at their happy hour because their drinks are so good. They have $4, $5 & $6 plates & pours to choose from.

I have tried everything on the food menu. If you're with other people, I suggest getting the "Brio Burger" for yourself & another plate to share with each other to have variety.

As for drinks, the "Sangria Rosa" & "White Peach Sangria" are my go-to. They're only $4 & they taste amazing.

Shout-out to Danielle who has been my server a few times & is wonderful!

My husband and I arrived in Vegas on 5/15/16 and decided to eat here for dinner. My husband had the lasagna and I had the salmon. My husband said the lasagna was absolutely amazing. My salmon was cooked well and was tasty but it needed more salmon and less veggies. The lasagna was made with a white sauce and it was really good with it. My husband scarfed it down in no time. 
The upholstery was a little outdated,cushions at our booth was torn and the back were worn and stained. Other than the upholstery, everything was good.

Great ambiance and service was impeccable. The food is just okay, definitely over-salted. We had the kids cheese pizza (which was generous in size), ceasar salads, the roasted vegetable panini and risotto.

I must say this is one of my favorite happy hour places. It starts from 3pn to 6:30 p.m. Monday through Thursday. There are a lot of appetizers and drinks on the happy hour menu. My favorite one is the Beef Carpaccio, and the eggplant shrimp. The drinks on the happy hour menu were decent and I think it's a little diluted on the alcohol. If you want to check out this place try to come early as it tends to get pretty packed during about five or six mark.

Nice environment, clean establishment.

Wouldn't recommend for food. 
They don't accomodate vegans very well.  
Food has no Wow factor to make it stand out for the prices. 

Go to the Bootlegger bistro up the street another 5mins or panevino.

Sorry brio. I only come here to sit out side really.  Happy hour is OK.

Came here the other night and MAN! Is this place worth yelping over or what. First of all, great ambiance, great location. 

The menu had lots of choices and was very busy. We were on our way to the airport and told out waiter that we were kind of in a rush. He punched in our food and it came out I would say within ten minutes. I was extremely impressed.

Not only did the food come out timely and our server was very attentive, but the food was DELICIOUS! I had the Tuscan Harvest Salad and it was so delicious. It had chicken, bacon, dried cranberries, fresh apples, and a nice vinaigrette to top it along with other things that I can't remember.

For the price, this restaurant exceeded my expectations and I will DEFINITELY be coming back!

Brio Tuscan Grille is located in a very random shopping area that is a little further away from the strip. If I wasn't going to dinner with my family I probably wouldn't have come here. It is just too out of the way, especially if you don't have a car or you would rather go wild. This is not the place for you. The patrons who come here are mostly an older crowd or families, so this is not a party spot.

The food here isn't too bad. It isn't gourmet, but it isn't trash. We ended up ordering the Pasta Pesto (Angel hair, grilled chicken, caramelized onions, spinach, tomatoes, red peppers, Feta, basil, light pesto sauce) and the Fettuccine Rustica (Fresh egg pasta, spicy marinara, capers, basil, Kalamata olives, Parmesan). They were both just ok, nothing special. A little on the bland side.

Overall, I would probably try this place again if I was in the area.

We absolutely love the brunch here! The stuffed French toast is sensational and they have a variety of delicious cocktails like sangria and bellinis. We always enjoy sitting outside. Sometimes they bring the kids a little plate of pizza dough to play with, which keeps them entertained until the food arrives, and they'll even bake it if you choose. We've gone back many times and have always had great service!

First impression was that this was going to be a great meal. I was right! Our server was Tamara and she was excellent,in fact everyone who worked here was outstanding. The food was fresh and served as it should be. Tasty,hot, promptly delivered in order not ahead and not too slow. Tamara went out of her way to see that our meal was excellent and it was appreciated in my tip. They also have the best tasting flat bread to nibble on while you wait for appetizers and main course. To my shock I discovered that this is actually part of a chain. This is the best chain I have ever eaten at for Italian food. The impression was more like a fine dining experience in beverly hills or pasadena. I think that they have an incredible future if they stick to this formula. Meticulous attention to detail and of course great tasting food. I will definitely be back as I live in summerlin and I discovered they have a place at tivoli.

Town Square is always a fun choice. Brio has a lot of options and whether dining at the bar or dining room you can't go wrong. 

One of the better happy hours in town square and the reverse is even better. When the weather is great sit outside and people watch!!

Brio reached out to me to come back to make up what happened last time back in February.  We haven't been back to Brio since Valentine's Day.  We normally go here once or twice a month before Valentine's incident.  Service here has changed from what it was years ago.  It's always a hit or miss.  We tend to spend about an hour to an hour and a half here, depending on how the service is and how busy they are. 

We came on last Wednesday night with the same couple we went on Valentine's Day.  I didn't tell them we were invited back.  We all weren't too hungry this time around and only ordered 3 glasses of wine and an entree each.  I did have a gnat in my glass of wine.  They replaced it right away.  Service was much better this time from the hostess to our server.  I added one of my friend to the dinner and asked the hostess to tell our server to hand me the check at the end, so I can pay for the bill and tip properly on what was being taken care of.  We didn't order so much food and drinks, maybe this is why they took care of our visit.

I really do appreciate the kind gesture from the management.  After being a loyal customer of Brio since 2010...  Either this location have to get better in customer service or we'll have to suffer through the service.  LOL

Went here on a tuesday night with a group of 4 after one member of our party declared she'd been burned out on spicy food, and required some pasta. It was 9:30 at night, we didn't want to spend $32 a plate on the strip, and so we decided to give long passed-by Brio a try.

The verdict; upscale olive garden that knows what Al Dente means. So 3 stars at least for that. We had hoped to sit outside, but after putting our names in for a table, got so quickly ushered to a seat next to the miniature Colosseum replica (?!...Why would you build that?!) that we sort of gave up on asking.  Very much has the same "upscale chain that doesn't want to be considered a chain" vibe as a Yardhouse or a McCormick and Shmick's. 

There was absolutely nothing wrong with the food. We had a calamari appetizer, 2 basil gimlets, a lemonade, 3 pasta dishes and a salad. We might have all been really hungry, but we also finished everything, and then nibbled at some of the crumbs. I actually wish they would have offered a refill on the bread, as my jerk tablemates ate all the french, and left me the crackers, but this offer was not forthcoming. That was sort of the modus opperandi. Nothing extra or surprising or special, no extras extended. You get what you ask for, you pay for what you ask for. Nothing wrong with that, just nothing to get super excited about, either. 

I had the sausage and tomato pasta, which was good; the pasta actually had flavor and texture, which I had hoped for but not expected. The tomatoes were actually fresh and the fennel sausage a bit on the dry side, but crispy and very flavorful. I ate the whole thing and enjoyed it. I just doubt I'll remember anything about it a month from now. 

Brio seems like a very safe bet; I'm sure if I went back in 6 months I would have a very similar experience. It would be a great place to take my utterly unadventurous friends and relatives when they visit from out of town. If I was still doing the dating thing and on a blind date, had to do a working lunch, or meet an estranged relative I knew nothing about, this might be a good place to avoid judgments.
Every time I'm in Vegas I hit this place up. Everything delish!!!!  Reasonable price, beautiful decor great service.  Great outdoor area. Plenty of parking. Cheap cab ride from the Strip

Great family friendly menu and very helpful wait staff.  The portions are very large, even on the kids menu!  We hit this place on the way out from Vegas back to LA and were very happy with the food and service.  At first we were not sure it would be a good place to take our 2 year old but everything was great!  I had the red fish with potatoes (daily special) my wife had the mushroom raviolli and our daughter had the pizza (of course!)
The food seemed thoughtfully prepared and fresh.  The atmosphere was great for lunch and it was not overly crowded.  Our waitress was VERY attentive and our glasses were never empty.  
I would definitely revisit Brio and recommend it to anyone looking at Brio as a possibility!

Came here on Father's day at 5PM. It was a pretty full. The decor is very nice, reminds me of typical Cheesecake factory. The main dining room is a little loud, fortunately we got to sit in a round room in the back of the restaurant that was very nice and quite a bit quieter so that a normal conversation could be had. I ordered the espresso ribeye steak with mashed potatoes and grilled asparagus. The steak was cooked perfectly and the seasoning was mild. It was Very good. I tried a few of my neighbors dishes, cod over angel hair with lemon caper sauce, and Brio pasta. They were all pretty good but I felt I made the BEST choice. Most of their dishes range in the $20-30. The sourdough bread is warm and crusty. delicious.

We went to Brio for the first time to celebrate an anniversary. The hotess sat us at an intimate table. When we arrived to the table there was a card waiting to congratulate us. The atmosphere and decor was great. The server seemed a bit overwhelmed at times, but the meal and sangria were delicious. At the end, the server surprised us with a cheesecake with two candles. It was a great evening!

I think at this point I may not check in but I have been going into Brio for quite some time now and I have to say the service here is phenomenal! The food is also just as amazing as the staff! The atmosphere at this location is awesome I prefer it over the other location on Rampart. Always come here with my mom. Definitely a hot spot! 

Kai....just go see him! He makes THE BEST cappuccino! and you'll receive the best customer service from him! :D He checks in at the right times, he makes an effort to suggest other items on the menu. It is nice to see servers know their menu and can suggest other options to explore as well. Great job! :)

I have dined with Brio Tuscan Grill in the past, but this time felt compelled to review.

I arrived at Brio Tuscan Grille  just before noon on a Friday and to my surprise did not wait to be seated - the restaurant, albeit busy, provided immediate space.  The restaurant is that of a large, open floor, high ceiling dining space.  The "Tuscan" d√©cor is immediately apparent and the high ceiling with streaming tapestry is a nice touch.  Regretfully I felt as though I spent the entire meal yelling at my colleague as the roar of the patrons is stifling.  The dining room rumbles with dialogue from the tables, each seemingly attempting to talk louder than the next.  This may be the result of the large dome-like space.

The team serving us was friendly, not unlike the hosts, but did unfortunately need to be reminded of extra table flatware, indications for drink refills, and simple things like a spoon to stir my coffee, however, negating these oversights with accommodating pleasant demeanor.

I cannot speak on my friend, but I ordered the Mezza Chicken Limone and would recommend it to anyone that enjoys characteristic chicken.  Aside from the elegant name, this lunch fare is simply Lemon Chicken with Campanelle Florentine.  The chicken was flavorful, with lemon obvious with each bite, and the bed of greens accented the capers nicely; the portion size is perfect for a healthy lunch as well.  I would also like to note the Campanelle Florentine was just a bit overcooked, but not enough for most to notice.  Again, I recommend the Mezza Chicken Limone and Brio Tuscan Grille to all - we'll see how things are next time: at dinner.

Love love love this place!! It's my husband & I go-to place on our date nites. The food is delish, the ambiance is nice. Alittle loud for ur typical "date-nite" setting but u can have a normal conversation w/o yelling. Service is great & quick. The wait staff know the menu and will help u choose if ur stuck, regardless of what u end up with u won't be upset! My hubby fav is Tomatoe Caprese and I get the beef carpaccio as our 1st sides always! 
Ty Brio!!

UPDATE: Brio was very quick to respond to my post and stated a member of management would contact me. I then received an email from William and we spoke about my experience.  He was extremely apologetic and concerned about my experience.  I provided the details of my visit and again he was very apologetic.

I am very happy that Brio reached out and responded with an apology.

Thank you to William and Brio for listening to my experience and apologizing.

After a horrid experience moments before at a nearby restaurant, it has felt good to relax and enjoy a nice meal here. Eating outdoors with misters keeping things cool, pleasant music, and wait staff who knows the difference between hovering and serving, very very nice.

Disappointed in the chicken (too dry), but everything else was great. No wine cooler on the menu, but that didn't stop them from serving that when I asked.

Bread is top notch, worth the price of admission.

No dessert this time, maybe next.

Server's name: Trevor.

I have eaten at this location before and it was always ok.  This last time I dined the service was terrible and the food even worse!  We couldn't get anyone to give us refills on our water.  The steak salads were missing the tomatoes and candied pecans and just didn't taste right.  It was rather disappointing after dining here in the past then having this experience.  We usually go to the location in Tivolti Village and will continue to go there as the service is excellent and the food amazing!

First time coming to Brio, and don't think I'll be recommending it to anyone. Food was really mediocre. Felt kinda sick by the end of it because my braised short rib just didn't taste good or outstanding in any way. 

Strawberry lemonade was decent. If I could rate the atmosphere, I'd give it a shrug out of 5. Just a shrug.

Great Restaurant! I went with some friends and tried the brucshetta sampler! awesome!. 
I had the lobster and crab meat ravioli. Was delicious. Very classy place and nice decor. a dress up place for sure. I would recommend this place for a special occasion for sure.

Great food, great service! 

If I do return, I'll be wearing DEET.  If you're going to leave the front door open, you need to deal with the damn gnats.

Liberi degli insetti !  (Get rid of the bugs!)

Oh Brio's HAPPY HOUR is probably one of my top HH places! You can not beat their $3.95 appetizers and $5 drinks! Well actually before their apps were only $2.95 but hey it's only a $1 increase.. I can handle that! Haha my must haves when I go are the beef carpaccio & spinach artichoke dip! My man and I usually share the burger as well.. The sucky part about this place would be that you can never tell if you're going to be able to get a spot or not.. The best place to sit is inside in one of the booths or outside by the firepit if you have a big group but it can get pretty busy.  Another negative thing is that sometimes there are lots of pigeons out on the patio... Boo! But hey what can you do..!?
