I've gone to Brio a lot but just never gott around to writing a review.  Lunch here get's so crazy that I rarely go, but I was meeting some ladies for a little early for a business meeting so we decided to go here.  They had already gotten a table when I got there so there wasn't a wait.  However, there were only two place settings at the table and our server never even offered to bring me one or a menu or anything once I sat.

We ordered our lunches and still no place setting.  When our food came I had to ask for silverware, which he brought, but no napkin, which I had to ask for so he finally brought it.  I had ordered the steak medium rare and it was medium.  I ate it anyway and didn't complain since I wasn't paying for lunch and I knew these ladies were in a hurry.

If I had to rate Brio on all my visits together, I'd give it 4 stars, but based on this last visit alone I have to be honest and say it was only a 3-star visit.

My company hosted our annual Holiday Office Celebration at Brio. Our event coordinator, Nova, was extremely helpful and accommodating. Our server, Jessie, was very attentive and professional. The food was prepared perfectly. The ambiance was very nice. We had a wonderful time and I would recommend anyone to this place, weather it be for a nice dinner, a happy hour treat, or any event. Thank you to the staff of Brio who made our evening!!

I want to start off by saying my wife and I love brio. We usually come about 6-8 times a year and even did our rehearsal dinner for our wedding here. We got seated right away, 4 total in the party, and for about 10-15 mins no waiter or anyone noticed us or said anything until I finally asked a bus boy to grab her. Not a good start but whatever, the service was bad for brio standards tonight, at least she was friendly. 

So the good, the reason we come. The food was great. We had calamri and sausage pepperoni pizza to start. Great. I got the lobster bisque and as always great. For dinner I had lamb, great!!, my wife had rissoito, pretty good, my friend had shrimp Vodak pasta, very good and his girlfriend had steak salad, which she enjoyed. For dessert we split tiramisu and creme breleu, both very good. Overall great meal and mediocre service. Will come back as the service is usually much better than today.

I visited this place during happy hour and it is one of the best in the area! The happy hour goes from 3:30-6:30pm and it includes a selection of drinks and food. The wine glass is $5 and it was good to see that they offer more than just the house wine during the happy hour. 

The food is simply amazing! I ordered the crispy shrimp (spicy Remoulade, green onions), the margherita dip (four cheese blend, tomato compote, Reggiano, basil, grilled ciabatta) and the black pepper shrimp (romano crusted eggplant, spicy black pepper cream sauce). All three of these dishes were delicious. I would order all three again. 

When I visited this restaurant it was a Thursday afternoon. The place was really full and it was difficult to find a table (even at the bar!). Because of how busy it was it was sometimes difficult to get our waitress attention in order to place an order. Even though she was swamped with work she was very friendly. 

This is a place I am def coming back. Thank you for the awesome food!r

I ordered a salmon dish and a glass of great wine to pair. The waiter seemed new but I liked that they had the lighter calorie menu to choose from. You don't typically get that from an Italian style menu.

The prices aren't cheap, but I felt that my $37 for meal and wine was reasonable.

Good for groups.

Great service ( Anna) and great food! We had the flatbread  for appetizers and with a party of 6 had a variety of entrees.  I had braised short ribs with Brussel sprouts ( no pecans - I'm allergic)and polenta.  Others at the table had salmon, crab cakes , lasagna, chicken Caesar salad and shrimp alfredo.

First experience as we were shopping at Town Square. While this place was very crowded it only took 5 min to get seated.The service was super duper and a cut above the best of most restaurants. The menu selections had something for every taste. I selected the 
Lasagna which I must say was The Best
my discerning palate has ever enjoyed.
My 3 guests also enjoyed their selections as well....and only left the design on their plates uneaten.
The prices are a little bit higher but well worth the quality and quantity proved.
Try it I'm sure you will enjoy it as well.

Tonight my boyfriend and I had one of the best dining experiences we've ever had. Craig B. was just brilliant. From the moment we sat down, he was so friendly and personable. We had never been to Brio before, so he explained the menu to us and answered my (many) questions. Craig was very attentive and went above and beyond to make our experience memorable. He even brought over complimentary tiramisu for the both of us, which was delicious. I had the Vodka pasta and my boyfriend had the lasagna, both were absolutely amazing. My favorite part of the evening, besides the wonderful server, was the atmosphere of the restaurant. There are lights strung in the trees and you really feel at home. Coming from a couple who dines out frequently, please don't hesitate to visit Brio in Town Square, you won't regret it. And ask for Craig, I cannot put into words just how wonderful he really was.

Went a while back for a little birthday dinner and order the mushroom ravioli. So delicious I cleaned the plate! The servers and bussers were friendly and helpful without interrupting too much and even turned on the heaters outside and set it up real close to us because it was cold out that night. Much appreciated. We got the dessert sampler and all three were so good, especially the creme br√ªl√©e. Definitely a nice spot for dinner that doesn't have to break the bank.
I gave them 3 stars because I couldn't believe that ordering a burger and didn't want lettuce and tomato on there they said they couldn't do it that way. They had to put it on there. WTH.

I don't want to give this place 1 star but after last night I have to. I've eaten here many times and it's always so good and the service is good. I made a reservation for 8:30, checked in with the hostess and she said we would be seated soon. Unfortunately we sat there for 45 minutes past our reservation time. Not happy with that at all. 

The only explanation we were given was that they were running behind because it was Valentine's Day! Well obviously that's why I made a reservation. Maybe you shouldn't double book your reservations so you can seat people that expect to be seated on their specified time.

Disappointed!!!

Update (5/19/2008)

For my original review, see below.  However, an update and upgrade in rating is called for.  After submitting my complaint to Brio's management, they took exceptionally thorough remedial measures to correct the issues I had.  They talked to the waiter and offered a discount on my next meal.  I understand that screwups happen, but when a restaurant takes the effort to mitigate the poor experience, that's worth a lot to me.  It means the restaurant does care about your dining experience.  The management staff was very attentive to my concerns and I would go back to give them a second chance. :)

(Prior Review)

For 75 dollars for a group of three, this place is was a major disappointment.  The decor is nice with vaulted ceilings.  The ambiance is loud but acceptable.  The problems with this place are significant.  I can recommend the carbonara since it was the only dish that was properly seasoned.  My two associates ordered the lobster risotto and veal scallopini.  Both dishes were sent back for being underseasoned.  The risotto was overcooked and thereby mushy with only a hint of lobster taste.  The scallopini was so underseasoned that my associate had to cover it in vegetables to give it some flavor.  The service was equally disappointing.  Our bill was mixed up with another table.  If I didn't check the receipt, I would have overpaid.  I informed the waiter who corrected the mistake.  However, when I asked for the receipt showing the prior charge was voided, he argued that the receipt was fixed.  I think he was too busy trying to argue with me that he wasn't listening to what I was asking for.  He then blamed me for not being clear.  Holy crap.  Are you serious?!  I left a 4 dollar tip only because leaving ZERO is reserved for particularly egregious service but this case came close.

My Hubby and family and friends take me out to Vegas for my birthday and I have to say this one was the best place I have ever been. I loved the atmosphere and the food was so good the service was top notch. You start off with salad bar lobster bisque and they have sushi too. The waiters come round with all sorts of meats and sliced right at ur table and all the varieties of the meats I can't count em all... However my favorite was bacon wrapped filet mignon . I even had a birthday cheese cake and everyone sang to me. I highly recommend you try this place when out in Vegas . I will be coming again and I'm bringing my kids. What an experience .

Ordered:
Pasta alla vodka (taste was as expected, but pasta was overcooked)
Sourdough bread (normal)
Chocolate molten brownie (a bit dry)

Service was good, but they are being pulled down by food that is not that great.

First time here at this restaurant & I will be coming back. Awesome experience. Awesome customer service & they have a beautiful clean establishment. Lovely staff. Kai was my server & he was amazing. Thank you!
Pretty good italian chain restaurant. The outdoor seating at this location is really nice.

Just had our anniversary dinner at Brio with our family..,in one word, FABULOUS!  This was not our first time dining here , and as usual, it was not a disappointment! Three of us in our party had the Chicken Marsala and one had Pasta Brio.  The Chicken Marsala was tender, large size portion, Marsala sauce was flavorful and good consistency, plus they don't scrimp on the mushrooms. The asparagus was seasoned to perfection and cooked perfectly, as well. We all had Caesar salads that were fresh and with a great tasting Caesar dressing ! The Pasta Brio was also a huge hit... rigatoni with grilled chicken, and seared mushrooms , in a roasted red pepper vodka sauce! Just a winner of a night all the way around! Fantastic dinner, outstanding service, beautiful ambiance,  and lovely company to enjoy it all with!  Anytime you want to awaken your taste buds with a flavor-bursting meal, Brio is definitely the place to go! :)

My first visit here by recommendation and oohhh why oohh why don't you have a location near my home?? 

I had the medallions encrusted in artichokes, fresh grilled veggies and yummy mashed taters. I most often alter my mashed but these were so buttery and creamy they didn't even need salt. 

My boyfriend had one of the specials for the day. Grilled yellowtail with mashed taters and grilled asparagus. The fish was grilled just perfect and the seasoning was very good. 

We also had their signature bruchetta which I am still dreaming about and trying to figure out a way to make it myself since they are not local to me. 

I also here they have a great Happy Hour but e were here on a Saturday s we did not partake.

Town Square is the place to be for happy hour!  With so many choices - Brio Tuscan Grille is a great place to get your grub on for cheap!

Their Tuscan Taster Menu is available in the bar area only and runs
Monday through Friday: 3 pm to 6 pm
Sunday through Thursday: 9 pm to close

All nine of their mouthwatering items are only $2.95!!  What a steal!

* Braised Meatballs & Creamy Polenta "Topped with Marsala tomato sauce, Reggiano and parsley." - Three generous sized meatballs in a tasty and tangy sauce.  The polenta is a minimal amount the covers the bottom of the dish, but a nice touch.  The Husband really enjoyed this and was about to get another!

* Beef Carpaccio "Served with field greens, capers, mustard aioli and shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese." - Our favorite of the ones we tried, so we got two orders.  So good and tasty, and the field greens are a nice complement to the dish.

* Margherita Flatbread "Fresh Mozzarella, vine-ripened tomatoes and fresh basil." - Very basic flatbread pizza, no fancy frills here.  A nice simple crunch.

* Sliced Steak Bruschetta "With Gorgonzola Dolce, arugula, fennel, charred tomato, shaved Parmesan and Tuscan Italian dressing." - Four slices of bruschetta makes this a hearty dish with the cheese and beef.  Good flavors though and sauce adds a nice sweetness.

Unfortunately, their happy hour only extends to the food so there are no drink specials.  (When I called, whomever answered said there were drink specials but it wasn't so when we sat down.)  

The bartenders took our food and drink orders, and the food came out promptly.  We had no issues with service as a result unlike the other reviewers.

Overall, it's a nice place and we enjoyed ourselves here.  The dining room looks like a grand hall with all the drapery.  I suggest getting your grub on here and getting drunk somewhere else if you want to save a few bucks.

Update! 07/15/09 - Went back again last Friday and finished off the entire Tuscan Tasters menu.

* Brio Burger "A quartet of BRIO's famous Bistecca Burgers, with smoked Mozzarella and housemade chips." - A very decent size burger for three bucks that was tasty and cut into four, perfect for sharing.  Chips were yummy too!

* Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant "Grilled shrimp with Romano crusted eggplant and a black pepper cream sauce." - A surprise goodie!  Came with eight shrimp/eggplant stacks and definitely would definitely order again.

* Sausage & Pepperoni Flatbread "Fresh Mozzarella and housemade tomato sauce." - Good pizza where they aren't shy about the toppings.

* Shrimptini "Chilled shrimp served in a martini glass with roasted tomato cocktail sauce and fresh lemon."  Uneventful of the bunch, fine for simple shrimp but lacks any excitement.

* Roasted Red Pepper & Fresh Mozzarella Bruschetta "With fresh basil and balsamic drizzle." - Tasty bread bites with four pieces of bruschetta.

This time we went with a group of four and ordered one of everything.  It pretty much filled us for the most part, although if you're hungry, just double up on the burgers and meatballs.  We grabbed a little table this time in the bar area inside and our waitress was fine again.  It took a bit of time to get the table cleared and for the orders to go in, but nothing to complain about.  

Overall, they did well again for filling our tummies on a budget!

I walked in and felt like i was in a hotel. Maybe bellagio cafe or something. not sure. But it didnt feel like any italian restaurant ive ever been to. not that thats a bad thing. the bread they put on the table was somewhat epic. im not sure ive ever said that about bread, but it was. the butter was on the sweeter side but the bread was so good it didnt need butter. for an entree i ordered the chicken pomodoro classico. probably the best pasta dish ive ever had in vegas. Direct from the menu..."Angel hair with grilled chicken, tomatoes, pine nuts, basil, Parmigiano-Reggiano and pesto drizzle 14.15"...yum. the pine nuts were a really nice touch.

what i dont understand though is why they dont have gingerale. the waitress was really sweet and tried to make it by mixing pepsi with sprite. but it didnt taste like gingerale. so i just had a pepsi. 

overall really good for lunch. im told lunch here is better than dinner. who knows. get gingerale!

I was initially let down that there was too long of a wait for the patio as it was a gorgeous day outside..nothing their white peach sangria couldn't fix! I'm normally a red wine kinda gal, but seeing as this was recommended by both my boyfriend and the server I decided to give it a try. It was good until (almost) the last drop...last few sips tasted like straight soda. 

    On to the food. I have had quite a few beef carpaccios in my day but none come even CLOSE to comparing to the one they have at Brio. It was about half the size of me, unbelievably fresh and drizzled in what tasted like a garlic aioli. Mind. Blown. The Caprese salad was pretty tasty as well but needed a bit more balsamic glaze; I was too emanored by the carpaccio to remember to ask for more hehe. We also had the bruschetta quattro, Pasta Brio and the special bruschetta, which was a spicy shrimp with lobster butter. I, being allergic to shellfish, could not have the special bruschetta, hence why we ordered this way.

    I deducted a star because the shrimp bruschetta was on the serving plate with the other assorted bruschettas. My allergy is not deathly so I simply avoided the pieces on either side of the shrimp, but as a server they should be a little more careful when a guest states they have an allergy. Hives aren't exactly my idea of a "fun" Friday night. 

   On a side note: The Pasta Brio tastes just as good cold as it does fresh out of the kitchen.

I come here for lunch and a glass of wine every time I am in Las Vegas. Are usually opt for the shrimp Mediterranean which is a very tasty low calorie option on their menu. It is plenty of food to feel satisfied and still healthy. Add a glass of rose and that round out the meal very well. The cracker bread and sourdough loaf that they serve or both delicious as well.
Today I just stopped in for a glass of wine and to use the Wi-Fi so I could get some work done while waiting to check into my hotel. I found a comfortable seat in the bar area and couldn't believe how great the service from both the bartender and the support staff were. I had to write a review just to comment on how wonderful they were even though I wasn't eating. 
Great job and I will return next month!
LOVE Brio. Food is always great service is always on point. And let's not forget how awesome the bellinis are!!! Highly recommend even if just for a lunch for one.

It feels like if you're not willing to shell out big bucks for the extravagant restaurants, you're going to eat crap. I was very grateful for this restaurant because food was reasonable and tasted reasonable as well.

I ordered the pasta alla vodka, and it was delicious. I love stuffed pasta, and this didn't disappoint stuffed with ricotta. The portions aren't as large as you'd expect from Olive Garden or some other pasta place, but larger portions doesn't always mean better food anyways. We saved half of our entrees to save as leftovers and munched on an extra serving of fresh bread. Yum!

Brio is very pretty, light, quiet, not the best place if you have rowdy kidlets. 
 The Calamari is VERY good, and the Lobster Bisque is uite tasty. The desserts are smal enough to be crazy, except the cheesecake, but if you're prdering cheesecake calories may not be your focus. heh
 We had two great servers, and were checked on often, but my daughters coffee never got refilled. There was a chari in a sitting near us LEAKING. Dripping onto the floor. No one knew why and the servers stared at for a long time after I pointed it out, but no one cleaned it up.....? Really?

I was initially concerned because it is located in a shopping area but was extremely impressed when I walked in.  The restaurant is beautiful and very inviting!  I absolutely loved the ambiance...if you like Tuscan Mediterranean decor with wrought iron, rich colors, and beautiful architecture..this is the place....it is loud, but hey everyone one seemed to be enjoying themselves...Our waiter introduced himself as Mr. Meat and he had a great personality and made great recommendations..we started out with the calimari..loved the marinara on the side but not a fan of the white sauce though.  Their chopped salad was fresh, and crisp with chopped olives, tomatoes, cheese and mouth watering vinaigrette.  My husband had the shrimp mediterranean...grilled prawns, spinach, cherry tomatoes, tossed in a delicious light sauce over a bed of orzo..loved it!   I had the creamy cheesy bacony chicken carbonara with baby spinach tossed into the mix!  Bread was delish..  Loved the experience..will definitely be back when visit Vegas again..

We had our weeding dinner in their banquet room. Their staff was top notch and accommodating. The banquet planner had everything set up well and the food was outstanding.
It created an experience for a lot of my family who were not accustomed to a dinning experience like this.
We are very grateful to their whole team for making this day memorable.

This place was really just ok.  Its overpriced Italian food but with a beautiful ambiance.  Went here and made a reservation.  Thank goodness we did because the wait would have been over an hour!!  And even with a reservation they sat us 15 mins later.....

We got water and menus promptly and decided to order the pasta tuscano, the vodka pasta, the shrimp and eggplant appetizer and the beef Carpaccio.  Food came out relatively quickly and we got everything at once.  The beef Carpaccio was plated beautifully.  It was in this gigantic plate that took up the whole table space.  Beef was sliced super thin and stuck to the plate.  You can't even pick up a piece of it without tearing.  I don't know if that's good or bad.   But it was delicious and fresh.  The eggplant and shrimp was probably my favorite dish.  A little salty but the eggplant was perfectly fried and crispy.  It was not mushy at all even though it was smothered in sauce.

As for the pastas, the noodles were cooked well.  It wasn't aldente and I actually liked that it was softer.  The tuscano pasta is Bolognese made with sausage instead of beef.  I was disappointed because it tasted overly cheesy and the sausage is overwhelming.  I think I like the original version with beef better.  The vodka pasta was very good.  It was ricotta stuffed pasta in a creamy tomato sauce.  The ricotta was light and airy and the tart tomato sauce balanced it well.

Overall, this is not a place I will come to again on my own.  Its a nice ambiance, but too expensive for the quality of food.  Our waiter was also super FORGETFUL.  Had the ask for water, plate, fork, check TWICE.

Stay away from this place. The food was horrible. I complained to the executive chef who was working last weekend. He didn't even have the courtesy to come and see me when asked. Found a band aid in my food. The management criticizes employee's right in front of you. I would hate to be an employee there. A manager Tony belittled a female employee almost to the point she was crying. How extremely unprofessional. Eat at Claim Jumper next door!!!! I would gave NO STARS but I had to give 1.

I went in during happy hour with one of my friends the selection was fantastic and the bartender was so friendly the only thing I would say is there was some other lady behind the bar that wasn't the bartender I don't think and she was so unfriendly I was nervous to ask for a to go box I would definitely come again and one bad apple doesn't spoil my experience I loved the soup

Although this is an Italian chain restaurant, I really think Brio is above the rest of its chain competition.  An old friend reached out to me the other day and suggested we do dinner, so we decided to visit this place last night.  

The place is dramatic.  There's linen draping the entire top of the inside.  The lighting is dim and super intimate.  Great place for a date!  Our server was cordial and didn't bother us much during our meal.  I appreciate very personable service and a lot of interaction, so it was a little quiet for my taste, but not bad to say the least.  

Tonight, we got a bottle of the Tavolo Matto (house brand) pinot grigio.  It was good enough for a house wine at $24 for the bottle.  I also go the sweet potato & chicken risotto for $17.65 which is a weird price.  One thing I can always count on Brio to deliver is an awesome risotto!  So creamy and perfect!  I LOVED the big chunks of sweet potato, asparagus and chicken.  Brio tends to change what they add into their risottos however, I don't mind.  Whatever they add, I know is always good.

I don't tend to visit this place often because I consider it on the higher end of my budget.  I don't really think spending $30 a meal (including drinks) is spending my money effectively, however, it's a great place to visit once in a while.  Tonight was a special occasion and I'm convinced that Brio will be a great place to return to on another occasion!

Attention: Their Happy Hour Menu is BETTER than McCormick & Schmicks!

I thought I would never say this, but for the quality (better) & price (same) you can get more for your tummy & money here.

Monday - Thursday 3 - 7 PM, 9 - 11 PM + Friday 3 - 7 PM you can enjoy their Tuscan Tasters menu for $2.95. You don't even have to purchase a beverage to get this deal either...just sit in the bar area. 

The bar area is half-inside and half-outside with a bar, but also high tables and even some nice chairs (but they go fast!)

We tried the: 
*Brio Burger - great "soft" burger w/ homemade chips
Ravioli Caprese - crusted ravioli w/ tomato/mozzarella drizzle
Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant - seared shrimp & breaded eggplant
Sausage & Pepperoni Flatbread - self-explanatory on cracker bread
Steak Bruschetta - steak & arugala on french bread

Liked all of them...burger & pizza were the most filling. Shrimp was small, but tasty. Bruschetta & ravioli had a nice taste to them.

Dessert Trio: hazelnut/chocolate cannoli, caramel cheesecake & choc chip bread pudding. 

This dessert was awesome! We were about to leave, but I saw the dessert tray (better seeing what you're getting in person - great marketing tactic for visual learners like me) and was hooked! 

Each dessert had tons of flavor that you had to take small bites to enjoy each sensation in your mouth. 

I can't say enough great things about this place. The fact it was off the strip and mostly locals went there was one of the best parts. I learned that waking the strip is quite overrated....

Service was great and I am definitely hitting this place up EVERYTIME I go to vegas...

I was wanting an inexpensive but good steak. I went with Pork chop plate instead-it was delicious! The vegetables did have an interesting flavor...
This was our second visit and not our last. Good variety of options for the good price

A double cappacino with artichoke heart dip and caprese.  Dining outside on Easter Sunday...here's a tip. No wait for outside dining and fortyfiveminutes for inside. Inside is noisy and your words bounce off the wall 

Having a salmon salad.  Oh yum. Lots of options under 500 calories by the way

I have wanted to eat here for a long time but my boyfriend is not fond of Italian. My mom and I Planned on coming to town square to hang out and do some shopping and we we're both hungry so I remembered Brio had a happy hour and it was almost 4 so perfect timing. 

We came in and sat by the bar for happy hour and I was kind of worried it would be too hot since it was hot outside , but the bar area is shaded so it worked out fine. Even if you do sit by the patio by the walkway and street they have misters and umbrellas. 

I decided to have a white peach Sangria which is $4 on the happy hour menu it was so refreshing and perfect for the hot weather and presented very pretty. My mom had a virgin Italian Lemonade because she was scared to drive with a drink in her :). For food we decides to go with Crispy Eggplant Fries ( recommended by a friend on yelp Thanks Nieves ! ) crispy ravioli and Tomato Mozzerella Salad just to start. The eggplant fries were perfectly crispy and super yummy. The pomodoro sauce for both the ravioli and fries was so yummy. The raviolis lacked flavor in my opinion. The tomato Mozzerella salad was really fresh and the balsamic glaze was perfect. It could have had more basil and glaze but that's ok. I just asked for some more glaze ;). I'm glad we only ordered those three dishes because a few raviolis in and some fries later I was stuffed. 

All the servers were friendly and food and drinks came out fast. Despite how busy it was. I suggest coming early and seeing if there is a wait because it filled up fast for happy hour. I will definitely be coming back to try the regular menu as I'm lasagna lover and I'm out to find the best in vegas. That I'm yet to find maybe it's hiding here at Brio. I'll find out sooner or later.

An excellent place for an early lunch as it fills up fast! It's huge inside and will remind you of a cross between an Olive Garden and a Macaroni Grill.

Similar food as the above mentioned restaurants with a tad nicer dining room.

Service was VERY good and FAST.  Food comes quickly.

Meals that include the salad are few, but for what it's worth, the chopped salad is incredible!  It's a meal by itself so make sure to share it.

The bread and crackers included with the meal aren't memorable and aren't served with any oil or spices.  Just butter.

Hadn't been here in several years. They do a solid job. Food was prepared just right and service was pretty good. Nothing to complain about other than my personal bias against chain restaurants as they all seem to have an institutional feel and there's never anything too exciting on the menu, just stuff that appeals to the masses. Overall pretty good and reasonable price for what you get. Good spot for lunch.

Planned my wedding reception in the round private room in the back here in 2011. When arriving to go over things the night before my wedding which was already hectic, the service I received was crap. However the next day the pulled it out and did an outstanding job. The day before is my only reasoning behind not giving them five stars. Without mentioning the total amount I paid...lets just say a small fortune. That erked me. The food was delicious and the prefixed menu came out nice. They did screw up the seating chart but who cares. The ambiance were nice and all and all it was a good choice.

I love coming here for happy hour! $2.95 food menu :) 

The only thing that sucks about happy hour is that it's only in the bar area only and the bar area can get packed really fast so come early to get a good table. Also, another thing I love about this place is their chocolate mints haha I think it's so much better than olive garden too. 

The staff here can also be a bit slow and lazy. Because every time i come here and there are empty plates on the table, the server would not pick it up unless we handed them the plate ourselves. It's a bit obvious that we're done with the plate when there's nothing left on the plate

I just experienced the sea scallop risotto and it was delicious.  As was the chopped salad. As was the bread and butter...lol.  I was greeted with a smile.  Served with friendliness.  Best place I've eaten in town square so far.

This is the worst restaurant I have ever been to. Have been there several time and every time: Horrible service. Food is mediocre and overpriced. Also, the veal is extremely salty. Not sure why it has so many stars....lol working for the food industry for years, I can't understand how they have such good business. One of my coworkers even left to work there and came back to the original job within a month. Not worth it to go there, don't waste your money.

We were in Vegas for a wedding and this was the reception. We arrived and I was skeptical because we we're at a mall and I was like "Really?". Turns out I was totally wrong! We arrived and we were taken to the back for the reception in a big open room. Food took a while but it was worth the wait! We received two different salads. One was a blue cheese with bacon and the other was your normal Caesar salad. Next came was fruits slices of grapes, blue berries, pineapples, and watermelon. The entrees finally came and it was freaking insane! We had asparagus seared with salsa salmon, creamy mashed potatoes, filet mignon, and their house pasta. The chicken pasta was my favorite dish because I had never eaten anything like it. Super delicious was the steak, tender and juicy with each bite. The salmon was a bit dry and the asparagus was sweet and crunchy.  Desert was a little coffee cup with cream, caramel, and cake. Very good place to eat and I would definitely go there again!

I went here with my sister one afternoon, and the service was a little off putting, seeing as I go here a lot. I was disappointed in my experience and told management about it. 
About a month later, I went in with my boyfriend. Got a nice bottle of wine, and we ordered some amazing food! I really liked the blackened tilapia. Our server was really awesome. Because of my experience last time, the management came to our table and was very apologetic. And discounted the whole meal! (Which I said I'd pay for the majority of it.) I was so impressed with my visit this time around I had to tip the waiter nicely, seeing as I got my meal comped. Will be back around to possible drink 2 bottles of wine :P

I don't usually review a chain restaurant but this one is special.  Although it is located in a "mall", it offers great outdoor seating in a comfy environment.  

Big plus, its meant for Vegas residents so its inexpensive.

They have a great tasting bar menu from M-F 3:30pm-6:30pm and M-Thurs 9:00pm till closing where all items are just 2.95.  Not just talking fries or chips either.  Great burger, sausage and pepperoni flat bread, beef carpaccio, spicy shrimp and eggplant, etc.  

Don't make the mistake of ordering the entire menu like a buddy and I did.  First your server and bartender will laugh at you (noob), and second, no way you will finish it (wasteful noob).

Wines are very inexpensive.  Large by the glass selection and generous pours are the norm.

If its a cooler night, sit outside by a fire pit and make some friends.

Service is very friendly (its a locals place).  Family friendly.

Oh yeah, the regular menu for lunch and dinner is also very good and fairly priced but you cannot beat the bar menu for price.

Well worth it.

I gave this place three tries over the course of a year.  I really like the decor, so I added a second star.

For Italian, it is Olive Garden grade at best at twice the price.  I have tried pasta, sandwiches and steaks, all of which didn't impress.

Tonight, the fettuccine was mush, stuck together and pasty.  It was obvious that my shrimp and lobster fettuccine was the first of five entrees complete and sat too long.

As they served, they handed me my plate and told me watch out, it is very hot.  Wait, what?   How about doing your job and presenting my entree to me on the table.


More disturbing, I ordered a bottle of wine.  The server poured and I took a couple of sips. I them noticed a two inch crack in the glass.  These things happen, but the waiter wanted to pour the wine from the cracked glass into another glass.  Wait, what?  (Again)

Overall, mediocre food, mediocre service, VERY LOUD ATMOSPHERE and pretty pricy.

Go to Olive Garden and save your cash.

My fiance and I went to Brio for our fourth anniversary.  We had nothing to complain about - the atmosphere, service, and temperature were really comfortable.  We ordered the artichoke-crusted beef medallions, bistecca insalata, and stuffed peppers.  The food came out faster than I expected and each course was well-timed.  The waiter did a great job keeping our table neat and checked on us appropriately.  Everything was cooked to perfection and very flavorful.  We had a great time and will return for another special occasion... we're poor college kids, so we can't really afford to be "regulars!"

I'm not the biggest fan of chain restaurants. Olive Garden, Cheesecake Factory, Outback--you catch my drift? To my palette, everything tastes the same--buttery & salty. I've sampled the Brio dinner menu on numerous occasions and I will not be returning for any entrees.

THE BAR: I frequent Brio for an entirely different reason: a half indoor / half outdoor bar that brings refinement to the ever frowned upon day drinking. In the Spring & Summer, I can be seen in my designer heels relaxing by the bar with a book, sipping on a glass of over-priced shiraz or moscato on a bright, sunny Tuesday afternoon. Town Square is such a pleasant place. A little pop-up of class down the street from what I consider to be the tackiest shopping mall in Las Vegas (Premium Outlets South). 

BAR FOOD: I can't help but jump for joy at cheap food. Brio has a bar menu that's only $2.95 a plate. I've sampled everything on that menu. At 3 bucks a pop, I think I can afford to do so. Serving size is pretty big too. I always order the beef carpaccio: thin-slices of raw beef drizzled with olive oil and other delectables. The flat-breads and ravioli are mediocre. The spicy shrimp is too salty. The burger is a burger. And the ravioli is pretty basic. Then again, at those prices I wouldn't expect anything too fancy.

In short, olive garden food at cheap prices, alcohol, and a pleasant drinking environment to make your day-drinking the slightest bit more upscale.

Beautiful atmosphere, the decorations alone in this place is super nice.  I really enjoy seeing the italian coliseum, wood floors, hanging lights.  Something you would see at caesars palace but off the strip.  The food we ordered were a bit lacking.  I ordered the burger which i immediately regretted as i should have ordered something authentic.  My gf ordered the flatbread sausage and pepperoni and you think this would be good, but unfortunately the taste was just okay.  Flat bread pizza tasted like crackers.  The lobster bisque was good.  The lunch menu had some decent pricing though and the meal was quite inexpensive

I would try the raviolis or pasta if i coukd next time i go.

I often come here for happy hour and though there selection is good, I am specifically writing this review on my bartender (nicole). Being as an employee in the industry, a Vegas veteran, and etc. I have to say that Nicole is the sweetest bartender I have had. Now of days (especially in the summer when your working out in the heat) bartenders are short and crabby, Nicole was very sweet, and made my visit comfortable!
Always a pleasant  experience. Above average chain restaurant, very clean, servers are nice and food is delicious! Can't go wrong
Good food and cocktails went for happy hour had the blackpepper shrimp and the black berry martini. Good bartender and the quality and portion of food is very good

Came in for the famous lobster bisque. The burrata plate with roasted tomatoes and toasted baguette is awesome. Service was energetic, enthusiastic, and speedy, followed by a check back to make sure the food was up to par. 
          Las Vegas is hit or miss for good service. This time at Brio my wife and I had a fantastic experience. Ask for Josh. Bearded guy with glasses. The guy is just precise.
One of the best happy hours in Las Vegas. Great food (spicy shrimp, caprese, flat breads). Great drinks. Can't beat the prices. Great ambiance inside or outside.

LOVE coming here! Nicole M is the best bartender ever! She takes great care of us and is very precise and attentive, even on the busiest of nights! The food is great and the staff is very friendly! You won't be disappointed!

I have only been here for appetizers and sat at the bar each time.  The bar is big and has an indoor and outdoor space to choose from. The bartenders are friendly and attentive.  The appetizers are all pretty good.  I enjoy the different types of bruschetta a lot.  They have good drinks and happy hour specials as well.

Friday night was the second time I've visited this place. Atmosphere was nice, pretty dark, servers were very attentive but the food was not something that I would go back for. Especially a third time. Prices are pretty high but I was out with a friend and didnt have the family so that was ok. But the food once again was just mediocre. I ended up having the Sweet Potato & Chicken Risotto. Sauce drowned everything out and made it very soggy tasting...The only thing that made up for the food was that I wasnt paying and my peach bellini (AMAZING)...
I am super picky about my martinis and have never been disappointed. The food is good but they have hands down the best dessert....

Great off Strip restaurant. Great staff and service. Food is always great. Being Gluten Free is always tricky finding somewhere that caters to intolerances but this place has a great Gluten Free menu.

Got a table using the open table app! Had their ravioli, with a Caesar salad that was soooo good. My wife ordered some fish which was also really good according to her. Glad we found this place and had this great meal.

We've been here several times and have never had a bad experience.  They have plenty of different food options.  Good beer, wine and mixed drinks and great service.  They don't have a bad salad on the menu.   The burgers are great and all the appetizers are on point.  If you want a small meal and some drinks come check out the happy hour.  You won't regret trying Brio.
Brio's food is always the best! A small group of friends gathered for a birthday dinner one slow Tuesday night. The service was great! I recommend the pesto chicken pasta dish!

Evening before New Year's Eve, my kids, husband and I were hungry after a long day of walking the strip and sightseeing. Been in Vegas countless times but usually for work, so know the restaurants and bars in the hotels. Rarely do we ever leave the strip but the teenagers were asking for Italian so I got on Yelp and found Brio Tuscan Grille. We drove over and found a cute strip of restaurants. We were seated immediately even though they were busy. The decor is cool, the service excellent and the food was on point! Salad was fresh, pastas were made to order. Everything was top notch. Definitely a staple on our future visits to sin city.

Brio, what can't you do!!! My pasta comes out amazing every darn time! Happy hour is boss because you not only save paper on drinks, you also save on food items!!! You can dine inside or outside, or even at the bar. I prefer inside during the day and outside at night. The decor is phenomenal. It feels like I'm dining on the tank. No joke, it's extremely appealing and favorable to the eye. Also, there's tasty candy on your way out by the door. Snatch a pack and enjoy the final touch of your dining experience.

Pros: Delicious food, well priced, great decor, great service, free wifi, takes reservations, clean bathrooms

Cons: Food takes some time to reach the table

Overall: I'll see you shortly! In love with this spot. I can come here alone, with a friend or even with a date! It's great for all occasions!

Happy Hour: 
Monday- Friday from 3pm-7pm 
Monday-Thursday 9pm-Close.
Special Menu of $2.95 items.

I finally made it here to try their "Tuscan menu", and had the beef carpaccio, burger, shrimp cocktail, bruschetta, flatbread.  The burger was a little dry but worth $3, everything else was great!

I am not especially jazzed to be writing a review of Brio as it is more of a chain establishment; however, it has a couple of things going for it that elevate it a couple of inches above Wal-Mart, so I am doing it.

These things are atmosphere and tiny desserts. Let's start with atmosphere: the place is giant and perhaps bordering on tacky, but at least they tried, and they have probably the largest, most impressive patio in Las Vegas featuring not only tables but love seats and plenty of umbrellas. It must be at least a solid two blocks of outdoor experience. Of course, all of this is undermined by the fact that Town Square sits solidly underneath the flat path for McCarran, so every ten minutes you have a 757 flying over and rendering conversation impossible for about a minute. After about 15 minutes of this, my mom commented, "I hope they got a good deal on this property." I would say this makes what could be a five star atmosphere a three star experience, possibly even two if you are sensitive to jet engines.

Yet, they have one more trick up their patio: tiny desserts. Really, this is a brilliant idea, and I am not sure why more restaurants do not do this. Brio offers six miniature desserts. They come in what is best described as a sweet shot glass, which is probably the volume of 3 shot glasses. Each mini-sweetie only costs $2.45! My mom and I had the Peachberry Crostada topped with pecan streusel, vanilla bean gelato and Melba sauce. My mom wanted to order five more, and I can't blame her.

We both had salad and soup for our lunch, and those were done well. They also have a nice happy hour, but you have to sit at the bar to get those deals. I recommend just creating your own secret happy hour: grab a table on the patio and order $2.45 desserts until your sweet tooth begs for mercy. It's a good plan.

Great food. Great service. The atmosphere is lively but a bit loud. We were seated close to an outside door, so it was cold whenever the door was frequently opened - overall 5 stars. Our server was Abby - she was great!, ask for her section :)

This place is excellent! Great patio seating and if it's a hot day seating in the patio I recommend seating there at night time. Food is good and service is excellent. Food selection is plenty even if you are vegetarian, pescatarian, carnivore, whatever over acting wanna be healthy not really you are... there is a food item here for you. Okay... ambiance haaaa, good vibe. And there are plenty of wine and cocktails to choose from too. You can burn everything you eat afterwards by walking around the shops in the area. I recommend this place. Happy Italian eating nom noms! :)
I've come here a couple times since my last review, and I no longer feel like it's too crowded. Food is excellent and service is superb. I definitely recommend the pasta brio!!!

When I am in Vegas I always make it a point to stop at Brio once or twice for either lunch or dinner!  The Tuscan style decor is awesome!  Like you are in an old Tuscan vastly, with super high ceilings.

If you like a frozen drink, the peach Bellini is the best frozen concoction I've ever had hands down!

They have a salad on their lunch menu that is bomb!  The Romano crusted chicken salad.  Basically, mixture of fresh greens, kale, romain, cucumber, quinoa, feta and a few other ingredients.  Along with two crusted chicken breasts.  It is amazing.  Service is always fast and upbeat!

5 stars

I was at Brio on 9/25 and Joey was our server. He made the entire experience, I've never been so impressed by a waiter or waitress in my life. He seemed like he really wanted us to enjoy our dinner. Aside from the excellent customer service, the food is remarkable. If you are ever at Town Square definitely check out Brio!

We have been to Brio several times with the kids and I am been to Brio soooo many times on my own.  And here is a hint, take the kids with you and share the food that is served for the kids.  The portions are huge for children and half the price of adult entrees.  While my husband and I did not do this the two times we have taken the kids, we keep joking that "next time" we are going to do just that!  The food is consistent.  I typically hate chain restaurants, but I will make a slight exception for Brio, if I am craving the lobster bisque.

I had an incredibly lovely weekday lunch here. Their lunch specials, while not cheap are filling and delicious. I had one of the paninis and was quite pleased. The atmosphere is nice, and the outdoor patio looked awesome. I will definitely be back.

Brio
You made me order way too much good food
Highlights:
Tomato Mozzarella Flatbread- yummers
ITALIAN wedding meatball-yessers
Chicken Pomodoro and Milanese- ok I eat a lot of chicken, and I will always prefer chicken. BOTH of these dishes are great

Dessets- I love chocolate anything and all their mini desserts are awesome

This place is always packed but they seat you pretty fast.

I can't wait to come here again, very nice, romantic and lots of good looking people come here

THE END :)
Place is nice and big. Service is pretty top notch and their food is pretty good. Be aware that you might spend a good amount, but don't worry. Their quantities were pretty good.

A step up from the typical Italian chain restaurant.  The food was very good, the service excellent, and the ambiance very nice.  Had the pork chops for dinner and the apple crisp for desert based upon a friend's recommendation.  Glad I did because was one of the best chops I had in awhile.

The Bottom Line: Great service with decent food and a nice atmosphere make Brio a good place to grab lunch or dinner with friends.

Try:
Pasta Alla Vodka
Mushroom Ravioli Di Bello

Pro:
With quick, friendly service and a well appointed interior, Brio makes a great first impression. The food itself was flavorful and substantive, and you definitely feel like you get your money's worth. 

Con:
No big cons to think of! It's a solid place.

First time dining, wow the ambience is beautiful, takes you to another world... food is sub-par, bread was very good. Wedge salad, the dressing was just ok. Don't get the lasagna, WTF! Creamy on top not your traditional layered lasagna and the ground meat was more like mush, no flavor. 
Service is clueless. Mistake after mistake. 
Maybe great for tourists, families and non-foodies.
Best happy hour I've been to yet! Awesome prices, generous portions, tasty dishes, and yummy white peach sangria.

The food was so yummy and served in good sized portions. The price is very affordable. The place is very nice and has great customer service. I definitely recommend this place for lunch or dinner for friends, dates, or for the family.

Surprised I never wrote a review. I'm going to be forward only go for happy hour. It's amazing besides that I went to the dining area last week and the entree's were not fresh and  my server ordered the wrong entree from me and I was hungover so I was starving and wasn't thrilled to wait 10 more minutes. My salad was bitter and lots of brown lettuce and it was not good at all. Like I said only go for happy hour.

PROS: Happy hour, decor, ambiance
CONS: service, salads, beef tartare not fresh, mahi mahi dry

I keep trying every here and there when a friend wishes to go.  Another chain restaurant as if we aren't saturated enough with these in this town.  No matter the time of day or evening, whether or not I am in the bar or patio area or even the dining area the service is mediocre.  Always inattentive bartenders, and the bar only had a total of four people there including myself and my friend!  Until a try it again next year (I usually wait a year).  I will stick with my regular haunts for TS (town square) Killer Shrimp, Tommy Bahamas and Double Helix.  Always friendly and attentive service there;)

There are few places I can eat in Vegas any time of the day no matter what I'm in the mood for and this is one of them.  

Their Happy Hour menu in my opinion is the best! It's inexpensive and full of options.
Sliced Steak Salad and Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant are a MUST. Service is great as always- ask for Amanda she is super nice and attentive!

Great, refined quality of food. Friendly service. So-so prices. Not so Italian.

The reason I gave Brio a 3 star rating is because they don't have traditional Italian pizzas! This shocked me and put me off quite a bit. I'm 100% Italian and for an Italian restaurant not to have traditional pizzas is just a huge no-no. Like a burger joint that doesn't serve burgers and fries. However, they do have 4 choices of American style flat-breads that can be ordered on pizza dough. But it's just not the same. 

I've been here before and the other few dishes I've tried are very tasty. Although, I do not consider this to be an Italian restaurant. More of an American take on Italian cuisine. Still good but not what I was looking for.

Brio has never done me wrong.  We go here all the time and it's always good. Thank you for being so consistent.  My fave starters.   Lobster bisque and blue cheese wedge salad.   The healthy menu item with the chicken and quinoa is so good.

Service was good, however we made a reservation for 11 people at 5pm but were informed upon arrival that happy hour pricing is only available at the bar or outside (105 degrees) and although there was plenty of seating in the bar area our large group would not be able to actually sit together and enjoy each other's company from multiple tables. So we sat outside dripping in sweat until we couldn't take it anymore. Sorry Brio, your loss. Luckily Double Helix can accommodate our group and happy hour is until 7:30!

I am definitely a foodie, therefore it was hard for me to write thie review. The food itslef was beyond stellar! I had the Shrimp crusted salmon with Quinoa. The appetizers were amazing as well. So why only 1 star? The service... We had a party of 7, and the waiter took forever to take our order. we sat there starving ffor 30 minutes before they took our order. The place was beautiful, but yet dirty. They weren't eager to clean off tables, it was food and things on the floor. I was dissapointed for such a beautiful establishment to be so dirtly.

Lastly, the waiter knocked over an entire glass of water inside my purse ice and all... He handed me a napkin, apologize and that was it. I was there cleaning out my purse, trying to get the ice out. He never mentioned it again, checked if I was okay, nor tried to help me clean my LV $1236 purse. I was pretty disappointed. The only good thing was the food, and the decor. The service, cleanliness, and staff are not nearly up to the level of expectation of the environment, and or the food.

I've been coming to Brio Tuscan Grille since they've opened up at Town Square eons ago. I know, I like to write my reviews late. Even when I relocated for three years, whenever I visit Vegas, I would always have dinner at least once at Brio. I would always suggest Brio as an option to my out of town friends. And more than once did we celebrate birthdays with dinner at Brio. 

Honestly, I've never really had a horrible experience at Brio. If we had any issues with our meals, once we bring it up with our server, they'd always manage to get it fixed right away. One of my most recent visits to Brio, our waitress was a blast -- we had a lot of fun kidding around with her. 

However, I am a little sadden by the fact that a few menu items have changed, such as the steaks. They no longer offer the surf and turf or just a filet mignon with veggies dishes. Though the steak dishes they have right now are still pretty good. I gotta say, the price you pay is a whole lot better than what you pay for if you eat at the strip. Brio has awesome prices (even though the prices have gotten bumped up within the past three years). 

It can get loud while dining in though. There are tons of people talking, laughing, etc. But it never really bothered me. 

As for what to get to eat at the Brio? I'd say try anything you want. Everything I've tried was very good. Some of my favorites are the steaks, rack of lambs, and the carbonara. I also enjoy their bruchetta a lot. One of my favorite drinks at the Brio has got to be their peach bellini -- it's always so yummy!!! Don't be afraid to try anything there :)

This is a great spot to hang out with your friends and enjoy great drinks and tasty food. I normally visit during their happy hour (M-F, 4pm to 6pm) when their prices and portions are quite generous. Here is my happy hour breakdown.

Ambiance: High energy and BUSY!! Their bar area is spacious but plan on waiting for a table if you are not there right at 4pm. 

Service: Fast and friendly... The way it should be! 

Food: AMAZING! Their $3.95 dishes are tasty and come in large portions. Do not leave their happy hour without trying their burger or the shrimp and eggplant dish... You will be sure to love them!

Drinks: The mojitos and sangrias are awesomely refreshing... Depending on the bartender. I wish they were more consistent with their flavor profile and alcohol content of their cocktails. In fact, their drink unpredictability is why I give them 4 stars. 

I will most definitely visit again and again!

I went to Brio 3 times already so this review is long due.
I was always very pleased with the prices, variety, quality, the smaller plates menu, mini desserts...

I came here once with my bff and twice with chris before his bball games (he likes to have a big plate of pastas first for energy)

I always have smaller plates from the low carb menu,
My favorites are so far: beef carpaccio, lobster bisque, shrimp Mediterranean on orzo and spinach bed and mini creme brulee served in espresso cup! The tiramisu is very good too, it's my friend's favorite!
The shrimptini is just ok, the shrimps were small and a bit watery but the shrimps from the entrees are huge, nicely grilled and delicious.

The service was always great except one time when our waitress never refilled our iced teas until we asked for it again and again... Then had our refill finally when we paid our bill. Not cool. I am not asking for extra attention,  just for drink/water during my meal.

The service the other times was perfectly on point and everybody else was very friendly.

So we will come back tomorrow night for sure and I will make sure to update my review by then.
Lunch (soup and a salad) for under $15.  The service was very good and the food was excellent.  We will be back

Great food. Great atmosphere. Great prices. What more could you ask from an Italian restaurant? They have almost everything you could think of Italian. From the various pasta dishes to the unique entr√©es to the unforgettable appetizers, this Italian restaurant stands out when compared to other Italian restaurants you may find around the city, especially Olive Garden. I was never a big fan of Italian food until I discovered this place. Definitely recommend this place if you're into something Italian.

I visited Brio a few weeks ago with my friend for lunch. She was actually my best friend from 5th grade in California and she moved away when we were in middle school and I hadn't seen her in 14 years! Anywho, she moved to LV last year and when I was in town visiting she hit me up for a mini reunion. 

My friend had been to Brio before and she suggest this place for lunch. This place looks really nice! Picture a step up from Cheesecake Factory. I can see a bridal shower or a special event being held here.

 I ordered the prosciutto and burrata pizza, it was delicious! For some reason I thought I tasted hints of fruit in the pizza sauce. I liked it though and I would get it again if I ever come back. 

We had a wonderful lunch catching up. Service was great, they give you nice warm bread upon seating. 

Overall it's a nice restaurant and I would recommend it for a nice lunch or dinner.

Update:
Their happy hour is still great. I went back recently and sat outside on the couches. The appetizers have gone up in price to $3.95, but are still a great value. They now offer a happy hour drink menu for $5. I'll go back for their happy hour anytime. Still not crazy about their regular meals, but I'll probably give that another shot soon. 

I was sad to see that they changed their happy hour menu and took off the steak bruschetta, which was my favorite, but they still offer some fantastic options.

I like pork chops. I like salt.

And I like them not to have a sweaty orgy on my plate.

I get it, Brio, you like salt too. Guess what? I'm not a horse. Even though my penis will confuse you, I promise, I don't like salt enough to just show up, whinny, and start to canter because you knocked a tube of Morton's Iodized into your marinade.

Great ambiance, lovely vibe, VERY friendly waitstaff.

But that porkchop was saltier than a pirate's thighs.
Great Happy Hour, great service, really nice outdoor area, no-charge valet parking very near, many little shops near.

I arrived today at 11am & was greeted with a warm welcome from the very tall hostess.  She was sweet & had a nice smile, too.  

We were seated within 5 minutes and our waitress seemed sweet, as well.  We ordered our food & i go the salmon w/ angel hair lunch entree.  I dont remember the exact name for it (but thats what it had).  Anyways, our food arrived and all I could see was how oily the pasta was. GAA-ROOSSS. Good thing, I was hungry and didnt eat any breakfast, yet. So i ate at least half of my entree, but  after eating all that oily pasta, I wanted to barf.  The salmon was cooked almost perfectly & I enjoyed it.  

The waitress was so great, either.  Though she seemed sweet she never came back to check on us and took forever getting the check to us.  I dont know if I would come back here again, since this is the second time I tried Brio but who knows, I think I might try it at least one last time.  Hopefully, the third time is a charm

For happy hour, it is one of the best in Town Square. Monday-Friday 3:30-6:30 and Monday-Thursday 9-close. They have a set menu of certain appetizers for $2.95. A few of these dishes will make for a perfectly good meal. The special is only good for the bar and it is first come, first serve. Since the weather is getting chillier, it is easy to get a seat on the outdoor side. They close the curtains and turn on heat lamps, so it is not bad.

The offerings consist of Beef Carpaccio, Spinach Artichoke Dip, two styles of Flatbread, Fried Raviolis (3 large pieces), a Burger (cut into quarters for sharing), Spicy Shrimp with Eggplant, and Shrimptini (Shrimp Cocktail). The carpaccio was my favorite and so inexpensive.The burger was also good. It is very simple, topped with cheese and a special sauce with a few chips. I usually like mine with all sorts of veggies, but this was nothing to frown upon. The raviolis were the last item I had ordered and they were decent. Getting three of these dishes makes for a perfect dinner and will cost less then $10. 

I looked at the rest of their regular menu and many of the pastas were cream based or had it as a listed ingredient. I like my pastas to be on the lighter side, so I tend to skip on them here.
Still an awesome Happy Hour. Love their new $5 Martini Thursdays. Now I really won't be able to stay away.

This is probably the best place to go for Lunch or  even Dinner.   First of all our waitress with her name as Cinnamon (whether that's her name or just a made up on), she's bad ass.  She was like a hawk with our refills, orders and the bill.  The whole team there at Brio works so in sync with each other, so dynamic, it was a nice calm melody, how they worked as a team. Management must be great here. 

Food was amazing 
The pizza for our daughter was so good. 
My wife got the Strawberry Balsamic Chicken Salad and that was amazing. 
I got the Lobster Bisque that was out of this world and the Campanelle Carbonara that was finger licking good!

Thank you guys, for an awesome lunch!

I haven't even started eating and this place has already giving me bad service. I made reservations for 2 and they placed me at a table for 6. Whats the fucken point for making reservations if we have to wait for our table. We'll see how that food taste. 
 
Ok after everything got all figured out I must say the food itself was AMAZING. The general manager of the restaurant was so accommodating.

This Brio location is my go-to spot for happy hour, lunch outside on a nice day, or a healthy dinner either with the girls or on date night. So basically, I'll come here anytime! I love to sit outside when it's nice out. Some of my favorites are their bread, the White Peach Sangria, Spicy Shrimp with Eggplant, and the Chocolate Lava Cake (it's called something else on the menu). I especially love the "Lighter Side of Tuscany" aka healthy menu- every item I've tried has been delicious. Come here, you won't be disappointed.

Get yourself to Brio for their $2.95 Happy Hour specials!  Their HH is Mon-Thurs from 3:30 - 6:30.  The best day of the week to go is Thurs when they have $5 martini night.  All of the HH food is fantastic, especially the Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant and the Roasted Garlic, Spinach, Artichoke Dip.  Make sure to arrive early because HH is only served at the bar & lounge and seating fills up fast.

I wanted take out pasta for tonight, I had the choice to go either at Pizza California Kitchen either at Brio. Unlike California Pizza Kitchen, as soon I walked in I was greated with a smile from 2 polite and friendly hosts who didn't hesitate to go over the menu with me.

Sunday Brunch at Brio was even better than I thought it might be.  A little online research showed some promising entrees, but it was more than that.  The ambiance was perfect Sunday, even though we only had a lunch hour instead of the normal brunch experience.  Service was quick, and we had delicious bread and artisan crackers on our table before we could even order.
The brunch food is awesome.  I had my heart set on the vegetable omelet with egg whites, mushrooms, etc. (I was sold with the mushrooms) and my darling wife had the Sicilian Omelet, with ham, bacon, sausage, etc. - and the star of the whole meal by far was the tomato compote on top of her omelet.  That sauce made us think of Italy, and made us want to come back to try some pasta here, because it was the most flavorful, full-bodied tomato sauce we've ever had. It totally took over the omelet, but in a darn good way.
My white omelet was awesome, and I would get it again in a heartbeat.  But I'll try getting the tomato compote on it...  And maybe the brunch potatoes, which are also sublimely well done, not too crisp or soggy, not too salty or bland, just yum all around.

went to visit vegas and stopped in here. wow is what I got to say. service was great, clean and elegant place, food was crazy good. crab cakes are to die for and the desserts yum! good prices as well. I do recommend this place!

Had the Espresso Rubbed ribeye and it was delicious. Cooked to a perfect medium-rare. Was actually very surprised how good it was. Go to fine dining strip Steakhouse's with my wife fairly often and this was just about as good and for only $32. Also had the lobster bisque, swordfish and a kids pizza. Food was good, service was good.

What can I say... I am not much of a "chain" kind of girl but this place never disappoints!!! I have never had a bad experience! Whether it is a casual luncheon, happy hour or full fledged dinner... Their food, drinks and ambiance is always spot on! Great happy hour specials by the bar. Amazing appetizers, flatbreads and drink specials. My absolute favorite is the spicy shrimp and eggplant. It is so much creamy spicy goodness! Oh lord have mercy!!! It is ridiculously yummy! Funny thing is... I am not crazy about shrimp and I'm not crazy about eggplant. Somehow this just works! Have also had carpaccio, pasta and the Gorgonzola crusted lamb. Everything has rocked!!! Also, awesome outdoor patio with plenty of misters and shade so one can sit and people watch outside. Fantastic drink specials as well!

Loved this place until today... Worst, rude service ever. This fake Australian ruined our date. He was so obnoxious and you could tell he didn't want to be there. 

Side note: Don't ever just assume you're going to get a bad tip because you mess up once... You could always make it better. Instead you made it worse!

This is the short version of the longest review ever written...

I got married in Vegas June 20, 2008 and chose Brio for the after ceremony (reception?) dinner. I planned my entire wedding over the course of 3 weeks remotely from Colorado, so I didn't realize Brio was in a mall. I'm sure I could have figured that out if I'd read more reviews...

I ended up loving Brio! When we first arrived, we were told that our private room was not available due to the air conditioning unit going out inside and the room temp hovering around 90 degrees. I think when something goes wrong with a major reservation, the way the staff treats the issue is a true sign of their customer service skillz. Well folks, the staff at this Brio location has mad skillz, the skillz that pay the billz even!! They apparently left me a voicemail letting me know of the issue earlier in the night, but for some crazy reason, could be that I was exchanging vows and bling with the love of my life, I didn't get the msg. So anyway, they were very apologetic and seemed almost let down themselves that I didn't have the perfect room for my dinner on my wedding day....it was really okay though because I was at a very zen place right then and they were so nice about it. 

So, onto the meal. The staff had curtained off half of the regular dining area so we still had a private dinner, it was just a little louder around us than it would have been behind closed doors. Brio comped us two bottles of Champagne for our toast due to the room being unavailable and Chris, who was absolutely sweet and could not have been more attentive, waited on us hand and foot during our meal. He also provided sparkling orange juice for the kids and my sister in law who is expecting for the toast. The champagne was good, the bartender even came in and helped us pick out a few bottles of wine to drink with our meal which was nice. We all ordered right off the menu since there were only 14 of us. My son and I both had the Salmon which was served on parmesan crusted tomatoes and with shoestring potatoes, so delicious! My husband and step-son had the lamb chops and mashed potatoes - I don't like lamb but I tasted the mashers and they were seriously the best I've ever had. All in all, the food was scrumptious and prompt and the service was outstanding. 

The day after the wedding, I had a message from the manager at Brio, Kenna, that someone in my wedding party left something at the restaurant and she needed my address to send it to me. I waited a few days to receive whatever it was that was left there after I got back to CO. To my surprise, a package arrived with a letter from Chris and the staff at Brio thanking me for choosing them for my reception dinner. Included was the cork from our champagne bottle, that day's newspaper and the table covers that we had written on in crayon while enjoying our meal. So thoughtful and cute, the staff at Brio going above and beyond made the experience of my Vegas wedding that much more enjoyable! Grazie!

Brio has the best happy hour in the city!  I love the atmospere and sitting outside, it makes me feel like I am not in Vegas. Love the option to sit at the bar inside or out!  3.95 for a wonderfully cooked burger?!! My husband loves the carpaccio, be sure to ask for extra sauce. They used to have a steak brushetta with Gorgonzola on the happy hour menu, I am sad its gone but they still have great selections, like my favorite spicy shrimp and eggplant, again ask for extra sauce.

 You can get a cocktail for 5 dollars as well! We usually stick to the martini, but have tried a few of there specialty cocktails and they were all good. We usually sit at the bar close to Del Mar, he is so awesome! He's busy and still manages to make us perfect drinks, he is always attentive and smiling and always gives outstanding service!! He's in my top 3 bartenders in Vegas! When in doubt of where to go, he keeps us coming back!! Such a great asset to the bar! This is one of my main reasons it's our fave happy hour!

Went for lunch.  Very attractive and spacious restaurant.  Took a little while to get service but went great thereafter.  I felt like a salad and didn't look at the rest of the menu.  I had the Med. chicken salad....fresh, crisp, great textures and moist chicken.  My friend had the steak salad....beautiful thick pieces of medium rare steak.  Artisan bread to start.  Very enjoyable.

Spent my birthday here for lunch. I have a mixed bag rating for this place...there were things I did like: bread basket (flax seed crackers were good), calamari and white sauce and then things I didn't: turkey sandwich (see pic), chop salad (pic)......for your bday you get a very tiny dessert (very tiny like espresso shot cup size) - it was ok. Overall it was ok but I wouldn't rush back to eat there. Service was fine, nothing to brag about.  Honestly the best thing there was the flax seed crackers lol which was free.....I think is recommend eating there for HH instead of paying full price for their food.

My girlfriends and I came to Brio for Sunday lunch and we were promptly seated. I ordered one of the restaurant favorites, the Mezza Chicken with pasta. Although the flavors of the marinara sauce were tasty and satisfying enough, it didn't blow me away. The lunch portion size left me quite disappointed since there wasn't as much pasta as I expected, especially for a pricey dish at $13. The service was pretty decent but the lackluster food and price doesn't give me an incentive to be back.
Hosted a group of 75, great food, great service! Had numerous positive compliments from our guest. Great job team Brio!!!
Excellent Happy Hour.  Food has always been consistanly good. The service is good. Nice atmosphere and prices are reasonable

Served wrong food after 30 minutes of waiting and people around us who came after us got their food. This is just a big corporate chain, the employees really dont care. 

Eggs for my mother came out for a benedict almost completely raw. 

Ended up eating mediocre bread for lunch. I guess in the end this place is no better than an Olive Garden just more expensive.

Eaten here several times. Each time we have been pleased with the food. The Tuscan harvest salad is delicious. The waiters & waitresses are average and at times irritating due to lack of experience, poor serving and not checking on you. I would recommend this place to my friends and family. Just wish the service was better

The setting and decor is beautiful.  So I can give it 3 stars for ambiance. The restaurant really has a nice feel and would be perfect if the staff were more attentive and the food faire was better thought out by the Chefs.  First, we were seated for 7 minutes before our server approached us.   Second, the temperature inside the restaurant was uncomfortably warm and stale.  Third, the meals.....My wife had the shrimp and lobster pasta.  We counted 6 small shrimp and mere flakes of what appeared to be lobster.  The sauce was good, but the pasta was the main attraction not the seafood.  I had the crab cakes.  They were just ok.  Two small crab cakes atop a mound of fingerling potatoes and green beans.  The main course was the potatoes.  

The olive oil and vinegar cruets were disgustingly sticky and I asked them to be replaced.  They were without hesitation by our server, but it's obvious they are infrequently cleaned which is concerning. 

We had high expectations but were sadly disappointed.  We won't be back.  

I got an private message and gave the Mgr my phone number many days ago. Never got a call.  So my recommendation has gone down to 2 stars.

I gave them a second chance. I regret it. First try here was yesterday 6/11/18 with 3 girlfriends I dragged out of the house. We were seated outside right next to the mist by the sidewalk where foot traffic was plenty. Beautiful atmosphere. Our server came and for the first few minutes she was sweet and nice. She grew impatient and short after we asked her several questions regarding drinks. The difference between the tropical martini and this other martini. So I decided to just cut it short and order something to resolve the initial interaction. She brought our drinks all was well. Food came out.. I asked for silverware. My girls are halfway through their food and I had to catch a busy boy on his way back to the kitchen and ask for napkins and silverware as she never came back with any. It was pretty quiet yesterday. Not busy at all. Still tried to make the best of it and enjoy the company of my girls. We are and our drinks were low... after our food she never came to check on us. None of us noticed the bill she placed in the middle of the table. She never asked how we want it split. So we figure when she comes back, we can ask. Again she got by us and by the time she came back our 4 credit cards were already charged. I asked, how did she decide to split the bill? She replied, "Equally." I asked her why didn't she bother to ask? No response, so I did mention, in the future please check with your table and ask how they want it split. (This isn't something I should tell her) Day 2.. today. I decided to go back and redo this experience with my fianc√©. As he has never been. We head in and ask if I can have the same spot yesterday. One server said yes and the assistant manager said no. I had my receipt to show her that we were just here yesterday and sat at that exact table. Her response, "The general manager was here when you guys were here so that's why you were able to sit there." My thoughts... of the GM approves us sitting there, and she was only the assistant... why couldn't we sit there? We showed up same time. Today was far more dead than yesterday. Literally a total of 3 groups of a small party seated outside. I could understand if it's packed busy and they had to designate a spot. Anyway 2 days consecutive of shit service was enough for me.

I had my daughters baby shower here. Let me tell you I was a pain with all my changes. The banquet manager, Nova was very helpful and patient. At the event the room was beautiful, service great and the food was really good. I did not have one complaint!

My hubby and I went to Brio Tuscan Grille  on an invite from local friends (we are from Chicago). I received absolutely the best service from the time I walked in until I left. I had an amazing red sangria at the outside bar, where misters keep you cool,  while we were waiting for our friends. My food was perfectly cooked and tasty (gorgonzola beef medallions, veg medley and mashed potatoes). My husband enjoyed his vegetable pesto pasta. The atmosphere and decor is beautiful and seating is comfortable. I can't wait to come back!

We have had a corporate dinner two months in a row with 20 attendees.  The service has been excellent.  Nova; our contact at Brio Tuscan Grille was very easy to work with and communicated with us while preparing for our events.  We look forward to our next event already scheduled for June.
Service  was awful,  food cold,  drinks took a while , although  it was a weekend  ,  next time if we do go back it will be lunch week day .

The inside of this restaurant is beautiful, with its high ceilings and Tuscan villa-inspired hangings. They've also opened some of their windows so the nice breeze circulated throughout the place.

My friends and I went in for lunch. I ordered the Mezza Chicken Under the Brick, while my friends ordered an omelet and a risotto lunch special with salad. The breads for the table were delicious! My favorite was the crispy one with sesame seeds. I wish the butter was softer and more spreadable.

The Mezza Chicken, listed under 500 calories, was a good lunch-sized portion. The chicken was delicious and absorbed the mushroom flavored gravy it was topped with; but the vegetables were my favorite. They were seasoned very well and I loved the slight char on all of them. The mashed potatoes were light and provided a great contrast to the vegetables and chicken.

Our server was great and friendly. There was a mistake on our order, where we were charged an extra $5 for a salad that was included in the lunch special. When we pointed it out, she apologized and remedied it. I would definitely come here again, and I hope the location near home will be as beautiful as this one.
